Skip the queues and check in ahead of time! Pick up your badge at CityCube on the day before the congress officially starts – and while you're there, enjoy fireside chats, networking, drinks, and music. It’s the perfect warm-up for WeAreDevelopers World Congress.

Messedamm 26, 14055 Berlin

sessions.title: I’ve been assigned to a project… Now what?
sessions.description: In this interactive workshop, you will discover how to integrate essential project management skills into your day-to-day work. You will learn how to define, plan, and execute projects effectively. Through hands-on exercises and role play focused on human skills and stakeholders engagement, you will sharpen your ability to communicate with impact, navigate challenges, and manage key relationships to drive successful projects with confidence.

speakers.bio:
Bruno Morgante is driven by his purpose of “Making the world a better place by empowering people and delivering impact”. He is an outcome driven leader with 20+ years of experience delivering results, managing projects, leading successful teams, and coaching and mentoring 100+ professionals. An inspiring speaker, he blends storytelling with actionable insights, engaging audiences through keynotes that inspire, spark emotions, and drive impact.
Learn more about Bruno and get in touch at brunomorgante.com

Kurfürstendamm 11, 10719 Berlin

sessions.title: Building Mobile Apps with GitHub Copilot + MCP
sessions.description:
This hands-on workshop walks participants through building a mobile application using GitHub Copilot and the GitHub Model Context Protocol (MCP). We’ll start with an overview of MCP and demonstrate GitHub’s MCP server in action. Then we’ll build a real mobile app, powered by AI and GitHub metadata. Participants will learn how to draft a Product Requirements Document (PRD) with GitHub Copilot, generate UI with Claude, and use Copilot Agent Mode to ship a personalized playlist experience. They will also learn how to get better results when building with AI tools by implementing prompt files and custom instructions.

Required Setup:
- GitHub Account: Create free account at https://github.com if you don't have one
- GitHub Copilot access:
  - Free: 50 chats/month + 2000 completions at https://github.com/settings/copilot
  - Students: Free Copilot Pro with GitHub Student Developer Pack at https://education.github.com
  - Pro: $10/month for unlimited access at https://github.com/settings/copilot

Workshop Environment (Choose One):
Option 1: GitHub Codespace (Recommended)
- Click the workshop Codespace link (provided by instructor)
- Wait 3-5 minutes for container to build (includes Flutter, extensions, and dependencies)
- Everything pre-configured and ready to use

Option 2: Local Development (Alternative)
- Flutter 3.7+: installed and working (flutter doctor passing) - Get it at https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install
- VS Code: with Flutter extension OR IntelliJ IDEA/Android Studio with Flutter plugin
- Device/emulator: ready for testing (iOS Simulator, Android Emulator, or Chrome browser)

Required API Accounts (Free Setup):
- GitHub Personal Access Token: Create at https://github.com/settings/tokens with scopes: repo, user, read:org
- Spotify Developer Account: Create free account and app at https://developer.spotify.com/dashboard
  - App name: "GitVision Workshop"
  - Redirect URI: gitvision://callback
  - Copy Client ID and Client Secret

Programming Knowledge Required:
- Basic Dart/Flutter understanding (widgets, async/await, JSON parsing)
- REST API concepts (HTTP requests, authentication, error handling)
- AI development experience with prompt engineering and AI-assisted coding tools

Duration: 120 minutes
Format: AI-assisted live coding in GitHub Codespaces
Skill Level: Intermediate developers familiar with AI development tools

speakers.bio: Andrea Griffiths transforms how developers connect with cutting-edge tools. As GitHub's Senior Developer Advocate, she's spent over a decade turning complex tech into compelling stories that inspire global communities. From packed conference halls to intimate workshops, Andrea bridges the gap between breakthrough innovations and the developers who bring them to life, championing open source collaboration that drives the future of technology.

sessions.title: A Hands-On Guide to Writing Smart Contracts Like You Write Software
sessions.description:
What if writing smart contracts felt like writing modern backend software? In this hands-on workshop, you’ll build your first smart contract using WebAssembly and Rust. No Solidity required, no special tooling to learn.

We’ll walk through writing, testing, and deploying contracts in a fully configured containerized environment using familiar libraries, clear patterns, and strong typing. You’ll also connect your contracts to a frontend and explore how they work interoperably with other contracts written with more niche blockchain-specific libraries.

Smart contracts don’t have to mean context-switching into niche languages and stripped-down tooling. This workshop will show how to apply your existing software skills to on-chain development without starting from scratch.

speakers.bio: Ben previously spent a decade in adult education, community organizing, and non-profit management before transitioning to software development. He works as a Senior Developer Advocate at Couchbase and is a member of the board of Ruby Central. Ben is actively involved in open source and writes regularly on the intersection of tech, ethics, and community. He is the author of the book Vector Search with JavaScript, published by Pragmatic Bookshelf.
speakers.tagline: Senior Developer Relations Engineer at Arbitrum

sessions.title: Building AI Tool Integrations with Model Context Protocol
sessions.description:
This hands-on workshop teaches you how to connect external tools and data sources to AI assistants using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). 

You'll learn why MCP is so useful as a standardized approach for giving AI systems to access real-world functionality (information, actions) through tools. 

The session covers configuring MCP servers in development environments and in Claude Desktop. You'll integrate MCP servers into agent frameworks to interact with databases, APIs, and other systems. 

We'll examine the internal structure of MCP servers, including resource, tool definitions, and prompt templates. 
The workshop discusses relevant protocol specifications aspects. 
By the end, you'll have built your own MCP server using MCP and integrated it into an AI agent workflow.

speakers.bio:
Adam Cowley is a Developer Advocate at Neo4j with two decades of experience spanning software development, data analysis, and product ownership. 

At Neo4j, he leads developer educational initiatives, including GraphAcademy, Neo4j’s free, self-paced learning platform. 

He is passionate about Generative AI and the potential for personalised educational experiences for developers and data scientists. 

He's always up for a game of pool.

Michael Hunger has been passionate about software development for more than 35 years.

For the last 15 years, he has been working on the open source Neo4j graph database filling many roles, most recently leading Product Innovation and Developer Strategy.
He especially loves to work with graph-related projects, users, and contributors, his current focus is generative AI, cloud integrations and developer experience.

As a developer Michael enjoys many aspects of programming languages, learning new things every day, participating in open source projects and writing books and articles.

sessions.title: AI and LLM in .NET: Transforming Big Data Analysis
sessions.description:
In a recent large-scale .NET project, we tackled the challenge of analyzing nearly 1 billion records stored in a database. The data encompassed various details about individuals, requiring the system to generate comprehensive reports, including connections and economic scoring. Traditional manual analysis by specialists could take days for a single individual. To overcome this, we implemented an AI-driven solution powered by a Large Language Model (LLM).

After training the model and integrating it into the system, the AI now delivers reports that are up to 80% more accurate than manual reviews. This session will explore our journey in designing, training, and deploying AI in a .NET environment, addressing challenges, optimizing performance, and achieving transformative results.

speakers.bio: Mehdi is a senior software developer and system architect.  Since 2000, he has been responsible for the design, implementation, and development of several different systems in the field of office automation, CRM, healthcare management, and automation in industry and logistics solutions. Mehdi specifically works in the field of software development based on .NET technology. Mehdi is a staunch fan of object-oriented programming.  Since 2016, Mehdi has worked more or less with cloud computing systems.

sessions.title: A Jumpstart to Using LLMs for Test Design
sessions.description:
Amidst the hype and naysaying, there are real opportunities for using GenAI in the field of testing. The world of Large Language Models has tools to assist you in testing. Get ready to generate test ideas through conversational prompts that'll have you wondering why you didn't try this sooner.

Workshop Structure:

The Power of Conversation: The tutorial takes a more natural language conversational approach to communicating with LLMs.

Prompting Demystified: Have you tried an LLM in your testing work? No? No worries! This tutorial shows you how to tap into the magic of LLMs for that extra testing wizardry.

Hands-On Fun: With an inverted curriculum format, theory will be taught as an extension to first experiencing a problem in demonstration mode, first hand.

Pitfalls, Suggested Practices and Further Possibilities: The LLM world looks shiny but it has its quirks too. The workshop closes with exploration of these quirks.

speakers.bio:
Pierre is a passionate Test Coach and Agile Enthusiast at trendig technology services GmbH. He has over 20 years of experience in software development and quality assurance.
As a former handball player, he lives and breathes team spirit – both on the field and in his professional life. Therefore his conference talks and training sessions are never just about teaching and telling: they are shared expeditions with participants, filled with learning, exploration, and collective discovery.
Pierre helps teams strengthen their testing capabilities and embrace modern, agile testing strategies.
speakers.tagline: Test Coach & Agile Enthusiast at Trendig Technology Services

speakers.bio:
Rahul Verma is an awarded thought leader for his contributions to the testing community. He is Chief Strategy Officer for GenAI. at trendig. He is the author of The Last Book on Testing, a satirical novel.

His software testing experience includes using LLMs for test design and reviews, building test automation frameworks in Python, web security, white box testing and web performance testing.

He has presented, published articles and educated thousands of testers. His testing ideas and work are deeply influenced by his deep interest in poetry and spirituality.
speakers.tagline: Chief Strategy Officer for GenAI  at trendig technology services

sessions.title: No-Nonsense Networking: Connect, Collaborate, Create!
sessions.description:
Stop missing out on valuable connections. Learn how to craft your own networking strategy. Use it immediately at WeAreDevelopers World Congress 2025.

Do you seek inspiring and engaging conversations with like-minded people? Do you want to get there without wading through the dull desert of small-talk? This very interactive workshop is here to help! 

By reflecting on your role in the developer community and defining your networking purpose, you’ll clarify why you want to create meaningful connections. Using simple and effective strategies like leveraging proximity bias and intentional questions you will enter interesting conversations with fellow participants at the workshop. 

Whether you are alone at We Are Developers or just want to quickly get into the right mood for meeting new people, this session is your perfect start to the conference.

speakers.bio: When COVID changed the world it also changed Theresa's career. Formerly a sustainability manager, she has worked at several software companies as an Agile Coach. Her strong speaking skills were recognized at the Berlin Agile Camp, the PANDA Tech & Software Contest and We Are Developers 2024. Last year, hundreds of software developers gathered around her Lightning Talk to learn How to find time for coding.

sessions.title: How to Pitch Innovation to Your CEO
sessions.description:
Many innovations and change initiatives never make it to implementation. Storytelling skills and the right pitch can change that. Successful changemakers know this. As soon as they take responsibility for an innovation or transformation, creating a pitch is one of the first tasks they tackle. CEOs no longer just expect good execution of strategy.  They are looking for convincing pitches with powerful stories and well-founded arguments. Whether it's for technology, CX, organizational or culture initiatives, successful pitches are based on the same principles and building blocks used by top changemakers in corporations, startups and politics alike. This universal framework for “How to Pitch Innovation like a Changemaker” can be learned in this workshop. As a proven approach, it has enabled numerous future makers to master communicative challenges.
Through real-life examples, Linda and Markus will give insights into change management, business storytelling, and compelling pitches to CEOs.

speakers.bio: Linda is a Strategic Advisor specializing in the field of enterprise innovation. She is co-founder and MD at Experience One, a digital agency focusing on innovative technologies for designing and scaling new and better CX for companies like Mercedes-Benz, BOSCH, AOK and FI. She focuses on strategic consulting and positioning of changemakers as well as in the implementation of customer centric change programs to create a sustainable culture of innovation. She benefits from her many years of experience in rollout and architecture consulting for the major digital platforms of large enterprises.
speakers.tagline: Managing Director at Experience One AG

sessions.title: WeAreDevelopers Live Show
sessions.description: Join Chris Heilmann and Dan Cranney for the weekly WeAreDevelopers Live show discussing current topics, resources and chatting with GrahamTheDev about all things accessibility

speakers.bio: Former Yahoo, Mozilla, Microsoft. JavaScript and Accessibility expert. Worked on Chromium Developer Tools. Author of the Developer Advocacy Handbook, LinkedIn Learning and Skillshare Trainer. Curator of the WeAreDevelopers World Congress and editor for the WeAreDevelopers DevDigest Newsletter.

sessions.title: From Grind to Balance: Breaking the Burnout Cycle & Setting Healthy Boundaries
sessions.description:
Feeling drained, overwhelmed or stuck on the hamster wheel of work? When you’re constantly pushing forward, it’s easy to miss the warning signs until exhaustion takes over. Join this immersive, no-fluff workshop to learn how to recognize whether you're grinding hard or heading toward burnout and, most importantly, what to do about it. You’ll walk away with practical tools to set boundaries that actually stick, prioritize your mental well-being and stay productive without running on empty.  

What you’ll take away:
 
- Spot the 5 key signs of burnout (before it’s too late)
- Learn who’s most at risk and why some teams burn out faster than others
-  Set healthy boundaries at work (without feeling guilty)
 - Master 3 proven techniques to manage expectations and push back like a pro.

Whether you're a senior professional, team leader, ambitious go-getter or someone juggling multiple priorities, this session will help you work smarter - without burning out.

speakers.bio: Veronica Ambrosini is a leadership and team development expert with 15+ years of global experience across the private and public sectors. Founder of bix a beel in Berlin, she helps leaders turn complexity into clarity through workshops, coaching, and tools like LEGO® SERIOUS PLAY®, Insights Discovery, and Design Thinking. She’s held senior roles at global organizations and public service, driving transformation, talent strategy, and DEI with a practical, human-centered approach.

Dagmar Glow is an ICF-accredited Professional Business Coach (PCC) with over 13 years of experience in Learning & Development. Specializing in leadership excellence, Dagmar worked with top companies in tech, finance, management consulting and advertising to build resilient, high-performing teams.
Beyond leadership development, Dagmar is a passionate advocate for mental well-being in the workplace. Join her immersive workshop on burnout prevention - helping you spot the warning signs and take action before it’s too late. 
Interested in working with Dagmar 1-to-1? Go to coachingwithdagmar.com

sessions.title: Hands-On AI Agent Workshop: Knowledge graphs, Event Communication, Voice & Brainstorming
sessions.description: In this interactive workshop, you’ll get hands-on experience with four standalone AI agent exercises. First, you’ll build and query a complex knowledge graph to perform high-precision semantic retrieval. Next, you’ll configure event-based messaging between two simple agents, observing how they exchange data and trigger workflows. In the third exercise, you’ll integrate text-to-speech and speech-to-text libraries so your agent can “speak” and execute spoken commands. Finally, you’ll brainstorm AI-driven, computer-using agent scenarios and see for yourself how well they execute tasks by interacting with your desktop environment. By the end of this session, you’ll have practiced four distinct techniques that you can adapt and combine in your own projects. Pre-requisites - Github account - Laptop

speakers.bio: Rene Pajta is an AI Solution Engineer at Microsoft, where he spearheads AI pre-sales strategy and champions the adoption of generative and agentic AI solutions at enterprise scale. He architects AI platform foundations for global software vendors and empowers developer communities through extensive enablement and training. As a trusted advisor on security and compliance, he ensures responsible and scalable deployment of AI technologies.
speakers.tagline: Solution Engineer - Agentic AI at Microsoft

speakers.bio: Dennis Zielke is a Lead Architect at Microsoft where he drives strategic customer engagements across roles, industries, and domains to envision, design, and implement end-to-end solution architectures leveraging the Microsoft product portfolio. He collaborates with field teams and product engineering to design agentic workforces, build real-time user experiences, and modernize data platforms and services to ensure business outcomes and customer value.
speakers.tagline: CTO Customer Success, Lead Architect at Microsoft

sessions.title: Build, Automate, Accelerate: Level up your Developer Experience with Rovo Dev
sessions.description:
Discover how Atlassian’s new AI-powered Rovo Dev Agent is transforming the software development lifecycle (SDLC)— from planning to production.

In this interactive, hands-on session, you’ll explore real-world use cases where Rovo Dev Agent streamlines development workflows. We’ll walk through how our intelligent developer agent supports various stages of the SDLC, from planning, writing and reviewing code to deployment.

speakers.bio: Jovana is a Software Engineer and a Technical Evangelist with expertise in performance, DevOps, and platform engineering. At Atlassian, she optimized Jira for large enterprise migrations and later improved cloud infrastructure reliability and security. She was a finalist for Software Engineer of the Year (2022 Australia Women in Digital Awards) and for the Developer category (2025 Women Leading Tech Awards). Jovana mentors young women and is passionate about innovation and fostering a healthy tech culture.

is a Senior Engineering Manager at Atlassian with a dynamic background spanning animation, game development, and frontend engineering. He’s led high-impact teams at Blake eLearning (creators of Reading Eggs), Domain.com.au, and Atlassian—switching often between hands-on IC work and strategic leadership (a proud flip-flopper, by choice). Matt’s son considers him a rockstar for helping build Reading Eggs, the classroom staple that’s teaching a generation of kids to read and write. Currently, Matt is deeply immersed in the future of AI-driven code generation and how it can supercharge developer workflows.

Ming Wu is Head of Engineering for the DevAI organization at Atlassian, where she leads the development of AI-powered developer productivity tools leveraging Large Language Models. She has over 15 years of experience integrating artificial intelligence into flagship products, including GitHub Copilot, Microsoft 365 and Bing Search. Ming holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science from Michigan State University and is passionate about applying AI to real-world applications.
speakers.tagline: Head of Engineering for the DevAI organization at Atlassian

sessions.title: Operation FrankenstAIn - Let's build an agent with your own APIs
sessions.description:
LLMs in isolation behave like a brain without connected organs - it cannot retrieve new information or act on them other than creating new thoughts based on prompts (telepathy if you will ;-)
Function calling - or more fancy - Agentic AI changes that by providing a standardized way how to wire "organs" aka APIs to the model so that it can decide how to use those in order to accomplish a task. We will start with a very short introduction on Agentic AI and function calling and an example based on Anthropic's MCP how to create architecture descriptions and Berlin techno songs out of Confluence pages. Once we all have the demo up and running, we will wire their own APIs and SaaS APIs as additional organs building our own FrankenstAIn (sic) agent. All examples will be in Typescript and do not require any commercial licenses. Don't fear if you are not a Typescript expert: I will also show how to use a code GenAI agent  with Postman Toolgen and hack your FrankenstAIN together with you.

speakers.bio:
Johannes is an Open Source and A(PI) Enthusiast @ Day and standup comedian / comedy DJ @ Night.
He is a long-time open source enthusiast and contributor to many projects including the Postman reference collection for OpenAI and maintainer of jonico/awesome-runners. Johannes is interested in all things GenAI, IssueOps, integrations, CI/CD and API design. Check out his GitHub profile (@jonico) to learn more about his tech projects and (if you are really into comedy techno) https://soundcloud.com/majorsunburn.

sessions.title: Building Modular Applications with .NET and ABP Framework
sessions.description:
As people and companies experienced the challenges of building, testing, deploying and maintaining microservice solutions and understood that most of them don’t need such a complex architecture, modular monolith architecture became a shining and suggested software architecture to build a maintainable solution.

This talk consists of two parts:

Presentation: I will introduce a well-defined architectural and practical approach to build highly isolated yet inter-communicating application modules that compose a monolith system that is still easy-to-build, test and maintain. I will highlight the most challenging parts of such an architecture (from the database layer to the UI layer) and best practices and suggestions to overcome these difficulties.

Live Coding: I will use the ABP Framework and .NET to develop an example modular solution with live coding.

speakers.bio:
I am software architect and developer. I love to work on open source projects, producing articles, videos and having talks on software development.

I'm the lead developer of the ABP framework (see https://abp.io)

I'm mostly interesting in developing reusable framework & libraries, distributed systems, multi-threaded and scalable solutions. I'm talking at local and international conferences about multi-tenancy, microservice architecture, domain-driven design, modular systems and developer tools.
speakers.tagline: Co-Founder, Lead Software Developer at Volosoft

sessions.title: Building a new onboarding on your app
sessions.description:
Every time you need to register in an app and enter all your data with 2FA, there is a user dropout rate. The process is long, and people give up when they have to enter their information and use SMS. In some cases, the provided information is fake, which, depending on the business, could lead to fraud.
To solve these problems, we will program a new onboarding process that allows users to register using only their phone number.
This workshop is given by different telecoms in collaboration with the Linux Foundation.

Please bring your laptop. A code will be provide to you and you will modify it to create a new onboarding experience.

speakers.bio: Amanda Cavallaro is an Italo-Brazilian developer advocate @ Vonage. She is a Google Developers Expert for the Firebase, Assistant, and ML Cloud Conversational AI categories, who is passionate about cloud technologies, JavaScript, human-computer interactions, and ambient computing, and has a love of learning. You can speak to her in Portuguese, English, Italian, and a little Japanese.

Passionate about code and user experience, he’s a senior software engineer with 20 years of experience across cloud, desktop, and mobile apps. 

Currently part of Orange’s LiveNet team, he also worked at Voilà, a Twitch-based platform for businesses. He’s led projects like Orange Telephone, BFMTV or Fortuneo. 

When not coding, he’s probably exploring retro computing on his Amstrad CPC or crafting creative UIs.

Laura is a Computer Engineer with more than 15 years of experience. Her background is in software development and architecture specializing in AI and Big Data. 

Recently, she has been recognized as an exemplary citizen of Zaragoza for promoting science, creating local communities, and empowering women and girls in STEM. She was a finalist in the Advocate Women in IT Awards Dublin. She is one of the "Valuable People" from Telefonica. She is also being recognized as one of the 100 most creative people in business by Forbes.

Noel is product manager for Network APIs at Deutsche Telekom and believes that products can only be successful if they provide a high user experience. With network APIs developers can directly interact with the network of a telecommunication provider (e.g. requesting a higher quality). Prior to Deutsche Telekom, he worked for OBI as product owner and finished his Master’s in international management.

sessions.title: 0Day at Day Zero Security Quiz
sessions.description: 0day at Day Zero! Take part in a security quiz and learn how to protect your products in a dangerous world. Liran Tal from Snyk will show all about XSS, CSRF and many others issues.

speakers.bio: Liran Tal is a software developer, and a GitHub Star, world-recognized for his activism in open source communities and advancing web and Node.js security. At Snyk, he is leading the developer advocacy team and on a mission to empower developers with better dev-first security.

sessions.description: A live recording of our "Coffee with Developers" podcast, this time with Jenn Looper of MSFT/AWS fame, now talking to us how it is to be back in DevRel and what the future might hold for Academia.

sessions.title: The Chief Joy Officer and decoding effective teams
sessions.description:
Want to create a team that can overcome anything together? A team that’s fun to work in? A team that can achieve things greater than you can imagine? A team you’ll never forget being a part of?

In this inspiring, interactive and fun session, the Chief Joy Officer will share the code to unlocking that potential within your teams. To create a choesive, resilient and effective team. 

By explaining the concept of Togethership (recently showcased in his TED talk), you will learn a new and invaluable leadership skill - and many practical tips to bring it to life.

speakers.bio:
Max has a passion for making the world of work a place where people wake up on Monday morning & say, “Great, I’m looking forward to going back to work”.
He started this work as Chief Joy Officer on the Exec of Loylogic & now helps other companies to understand motivation, drive positive cultures & give inspirational talks. His TEDx talk last year has over 1M views.
From a PhD in Chemistry, to a 15-year business career & now co-founder of Motivators@Work as a Leadership Team Coach. He’s worked with Tech companies ranging from Google & Sumup, to Typeform and many other Scale-Ups across Europe.
speakers.tagline: Chief Joy Officer & Founder of Motivators@Work

sessions.title: Copilot for Architects: Scaling AI-Ready Infrastructure on Azure
sessions.description: Microsoft Copilot is transforming how cloud architects design, deploy, and manage infrastructure. In this session, we’ll explore how Copilot accelerates the creation of AI-ready environments in Azure—from generating secure network topologies and deploying AKS clusters to optimizing cost, performance, and compliance across regions. You’ll see how Copilot integrates into architecture reviews, Infrastructure-as-Code workflows, and DevOps pipelines to boost productivity and reduce complexity. Whether you're building for scale, resilience, or AI integration, this session will show you how to make Copilot your architectural co-pilot.

speakers.bio:
Demir Senturk is a Cloud Solution Architect at Microsoft in Munich, where he leads technical strategy for global automotive accounts. With over three years at Microsoft, he specializes in multi-cloud environments, AI-ready infrastructure, and resilient architectures for hybrid and enterprise-scale deployments.

Demir’s expertise includes cloud adoption, architecture design, and developer platforms such as GitHub Enterprise. He has delivered sessions at major industry events—including Microsoft Build 2022, conferences across Germany, and forums in South Africa.

Milena Martinelli Lopes is a Cloud Solution Architect at Microsoft, with experience delivering innovative technology solutions. Her career spans roles in Brazil, England, Portugal, and Germany, where she has worked across enterprise architecture, cloud infrastructure, and application modernization. Before joining Microsoft, she held key architecture roles at Siemens, leading architecture initiatives and digital transformation. She thrives in collaborative environments and is inspired by Microsoft’s mission to empower every person and organization on the planet to achieve more.

sessions.title: Next-Gen Vector Database for Sustainable GenAI
sessions.description: Monolithic databases waste energy, powering unused data in GenAI workloads. According to the 80/20 rule, only up to 20% of the data is regularly needed, while 80% is unused. The Eclipse open-source community works on the future of vector databases: a micro vector database network - inspired by the serverless microservice architecture principle. Unlike clunky, monolithic databases that waste energy running massive servers 24/7, whether data is accessed or not, a micro vector database network dynamically allocates compute power only to the 20% of data in use, shutting down up to 80% of idle regions. The result is a blazing-fast vector search for cutting-edge GenAI solutions, slashing energy, CO2 emissions, and infrastructure costs by up to 80%. Learn how this Eclipse project redefines performance and sustainability due to the Eclipse OpenJ9 JVM, aiming to globally reduce GenAI’s energy footprint with scalable, impactful innovation.

speakers.bio: Markus and his teams have been working on IDE tools for Java and database development, as well as various open-source projects for 20 years. Markus is CEO and co-founder of MicroStream, the company behind the Eclipse open-source projects EclipseStore, Eclipse Serializer, and RapidClipse IDE. He is also the editor-in-chief for the free JAVAPRO magazine in Germany and the founder and co-organizer of the Java community conference series JCON. He is an independent editor for several magazines, and a speaker at numerous international developer conferences, user groups, and meetups.

sessions.title: You get what you define - Backlog Refinement
sessions.description:
A lot of teams struggle with defining and creating good user stories and a well-prioritized product backlog.
This impedes a common understanding within the team and leads to frictions in the further software development process.
A common agile practice to avoid misunderstandings and rework, to facilitate better planning and to deliver what the customers really want and need, is to apply the INVEST-criteria on every requirement during the backlog refinement.

This workshop helps product owners, developers and every stakeholder involved with tools and techniques to create independent, negotiable, valuable, estimable, small and testable product backlog items.
It will cover story slicing, writing better acceptance criteria, estimation, prioritization and product backlog management hands-on, based on the own examples of the attendees.

speakers.bio: Arjan is involved in projects, workshops and training courses around the world. With over 25 years of experience in testing, agile methods, quality and project management, Test process assessments, requirements management and design. Arjan co-developed several training courses focusing on requirements management, testing and agile. As an experienced assessor and mentor, Arjan is a much sought-after workshop and  team coach. Arjan's great passion is waterpolo, the interaction and confrontation of which is also present in his training courses: in honest discussions around the topic in focus.
speakers.tagline: Managing Partner at Trendig Technology Services

sessions.title: Docker Deep Dive with a Docker Captain
sessions.description:
Unlock the full potential of Docker in this 2-hour hands-on workshop!

Join Docker Captain Mohammad-Ali A'râbi for a deep dive into advanced Docker features and container security. You’ll get hands-on experience with key tools and best practices.

Key Topics:
- 🛡️ Container Security: Best practices for securing Docker containers
- 🐋 Docker Init: Automate container creation
- 🔧 Docker Debug: Troubleshoot running containers effectively
- 🔍 Docker Scout: Analyze vulnerabilities and performance
- 📜 SBOM Generation: Generate Software Bills of Materials (SBOM) for Docker images
- 🚀 BuildKit & Docker Bake: Optimize build performance and multi-platform builds

Perfect for developers and DevOps engineers aiming to level up their Docker skills with a focus on security, efficiency, and advanced tools.

speakers.bio:
Mohammad-Ali A'râbi is a Senior Backend Engineer, a Docker Captain, Snyk Ambassador, Docker Community Leader, public speaker, and author. He has been writing code for 20 years.

He blogs frequently on git and Docker (aerabi.medium.com) and is currently writing a book on container security.

As a Docker Captain, he has given talks at various conferences and local meetups. He also created the Docker meetup group in Freiburg in 2022 and has organized a dozen events there so far.

sessions.title: Drag Karaoke
sessions.description: Work can be a drag, this won't be!

sessions.title: Official Opening of WeAreDevelopers World Congress 2025
sessions.description: Join us for the official opening of WeAreDevelopers World Congress 2025 as we welcome 15,000 guests and kick off an unforgettable experience. This year marks our 10th anniversary, making the opening especially meaningful. Get a glimpse of the exciting highlights ahead before we hand over the mic to our inspiring opening speaker.

sessions.title: Agents for the Sake of Happiness
sessions.description: Three years ago, Thomas kicked off the age of Copilot right here at WeAreDevelopers World Congress. This year, he returns to the stage to jumpstart the age of agents, making strong predictions about the future of software engineering- including how it will reinforce and extend the power of human developers.

speakers.bio: Fascinated by software development since his childhood in Germany, Thomas Dohmke has built a career building tools to accelerate developer happiness. Currently, Thomas is the Chief Executive Officer of GitHub, where he has overseen the rise of the world’s most widely adopted AI developer tools – including the launches of GitHub Copilot, Copilot Workspace, and GitHub Models. Thomas is a celebrated TED speaker and holds a PhD in mechanical engineering from University of Glasgow, UK.

sessions.title: HR Leaders Summit Opening
sessions.description: Official opening of the HR Leaders Summit.

sessions.title: NVIDIA Expert Session: Optimized Deployment of Large Language Models
sessions.description: Visit us at booth A-16 to get answers to your most pressing questions from NVIDIA technology experts, and claim a free self-paced DLI course on July 10-11.

speakers.bio: Anshul is a Sr. Solution Architect at NVIDIA's DGX Cloud team, he specializes in assisting customers with deploying their workloads at scale. Anshul has a strong background in SRE and has extensive experience in managing production-grade Kubernetes clusters across various Cloud Service Providers (CSPs). He has received Ph.D. in computer science from TU Munich, graduating summa cum laude.

Kevin Klues is a distinguished engineer on the NVIDIA Cloud Native team. Kevin has been involved in the design and implementation of a number of Kubernetes technologies, including the Topology Manager, the Kubernetes stack for Multi-Instance GPUs, and Dynamic Resource Allocation (DRA). When not working, you can usually find Kevin on a snowboard or up in the mountains in some capacity or another.

Martin Piercy is a solutions architect at NVIDIA, where he is responsible for helping customers effectively adopt and use NVIDIA hardware and software at scale. During his time at NVIDIA, Martin has helped customers scale out training to thousands of GPUs and built solutions to help customers train, monitor, and manage jobs and infrastructure effectively.

sessions.title: Migrating from COBOL with AI: A Moonshot Demo
sessions.description: COBOL still underpins many mission-critical systems—but traditional modernization approaches often come with high risk, cost, and complexity. In this session, we’ll explore how AI-assisted development tools like GitHub Copilot and autonomous agent frameworks are making large-scale legacy migration not only feasible, but strategically viable.  Through a live demo of a simplified COBOL migration, I’ll show how AI can accelerate key activities: reverse engineering business logic, generating documentation, creating tests, and transforming legacy code into modern architectures. We’ll also examine real-world customer projects, highlighting how to reduce time-to-value, mitigate migration risks, and integrate AI responsibly into existing development workflows.  Whether you’re evaluating modernization initiatives or looking to align AI adoption with long-term architecture goals, this session offers practical insights for both technical leaders and hands-on developers.

speakers.bio: Julia is a full-stack dev, sr software engineer, software architect, cloud solution architect, technology specialist & feminist - web & frontend development have a special place in her ❤️. Currently she is working as Global Black Belt for Developer Productivity at Microsoft. No one knows what that means, not even Julia from time to time. Just see her as an SME to talk about all questions about developer velocity, productivity and happiness. :)

sessions.title: Diversity Backlash, Anti-Wokeness, Resistance – Is the World Going Downhill, or Moving Up?
sessions.description: TBD

speakers.tagline: Managing Director at Charta der Vielfalt e.V.

sessions.title: Lynx: Native for More
sessions.description:
In this workshop, we will introduce you to Lynx, a family of open source technologies empowering developers to use their existing web skills to create truly native UIs for both mobile and web from a single codebase. 

Designed for diverse use cases and rich interactivity, Lynx delivers vibrant and engaging UIs for large-scale apps like TikTok, featuring a speedy, versatile rendering engine, performance-driven dual-threaded UI programming, modern Rust-based tooling, and more! 

The workshop is designed to bring interested developers up to speed on how to install, launch and manage their own front-end dev projects using Lynx.

speakers.bio: Xuan is a software architect on the Lynx family of technologies, where he can dream of making interfaces better for more users, more developers, and more machines. Before joining ByteDance, he worked on React Core ("React Forget"), React Native, Hermes and Reason during his time at Meta.

sessions.title: The State of GenAI & Machine Learning in 2025
sessions.description:
The growth of GenAI & Machine Learning has brought new emerging challenges; in this talk we dive into the state of GenAI & ML in the ecosystem, where we provide an overview of trends, challenges, opportunities and tooling that the ecosystem is standardizing towards.

As part of this session, we will provide a snapshot of the current state of the ecosystem, as uncovered by recent surveys, which highlights the gaps in tooling and skills [1]. We will then cover the best practices and tooling that are arising from production use-cases of LLMOps/MLOps at scale to tackle domain-specific challenges such as agentic-workflows, AI guardrails, efficiency requirements - between others. These include the OSS frameworks [2] that are supporting the end-to-end LLMOps / MLOps lifecycle across pipelining, optimization, productionisation, monitoring/observability and ML safety.

[1] https://ethical.institute/state-of-ml-2024
[2] https://bit.ly/ml-list

speakers.bio: Alejandro is the Director of Engineering, Science & Product at Zalando SE, where he is responsible for large-scale AI & Data platforms that power Supply and Demand across the group. Alejandro is appointed as AI Expert at the United Nations and the European Commission, serves as Board Member at ACM's Board of Directors, and is the Scientific Adviser at the Institute for Ethical AI, where he has led contributions to EU policy, including the AI Act, the Data Act and the Digital Services Act, among others
speakers.tagline: Director of Engineering, Science & Product at Zalando

sessions.title: Best practices: Building Enterprise Applications that leverage GenAI
sessions.description:
The new era of software development introduces a new breed of intelligent applications unlike anything we have seen before. It is fundamentally about integrating Large Language Models (LLMs) and Generative AI (GenAI) into various applications. This integration offers incredible opportunities for enhancing business processes in entirely novel ways. However, building intelligent applications that leverage AI presents significant challenges, beyond just finding the best prompts or relying on low-code techniques.

In this demo-driven technical session, you will learn how to build enterprise applications that seamlessly incorporate GenAI. We will demonstrate the capabilities of OpenAI and Azure OpenAI, and also discuss advanced concepts utilizing Microsoft's Semantic Kernel, an open-source development kit designed for creating enterprise-level AI agents.

speakers.bio: Dr. Damir Dobric is Lead Software Architect at DAENET. He specializes in Cloud Computing, IoT, and AI. In addition, Damir is also a Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP). The Microsoft MVP Award is a prestigious recognition given to exceptional technical experts who are passionate about sharing their knowledge and experiences with others. As an MVP, Damir is part of an elite group of professionals known as Microsoft Regional Directors who actively contribute to the Microsoft community by offering guidance, support, and expertise in various Microsoft technologies.

sessions.title: Bullet-Proof APIs: The OWASP API Security Top Ten
sessions.description: The OWASP Top Ten as a list of the ten biggest security risks for web applications has been a de facto standard for over ten years. Somewhat out of the limelight, however, there are other lists. The OWASP API Security Top Ten was last updated in 2023 and highlights risks for APIs. Since arguably almost every web application relies on APIs these days, it's imperative that we address them. In the talk, we'll take a look at how the list came about and then go through all the points, showcasing common attacks. In particular, we are interested in what this means for modern stacks. Which points are relevant, and how can we take technology-specific countermeasures?

speakers.bio: Christian Wenz is a software architect, author, and consultant specializing in web technologies and security. He has authored or co-authored over 100 books across various publishers and has been recognized as a Microsoft MVP in Developer Technologies every year since 2004. Christian is the lead author of the Zend PHP certification, contributes to several open-source projects, and is a regular speaker at developer conferences worldwide.

sessions.title: Optimistic UI Updates: Enhancing User Experience and Improving Interaction to Next Paint (INP)
sessions.description:
With Interaction to Next Paint (INP) recently becoming a stable Google Core Web Vital, ensuring your web application is responsive to user interactions has never been more critical.

This talk will cover the importance of INP and show you how to measure it effectively in your projects. You’ll discover how leveraging optimistic UI updates—providing immediate visual feedback—can significantly reduce delays, improve INP, and elevate the overall user experience. Through practical strategies and real-world examples, you’ll learn how to identify opportunities for applying optimistic UI and walk away with actionable insights to make your web applications faster and more user-friendly.

speakers.bio: Marc Müller is a Senior Frontend Engineer at Grover, bringing extensive experience in B2B, zero-to-one projects, and conversion rate optimization. Before Grover, Marc refined his web development expertise at Peaks & Pies, where he worked on improving conversion rates for high-profile clients, including mobile.de, NIVEA, ERGO, and Lampenwelt. Beyond software engineering, Marc has a passion for product management, design, and photography. This diverse skill set enables him to tackle projects holistically, ensuring aesthetic excellence and functional precision.

sessions.title: Developer Joy with Quarkus
sessions.description:
"Java is a great programming language, however 'traditional' Java isn't so great to work with when it comes to modern development paradigms. Quarkus is a (fairly) new Java stack that addresses issues such as the typical slow startup time and rather large memory usage that hinder the adoption of Java in container and/or Serverless workloads. Quarkus is not just useful for optimizing resource usage though. There is also a big focus on improving the developer experience.
If you’re new to Quarkus or want a refresher on some of its latest features, you’ll definitely want to join this session. We’ll show you how to experiment with databases, kafka clusters, containers, Kubernetes, and of course, AI, without ever restarting our application. 
After this session the audience should come away with inspiration to efficiently build modern applications with Java, and have lots of fun while doing so!"

speakers.bio: Daniel Oh is a Java Champion and Senior Principal Developer Advocate at Red Hat to evangelize developers for building cloud-native apps and serverless ob Kubernetes ecosystems. He's also contributing to various cloud open-source projects and ecosystems as a CNCF ambassador for accelerating DevOps adoption in enterprises. He's speaking at lots of technical seminars, workshops, and meetups to elaborate on new emerging technologies for enterprise developers & DevOps teams.
speakers.tagline: Sr. Principal Developer Advocate at Red Hat

sessions.title: 30 powerful AWS hacks in just 30 minutes: Boost your developer productivity
sessions.description: In this lightning-fast session, we’ll cover 30 essential AWS tips and tricks to supercharge developer productivity. From automation hacks with AWS CLI, CloudFormation, and CDK to cost-saving strategies using EC2 Spot Instances and S3 Lifecycle Policies, you’ll discover practical ways to optimize workflows. We’ll dive into security best practices, such as IAM role automation and AWS Secrets Manager, as well as serverless performance enhancements like Lambda cold start reduction and API Gateway caching. Debugging and monitoring insights using CloudWatch, X-Ray, and SNS will also be featured. Whether you're a beginner or an advanced user, these actionable insights will help you work smarter, deploy faster, and maximize efficiency in AWS.

speakers.bio: Modood Alvi is Senior Solutions Architect at Amazon Web Services (AWS). Modood is is passionate about the digital transformation and he is committed helping large enterprise customers across the globe to accelerate their adoption of and migration to the cloud. Modood brings more than decade of experience in software development having held a variety of technical roles within companies like SAP and Porsche Digital. Modood earned his Diploma in Computer Science from the University of Stuttgart.

sessions.title: RPC Reinvented: Asynchronous, Durable, and Agent-Ready
sessions.description:
Remote Procedure Call (RPC) frameworks provide a convenient abstraction for request-response communication. In practice, their implicit time constraints and sensitivity to intermittent failures present challenges. As a result, developers often abandon RPC and accept the complexity of asynchronous APIs, queues, and orchestration layers.

This session introduces Nexus RPC, a new open standard that brings the simplicity of RPC to long-running, fault-tolerant operations. Unlike traditional RPC, operations persist independently of client or service lifecycles and can be tracked, resumed, or cancelled at any point—even after outages or restarts. It's RPC reimagined for the realities of modern applications.

Attend this session to learn what Nexus RPC is and how it addresses fundamental challenges in distributed systems. You'll also discover why it is particularly valuable for agentic AI, as it enables LLM-powered agents to reliably invoke external tools and monitor long-running operations.

speakers.bio:
Maxim has spent the last 20 years building massive distributed systems for Amazon, Microsoft, Google, and Uber. Among other things, he led the design and development of the AWS SQS backend, and AWS Simple Workflow Service. At Uber, Maxim led the effort on the open source Cherami and Cadence Workflow projects.

In 2019, he co-founded Temporal Technologies, a company that is redefining the way large-scale reliable applications are developed and operated.
speakers.tagline: CTO and Co-Founder of Temporal Technologies

sessions.title: Advanced Micro Frontends: Multi-Version and Multi-Framework Scenarios
sessions.description:
Micro frontends are particularly appealing for large enterprise solutions as they grant individual teams greater autonomy. This approach brings the agility of small, efficient teams to even the most extensive projects.

However, things get truly challenging when it comes to combining different versions and frameworks. In this session, we’ll explore the numerous challenges that arise in such scenarios and examine various potential solutions. Emphasis will be placed on leveraging web standards to ensure long-term maintainability.

By the end, you’ll understand how to combine different versions and frameworks within your micro frontend architecture, the implications of doing so, and how to address the resulting challenges effectively.

speakers.bio: Trainer and Consultant with focus on Angular. Google Developer Expert (GDE) for Angular and Trusted Collaborator in the Angular team. Writes for O'Reilly, Hanser and the German Java Magazine. Regularly speaks at conferences.

sessions.title: 4 years of building k8s platforms: lessons learned
sessions.description: Me and my team have been building cloud native platforms for over four years now. In this talk, I'll share key insights and lessons learned from building things at dozens of customers. Drawing from both technical and non-technical experiences, I’ll dive into the challenges and successes encountered along the way. From architectural decisions and tooling choices to collaboration dynamics and organizational hurdles, this session will offer valuable (and fun) anecdotes and practical takeaways for anyone navigating the cloud-native journey. This is no hardcore tech talk, but rather an assembly of funny yet informative anecdotes from the life of a consultant.

speakers.bio:
Daniel started his IT carreer as an administrator for ETL and BI tools. He then worked some time in a data warehousing team before diving into all topics devops and cloud native. In his current role he is a DevOps and cloud-native consultant with FullStackS GmbH. Daniel holds a BSc in Industrial Engineering, a MA in Innovation Management and an MBA. 
He lives in Graz with his girlfriend and his tomcat Manfred.

https://drackthor.me

sessions.title: AI & Ethics
sessions.description:
It's been in the news, everywhere. Artificial Intelligence is the next thing in the evolution of technology. While it's probably not the end of everything as some sources say, it's likely true to change the face things for years to come. In this talk, we'll talk about what developers should focus on to build their AI knowledge and skills, what things we need to know outside of the technology to help our understanding, and some general ideas around AI itself.

Most talks about AI focus on tools only - this talk is meant to focus on the impact AI has. on the work of developers and what they should know during their AI journey.

speakers.bio: PJ Hagerty is a well-known figure in the tech industry, particularly within the developer relations and DevOps communities. He is recognized for his work as a developer advocate, community builder, writer, and speaker. PJ founded DevRelate.io, a company focused on helping tech organizations build communities and enhance developer relations. He has a strong presence in the open-source and tech communities, often speaking at conferences and producing content on topics such as software development, DevOps, and community engagement.

sessions.title: The Technology Revolution: Mastering the Challenges of Radical Change
sessions.description: The technology revolution, driven by advancements in generative AI and cloud computing, is reshaping industries at an unprecedented pace. Dr. Dominik Krimpmann examines how these disruptive technologies are redefining business models, decision-making, and the role of technology in organizations. Highlighting insights from over a decade of leadership in digital transformations, he discusses the challenges of navigating exponential technological change while maintaining resilience. The session explores practical strategies for democratizing technology, fostering adaptive mindsets, and building cross-functional teams to accelerate innovation and drive sustainable growth.

speakers.bio: Based on his background in computer science and business administration, Dominik advises many Fortune 500 CEOs, CTOs and CDOs on their “disruption journey” and has led more than 50 business and technology projects in the last ten years. This experience, coupled with his commitment to helping clients achieve their goals enables Dominik to break through organizational uncertainty and achieve rapid results.  As host of his own Podcast and speaker at conferences around the globe and , Dominik also highlights the trends, challenges and opportunities that he believes will shape the future.
speakers.tagline: Technology Strategy Lead ASG at Accenture

sessions.title: Hidden efficiency - How to enable your non-engineers as a CTO
sessions.description: The presentation “Hidden Efficiency - How to Enable Your Non-Engineers as a CTO” highlights strategies to improve organizational efficiency by empowering non-engineering teams through automation and no-code/low-code tools. It emphasizes key performance indicators like revenue per employee and benchmarks for operational efficiency. The content advocates for leveraging internal apps and automation to enhance productivity across all roles, not just engineering. It stresses the importance of fostering a company-wide automation mindset, led by business automation managers and supported by CTO sponsorship. The presentation underscores cross-functional collaboration, investing in user-friendly tools, and encouraging continuous learning. Through these strategies, the goal is to unlock scalability and efficiency by enabling every employee to contribute meaningfully to operational success.

speakers.bio: Andreas "Andi" Stryz is 40 years old and the co-founder and CTO of FINN, a leading company in the field of car subscriptions. As a passionate advocate of automation and the no-code movement, he oversees the development and implementation of FINN's technology roadmap, bringing exceptional leadership qualities and a focus on achieving results. Outside of work, he enjoys running and is known for effortlessly balancing work and leisure.

sessions.title: Gemini 2.x for Developers
sessions.description: Discover Gemini, Google’s most capable generative AI model. Learn to build real-time voice and video apps with the Multimodal Live API, use Google Search and Maps to ground responses, and detect objects in images and video using natural language prompts. Explore Gemini’s improved multimodal understanding, coding, and complex instruction following – making it ideal for developing AI agents. Experience preview features like customizable speech generation (control tone, pace, accent, and intonation) and image generation. Plus, learn where all the great notebooks and tutorials are for learning more. After this session, you’ll be ready to build with Gemini on Google Cloud and beyond.

speakers.bio: Abdel Sghiouar is a senior Cloud Developer Advocate at Google Cloud. A co-host of the Kubernetes Podcast by Google and a CNCF Ambassador. His focused areas are GKE/Kubernetes, Service Mesh, and Serverless.
speakers.tagline: Senior Cloud Developer Advocate at Google Cloud

speakers.bio: Daniela Petruzalek is a senior Cloud Developer Advocate at Google Cloud. Her specialization is data and backend engineering with Go and Python. She is also a Google Certified Data Engineer, Oracle Certified Professional and TEDx speaker. In her spare time she watches anime and pets random cats on the streets.
speakers.tagline: Senior Cloud Developer Advocate at Google Cloud

sessions.title: Scaling LLM Applications on Arm: Optimize for Performance and Cost in the Cloud
sessions.description:
Running cloud workloads and containerized LLM-based applications on Arm delivers better price-performance, improves energy efficiency, and meets growing demands for scale and sustainability. In this hands-on workshop, get a walkthrough of the end-to-end process of containerizing a PyTorch application, building multi-architecture Docker images, deploying Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) using Terraform, and running your application across scalable cloud workloads. If you’re running applications in the cloud, this session shows you how to do it better, faster, and more cost-effectively.

*All workshop attendees are required to bring their own laptop*

speakers.bio: Avin Zarlez (She/Her) is a mother, an advocate, and a staff developer evangelist at Arm. She works at the intersection of technology, community, and innovation to empower developers to create and innovate. She is an accomplished public speaker and has presented at many major industry events and countless tech meetups.
speakers.tagline: Staff SW Engineer & Developer Evangelist at Arm

sessions.title: Microservices in Action, Hands-on with Message Queues: Build and Connect Microservices with AMQP
sessions.description:
This workshop covers the basics of building applications with a microservice architecture.
 You'll learn how services communicate using open source message brokers, and how to implement this using LavinMQ and the AMQP protocol.

Through hands-on exercises, you'll gain practical experience in designing scalable, decoupled systems that use real-world messaging patterns—including fanout for broadcasting, topic exchanges for flexible routing, and direct messaging for targeted delivery.
Perfect for anyone looking to get started or refine their approach to microservices and event-driven design.

speakers.bio: Christina Dahlén, developer and team lead at 84codes (LavinMQ). I specialize in AMQP message brokers and spend most of my time writing code for the LavinMQ project—mainly low-level backend stuff—with a focus on performance and efficiency. I think LavinMQ is a really solid, innovative tool that stands out from what’s available today. It brings something new to the table, and I’d love to see more people explore what it can do and how it can improve the way systems are built. I'm all about sharing knowledge and resources to help others get started and feel confident using these technologies.

Lovisa Johansson is an expert in message queuing and distributed systems, known for her pedagogical approach to teaching complex topics. With extensive experience in open-source message brokers like RabbitMQ and LavinMQ, she focuses on making message-driven systems accessible to learners of all levels.
 
Passionate about hands-on learning, Lovisa uses real-world examples to break down intricate concepts into simple, actionable insights. Her goal is to empower others to master message queuing and build scalable, reliable systems, regardless of their technical background.

sessions.title: Code Red: When Your Tools Turn Against You
sessions.description:
Did you ever wonder what typosquatting, dependency confusion, malicious maintainers, or shadow libraries really mean, and how they could compromise your applications without a single line of your own code being wrong? 

Welcome to the hidden war zone of modern software development: the software supply chain. In this workshop, we’ll demystify the most dangerous and fast-evolving attack vectors that are targeting developers through the tools they trust, package managers, build systems, third-party libraries, and CI/CD pipelines. 
Through real-world case studies and code-level examples, we’ll unpack how: 
Attackers exploit developer mistakes with typosquatting. 
Internal dependencies are hijacked via dependency confusion. 
Maintainers or compromised packages introduce malware into trusted ecosystems. 
Obscure transitive dependencies become silent backdoors. 

This session is designed for developers who want to understand the risks, recognize the signs, and start building defense-in-depth strategies. If time permits, we’ll get hands-on with practical exercises where you’ll see (and maybe try) some of these attack techniques in a controlled environment—so you can learn how to defend against them in the wild. 
Come prepared to rethink your assumptions about open source and start building a more resilient development workflow.

speakers.tagline: Director of Product Management at Veracode

speakers.bio: Julian Totzek-Hallhuber is a manager solution architects at Veracode. As a specialist in application security with almost 20 years of experience in the IT security environment, he has expertise in the areas of application development, penetration testing and web application security. He is also the author of numerous articles, a regular speaker at trade fairs and has participated in projects for www.webappsec.org.
speakers.tagline: Senior Manager Solution Architects at Veracode

sessions.title: Building Agentic Apps with Docker
sessions.description:
Building GenAI apps may feel like a large leap, especially if you're unfamiliar with the stack. With Docker, you can use the same tools and processes you're using on your other apps, but with this new stack! And you'll quickly come to learn that it's not as different as you thought.

This hands-on workshop is designed for developers of all backgrounds - whether you're just getting started with GenAI or looking to deepen your understanding of Docker's latest AI tooling. We'll walk through the fundamentals of LLMs, learn about tool calling and MCP, and then orchestrate agents using Docker Compose. By the end, you'll have created your very own agentic application!

Agenda:
Introduction to LLMs and the OpenAI API
Running models with Docker Model Runner
Choosing the right LLM - trust and security
Understanding tool calling and MCP
Running MCP Servers with the Docker MCP Toolkit
Step-by-step guidance to build a simple Agentic app
Sneak peeks on orchestrating more advanced agents with Compose

speakers.bio:
Michael Irwin has been a developer for ~20 years and has been a part of the container space since 2016, from meetup organizer/presenter to platform architect to recognized Docker Captain. In early 2022, he made the jump to join Docker, where he's now a leader in the Developer Relations team. He's passionate about making development easier for all and breaking down complex concepts into simpler ideas.
Outside of work, you'll find him spending time with his family of seven kiddos, working on various home renovation projects, or trying to enjoy the outdoors.
speakers.tagline: Principal Software Engineer, Developer Success at Docker

sessions.title: Build production-ready headless CMS solutions: Mastering Storyblok and Symfony Integration
sessions.description:
Transform your PHP development workflow by mastering the powerful combination of Storyblok's headless CMS and Symfony's robust framework. This intensive workshop will guide you through the process of building a scalable, content-driven application from scratch.
You will discover how to architect clean, maintainable code using Domain-Driven Design principles, and how to create flexible, reusable content components. You will learn how to leverage the official Storyblok-Symfony bundle, a collaboration between Storyblok and SensioLabs, to seamlessly bridge content management with Symfony's advanced backend capabilities.
By the end of the workshop, you will have gained hands-on experience with real-world patterns for content organisation, API integration strategies and front-end rendering techniques that deliver exceptional experiences for developers and content editors. This workshop is perfect for PHP developers ready to embrace modern headless architecture.

speakers.bio: Edoardo is a Developer Relations Engineer. He has a strong software developer and team leader background, working on various projects and platforms. He is passionate about creating and sharing content that educates and inspires other developers, such as tech talks, videos, podcasts, conferences, and more. He enjoys connecting with the developer community and promoting the benefits of open source software.
speakers.tagline: Senior Developer Relations Engineer at Storyblok

sessions.title: Beyond AI Readiness: Scaling Data-Driven Engineering for Next-Gen Software & Infrastructure
sessions.description:
Data-driven engineering is at the core of modern software development and high-performance IT infrastructures. To stay ahead, analytics solutions must not only process vast and diverse datasets efficiently but also integrate AI-powered automation, Agentic-AI and real-time decision-making.
Join Jannis, Sophie, Christian and Eduard as they introduce the strategy and architecture behind the analytics platform powering the daily banking experiences of 50 million Sparkassen clients. They showcase how they scale automation in AI and Data infrastructure within a secure, air-gapped enterprise environment—bridging compliance and innovation.
Through hands-on use cases, including process mining, they demonstrate how data analytics drives operational excellence. Looking ahead, they share their roadmap for tackling the next big challenges in data analytics: How can we evolve our platform to be more adaptive, scalable, and continuously AI-optimized?

speakers.bio:
Jannis Eickenroth has been working for Finanz Informatik (FI) since 2014 and currently leads the department responsible for the Data & Analytics Platform.

In the early years, Jannis was involved both in backend development on the mainframe and in Java development for frontends and middleware on client/server systems. Over time, he took on the role of project manager and played a key part in introducing new software technologies for OSPlus—the core banking system used by the savings banks.

Now, Jannis supports a fantastic team at FI, working to ensure that Finanz Informatik’s technical ecosystem for data, analytics, and AI is secure and modern, ready for the future.

Outside of work, Jannis enjoys spending time on his mountain bike.
speakers.tagline: Head of Analytics and Customer Engagement at Finanz Informatik

speakers.bio:
Ursprünglich als Java Entwickler bei der FI gestartet für die Entwicklung der Banking-Geschäftsprozesse.
Mittlerweile als Data Engineer für die Data Analytics Plattform unterwegs neue Daten für spannende Analysen anzubinden.

Darüber hinaus organisiere ich seit einigen Jahren die Java Grundlagen Schulung für unsere neuen Auszubildenden.  

https://www.linkedin.com/in/eduard-d%C3%BCcker-683684263
speakers.tagline: Data Engineer Data Analytics Platform at Finanz Informatik

speakers.bio:
Sophie Kleinke is a Data Engineer and Business Analyst at Finanz Informatik, the IT service provider and digitalization partner of the Savings Banks Finance Group.
With a background in mathematics, she focuses on the optimization of business processes, specializing in process mining. Her expertise spans the entire data value chain—from working with backend data structures to designing advanced data visualization solutions using business intelligence tools. Combining data engineering with business analysis, she enables data-driven decision-making and drives efficiency across financial systems.

sessions.title: Unleash the power of 5G in your code: transform your apps
sessions.description: In this session, we’ll explore how to integrate 5G capabilities into your applications using standardized APIs that work in all countries. You will learn how to prevent fraud, create faster and easier form experiences for users, and enhance connectivity—all with practical code examples. Telecom providers have joined forces in an open-source initiative called CAMARA, which standardizes APIs and makes them accessible to all developers through cloud platforms. Now you can truly unleash the power of the network in your code!

speakers.bio: Noel is product manager for Network APIs at Deutsche Telekom and believes that products can only be successful if they provide a high user experience. With network APIs developers can directly interact with the network of a telecommunication provider (e.g. requesting a higher quality). Prior to Deutsche Telekom, he worked for OBI as product owner and finished his Master’s in international management.

Alexandru is responsible for product innovation and business growth by bridging technical expertise and strategic development in the Network API domain at Orange.

His work spans product and business development for Telco APIs, cloud-native services delivery at Orange Business, and 5G edge computing technical projects, where he led cross-functional teams to design, implement, and launch scalable solutions in Orange countries. 

With more than 10 years in the telecom and cloud business and by having a hands-on approach to customer discovery, market research, and solution architecture, he collaborates with diverse internal stakeholders and external partners to create impactful products and use cases that align with Network API strategy at Orange and market trends.

Alexandru holds a M.Sc. degree in Microsystems and a B.Sc. degree in Applied Electronics, both from the University Politehnica of Bucharest, Romania.

Mark Cornall is Technical Director for Cloud Networks at the GSMA, where he leads the technical delivery of the GSMA Open Gateway program. He works closely with TM Forum and CAMARA to align API standardization efforts across the telecom ecosystem, driving operator collaboration and innovation. With a background at Vodafone, Orange and P3 Communications, he brings deep expertise in mobile edge computing, network optimization, and telecom innovation. Mark is a frequent speaker on API standardization, cloud-native networks, and cross-industry collaboration.
speakers.tagline: Technical Director for Cloud Networks at GSMA

speakers.bio: Sameer is a business development professional at Telefónica Germany, focused on innovation-driven business models, GTM strategies, and multi-partner ecosystems. He believes modern apps can unlock network capabilities beyond telephony via Network APIs for seamless user experiences. With a background as a product manager and data engineer at global telcos, Sameer has used APIs for data integration and workflow automation. He combines technical expertise with business acumen to drive collaborative innovation in telecom.
speakers.tagline: Business Development Manager at Telefónica Germany

sessions.title: Agentic AI - From Theory to Practice: Developing Multi-Agent AI Systems on Azure
sessions.description: Transition from theoretical concepts to practical implementation of multi-agent AI systems using Azure. Attendees will learn about architectures, design patterns, and tools necessary to build and deploy multi-agent systems that can solve complex problems efficiently based on Azure AI Foundry Agent Service and Semantic Kernel.

speakers.bio: Ricardo Niepel is a Senior Technology Specialist at Microsoft, covering software development topics at Azure for large enterprises in Germany. Being 11+ years at Microsoft he worked with a lot of different development teams across enterprises, distributed worldwide, helping them with architecture design sessions, reviews and proof-of-concepts how to adopt Microsoft technologies and Azure cloud for application innovations.
speakers.tagline: Senior Technology Specialist - Azure Application Innovation at Microsoft

sessions.title: Beyond Digital: Leading Organizational Transformation with Deloitte and Zalando
sessions.description: This fireside chat explores what truly defines deep organizational transformation beyond superficial digital changes, using Deloitte’s concept of “stagility” (stability plus agility) and Zalando’s real-world transformation journey as key examples. Topics include how Deloitte and Zalando collaborated to align technology, people, and culture; how transformation extends beyond implementing tools to embed new ways of working; the evolving role of AI in transformation; and how organizations are rethinking the definition of value in tech and workforce investments. The session concludes with practical advice for companies embarking on their own transformation journeys.

speakers.bio: Svitlana is a seasoned HR professional with over 20 years of experience, currently leading Workday implementation at Zalando, a leading fashion and lifestyle e-commerce company. Svitlana excels in strategic HR, talent management, and organizational development, driving success in global and local HR functions. With extensive experience across Europe, Scandinavia, DACH, and Asia, she has spearheaded business engagement initiatives, tech transformations, and advanced HR operating models.
speakers.tagline: People & Organization Transformation Director at Zalando

speakers.bio: As an experienced management consultant, Birte has extensive experience in talent transformation projects incl. strategic direction and end-to-end implementation. Birte is addicted to tailor the latest trends to her client needs and put specific solutions in the bigger picture / human capital dynamics. Birte has supported various companies in digital transformation processes and (Gen)AI talent impact assessments on jobs, tasks and skills incl. derivation of strategic measures to accompany the shift towards human performance in uncertain times.
speakers.tagline: Human Capital and Talent Transformation Expert at Deloitte

sessions.title: The End of Software as we know it
sessions.description: We're at the beginning of the AI technology wave that will be very big, and happen very fast. The businesses that survive will reimagine how they build, sell, and market based on AI-first principles. In this talk Intercom's Chief Product Officer Paul Adams will walk you through the new ways of working and building software in the AI era. He'll offer practical tips and lessons learned from helping reinvent Intercom from a 13 year old incumbent who ripped up its existing strategy and processes  to transform into an AI-native company.

speakers.bio:
Paul is Intercom’s Chief Product Officer, leading the Product Management, Product Design, Data Science, and Research teams. 

Before Intercom, Paul worked in Leadership, Product, and UX roles at Facebook, Google, Dyson, and in UX consultancy. 

Paul is an author and speaker on product strategy, product execution, team building, business development, and social software design. He has written a best-selling book on social software design called Grouped and speaks at many leading industry conferences.

sessions.title: Building AI Applications with LangChain and Node.js
sessions.description: In this session, we'll dive into the process of creating AI applications using the LangChain framework and Node.js. You'll learn how to effectively integrate Large Language Models (LLMs) into your projects, and how to use embeddings to vectorize text-based documents. This embeddings will be stored in a vector database, we will use pgvector, a extension for supporting vectors in PostgreSQL, which is crucial for handling similarity search queries for Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) applications.

speakers.bio: Julián Duque is a Telecommunications Engineer, Software Development specialist and Community Leader with strong experience in Node.js programming, event-driven architectures, and education. He works as a Principal Developer Advocate at Heroku building quality content for our developer audience.

sessions.title: GenAI Security: Navigating the Unseen Iceberg
sessions.description:
Have you ever marveled at a GenAI application, only to wonder about the unseen complexities beneath its sleek interface? You're not alone. 

Imagine implementing a GenAI solution, only to discover months later that it's been silently propagating biases or compromising data privacy. How would that affect your reputation and bottom line?
