By understanding the full spectrum of GenAI complexities, you'll be equipped to prevent such scenarios and create more robust, ethical solutions.

You will deep dive beneath the surface of GenAI, revealing the hidden iceberg of security and responsibility challenges that could impact your projects and organization.

By the end of this presentation, you'll have a comprehensive understanding of GenAI's hidden complexities and the tools to address them.

speakers.bio:
Maish Saidel-Keesing is a Senior Developer Advocate at AWS with over 20 years of trailblazing IT expertise. His visionary leadership in architecting intricate systems has driven industry evolution, with a keen focus on cloud, automation, and open-source solutions.

Maish's mission to unify Developers and Operators has revolutionized operational harmony, erased silos, and mitigated disruptions. As a passionate advocate for automation, he propels efficient architectures, driving progress that enriches both technology and lives.

sessions.title: The Future of React: A Deep Dive into Its Compiler and Auto Optimization
sessions.description: React’s new compiler is redefining performance optimization, eliminating the need for manual techniques like React.memo and useMemo. This talk takes a deep dive into how the compiler works under the hood, its impact on component rendering, and how it automates performance gains without extra effort from developers. We’ll explore its potential, current limitations, and what this means for the future of React applications. Whether you're building new projects or optimizing existing ones, you'll walk away with a clear understanding of how to leverage this cutting-edge tool as it evolves.

speakers.bio: Hammad is a Software Engineer with expertise in the JavaScript stack and Machine Learning. His coding journey took off while building mobile apps in React Native, where countless hours debugging those famous red error screens sparked his deep love for development. This passion led him to explore full-stack development and the ML stack. Now, he creates modern, high-quality applications and integrates them with smart AI solutions. He also actively engages with the community to share his knowledge through speaking at conferences and meetups.

sessions.title: Agentic AI Systems for Critical Workloads
sessions.description:
Although there is no universally agreed definition of what an AI agent is, in practice several patterns are emerging that demonstrate how to coordinate and combine the capabilities of multiple AI services, in order to create AI-based systems that can accomplish more complex tasks.
These Agentic Systems architectures can be grouped in 2 main categories: workflows, where LLMs and tools are orchestrated through predefined code paths, and agents, where LLMs dynamically direct their own processes and tool usage, maintaining control over how they execute tasks.
Moreover testing these Agentic Systems architectures is one of the biggest challenges for the adoption in mission critical scenarios, due to their not completely deterministic nature.
The goal of this talk is giving a theoretical overview of Agentic AI in general and these patterns in particular, discussing their differences and range of applicability and showing with practical examples how they can be easily implemented and tested with Quarkus and its LangChain4j extension.

speakers.bio: Mario Fusco is a Java Champion and works at Red Hat as principal software engineer and Drools project lead. He is also a frequent speaker, the coordinator of JUG Milano and the co-author of "Modern Java in Action" published by Manning.
speakers.tagline: Senior Principal Software Engineer at Red Hat

sessions.title: Unwind: Breaking the Psychology of Cloud Vendor Lock-in
sessions.description: Do you base your goals and success criteria on what’s good for you? Or what’s good for your cloud provider? The phenomenon of vendor lock-in is widely acknowledged to over-sell and under-serve us, so why is this so prevalent? A cloud agnostic approach is a durable and highly sought after strategy, but it requires more than just redrawing an architecture. In this talk we’ll explore the narratives and psychological aspects that shape our choice of tooling, and the art of the possible when that tooling works for us.

speakers.bio: Billy Thompson leads DevOps and Platform Engineering solutions for Office of the CTO at Akamai Cloud Computing. He consults and helps customers to build and implement portable Cloud-native workloads at scale. As a passionate voice and thought leader, and open source evangelist, Billy is just having fun! He is also a longtime Arch Linux user and vegan, and never knows which to tell people first! Outside of work he volunteers his home for fostering and acclimating rescue dogs. And if you've got any good recommendations for good techno music, he's all ears!
speakers.tagline: Global DevOps & Platform Engineering at Akamai

sessions.title: Beyond Kafka & RabbitMQ: Why NATS is the Future of Microservices Messaging
sessions.description:
Messaging is the backbone of modern applications, connecting systems in real-time. Traditional messaging systems like Kafka and RabbitMQ are powerful, but they come with significant complexity, making them less suited for lightweight, low-latency environments. That's where NATS (https://nats.io/) shines.

In this talk, we'll dive into why NATS could be the perfect choice for your next project by outperforming other systems with cool features like;

- Lightweight & Cloud-Native – Simple and efficient, perfect for environments with limited resources.
- Ultra-Fast – Low-latency for real-time communication.
- Easy to Scale – Built-in clustering, auto-discovery, and horizontal scaling, ensuring that the system grows with your needs without added complexity.
- Edge-Ready – Ideal for IoT, mobile apps, and devices that need low power.

Whether you're building microservices, IoT applications, or real-time systems, NATS is the ideal, lightweight open-source messaging platform.

speakers.bio:
I am a Cloud DevOps Engineer, working at Zeiss Digital Innovation GmbH. I worked with Kubernetes in my master's thesis working specifically with custom resources and controllers. Previously, I interned as a System Development Engineer at Amazon Web Services working on EC2. 
When I'm not in the tech zone, you can catch me cooking up cool DevOps projects, tuning into podcasts, and having my mini karaoke party. Because, you know, why not add some rhythm to the tech life? 🎤 Let's make the digital world awesome together! 💻✨ #DevOpsExplorer #CloudEnthusiast
speakers.tagline: Cloud DevOps Engineer at Zeiss Digital Innovation

sessions.title: Resolving technical debts in software architecture
sessions.description:
Today programmers do not develop applications from scratch, but they spend their time fixing, extending, modifying and enhancing existing applications. The biggest problem in their daily work is that with time maintenance mutates from structured programming to defensive programming: The code becomes too complex to be maintained. We put in code we know is stupid from an architectural point of view but it is the only solution that will hopefully work. Maintenance is more and more difficult and expensive. Our software accumulates technical debts.
In this talk, you will see how you should improve your architecture and source code to prevent technical debt growing unrestricted. With the proper knowledge about well-structured architecture, refactorings for tangled code can quickly be found. Complex code can be eliminated, and maintenance costs will be reduced.

speakers.bio: Dr. Carola Lilienthal is Managing Director of WPS - Workplace Solutions GmbH and has been regularly analysing the future viability of software architectures on behalf of her customers since 2003. In 2015, she summarized her experiences from over a hundred analyses in the book "Langlebige Softwarearchitekturen". In 2017, together with Henning Schwentner, she translated Vaughn Vernon's book "Domain-Driven Design Distilled" into German.

sessions.title: Logs in observability - Correlation
sessions.description: Explore how system logs can unlock actionable insights in this session. We'll discuss daily log volumes in modern infrastructures, the impact of descriptive logging, and how to create meaningful stories through context and correlations. Discover the power of automation and K-Means clustering to uncover hidden patterns, drive faster issue resolution, and predict failures. With real-world experiments and practical tips, you'll see how logs can transform operations and provide a strategic edge for your business.

speakers.bio: Site Lead and R&D Director at Dynatrace's Gdańsk office, the company's second-largest R&D center, employing over 430 IT specialists. Over two decades in IT, he has held leadership and software engineering roles across various industries, including aviation, fuel, chemical, HVAC, and engineering. His international experience spans the UK, France, Germany, Romania, the Netherlands, Sweden, and Canada.

sessions.title: Exploring LLMs across clouds
sessions.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) are powerful tools for natural language processing and generation, and they have been widely adopted by various cloud service providers. However, the practical implications of the differences in the approaches, features, and limitations of LLMs across different cloud platforms are significant. In this session, we will compare and contrast the LLM offerings of Google, Microsoft, and Amazon and provide an overview of the pros and cons of each of them. We will also explore the different options and challenges of integrating LLMs in custom applications, as well as the tooling ecosystem that each vendor provides to help developers build LLM-based solutions. Finally, we will discuss the security and safety aspects of using LLMs in the cloud, and the best practices for ensuring ethical and responsible use of generative AI.

speakers.bio: Tomislav is the CTO and partner at Nephos, a company that supports digital transformation for clients globally. Before Nephos, Tomislav spent 13 years at Microsoft, most recently as a technology strategist for partners integrating Microsoft's technology and cloud services. He has collaborated with various companies, from startups to large enterprises, aiding developers and system engineers in adopting the latest technologies. His focus areas include AI, cloud technologies, microservices, DevOps, Data and IoT. He frequently shares knowledge through workshops and conferences.

sessions.title: How Visionary Leaders Drive Transformation

speakers.bio:
Anu Bharadwaj is the President of Atlassian and is focused on uniting the Product, Business, Design, and Engineering teams to deliver innovative products that customers love while supercharging the growth of Atlassian’s businesses.
With nearly 20 years of experience in transforming and building billion-dollar businesses, Anu brings deep expertise in Product, Operations, and Engineering for customer-focused growth. As former Atlassian COO, she scaled a distributed workforce across 13 countries, led Atlassian’s SaaS transformation, and built the Cloud enterprise business. Previously, she held leadership roles at Microsoft, launching products for the Visual Studio ALM team.
Anu is deeply passionate about growing diverse teams and making the world a better place through technology and effective philanthropy, and regularly advises young and emerging companies (Snyk, Xembly).

Boris Nemsic is a visionary serial entrepreneur, investor, and board member of leading tech companies. Named one of Europe’s top telecom CEOs by "Institutional Investor", he served as CEO of Telekom Austria Group, transforming it into a leading European mobile operator across eight countries, and as CEO of VimpelCom, managing 65 million customers in Russia and beyond, including pioneering greenfield operations in Southeast Asia. He chaired Delta Partners (now FTIDelta), a globally renowned TMT advisory and investment firm, and advises KKR on high-stakes technology, media, and telecom investments. With a PhD in technology, Nemsic’s landmark research predicted industry trends over a decade ago. A bold advocate for innovation and market-driven regulation, he has shaped the telecom industry as a thought leader, serving as a GSMA board member and Chairman of its Public Policy Committee.

speakers.tagline: General Manager & Technology Leader at IBM Germany

speakers.bio: Tobias Schlottke is the founding CTO of saas.group, a B2B SaaS aggregator with over 400 employees across its global portfolio. He co-founded OMR, Germany’s leading platform for the digital economy, best known for its annual 70,000+ attendee festival, as well as two adtech companies, serving as CTO in both. He’s passionate about developer experience, AI adoption, and scaling engineering teams. Tobias also hosts the alphalist.CTO podcast and runs Europe’s largest CTO community.

sessions.title: Leading through infrastructure investment decisions
sessions.description:
Many organizations face the challenge of delivering more with limited budgets while also meeting the increasing demands of their customers for innovative products and improved service.

For engineering leaders, this means carefully prioritizing engineering work and investments in technical projects while also considering the need to develop new technologies. However, choosing which engineering work to prioritize involves making effective budgetary tradeoffs and identifying the most impactful investments for the business. 

This session will explore practical tools such as SLOs, KPI Trees, and the FinOps culture to make cost management a shared responsibility across the organization. It will also focus on influencing without direct authority, driving transparency, and integrating cost optimization into the engineering culture.

speakers.bio: Italo Vietro is a seasoned engineering leader with a proven track record in scaling platforms and driving engineering excellence. As VP of Platform at Babbel, he focuses on fostering technical excellence, innovation, and building inclusive, high-performing teams. With experience leading organizations of over 100 people at companies like Urban Sports Club, Lykon, N26, and HelloFresh, Italo expertly navigates complex challenges, always emphasizing customer-centric and scalable solutions.

sessions.title: Stories from an Unsuccessful Recruiter
sessions.description:
Let’s face it—recruiting isn’t just about finding great candidates; it’s about winning over hiring managers, and wow, did I fail at that when I first started. In this lighthearted (but painfully real) session, I’ll take you through three cringeworthy stories of how I totally botched stakeholder relationships—and how I eventually turned it around. Expect laughs, hard truths, and lessons that’ll save you from making the same mistakes. If you’ve ever struggled to get hiring managers on your side, this one’s for you! Think of it as a recruiter’s guide to what not to do—served with a side of self-deprecating humor and a dash of “please learn from my mistakes.”
And who knows, I might have a little surprise for you in the end;)

speakers.bio:
Mahmoud is a Talent Acquisition expert with 9 years of experience recruiting for agency and in-house teams around the world. Throughout his career, Mahmoud has taken on several roles from Talent Sourcing, Early Careers recruiting, Executive hiring, Corporate/Tech Talent Acquisition and Employer Branding, one thing for sure, he absolutely loves Recruiting.
He's currently leading GTM Recruitment at Semrush globally and previously led the Data & AI business at Nike. He's also the Founder of Egypt Recruiting Community, the first community in Egypt to the People community

sessions.title: Building Talent Acquisitions Teams
sessions.description:
Business Case: Building Talent Acquisition Team 

Introduction:
In today’s competitive job market, organisations must invest in a strategic Talent Acquisition (TA) function to attract, hire, and retain top talent. A well-structured TA team is not just about filling vacancies; it is about driving business growth, enhancing employer branding, and ensuring long-term workforce planning. This keynote will provide business leaders, HR professionals, and talent leaders with actionable insights into building a high-performing TA team that aligns with organisational goals.

Problem Statement:
Many organisations struggle with an ineffective talent acquisition strategy, leading to challenges such as high turnover, long time-to-fill metrics, poor candidate experience, and misalignment between hiring efforts and business needs. A fragmented TA structure can result in inefficiencies, lack of innovation, and failure to secure top-tier talent.

speakers.bio:
A Talent Acquisition Leader with an educational background in HR. Having worked in the HR function as an HR Generalist, International Mobility and Talent Acquisition. Kobi is a big advocate for Diversity & Inclusion in recruitment. 
He has worked in the FMCG, Retail, Sporting Goods, Fashion, and Technology industries for 23 years. 

With his years in Human Resources and Talent Acquisition functions, Kobi brings insights that can help you gain a different perspective. 

With a global network of talented individuals, he sees himself as a connector with a passion for Talent Acquisition.
speakers.tagline: Head of Talent Acquisition at The HEINEKEN Company

speakers.bio:
By nature, I am an energetic speaker who easily translates complex topics into practical insights. With a focus on autonomy and communication - what can YOU do to make your ideas land better in the organization - I inspire you to get the best out of yourself.

My way of speaking is sharp, accessible and I also provide a lot of familiarity. Because of this, I not only inspire but also really spur people into action.

sessions.title: Compose the Future: Building Agentic Applications, Made Simple with Docker
sessions.description:
Agentic applications are here, and Docker is making agentic development real for every developer. In this keynote, learn how new enhancements to Docker Compose simplify the development of apps powered by models, agents, and the Model Context Protocol (MCP). 
We’ll highlight advancements that let you seamlessly move from local to cloud to production—while maintaining security by using approved tools, secrets, MCPs, and more. Plus, see live demos and hear from partners on how to integrate agentic apps into your existing developer stack

speakers.bio:
Mark Cavage is President and COO at Docker, with over 25 years of experience in business, product development, and engineering. His career includes leadership roles at AWS, Joyent, Oracle, Salesforce (Heroku), Stripe, and Nuna, focusing on developer platforms, cloud-scale operations, and security-driven software delivery—aligning perfectly with Docker’s mission.
At Oracle, Cavage co-founded Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), building it into a hyperscale cloud platform for mission-critical applications and AI workloads. He also led Oracle’s application development and container strategy, making it the first enterprise ISV to containerize its databases and applications. At Salesforce, he led engineering for Heroku, and at Stripe, he helped launch the Stripe App Marketplace and later led the Financial Services division. Most recently, as CTO of Nuna, he drove innovation in healthcare technology focused on patient engagement and outcomes.
speakers.tagline: President & Chief Operating Officer of Docker

speakers.bio: Tushar is the EVP of Engineering and Product at Docker, where he leads the development of the platform that powers secure, developer-first, and AI-enabled application development. At Docker, he is driving new innovations across the software supply chain, developer experience, and AI workflows, helping teams build, ship, and run applications faster and more securely.
speakers.tagline: Executive Vice President, Product & Engineering at Docker
Director of Engineering at Google Cloud

sessions.title: Overcoming bottlenecks of Platform Teams
sessions.description: Platform Teams became a known concept for speeding up software delivery thanks to Team Topologies, which defines Platform Teams as a team focused on reducing the cognitive load of stream-aligned teams by providing reusable services, APIs, infrastructure, etc. Inspired by Team Topologies, many organizations try to implement either the whole concept or a part of it but face various challenges. One of the biggest problems is that platform teams are becoming bottlenecks. In this talk, we'll dive into systems thinking, organizational structure, stakeholder management, prioritization, and many other topics to understand how to move platform teams out of a bottleneck situation. We will talk about an example where I led the transformation of a cross-functional team into a platform team and overcame the bottleneck situation. I will share our challenges in a dynamic and changing organization, the mistakes we have made, and how we solved the bottleneck situation.

speakers.bio:
Candost is a software engineering leader, writer, coach, mentor, and advisor.

He works towards creating great and high-performing systems and teams whose members work in sync, have good communication, share common principles, and are aligned on the same goal. He always wants to create and be part of a powerful and strongly communicating team working toward a clear vision that he can contribute and be passionate about.

sessions.title: Accelerating Python on GPUs
sessions.description: There has been a huge rise in the use of graphics processing units (GPUs) for general purpose computing outside of purely visual applications, be it for accelerating scientific simulations, or training artificial intelligences. Last year this talk looked at some of the Python-based software, tools and frameworks available to help developers and researchers quickly utilise the full abilities of GPU acceleration technology in their work. This talk will provide an update and highlight the latest developments in using GPUs in the world of Python.

speakers.bio: At NVIDIA, Paul has responsibility for supporting customers and partners in delivering accelerated solutions for the Higher Education, High Performance Computing and AI communities in the UK. As well as providing advice on making the best use of NVIDIA hardware, Paul teaches on how to program for GPUs, mentors at hackathons and regularly engages with research software engineering groups. Paul is an advocate for using accelerated computing in HPC, and the use of AI as a powerful tool for researchers.

sessions.title: Safeguarding Sensitive Data Access At Scale with Privacy-Enhancing Technologies
sessions.description: Microservice architecture has become a popular system design option in recent years due to its agility and scalability. Business logics are decoupled into multiple services and data can easily flow among them. However, this brings in another critical challenge in data protection - how to safeguard sensitive data while maintaining the benefits of microservices. In this talk, we will present our innovative solution to protect sensitive data lifecycle in large-scale microservice architecture. By utilizing privacy-enhancing technologies (PETs) like encryption, pseudonymization and confidential computing technologies, our solution guarantees that sensitive data can only be accessible by minimal logics in trusted execution environments. In addition, to provide better transparency on sensitive data usage, computations can be audited and verified by external parties through the remote attestation mechanism. Finally, we will also discuss challenges and opportunities of applying PETs at scale.

speakers.bio: Mingshen is a research scientist at TikTok, leading applications and innovations of the trusted/confidential computing technologies. Previously, he worked on multiple open-source projects in security with trusted execution environments. He also serves on Technical Advisory Council (TAC) of Confidential Computing Consortium. Mingshen also published several academic papers on topics at the intersection of privacy and security, operating systems, and programming languages and holds a PhD in Computer Science and Engineering from the Chinese University of Hong kong.

sessions.title: Bootable AI Containers with Podman Desktop
sessions.description:
The world of containerization is advancing rapidly, and bootable containers are at the forefront of transforming operating system (OS) deployment and management. But what exactly are bootable containers? They go beyond traditional containers by packaging entire operating systems, combining the agility of containers with the capabilities of full OS deployment. With Podman Desktop, you’ll explore how to create, manage, and deploy these bootable OS images seamlessly.

This session will guide you through building a custom bootable container image based on CentOS Stream 9, complete with an artificial intelligence (AI)-powered code generation application. From configuring the environment to deploying bootable disk images on cloud and bare metal, you’ll master the essentials of packaging OS images with application workloads that are consistent, immutable, and easily updatable. Join us to discover a new frontier in containerization!

speakers.bio: Kevin is a Java Champion, software engineer, author and international speaker with a passion for Open Source, Java, and Cloud Native Development & Deployment practices. He currently works as developer advocate at Red Hat where he gets to enjoy working with Open Source projects and improving the developer experience. He previously worked as a (lead) software engineer at a variety of organizations across the world ranging from small startups to large enterprises and even government agencies.
speakers.tagline: Sr. Principal Developer Advocate at Red Hat

speakers.bio: Cedric Clyburn (@cedricclyburn), Senior Developer Advocate at Red Hat, is an enthusiastic software technologist with a background in Kubernetes, DevOps, and container tools. He has experience speaking and organizing conferences including DevNexus, WeAreDevelopers, The Linux Foundation, KCD NYC, and more. Cedric loves all things open-source, and works to make developer's lives easier! Based out of New York.
speakers.tagline: Senior Developer Advocate at Red Hat

sessions.title: A Deep Dive on How To Leverage the NVIDIA GB200 for Ultra-Fast Training and Inference on Kubernetes
sessions.description:
Kubernetes traditionally does not have a mechanism for allocating non-node-local resources. The one exception being persistent volumes, which allow a user to attach the same volume to multiple pods running on different nodes. With the introduction of Dynamic Resource Allocation (DRA) we now have a way to allocate any type of resource with similar semantics.

In this talk, we discuss how DRA’s ability to allocate non-node-local resources has unlocked the potential to read / write remote GPU memory over high-bandwidth, multi-node NVLinks. We begin with an introduction on how DRA models non-node-local resources in general, followed by the specifics of how we have leveraged this capability to enable lightning fast multi-node training and inference on the NVIDIA GB200 NVL72 supercomputer. As part of this, we discuss how this support has been pushed to all major cloud providers and integrated with their managed Kubernetes offerings. We conclude with a demo.

speakers.bio: Kevin Klues is a distinguished engineer on the NVIDIA Cloud Native team. Kevin has been involved in the design and implementation of a number of Kubernetes technologies, including the Topology Manager, the Kubernetes stack for Multi-Instance GPUs, and Dynamic Resource Allocation (DRA). When not working, you can usually find Kevin on a snowboard or up in the mountains in some capacity or another.

sessions.title: Optimizing Discovery: PostgreSQL's Role in Transforming GetYourGuide's Search
sessions.description:
Search is broken into 2 components at GetYourGuide. Structured and Unstructured Search. While opensearch and json gave us a lot of flexibility in schema and access to the data with simple filtering over complex json data types and aggregations, there were ofcourse tradeoffs, like performance, and complexity to manage Opensearch cluster. As well as lack of simple scalability and significant slow writes to avoid read impact. A lot more troubles that I would like to present, but more on the pros of Postgres, and how it helped us achieved a nice hybrid schema with tables that have hybrid denormalization allowing us to build a strong foundation that opened up a lot of possibilities for our Marketplace. 
Impact - PG is 40% faster in those queries when we compared against Opensearch.

speakers.bio: Staff Software Engineer at GetYourGuide, passionate about coding and deep diving into databases (moreso Postgres). I've got a background in HFT, financial systems, and quant engineering, and now really enjoy building backend systems. Beyond tech, I'm a soon-to-be dad, adventure sports enthusiast, snowboarder/skateboarder, and generally just love traveling in the mountains.

sessions.title: Trunk-Based Development at Scale: Real-World Insights from a High-Traffic Luxury E-Commerce Platform
sessions.description:
Modern software teams need to deliver high-quality software at high speed while maintaining stability. 

Trunk-Based Development (TBD) is a powerful approach that enables teams to deploy multiple times a day with confidence. In this session, we’ll explore how TBD improves collaboration, reduces release cycles, and optimizes Time to Value. 

Using a real-world example from a luxury sports car manufacturer’s e-commerce platform with 10M+ monthly visitors, we’ll dive into the benefits of TBD, the role of a solid CI/CD pipeline, and a comprehensive testing strategy to catch issues early. 

Expect practical insights, live examples, and actionable strategies to streamline your development workflow and confidently push changes to production.

We'll cover: Unit Tests, Integration Tests , Contract Tests, Load Tests, Visual Regression Tests, E2E Test, Cross-Browser Tests, UI Performance Tests, SEO Tests, Accessibility Tests , Security & Penetration Tests

speakers.bio: Julian is the Co-Founder and CEO of Team One Developers. With over 13 years of experience in agile software development, he empowers teams to build digital products that truly resonate with users. Specializing in the TypeScript ecosystem, he focuses on Frontend Performance, User Experience, and Accessibility—ensuring that fast, intuitive, and inclusive applications become the standard
speakers.tagline: Co-Founder & CEO of Team One Developers

sessions.title: Semantic AI: Why Embeddings Might Matter More Than LLMs
sessions.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) get all the attention, but Embedding Models might be the real unsung heroes of AI systems. Christian shows how embedding-driven semantics can guard against hallucinations, dynamically route tasks, and supercharge Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) workflows. Combined with Small or Large Language Models, embeddings offer a scalable way to build AI systems that aim to be more accurate, efficient, and context-aware. If you're ready to move beyond LLM hype, discover a semantic-centric approach in a pragmatic way.

speakers.bio: Christian Weyer is co-founder and CTO of Thinktecture AG. As a Microsoft MVP, Google GDE, and Microsoft RD, he is an engaged and passionate speaker at various software conferences and events worldwide. For more than 25 years, his heart has always been with the latest technologies and how to apply them reasonably to ISV and enterprise solutions.

sessions.title: Rethinking Customer Experience in the Age of AI

speakers.bio:
Dr. Saskia Meier-Andrae has been leading eBay's operations in Germany since March 2024, focusing on sustainable growth through marketplace initiatives and innovations. She also heads the European Central Market (ECM) team, which includes Poland, Austria, Switzerland, the Netherlands, Belgium, Spain, and Ireland. Her strategy centers on investing in unique inventory that connects people globally on a secure marketplace, utilizing a diverse and competitive range of sellers.
To boost eBay's standing as a top online marketplace in Germany, she prioritizes platform development, tech advancement, recommerce expansion, and strengthening partnerships with sellers.
Before joining eBay, Dr. Saskia Meier-Andrae held various management roles at Wayfair, a major U.S. e-commerce platform, where she oversaw the German market. She previously spent 10 years at Boston Consulting Group, leading projects in M&A and strategy. A mathematician and PhD bioinformatician, she lives in Berlin with her family.

Stefan Bär is CTO and Business Unit Head at Nagarro with over 2 decades of experience
in software engineering, enterprise IT, and innovation leadership.
Stefan is a tech visionary and digital transformation expert with a proven track record of
bridging cutting-edge technology with real-world business impact.
As a founder of multiple startups, Stefan brings a strong entrepreneurial mindset to
everything he does — from building scalable products to guiding clients through
complex digital journeys

Daniel Gebler is CTO of Picnic, the world’s fastest growing online supermarket that makes grocery shopping simple,fun, and affordable for everyone. Previously, he was Director R&D of Fredhopper, responsible for the product and technology roadmap, and led engineering teams located in Amsterdam and Sofia. Daniel holds a PhD in Computer Scienceand an MBA. He published papers, edited journals, and chaired international workshops on software correctness.

Keno is a Principal Consultant and Head of AI at SQUER, where he drives AI initiatives and contributes to the company’s strategic direction. 

He holds a Master’s in IT and Cognition from the University of Copenhagen, specializing in machine learning, NLP, and software architecture. His experience spans AI-driven solutions, full-stack development,  and blockchain, with leadership roles across fintech and AI product development.

He thrives on solving complex challenges, leading high-performance teams, and pushing the boundaries of AI and software innovation.
speakers.tagline: Principal Consultant & Head of AI at SQUER

sessions.title: Destigmatizing the Workplace: Building Real Inclusion
sessions.description:
Many companies claim to value inclusion, but the reality often falls short. Employees are still expected to hide parts of themselves whether it’s mental health struggles, neurodiversity, or personal challenges. Despite the focus on diversity, many workplaces aren't ready for real authenticity.

In this session, we’ll explore how HR leaders and developers can move beyond good intentions to create true, lasting change. We’ll focus on the how: shifting from surface-level policies to fostering a culture of empathy, support, and vulnerability. Learn how to break down stigma, normalise tough conversations, and build an inclusive environment where people can bring their full selves to work.

This isn’t just about talking inclusion it’s about creating workplaces where authenticity is welcomed and inclusion is woven into the culture.

speakers.bio: Marie is the co-founder of Behind The Mask, a community dedicated to creating spaces where people can bring their whole selves to work and discuss mental health, neurodiversity, and more. With 15+ years in Talent Acquisition, Marie advocates for neurodiverse individuals and leads with vulnerability. She’s committed to helping organizations break down stigma and build inclusive, flexible, and human-centered workplaces where everyone can thrive.

sessions.title: Signs of an Engineering Culture
sessions.description:
The talk explores the characteristics of a productive, innovative, and healthy software engineering environment. 

It addresses key questions such as: What do software engineers truly need to deliver the next innovative product or service? Are perks like massages, rewards, and other benefits effective for long-term success? 

The talk aims to uncover what genuinely drives motivation and sustainable innovation in software engineering teams, while also suggesting actionable steps to shift the culture in a positive direction.

speakers.bio:
Ever since I acquired my first 8-bit computer, I developed a profound love for coding. Following my studies in Software Engineering, I devoted over 15 years to coding ams technical leading in various roles across diverse companies. 

A decade ago, I transitioned my career towards engineering management, and today, I serve as the Engineering Coach at Slido.

I am an ardent supporter of Linux/Open source and Agile product development. I actively contribute to community through blogging, hosting podcasts, and organizing meetups centered around product and software engineering topics.

sessions.title: Modern software architectures
sessions.description: In times when applications are facing an uncertain future with the cloud, artificial intelligence and the like, one quality attribute is more important than ever for architecture: flexibility. A modern architecture should not only cover the requirements of the present, but also take future scenarios into account. In this session, we will look at how an architecture can be given the necessary flexibility to meet all future requirements and at the same time be operated in an economically optimal way.

speakers.bio: David Tielke is a certified consultant, coach and trainer for software architectures and software quality. He has over 15 years of project experience across a wide range of industries across the world. In addition, David works as a speaker on numerous professional conferences and as an author in various print media.

sessions.title: Web-Fragments: incremental micro-frontends migration approach for enterprise
sessions.description:
During this session we will introduce Web Fragments, a radically different approach to incrementally migrating a monolithic frontend to a new stack. 

The session will guide developers and architects into understanding the benefits of migrating from client-side to server-side rendered stacks, and then hands-on demonstrate how to efficiently build seamless micro-frontend integrations from independently built and deployed applications, that are accessible as independent contexts with browser standard tools. 

This technology in the making, is already being used in production with measurable performance and maintenance gains.

speakers.bio: https://igor.dev/about/
speakers.tagline: Sr. Director of Engineering at Cloudflare

speakers.bio: Natalia has worked in the roles of frontend developer, full-stack developer, technical lead, software and solutions architect. She is a CPC member of the OpenJS foundation, a Node.js contributor, OSS enthusiast and award winning O'Reilly author.
speakers.tagline: Lead for DX and DevTools JavaScript at Microsoft

sessions.title: How to Build a Sustainable High Performance Culture
sessions.description: The way we work is evolving at an unprecedented pace. Organisations that fail to prioritise employee wellbeing as a driver of performance risk falling behind. But here’s the challenge: how do we build high-performing individuals, teams, and cultures without burnout, disengagement, or losing talent to more progressive workplaces? Join Bianca Errigo in this powerful session as she unpacks the Sustainable High Performance Framework, a research-backed approach that enables businesses to achieve consistently high results without compromising wellbeing.

speakers.bio: Bianca Errigo is a wellness expert, global speaker, and founder of HumanOS, a pioneering company integrating health and performance into the workplace. With a background in psychology and over 12,000 coaching hours, she blends science with real-world insight. Once hospitalised from corporate burnout, Bianca now partners with companies such as American Express, Cisco, Snapchat and The University of Cambridge to support individuals and organisations on their journeys of sustainable high performance.

sessions.title: Infrastructure as Prompts: Creating Azure Infrastructure with AI Agents
sessions.description: Transform cloud infrastructure deployment from complex command-line operations to simple conversational requests. This showcase demonstrates how AI agents can interpret natural language requirements and automatically provision Azure resources through an intelligent multi-agent system. Demonstrate End-to-End deployment, from chat message to live Azure resources in a matter of minutes with built-in compliance and best practice validation, bridging the gap between business requirements and technical implementation. Includes deep dive on agent orchestration and Azure integration patterns.

speakers.bio: Marcel Scherenberg is an AI Engineer and IT Consultant at PRODYNA with a background in mathematics and data science. He specializes in designing and deploying tailored AI-driven solutions that deliver tangible business value through intelligent process automation. With extensive experience in enterprise AI deployments, Marcel has led technical product management for GenAI integration and established MLOps practices across organizations, shortening the gap between business requirements and technical implementations.
speakers.tagline: AI Engineer and IT Consultant at PRODYNA

sessions.title: HR Tech: An Essential Ingredient for Tech-Driven Business Transformation
sessions.description: Join us for a bold and practical conversation on the future of HR tech—where corporate meets cutting-edge. From failed implementations to AI-driven transformation, our panelists from HelloFresh, Novartis and Stakkd will share unfiltered insights, hard-won lessons, and what’s truly working (and not) inside some of the world’s most complex organizations. Expect a fast-paced discussion that will leave you with actionable ideas and a glimpse into what’s next in HR tech.

speakers.bio: Jessie is the Founder of Stakkd: the go to place to discover HR tech. A strategic leader with 13+ years of unique experience in both corporates and startups. She is known for her unconventional approach to People topics and is passionate about HR tech and leveraging the benefits to build the future of work.

speakers.tagline: Global HR & Transformation Lead at Novartis

speakers.bio:
Syed Ali Abbas is Vice President of People – International, SE and HRBPs at
HelloFresh, the largest meal-kit company in the world. In this role, Abbas serves as the
matrix People leader for our SE corporate HQ in Germany plus all HelloFresh markets
around the world excluding North America; and functionally leads the SE HR Business
Partner team supporting our Global / International functions including Tech.

He has previously held various leadership roles in other companies including Group HR
Director for Global Fashion Group, Chief HR Officer for Pacnet Group, Chief Strategy
Officer for Epitome Global and Executive Director of HR for AT&T Inc. Abbas has also
served on Boards in Executive Director, Non-Executive Director and Board Committee
roles. He is an HR Transformation and HR Tech veteran, who also has experience as a
leader, advisor and investor in the HRTech startup space.
speakers.tagline: Vice President of People – International, SE and HRBP at HelloFresh

sessions.title: NVIDIA Expert Session: Best Practices and Techniques for Building Agentic and RAG applications
sessions.description: Visit us at booth A-16 to get answers to your most pressing questions from NVIDIA technology experts, and claim a free self-paced DLI course on July 10-11.

speakers.bio: Anshul is a Sr. Solution Architect at NVIDIA's DGX Cloud team, he specializes in assisting customers with deploying their workloads at scale. Anshul has a strong background in SRE and has extensive experience in managing production-grade Kubernetes clusters across various Cloud Service Providers (CSPs). He has received Ph.D. in computer science from TU Munich, graduating summa cum laude.

Ziv Ilan is a Solution Architect at NVIDIA, focusing on Agentic AI, LLM evaluation, optimization, and deployment. He joined from deci.ai (acquired by NVIDIA), where he worked on Neural Architecture Search and model compression techniques for GenAI and Computer Vision models. Ziv holds an Electrical and Electronics Engineering degree from Tel-Aviv University and an MBA from HEC Paris. He leverages his technical and business expertise to drive AI solutions development and deployment.

sessions.title: Introducing JSON Structure - A Better Schema
sessions.description: Mostly everyone uses JSON Schema in some way and mostly everyone had also stepped on their own toes using it. Why? Because we all want a data definition language to define data structure and JSON Schema isn't one. In this talk, you'll learn about JSON Structure, a data definition language that looks quite familiar, but provides better guardrails and fewer pitfalls

speakers.bio: Clemens Vasters is Lead Architect in Microsoft’s Azure Messaging team that builds and operates a fleet of hyper-scale messaging services, including Event Grid, Service Bus, Event Hubs, Stream Analytics and Microsoft Fabric Eventstreams. Clemens represents Microsoft in messaging standardisation in OASIS (AMQP, MQTT) and CNCF (CloudEvents, xRegistry) and writes too much code for being an "Architect". He looks back at nearly 30 years in professional software development and has seen the same fashion come and go a few times.

sessions.title: Strong decisions - decisive distinctions between digital and analog aspects
sessions.description: Heinz v. Foerster said: “Only those questions that are in principle undecidable, we can decide”. Can we challenge this in the digital age?

speakers.bio: Distinction Based Management - coach, investor, complexity navigator, developer and user of pragmatic management tools, scientific work on social systems theory, moderator of systemic development processes of people, management and organizations.

sessions.title: How to Destroy a Monolith?
sessions.description:
In the ever-evolving field of Software Engineering, one pressing challenge is the modernization of the technical landscape that supports the user journey across systems. This talk will tackle the ambitious goal of decommissioning a massive monolithic system and replacing it with a state-of-the-art solution.

Attendees will gain insights into the strategic approach taken to dismantle the monolith, leveraging cloud-based technologies to build a high-performing, secure, and future-ready environment. The session will dive into key decisions and techniques, including adopting cloud-native architectures, choosing the right tech stack, and aligning development paradigms to meet modern standards. It will also cover the critical roles of team dynamics and process evolution in overcoming the complexities of such an endeavor.

speakers.bio: Babette discovered her passion for software development later in life, earning her degree at the age of 40. With 19 years of experience since then, she has been dedicated to creating and enhancing web applications. In her current role at Axel Springer National Media & Tech, she focuses on shaping the architecture and development of solutions for account management and user authentication for two of Germany's leading newspapers. She continues to enjoy coding while also guiding her team in building robust, modern systems.
speakers.tagline: Senior Software Engineer at Axel Springer

sessions.title: Privacy-first in-browser Generative AI web apps: offline-ready, future-proof, standards-based
sessions.description:
Powerful generative AI features are quickly becoming a baseline in modern development. Potential blockers include privacy concerns, the need for a stable connection, and the costs associated with using or hosting models. However, we can now leverage generative AI directly in the browser on the user's device using emerging Web APIs like WebNN, combined with higher-level frameworks, for a better developer experience.

In my session, I’ll discuss the current state of in-browser ML and AI features, compare the main players, and show you how to start building an offline-ready, future-proof, standards-based web application.

speakers.bio: Maxim Salnikov is a tech and cloud community enthusiast based in Oslo. With over two decades of experience as a web developer, he shares his extensive knowledge of the web platform, cloud computing, and AI by speaking at and providing training for developer events worldwide. By day, Maxim plays a crucial role in supporting the development of cloud and AI solutions within European companies, serving as the leader of developer productivity business at Microsoft.
speakers.tagline: App Innovation Business Lead at Microsoft

sessions.title: Beyond the Hype: Building Trustworthy and Reliable LLM Applications with Guardrails
sessions.description:
Generative AI is driving a broad range of solutions, from chatbots and search tools to enterprise support systems. With GPT-4, ChatGPT, and new open-source developments appearing every week, there has never been a more interesting time to work with Large Language Models. However, organizations now face critical challenges: preventing data leaks, blocking hostile prompts, and ensuring brand or organizational policies remain enforced.
This session explores concrete safety practices that help teams build more secure and consistent AI-based applications. Real-life examples will highlight the types of vulnerabilities encountered in customer support chatbots, internal knowledge bases, and automated content workflows. Using frameworks like LangChain4J, Hugging Face, and OpenAI, participants will learn to:
Monitor and filter inputs and outputs to deter unauthorized content and malicious activities.
Protect private data with targeted access controls, making sure sensitive information remains confidential.
Address risks in retrieval-based tasks that could compromise data accuracy.
Maintain responsible permissions and ongoing reviews so systems stay within intended parameters after release.
Attendees will see live demonstrations of protective measures and gain practical insights for applying these methods throughout product development. The session closes with a look at the shifting landscape of LLM safety and the strategies needed to adapt as more sophisticated threats arise. It is intended for developers, security experts, and project leads seeking to deploy AI-driven features while preserving user and organizational security.

speakers.bio:
Alex Soto is a Director of Developer Experience at Red Hat. He is passionate about the Java world and software automation and believes in the open-source software model. Alex is the co-author of Testing Java Microservice, Quarkus cookbook, Kubernetes Secrets Management, GitOps cookbook, RHCE Ansible Automation Study Guide, and Applied AI for Enterprise Java Development
books and contributor to several open-source projects. A Java Champion since 2017, he is also an international speaker.
speakers.tagline: Director of Developer Experience at Red Hat

sessions.title: Pioneering AI Assistants in Banking
sessions.description: Hear about the large-scale implementation of “S-AIPilot”. You’ll learn how one of the first custom-made personal AI assistants that is operated inhouse and designed specifically for the employee workplace of the Savings Banks was deployed 100% on-prem. Discover the benefits of the AI operating within FI’s own data center. You’ll also understand the complexities and importance of integrating with the core banking system which enabled contextually relevant support while ensuring data privacy and compliance. In this session you’ll explore the architecture, security measures, scalability of the AI infrastructure and data integrity practices from one of the largest generative AI deployments worldwide powered by NVIDIA GPUs.

speakers.bio:
Markus leads the Enterprise Business for NVIDIA in Germany, Austria, and Switzerland. Based in Munich, he oversees the company’s go-to-market activities for enterprises in Central Europe, focusing on advancing AI, visualization, and virtualization technologies.
Markus’ career began in Microsoft’s Central European Data Centeroperations. Before joining NVIDIA in 2019, he held leadership roles at Akamai, Lionbridge, T-Systems, and Colt Technology Services. His two decades of experience in sales and business management have equipped him with deep expertise in the IT industry's evolving needs.
Markus is committed to fostering innovation and making valuable contributions to the field of AI. At NVIDIA, Markus leverages his knowledge to help businesses achieve their AI and industrial digitalization goals.
speakers.tagline: Senior Regional Director Enterprise DACH Region at NVIDIA

speakers.bio:
Tabitha Kleine is responsible for developing all kinds of lending business applications at Finanz Informatik, the central IT Partner for the Sparkasse Finance Group.
Together with her team, she works on designing the simplest and most secure solutions possible for the savings banks' lending business.
She also coordinates all AI initiatives within application development with a focus on the further development of digitalization and efficiency gains.
speakers.tagline: Business Unit Manager Software Development at Finanz Informatik

sessions.title: You are not my model anymore - understanding LLM model behavior
sessions.description:
Imagine you are a developer and you finished and polished your AI application.
Everything seems to work well, then suddenly phone calls or tickets appear with odd behavior you haven't seen before. User satisfaction goes down, and some things suddenly don't work anymore.

What happened? The model or other parts of the infrastructure you were using got updated, and you may have missed the memo.

In this session we will look at how even seemingly trivial upgrades that a cloud vendor may make, or a new rollout of a model version can impact your application, and what you need to do to get ahead of the curve.

It sounds like regression testing? Yes, but there are more analytical ways to "understand" what you are dealing with when the underlying AI model changes.

speakers.bio:
Andreas spent most of his professional life and a career of over 25 years integrating "backend", SOA, and Cloud applications.
Before that, Andreas dabbled with Virtual Reality in the 90s. In 2013, he started to work with Kinect for Windows V2 and something wonderful happened - Andreas had new fun with new toys and he was all set to work on new paradigms to interact with computers. From there he kept adopting technologies before the mainstream. He cannot stop talking about technology, which has been recognized by Microsoft. He acts as CTO for Applied AI of daenet.
speakers.tagline: CTO for Applied AI and Metaverse at daenet

sessions.title: We Are Developers: Inside the Tribe of Code, Keyboards, and Community
sessions.description:
Ever wondered what it truly means to be part of the developer tribe? Join us for a humorous and honest dive into the quirks, habits, and rituals that define developer culture—from the endless quest for the perfect mechanical keyboard and the stickers that transform our laptops into personal billboards, to the all-too-familiar syndrome of Friday deployments. But it's not all fun and RGB lights. We'll also explore the challenges that come with being a developer, like gatekeeping, burnout, and the pressure to keep up in an ever-evolving industry.

In this talk, we'll uncover why we do the good, the bad, and the nerdy—what drives our passion for code, why we push ourselves to the brink, and how a unique sense of community brings us together, despite our differences.

speakers.bio: With 20 years of experience developing web applications and tools, I'm a highly competent software engineer who understands all aspects of the development cycle. Whether working with international teams or leading small groups, I create documentation, write and test code, and offer support for successful projects.

sessions.title: Growth mindset in Tech hiring: unlocking team potential through collaboration and feedback
sessions.description:
I will discuss two distinct types of mindsets: growth and fixed. The growth mindset embraces challenges, sees effort as the path to mastery, and believes in the potential for development. In contrast, the fixed mindset assumes abilities are set in stone, limiting both personal and team growth.

When it comes to working with hiring teams, adopting the right mindset can significantly improve collaboration. 

Furthermore, when providing feedback, using a growth mindset means delivering it in a positive, constructive way. I will present "honour your senses"techniques.

speakers.bio:
Originally from Kyiv, Ukraine, Inna has been a resident of Berlin for the past seven years. With over 13 years of international experience spanning B2C, B2B, public, and multi-national organizations, she thrives on igniting a similar enthusiasm for talent in those she collaborates with.

She has been in leadership roles for the past nine years, leading company TA teams. Her key skills include leadership, TA strategy development, and executive stakeholder management. Inna is also dedicated to sharing her knowledge through various speaking engagements and training sessions over the past years.

sessions.title: 360 degree AI - who actually drives AI in Recruiting & Employer Branding
sessions.description: Based on labor market data, not only the need for AI expertise and AI tools within HR departments is determined in various steps. Above all, it is also about the target groups' view of the use of AI in the application process - both on the part of the companies and in their own use. This results in great pressure to act, especially on the part of HR departments, which above all requires that AI applications and scenarios are understood by HR managers. The data presented in the session comes from one of the largest long-term studies on the subject of talent acquisition in Germany.

speakers.bio: Robindro Ullah is partner and managing director of the leading Talent Intelligence Company Trendence and has been a consultant, author, speaker and podcaster for many years. He is an expert in the fields of employer branding, HR marketing, recruitment and data-driven HR. Previously, he was head of HR marketing and Recruitment South at Deutsche Bahn and then head of global employer branding, recruitment and HR communication at Voith, a technology group based in Heidenheim, Germany.
speakers.tagline: Partner and MD at Trendence Institut

sessions.title: Happy engineer, happy company - how to optimize engineering productivity
sessions.description:
How can companies improve engineering productivity – while also improving the happiness of devs and engineers at their workplace? Pipedrive uses a tool called GetDX. Or rather: Its engineers voluntarily use and contribute to GetDX. It functions like an engagement survey (with much greater detail): It collects feedback and sentiment, providing insights into what could or should be improved within the engineering department to ensure high engagement and an excellent workflow. GetDX evaluates the urgency and importance of upcoming issues, helping to prioritize tasks. 

The fewer minor issues one encounters, the easier it is to work faster, more precisely, and more productively. Because, if engineers are happy, the company benefits as a whole. One of the key figures is the Developer Experience Index (DEI) - the higher it is, the happier engineers are. Response rates are extremely high (ca 95%). Why? Because it's about seeing tangible actions taken based on the feedback.

speakers.bio: Agur Jõgi is the CTO at Pipedrive, where he applies his strengths as an innovator. He thrives on solving complex challenges, launching new ideas, and driving strategic change. With a unique mix of technical expertise and business acumen, Agur has become a recognized leader, focused on delivering practical, impactful solutions in the ever-changing digital landscape.

sessions.title: Three years of putting LLMs into Software - Lessons learned
sessions.description:
After GPT 3.5 came out, many wanted to augment their software with LLMs - or, AI, as most call it. We built a lot of such features into different software, with transcription, commands, live feedback, different services, that made us sometimes feel superhuman and sometimes humbled us down.
So, after three years, its time for a recap - I'll show real results, talk about (exactly) how we made it, what the customers liked about it and what they disliked. I'll show the differences between commercial and self-hosted, discuss prompting, fine-tuning and when-not-to-finetune.
I'll talk about the time we needed to add those functionalities, and how well it did work - and the talk will be kept up-to-date until the last week before the event ;)

speakers.bio: I have been self-employed in software development for nearly 20 years now and have already written thousands of pages of requirements. In doing so, I've noticed how much better offers function when they don't just cover the bare minimum and are 2-3 pages long, but instead detail everything, and how much easier everyone involved finds the progress of the project becomes, as it is easier to follow the status. As a result of a huge project that was awarded to someone else who sold cheaply and then bungled the work, I've made it my task to make software offers comparable.

sessions.title: Modern Java 25
sessions.description:
In this talk, I will take you through all the awesome new stuff you can find in Java. I’ll show you the actual usage of these new features so you can use them in your projects too.
Learn about all the latest and greatest Java has to offer, including Java 25, which will be released in September 2025. This will get you up to speed and prepare you for Java’s next LTS.
Think records, type pattern matching, sealed classes, virtual threads, structured concurrency, scoped values, stream gatherers, switch for pattern matching, record pattern matching, primitive type patterns, unnamed variables, instance main methods, flexible constructor bodies, module import declarations, and more...

speakers.bio:
I am a highly experienced software engineer who has seen it all, from Midrange Systems to Micro Services.

Through all of this, I was guided by my passion for software engineering and software architecture.
For more than 20 years I have been working on the JVM and the Java ecosystem.

At Team Rockstars IT I am a Special Agent and senior software engineer.

I am a regular speaker at international conferences on all things  Java.

I have co-authored a book about Jakarta EE 10,  published in 2023. In 2024 I co-authored a book about Project Loom (Virtual Threads and Structured Concurrency).
speakers.tagline: Special Agent at Team Rockstars IT

sessions.title: Like Spring, but Faster: The new Java Jedi
sessions.description:
Are you a Spring developer and interested in learning something new? More importantly, are you interested in saving 50% in your Java application operational costs? Come to this session to learn how!
Additionally, I will show concepts and conventions familiar to Spring developers and how those same concepts and conventions can be implemented in Quarkus.

speakers.bio: Eric Deandrea is a Java Champion & Senior Principal Developer Advocate at Red Hat, focusing on application development technologies. Eric has over 25 years of experience designing and building Java-based solutions and developer training programs. He is a contributor to various OSS projects, including Quarkus, Spring, LangChain4j, WireMock, and Microcks, as well as a speaker at many public events and user groups around the world. Eric recently put his Quarkus and Spring knowledge to use by publishing his first book, “Quarkus for Spring Developers (https://red.ht/quarkus-spring-devs).”
speakers.tagline: Senior Principal Developer Advocate at Red Hat

sessions.title: Startup Spotlight
Engineering Velocity in the Age of AI: Lessons from Mobile CI/CD
sessions.description: As AI-generated code becomes more common, the need for clean, automated, and scalable CI/CD pipelines is greater than ever. This talk explores how high-performing mobile teams are building strong DevOps foundations to support complex architectures, fast release cycles, and AI-driven workflows. Learn where AI is already delivering value in mobile CI/CD workflows, how to leverage different tools for smarter debugging and optimization, and what it takes to turn automation into true engineering velocity.

speakers.bio: Tamas Bazsonyi is a member of the Solutions Engineering team at Bitrise working with customers in the EMEA region to implement CI/CD pipelines successfully that help them during their day-to-day jobs. During his career he’s been working as a Full Stack Developer, QA Engineer and also jumping into mobile app development. Some of his favourite topics are Test Automation and Automation in general.

sessions.title: State of DevEx 2025: Navigating the AI Revolution and Developer Experience
sessions.description: In a year defined by economic pressure, rapid AI innovation, and rising demands to deliver more with less, developer experience (DevEx) remains a critical focus for engineering leaders. Join us for a deep dive into Atlassian’s State of DevEx Report 2025 to unpack how AI is reshaping developer workflows—and what that means for the future of productivity and teamwork.

speakers.bio:
Andrew Boyagi is the Customer CTO at Atlassian, working with CIOs and CTOs to accelerate delivery, improve developer
experience, and lead lasting transformation.
With over 20 years of experience in complex enterprise environments,
Andrew helps bridge the gap between strategy and execution. He brings
a pragmatic lens to DevOps, focusing not just on tools, but on culture,
leadership, and how teams really work.

sessions.title: Technical Diversity 101 - Become a better engineer
sessions.description:
In today’s rapidly evolving tech landscape, staying ahead can be challenging with so many available technologies. While many companies address this by hiring specialized teams like QA, DevOps, and Frontend, these divisions can slow down productivity. The shift towards Full Stack Engineers helps bridge these gaps, but is that enough?

In this talk, we’ll explore Technical Diversity, showing how it can elevate your career and improve team performance. For example, drawing inspiration from different language-based communities can spark new ideas and solutions. Learn how to foster technical diversity within your team, regardless of your organization’s structure, to solve problems faster and work more efficiently.

speakers.bio: Software engineer with over a decade of experience in the design and development of complex distributed systems, including high-loaded microservices and large data storage. Worked with the majority of the most popular and established technologies. He is passionate about non-trivial solutions that empower engineers to make a better world!
speakers.tagline: Senior Software Engineer at Fuse Energy

sessions.title: New world: New Approach. Why Workations and Community are Game-Changers in the Future of Work
sessions.description: As the world of work continues to evolve at a rapid pace, businesses must adapt to a future that is increasingly hybrid, remote, and disrupted by AI. In this session, we’ll explore how workations and community-building are not just buzzwords, but strategic game-changers in the agile, post-pandemic era. Join Gina Schinkel, founder of Driftawave, as she dives into the importance of flexible work options, continuous upskilling, and mission-driven leadership in building high-performing, resilient teams. Learn how companies can use workations to foster culture, increase engagement, and navigate the challenges of a global talent war. Walk away with actionable insights on how to integrate community into your organization’s DNA to drive collaboration, innovation, and retention, ensuring that your business thrives in the new world of work.

speakers.bio: Gina Schinkel is the founder and CEO of Driftawave, a company designing transformative workations and offsites for remote teams, digital-first companies, and communities. With 14 years of global travel experience and a background at LinkedIn Talent Solutions, Gina brings expertise in HR strategies, talent lifecycle, and the future of work. She helps organizations navigate the evolving workforce landscape, blending travel, leadership, and community-building to drive positive change in the remote work movement.

sessions.title: MCP Mashups: How AI Agents are Reviving the Programmable Web
sessions.description:
Remember the Mashup Era where developers mixed and matched APIs from different vendors to create new services?

This was such an exciting time for developers. APIs like Google Maps, Twitter, and Flickr gave developers access to data they could use to create interactive user experiences that were simply delightful. However, the excitement eventually fizzled as developers realized they had to maintain these applications which were often just fun side projects.

Now, 20 years later, that excitement and curiosity has returned with the introduction of AI Agents. With the MCP (Model Context Protocol) open standard, developers can integrate data and functionality from multiple services without the burden of maintaining full systems. By connecting AI agents to various APIs, resources, and data sources, we get quick modern-day mashups.

In this talk, we’ll explore how AI Agents are bringing fun and creativity back to software development and giving new life to the “programmable web”.

speakers.bio:
Angie Jones is the Global Vice President of Developer Relations at Block, Inc. An award-winning educator and international keynote speaker, Angie shares her expertise with audiences at software companies and conferences around the globe.

As a Master Inventor, Angie is celebrated for her innovative and creative thinking, which has led to over 25 patented inventions in fields such as metaverses, collaboration software, social networking, smarter planet technologies, and software development processes.
speakers.tagline: Global VP, Developer Relations at Block

sessions.title: Quality of Hire - Measuring The Impact of Talent Acquisition
sessions.description: TBD

speakers.bio: Marta is a Talent Acquisition Manager at Uber, based in Berlin, where she oversees high-volume recruitment for the customer support business in EMEA. Having transitioned from a background in hospitality and with almost a decade at Uber, her career within the company spans two different regions and a diverse range of roles, including Talent Coordinator, Sourcer, Recruiter, and Manager, all while supporting various business lines while focusing on operationalising rapid growth and candidate experience.
speakers.tagline: Talent Acquisition Manager EMEA at Uber

sessions.title: Get security done: streamlining application security with Aikido
sessions.description:
Security is often seen as a killer of productivity thanks to legacy tools that dish out false positives to developers (like my dog barking at invisible threats). In this lightning demo, we will show how Aikido Security can integrate security throughout your software development lifecycle, but - most importantly - is able to reduce false positives, enable developers to quickly deal with security and streamline remediation.

In this demo, we will show how quickly you can integrate 10 different security scanners: from SAST and SCA to CSPM and even runtime. Plus, you’ll see how you can harness AI to automatically fix security issues and generate compliance reports in seconds.

speakers.bio:
Born in Cape Town, South Africa and now based in Ghent, Belgium, Mia is a Founding Account Executive at Aikido Security - a platform built to secure your web applications from code to cloud to runtime.

With a background in neuropsychology and a focus on clear, practical communication, she works closely with both the commercial and product teams at Aikido to help bring the dev-centric, no-BS features Aikido prides itself upon to life.

Mia regularly creates content on topics like CI/CD security, supply chain threats, and cloud asset visibility—always aiming to make security feel less like a blocker and more like a no-brainer. When she's not creating content or giving product demos to prospective clients, she enjoys attending events to meet more developers face to face and learn about the way they like to build and ship.
speakers.tagline: Founding Account Executive at Aikido Security

sessions.title: If You Know TypeScript, You Know Blockchain: Learn How to Create a TypeScript Smart Contract
sessions.description:
In this session, you will learn how to create a complete, functional smart contract using native TypeScript.
We'll cover:

- The unique native features of the Algorand blockchain
- How AlgoKit enables you to set up your complete environment in under 5 minutes
- How to use the Algorand blockchain features in real-world applications
- The benefits blockchain can bring to an application

If you ever wondered how to build on blockchain, this workshop is for you. Learn to master the entire lifecycle of decentralized app development and leave ready to create your own Web3 project.

speakers.bio: With over a decade of experience spanning blockchain, cybersecurity, and web2 software engineering, Gabe brings deep technical expertise and entrepreneurial spirit to the Algorand ecosystem. As a Developer Relations Engineer at the Algorand Foundation, he bridges the gap between emerging technology and practical implementation. Previously, he co-founded TxnLab and helped build NFDomains - the leading identity solution on the Algorand blockchain.
speakers.tagline: Developer Relations Engineer at Algorand Foundation

sessions.title: Mobile AI on Arm: AI Text and Audio Generation Entirely on Device
sessions.description:
Mobile AI is going mainstream, and Arm is powering accelerated workloads across platforms. In this hands-on workshop, you learn how to leverage the latest in AI models to run optimized text and audio generation entirely on a mobile device. Using the latest AI enabling technologies from Arm and our network of partners. From frameworks like ExecuTorch and LiteRT, to Arm technologies such as KleidiAI, Neon, Scalable Vector Extension (SVE2), and Scalable Matrix Extension (SME 2). If you’re interested in running generative AI on mobile devices, this session shows you how to do it with the best performance. 

*All workshop attendees are required to bring their own laptop*

speakers.bio: Michael Hall is a passionate technology advocate and AI innovator with a career dedicated to empowering developers and advancing open ecosystems. Currently at Arm, he champions the intersection of open source and AI, leading efforts to make cutting-edge machine learning tools and frameworks more accessible and efficient across diverse hardware platforms.

sessions.title: Getting Your Company on Discord (For Beginners)
sessions.description: New to Discord? No problem. This beginner-friendly workshop walks you through everything you need to know to launch a professional Discord server for your company or game studio. We'll cover the basics of server setup, permissions, channel organization, bots, roles, and branding. You’ll learn how to create a welcoming space for your community, team, or playerbase—without getting overwhelmed by settings or jargon. Learn how to: set up a secure and structured Discord server from scratch, essential tools and bots for moderation, support, and engagement, tips for creating onboarding flows and defining your server’s purpose, as well as common pitfalls and how to avoid them. Perfect for those just getting started or considering Discord as a new channel for player, fan, or internal engagement.

speakers.bio: Maezza Romero is a Community Manager at Romero Games. With 5 years of experience in the industry, she has used her acquired skills to build and manage large community spaces, such as the Romero Games Discord which has recently celebrated 7,000 members.The Romero Games Twitter, the company’s biggest social media page with nearly 9,000 followers is a fun and nostalgic space for fans of Romero’s legacy titles such as DOOM and Quake, offering discussions on what DOOM weapon one would bring to a desert island, and other lively user polls and QnA. The current social media landscape is challenging, with new platforms overtaking the next.In 2023, fast-form video content is the meta, so Maezza has had to adapt her social media management to platforms such as TikTok and Instagram Reels. By utilising traditional social media platforms such as Facebook and Twitter, as well as modern platforms, Maezza creates content for diehard Millennial and Gen-X fans.

sessions.title: Strong Decisions in Leadership and Communication in Organizations
sessions.description: What makes a decision a „strong" decision? How to insure impact in leadership context? Key issues of communication in leadership in order to induce clear support and orientation?

speakers.bio: Distinction Based Management - coach, investor, complexity navigator, developer and user of pragmatic management tools, scientific work on social systems theory, moderator of systemic development processes of people, management and organizations.

sessions.title: NVIDIA Expert Session: Efficient Generative AI Inference Using Model Compression Techniques: Quantiz
sessions.description: Visit us at booth A-16 to get answers to your most pressing questions from NVIDIA technology experts, and claim a free self-paced DLI course on July 10-11.

speakers.bio: Harshita is a Senior Solution Architect at Nvidia, focusing on driving AI adoption among Global System Integrators. She has experience in building and deploying large language models, with a particular focus for on-device/edge applications.

Lavinia Ghita is a senior solutions architect for the financial services industry (FSI) at NVIDIA. Her work at NVIDIA focuses on applied AI research and driving the adoption of AI-driven technologies in the financial sector. Prior to joining NVIDIA, Lavinia worked on natural language processing research and applications in a quant hedge fund and in big tech.

Ziv Ilan is a Solution Architect at NVIDIA, focusing on Agentic AI, LLM evaluation, optimization, and deployment. He joined from deci.ai (acquired by NVIDIA), where he worked on Neural Architecture Search and model compression techniques for GenAI and Computer Vision models. Ziv holds an Electrical and Electronics Engineering degree from Tel-Aviv University and an MBA from HEC Paris. He leverages his technical and business expertise to drive AI solutions development and deployment.

Sergio Perez specializes in conversational AI. He has experience in optimizing training and inference of LLMs, building retrieval-augmented generation systems, and working with companies in different sectors to leverage AI. His area of expertise at NVIDIA is quantization and inference serving.
