Previously, he worked as an AI engineer at Graphcore and Amazon, and got a Ph.D. in computational fluid dynamics from Imperial College London.

sessions.title: AskUI - How to leverage Vision Agents for Test Automation
sessions.description: Automation frameworks have long depended on selector-based approaches, which can be fragile and limited—especially when working across diverse platforms. In this talk, we introduce AskUI’s Vision Agent, an AI-powered automation solution that uses computer vision to recognize and interact with UI elements like a human would. Through a compelling case study, we demonstrate how this technology enables seamless automation across native applications on Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, and iOS—without relying on traditional selectors. Learn how AI vision redefines what’s possible in test automation and process execution by enabling a single, unified framework that adapts to any UI, regardless of technology stack. This talk is ideal for developers, QA engineers, and automation enthusiasts looking to explore the next evolution in UI automation.

speakers.bio: Jonas Menesklou is the co-founder and CEO of AskUI, an innovative tech startup specializing in AI-powered automation solutions. With a background in software development and entrepreneurship, he is driven by the vision of creating a new generation of UI agents that can visually understand and control applications—regardless of the operating system. His passion lies in combining technology and efficiency to radically simplify the use of digital tools.

sessions.title: ShapeShift: Reinventing Agile for a B2B SaaS Scale-Up
sessions.description:
Delivering impactful product increments in a fast-scaling SaaS company like HERO Software
is tough, something Milton Leon Rodriguez, Head of Engineering at HERO, knows firsthand.
For his team, Scrum felt rigid, Shape Up too radical. So, he and his engineering team built
ShapeShift: a pragmatic blend of both, tailored for focus, efficiency, and flexibility.
With 6-week Milestones (inspired by Shape Up) and lightweight Scrum elements, HERO now

drives structured execution without the overhead. No unnecessary meetings, just
on-demand refinements, 10-minute dailies, and built-in cool-down cycles—all while keeping
teams stable for consistency.
ShapeShift isn’t a one-size-fits-all framework. It’s a work in progress, shaped by HERO’s real
dev team challenges. In his talk, Leon will provide an inside look at this evolving
methodology, sharing key learnings, practical insights, and how ShapeShift is helping HERO
scale smarter.

speakers.bio:
Milton is Head of Engineering at HERO Software, leading strategic technical initiatives,
scaling teams, and fostering cross-functional collaboration. With over a decade of
experience in backend development and engineering management, he has a strong track
record in building high-performing teams, mentoring engineers, and aligning technology
with business goals to drive innovation and growth.
speakers.tagline: Head of Engineering at Hero Software

sessions.title: Build with Blockchain & AI Agents
sessions.description:
Web3 and AI are two of the most transformative technologies reshaping software development today, but bridging these two remains challenging for many developers. This hands-on workshop provides developers with a practical path into blockchain and AI agents, requiring no prior distributed ledger experience. We'll begin with a concise overview of both technologies before exploring the architectural patterns and tools that enable their integration.

Participants will build and deploy a functioning AI agent that interacts with blockchain data and smart contracts. Using languages you already know, like JavaScript, we'll construct agents capable of on-chain operations, data retrieval, and intelligent response generation. 

You will leave with working code, a development environment ready for future projects, and the fundamental skills to create applications combining the verification properties of distributed ledgers with the intelligence capabilities of modern AI systems.

speakers.bio: Ed is an Engineer and Marketer experienced in advanced vehicle technology, model-based design (MBD), and distributed ledger technologies (DLT). He is passionate about leading interdisciplinary teams, building user-centric solutions, and connecting with developers and organizations in technology sectors. Currently, Ed works at Hashgraph, growing the Hedera network and helping developers get on board with Web 3. He is also pursuing a graduate degree in Management at Harvard.
speakers.tagline: Head of Developer Relations at Hedera

speakers.bio: Jake is an experienced Hedera developer who had been a regular contributor to ecosystem for three years prior to joining Hashgraph. He's had lead dev / architect roles at Hedera startups as well as experience in hackathons and creating Hedera related video content. He also led the development of the first community project commited to Hiero. Outside of Hedera he has worked in tech teams at companies like EY and bp.

sessions.title: Lynx: From Zero to Native
sessions.description:
In this workshop, we will introduce you to Lynx, a family of open source technologies empowering developers to use their existing web skills to create truly native UIs for both mobile and web from a single codebase. 

Designed for diverse use cases and rich interactivity, Lynx delivers vibrant and engaging UIs for large-scale apps like TikTok, featuring a speedy, versatile rendering engine, performance-driven dual-threaded UI programming, modern Rust-based tooling, and more! 

The workshop is designed to bring interested developers up to speed on how to install, launch and manage their own front-end dev projects using Lynx.

speakers.bio: Pete Gonzalez is a software architect at TikTok, specializing in developer productivity for large-scale TypeScript monorepos. He coordinates the Rush Stack community on GitHub and co-created popular frontend tooling such as RushJS, Heft, API Extractor, and the TSDoc syntax standard. He also helped develop TikTok's Sparo and Lockfile Explorer projects.  This year he's raising awareness about the LynxJS framework, an innovative new way to make mobile apps!

sessions.title: Code the Brain! We’ll Power the Body — Build, Run, and Orchestrate AI Agents
sessions.description:
Your code + UiPath best-in-class Enterprise Automation Platform = One professional-grade solution—ready to ship, run, and scale.

Unlock speed and flexibility with our SDK. Access easy-to-build and maintain Automations via MCP—whether you're powering Python-coded AI Agents or integrating through our REST APIs.
From isolated components to full end-to-end Business Processes, you get a single, unified platform where you can seamlessly build, test, deploy, monitor, troubleshoot, and iterate.

Why join us:
Don’t miss our session for
AI Agents
End-to-End Agentic Process orchestration
Blazing-fast API Workflows
Self-healing automation processes
 …and much more

Joining us also:
Alina Capota, Sr. Manager, Forward Deployed Engineering, UiPath
Bogdan Sultana, Principal Product Manager, UiPath
Liviu Bobocu, Sr. Software Engineer, UiPath

speakers.tagline: Senior Manager & Forward Deployed Engineering at  UiPath

sessions.title: Leapter: The Reinvention of Software Development? A Future Built On AI Generated Code.
sessions.description:
Learn how Leapter is bridging the trust gap in AI generated code. 

Using AI tools to write code is table stakes now. It’s not a huge leap to start imagining a future where AI writes all the code. 

Let’s look back in order to move forwards in the right way.  A legacy codebase that no one understands is a liability in production, the same is true for AI generated code that no one understands. 

But the temptation of “vibe code” is very real. It works.

Most AI tools measure success by how much they can generate. At Leapter, we care more about what you can understand. Understanding leads to trust. Trust leads to speed.

speakers.bio:
Robert is the CTO of Leapter, where he is focused on solving a critical paradox in modern software development: while AI coding tools promise acceleration, they often amplify the cognitive load on developers through a sprawl of untrusted, hard-to-verify code.

His career has been defined by leading high-stakes technical initiatives: from designing critical systems as a Lead Architect at DHL, to heading product development for a Bosch FinTech spin-off, to driving cloud-native adoption for enterprise customers at Pivotal (later VMware/Broadcom).

sessions.title: From Traction to Production: Maturing your GenAIOps step by step
sessions.description: Your concept of a product that leverages the power of Large Language Models is gaining traction, and your initial API calls to the selected LLM vendor show promising results. What's next? Should you look forward to ensure your app is scalable, maintainable, safe, secure, and ready for the introduction and monitoring of quality metrics like groundedness, as well as operational metrics such as latency and token consumption? Or should you look back to reconsider model selection or fine-tuning, refine prompts, and improve RAG techniques? And how do you close the continuous improvement loop?

speakers.bio: Maxim Salnikov is a tech and cloud community enthusiast based in Oslo. With over two decades of experience as a web developer, he shares his extensive knowledge of the web platform, cloud computing, and AI by speaking at and providing training for developer events worldwide. By day, Maxim plays a crucial role in supporting the development of cloud and AI solutions within European companies, serving as the leader of developer productivity business at Microsoft.
speakers.tagline: App Innovation Business Lead at Microsoft

sessions.title: How to Assess and Hire Talent: The Skills-Based Hiring Playbook for the AI Age
sessions.description:
In an era where generative AI can write the perfect resume for your job description, the traditional methods of identifying top tech (and any) talent are failing. How can you be sure you're hiring for genuine skill and not wasting your time on just prompt engineering? 

The answer lies in a strategic shift you can make easily: moving to a skills-based hiring model.

This session is a practical playbook for HR and Talent Acquisition leaders navigating this new landscape. We will cut through the noise to provide a clear, step-by-step framework for implementing skills-based hiring. You'll learn how to replace high-volume, low-accuracy resume screens with high-fidelity job simulations that reveal a candidate's true abilities. We'll cover how to design assessments that are not only resistant to AI cheating but can also help you identify the candidates who leverage AI as a powerful productivity tool. 

Leave this session ready to build a faster, fairer, and more predictive tech (And any other role) hiring process.

speakers.bio: Guy Barel is the CEO and Co-founder of Canditech. Prior to founding Canditech, Guy held key leadership roles in the tech and professional services industry, focusing on product, marketing, and business development. After experiencing the pains of hiring first-hand, he co-founded the company alongside fellow tech leaders from companies like Microsoft and Google, united by a shared mission of revolutionizing candidate evaluation with realistic job simulations.

sessions.title: How to scrape modern websites to feed AI agents
sessions.description:
It was web scraping that quietly enabled the AI revolution.

All major generative AI models and large language models (LLMs) have been trained on massive datasets extracted from the web. But the story doesn’t end there. Today’s AI agents still rely on up-to-date information from online sources to stay relevant, reduce hallucinations, and go beyond their training data. Once again, the web becomes the richest source of context.

Yet scraping the modern web is far from trivial. From anti-bot protections to dynamic, client-side rendering and long-term maintenance issues, building scalable data pipelines has become increasingly complex.

In this talk, we’ll demonstrate how to:

- Set up resilient, maintainable data extraction workflows using cloud-based web scraping Actors,
- Clean messy HTML and structure it into meaningful content,
- Feed that data into a vector database to power a Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline,
- And integrate scraping tools directly into AI agents using the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

Whether you're building copilots, smart assistants, or knowledge-augmented LLM apps, this talk will equip you with the techniques and tools to make the web your AI's best friend.

speakers.bio: Jan Curn is the founder and CEO of Apify (https://apify.com), a full-stack web scraping and automation platform that powers (not only) AI agents with up-to-date data. He has a lifelong passion for software engineering, which earned him an MSc and PhD in computer science and eventually led him to founding Apify. Jan lives between SF and Prague, is active in the tech community in both cities, organizes meetups, and talks about software, startups, or AI.

sessions.title: Your Next AI Needs 10,000 GPUs. Now What?
sessions.description:
As Large Language Models become foundational to modern applications, the complexity of securing and managing the right GPU infrastructure is a critical bottleneck. This session demystifies GPU consumption at scale, from single-GPU setups to vast, multi-node clusters. We will then introduce NVIDIA DGX Cloud Lepton, a revolutionary AI platform and compute marketplace. Discover how Lepton connects developers to a global network of cloud partners, unlocking access to tens of thousands of GPUs to build the next generation of AI.

Key Takeaways:

- GPU and multi-node system architectures for AI.
- Navigating abstraction layers: Bare Metal, VMs, and Kubernetes.
- Unifying access with the DGX Cloud Lepton compute marketplace.
- Achieving location and vendor-agnostic AI deployment.

speakers.bio: Anshul is a Sr. Solution Architect at NVIDIA's DGX Cloud team, he specializes in assisting customers with deploying their workloads at scale. Anshul has a strong background in SRE and has extensive experience in managing production-grade Kubernetes clusters across various Cloud Service Providers (CSPs). He has received Ph.D. in computer science from TU Munich, graduating summa cum laude.

Martin Piercy is a solutions architect at NVIDIA, where he is responsible for helping customers effectively adopt and use NVIDIA hardware and software at scale. During his time at NVIDIA, Martin has helped customers scale out training to thousands of GPUs and built solutions to help customers train, monitor, and manage jobs and infrastructure effectively.

sessions.title: Solving the puzzle: Leveraging machine learning for effective root cause analysis
sessions.description: Root Cause Analysis (RCA) is an established and important methodological tool widely used in manufacturing to determine the causes of repeating machine breakdowns, defects or to improve overall efficiency. Traditionally, specialists may use quality management tools like 5-Why and Ishikawa diagrams or statistical methods to systematically identify and address the underlying causes. With increasing digitalization, more and more data are being collected providing a good basis for systematic data driven analysis. However, it is difficult and time-consuming to extract valuable insights from this data. Today's established methods today are reaching their limits dealing with the sheer amount of data and the complex, non-linear interrelationships of modern manufacturing processes and process chains. To navigate these complexities, the integration of Explainable AI (XAI) and causal discovery techniques offers promising avenues for enhancing RCA. XAI provides transparency in machine learning models, enabling practitioners to gain impulses from inspecting how a model uses the data. Meanwhile, causal discovery focuses on distinguishing between mere statistical associations and genuine causal relationships, allowing for the identification of causal paths. This talk will provide an overview of these methodologies, discussing their application in root cause analysis, as well as the challenges and opportunities they present in improving decision-making processes.

speakers.bio: Bernhard de Graaff is a Product Owner at the ZDP AI Accelerator, who started his journey with ZEISS as a Data Scientist. Before joining Zeiss, he worked as a manufacturing engineer and process chain expert at Robert Bosch GmbH developing new innovative manufacturing processes and optimizing production chains and later as a software engineer & data scientist dedicated to the development of machine learning based applications in the field of Noise Vibration Harshness engineering.
speakers.tagline: Product Owner at Zeiss Digital Partners

speakers.bio: Varsha is a Data Scientist at ZEISS with about 4 years of experience and a Masters in Applied Computer Science. She brings expertise in Timeseries Forecasting, NLP and Federated Learning, contributing to strategic initiatives like financial forecasting and developing cloud ML solutions. She actively mentors, organizes tech events- and dances her way through life outside the data world.

sessions.title: The Evolution of Enterprise Java with Jakarta EE 11 and Beyond
sessions.description:
Jakarta EE 11 has just been released with lots of features for increasing performance and developer productivity, such as support for virtual threads and the new Jakarta Data specification. With this release, Jakarta EE has established a predictable release cadence and the work with Jakarta EE 12 has already started.

This session will give you an overview of everything brought to you by Jakarta EE 11 with lots of code demos. We will also look forward and check out what's in the pipeline for Jakarta EE 12.

speakers.bio:
Ivar Grimstad is the Jakarta EE Developer Advocate at Eclipse Foundation. He is a Java Champion and JUG Leader based in Sweden.

Besides advocating the Jakarta EE technologies, Ivar is contributing to the Jakarta EE specifications as well as being the PMC Lead for Eclipse Enterprise for Java (EE4J). He is also one of the specification leads for Jakarta MVC and represents Eclipse Foundation on the JCP Executive Committee.

Ivar is also involved in a wide range of other open-source projects and communities. He is a frequent speaker at International developer conferences.
speakers.tagline: Jakarta EE Developer Advocate at Eclipse Foundation

sessions.title: Backstage Software Templates for Java Developers
sessions.description: As a Java developer you might have a hard time accepting the limitations that you feel being introduced into your development cycles. Let's look at the positives and learn everything important to know to turn Backstag's software templates into a helpful tool you can use to elevate the platform experience for all developers.

speakers.bio: Markus is a Java Champion, former Java EE Expert Group member, founder of German JavaLand, reputed speaker at Java conferences around the world, and a very well known figure in the Enterprise Java world.
speakers.tagline: Senior Principal Technical Marketing Manager at Red Hat

sessions.title: Data Governance in the Era of AI
sessions.description:
Ever asked AI a question about your data and watched it confidently deliver the wrong answer? You're not alone! Every messy dataset, untracked asset, and "we'll document it later" adds to your data debt—and in the AI era, the cost of that debt is skyrocketing.

In this talk, we’ll break down how data governance can make or break your AI initiatives. From treating metadata as the new gold to managing BigQuery assets with Terraform, we’ll share real-world strategies for building trustworthy data products. Expect hands-on insights, hard-earned lessons, and actionable takeaways to turn data chaos into a governed, scalable ecosystem.

What you’ll learn:
1. How to stop AI-driven data disasters before they happen
2. Why metadata and governance are the backbone of reliable AI
3. Practical governance strategies engineers actually want to use

No corporate buzzwords—just real talk on making data work for you in the AI era!

speakers.bio:
Kateřina Ščavnická is an Engineering Lead at Kiwi.com, a leading Czech travel tech company. She is passionate about exploring the latest technology, driving innovation, and making data processes efficient and valuable. Her dedication to detail and persistent approach makes her a strong advocate for data governance and observability, where she applies product thinking to elevate data as a product. 
Known for her vibrant and engaging personality, Kejty loves public speaking and sharing knowledge to broaden her perspectives on both technical and cultural dimensions of the tech landscape.

sessions.title: REST in Peace? What does the API protocol of the future look like? Or do we have it already?
sessions.description:
Are you still building REST APIs because that's what you've always done? Or because it's truly the best choice for your application?

This talk challenges the conventional wisdom of API design, moving beyond comparisons of REST vs. GraphQL.  We'll explore the full spectrum of API possibilities, dissecting the trade-offs of different approaches – including some you might not have considered.  Drawing from real-world case studies and hard-won experience, we'll examine what works, what *doesn't*, and, most importantly, what's *missing* in current API implementations.

This isn't just about choosing the right tool for today.  It's about envisioning the APIs of tomorrow.  By analyzing the strengths and weaknesses of existing protocols, we'll explore the key ingredients for future API success. What will drive the next generation of API communication?  What challenges will they need to solve?

Prepare to expand your API horizons and join the conversation about the future of connected systems.

speakers.bio:
With more than 15 years in development and the experience of building and working on over 200 projects for startups and multinational companies Simon has worked professionally with almost every major modern framework. From React, Angular, Vue, Ember and Svelte to Flutter, and has discovered their pros and cons.
Lately he has been deeply in love with app development using in Flutter and also Co-hosts the monthly FlutterVienna meetups.

sessions.title: 42 x 2 Canvases Later: Two Years, Two Minds, Many Lessons
sessions.description:
In 2023, we introduced the Architecture Communication Canvas (ACC) to the world at the WeAreDevelopers World Congress. Two years, countless workshops, and many canvases later, we're back to share the lessons we've learned, the challenges we’ve faced, and how the ACC has changed how teams approach architecture documentation.

From bridging communication gaps between development teams and stakeholders to structuring discussions about complex architectures, the ACC has proven its value – but not without a few surprises along the way. In this talk, we’ll share practical insights into the ACC's application across diverse domains, industries, and team setups.

We’ll share honest insights into what worked, what didn’t, and how you can get the most out of the ACC to improve collaboration and clarity in your architecture work. Whether you’re new to the ACC or already using it in your projects, you’ll leave with actionable tips and fresh inspiration to elevate your architecture documentation.

speakers.bio:
Ben is an architect and a developer at INNOQ. He focuses on modernising legacy systems, architectural documentation, as well as architecture consulting and development. He particularly emphasizes the development processes and the team’s attitude towards software quality. He shares his vision of software quality as a speaker at conferences and meetups, as well as in training sessions. He is a certified trainer for several iSAQB trainings.

Ben is a committer in the arc42 project, an active member of iSAQB e. V., and currently the deputy chairman of the association.

Dr. Gernot Starke (INNOQ Fellow), Coach and consultant for methodical software architecture and -engineering.
(Co-)founder of arc42.org, founder of aim42.org

Gernot has been involved in architecture and implementation of medium to large systems for various business domains, mainly in finance, automotive, logistics, and telecommunications. His current topics are improving software quality, pragmatic approaches to system evolution and pain-free technical documentation.

He has written numerous books on software architecture, development practices and patterns.
speakers.tagline: Co-founder of arc42 and aim42 𑗅 Fellow at INNOQ

sessions.title: Tackling the Risks of AI - With AI

speakers.bio:
Kai Grunwitz is Country President of Kyndryl Germany and one of the leading figures in IT transformation and digital innovation. With over 30 years of experience in executive roles, he has established himself as an expert in developing and implementing business strategies for global enterprises. Prior to joining Kyndryl, he held positions at companies such as Oracle, Sun Microsystems, and NTT Data.

As a member of the executive board of Bitkom e.V., Germany’s leading digital association, Kai Grunwitz actively advocates for the advancement of digitalization in both business and society. He is also a sought-after thought leader and speaker at international conferences such as the Mobile World Congress, where he addresses topics like digital transformation, cybersecurity, leadership, smart society, and artificial intelligence.

Under his leadership, Kyndryl—the world’s largest provider of IT infrastructure services—plays a key role in modernizing, strengthening, and improving the efficiency of corporate IT systems. With innovative consulting approaches and global technology alliances, Kyndryl supports organizations on their transformation journeys, with a strong focus on developing sustainable digital solutions.

Klaus Bürg is the Managing Director & Vice President at Palo Alto Networks EMEA (DACH+CEE) – a market leading provider in the cybersecurity space. He oversees all go-to-market functions, strategic direction, channel expansion and is passionate about driving adoption of Zero Trust 2.0 as a mental model to secure businesses and their IP. 

Klaus has more than 25 years of experience in the IT industry. He has significant expertise in managing international Enterprise type companies, developing go-to-market strategies with a strong affinity creating customer value by using cutting edge technologies. Klaus worked in mature markets as well as in emerging markets. He has deep expertise in driving customer transformations across industries and specifically in Financial Services, Manufacturing/Auto, Retail and in Professional Services environments. 

Before Palo Alto Networks, Klaus was the Managing Director & General Manager of Amazon Web Services (AWS) DACH (Germany, Austria & Switzerland) – the global provider of public cloud infrastructure and services. While he helped customers and partners co-innovate using AWS as a technology foundation, Klaus led the AWS DACH organization through hyper growth (above 50% growth YoY), building a solid organizational foundation for continued growth in the years to come.

Prior to joining AWS, Klaus was Executive Vice President at audius AG where he oversaw Advisory (consulting) and Business Applications. Before that he worked 11 years at Microsoft in various management functions – i. e. leading the Dynamics business (CRM) for EMEA, COO for the Western Europe Enterprise Services business (12 countries) and lastly being the COO at Microsoft Central Eastern Europe headquarters (33 countries), running the Enterprise business across the whole Microsoft portfolio. 

Klaus is on the Board of Directors in the American Chamber of Commerce (Germany) and a member of the renowned “Atlantik Brücke” to help drive transatlantic cooperation between Europe, USA and Canada. 

Klaus graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree in computer science from the University of Esslingen (near Stuttgart, Germany). He also holds a Master of Science in computer science from the same university.
speakers.tagline: VP & Managing Director EMEA at Palo Alto Networks

speakers.bio: Tomislav is the CTO and partner at Nephos, a company that supports digital transformation for clients globally. Before Nephos, Tomislav spent 13 years at Microsoft, most recently as a technology strategist for partners integrating Microsoft's technology and cloud services. He has collaborated with various companies, from startups to large enterprises, aiding developers and system engineers in adopting the latest technologies. His focus areas include AI, cloud technologies, microservices, DevOps, Data and IoT. He frequently shares knowledge through workshops and conferences.

sessions.title: I'm a developer working in marketing, here's why!
sessions.description:
Many of you have probably heard about terms like Developer Evangelist, Developer Advocacy, or similar terms but do you actually know what that's about or why it's getting more and more important for any software business trying to recruit employees and third-party developers?

I'd like to talk about why Developer Evangelism is one of the most important things to do these days, why teaching others can be more rewarding than working on software yourself, why sharing knowledge is the key to a healthy relationship for any cloud business, and how all that's related to employer branding as well. 

In more than 25+ years of software development, I've been there and done that. It's time to talk about what do to with all that knowledge and experience!

Be prepared for an educational, sometimes funny, satirical yet helpful journey towards Developer Evangelism, open-source, employer branding, and other related topics.

speakers.bio: Working with Microsoft technologies since VB6 I've been there, and done that. These days I'm spreading the word for DeepL, working with third parties and customers using our API Product but also various community activities such as the WeAreDotnet portal and other things. Another thing I really enjoy doing is helping fellow developers in whatever way is good, mentoring or coaching, writing blog posts, building SDKs, and anything that helps make someone's work day a bit more enjoyable.

sessions.title: The Chief Joy Officer and Decoding Motivation@Work
sessions.description:
Want to know how to create a more motivated and effective team? Or even how you can rediscover your motivation at work?
Then come be inspired, upskilled and entertained by the Chief Joy Officer.
Max will decode the 4 key drivers of motivation in the workplace (the Roots & Fruits) and give you easy-to-implement tips and actions to improve the motivation of your team, yourself and the whole company. 
Off the back of his 1M+ viewed TEDx talk, Max's interactive, thought-provoking and practical session will help you become a better leader, create better leaders and find more joy in your work.
What are you waiting for?

speakers.bio:
Max has a passion for making the world of work a place where people wake up on Monday morning & say, “Great, I’m looking forward to going back to work”.
He started this work as Chief Joy Officer on the Exec of Loylogic & now helps other companies to understand motivation, drive positive cultures & give inspirational talks. His TEDx talk last year has over 1M views.
From a PhD in Chemistry, to a 15-year business career & now co-founder of Motivators@Work as a Leadership Team Coach. He’s worked with Tech companies ranging from Google & Sumup, to Typeform and many other Scale-Ups across Europe.
speakers.tagline: Chief Joy Officer & Founder of Motivators@Work

sessions.title: 402 - Payment Required
sessions.description:
Current payment systems weren't designed for AI agents, machine-to-machine transactions, or high-frequency microtransactions. As the internet evolves toward autonomous systems, we need payment infrastructure that can keep pace.

We’ll explore next-generation payment architectures, including existing open web standards, blockchain solutions, and micropayment systems that will enable value transfer in tomorrow's digital economy. We'll examine the technical challenges and emerging standards that could reshape how machines, agents, and applications exchange value at internet scale.

speakers.bio: Brian heads global developer relations at Algorand Foundation, where he helps devs learn, integrate, apply, and contribute to Algorand's open source blockchain technology to solve real world problems. Before joining the Foundation, Brian led global strategic transformation programs at Morgan Stanley, where he worked with commodities, exchange and OTC derivatives, Prime Brokerage, Brexit preparations, and digital assets over 15 years. When not on his laptop, he's probably cooking up something creative, literally or figuratively.
speakers.tagline: Head of Developer Relations at Algorand Foundation

sessions.title: Kalo: From Code Chaos to One-Click Polyglot Codegen
sessions.description:
Classical software development is a relay race across layers - DB schemas, backend DTOs, API specs, front-end types - where every hand-off risks a dropped baton. Low-code promises speed but collapses at scale; no-code can’t express nuance; pure code drowns us in boilerplate.

Kalo breaks the gradient: we define truth once in declarative, human-readable specs (YAML / JSON / OpenAPI), then chain modular compile plugins that generate all downstream artifacts like Go structs, TypeScript models, SQL migrations, docs - keeping every layer in lock-step. Result: faster delivery, zero drift, and a plugin marketplace where anyone can add new targets without touching domain code.

speakers.bio: Brennan Nunamaker is a driven entrepreneur with deep full-stack engineering expertise. As a senior technologist, he has refined polyglot generative-code techniques that transform fragmented services into reusable building blocks — now the core of Kalo. Join him on his journey of solving code reuse once and for all.

sessions.title: APItoolkit: Using Merkle Trees and LLMs to Detect the UnDetectable in Software Monitoring
sessions.description: In 2019, a single missing field in a Delivery Hero legacy service rewrite led to nearly $2 million in lost orders—an oversight no one caught until it was too late. Drawing on that experience, I’ll show how APIToolkit uses cryptographic proofs and LLM-powered analysis of logs and request payloads to detect these hidden breaking changes before they become disasters. In just five minutes, you’ll see how easily APIToolkit integrates into your existing stack, scanning every API call in real-time and alerting you to shifts that standard monitoring tools miss. It’s a fast, frictionless path to ensuring problems never slip through the cracks again.

speakers.bio:
Anthony has spent over a decade building software at companies like Opera (Browser),
Parity (Polkadot), and DeliveryHero. He has faced his fair share of dealing
with Software incidents, downtime and breaking changes, including losing over $2m in
orders to such issues at DeliveryHero, which prompted him to build
APItoolkit.io, to help companies navigate their backend and API landscape.

sessions.title: Building a Thriving Web Development Community in a Large Tech Company
sessions.description:
In a tech company with over 4,000 employees and numerous teams dedicated to web development, fostering a sense of community and collaboration is essential. In this session, we will share our journey of forming and nurturing a vibrant web development community since 2019:

- Learn how we started the web development community to connect developers spread across many teams.
- Discover the bottom-up organization approach that empowers developers to take initiative and lead.

- Explore our regular online meetups held every four weeks, featuring presentations and show-and-tell sessions.
- Understand how these meetups enable knowledge sharing and help developers tackle tricky problems together.

- Hear about our special on-site community events, including hackathon challenges.
- See how connecting with fellow developers facing similar challenges benefits everyone involved.
- Gain insights from our yearly survey about the community and technology, which helps us continuously improve .

speakers.bio:
Hi, I started as a software engineer at Schwarz almost ten years ago.
Since then I have implemented web applications and libraries in all three major web frameworks. 
Now I am the Engineering Lead for our open source component library https://onyx.schwarz/, which we are very passionate about.
In my spare time I like to play complex video and board games and spend time with friends.
When alone, I love to lose myself in sci-fi and fantasy worlds, both written and cinematic.

I started my journey as web frontend developer at the Schwarz Group in 2014. Since then I've worked on multiple enterprise web applications, grew my passion for all things JavaScript, discovered my love for Vue.js, and shaped the evolution of web development at Schwarz IT.

sessions.title: Focoos AI: Building the Future of Computer Vision
sessions.description: Focoos AI simplifies and accelerates AI model development with an advanced platform designed for efficiency, scalability, and seamless integration. This session will explore how the platform enables businesses to deploy high-performance, energy-efficient computer vision models with minimal effort. Thanks to seamless continuity between Focoos open-source library and the web platform, developers can go from prototyping to deployment without friction, whether working on visual inspection in industrial automation or traffic and flow monitoring in smart cities.

speakers.bio: Founder and CEO of Focoos AI. After earning a degree in Software Engineering, he obtained a PhD in Artificial Intelligence and Computer Vision from the Polytechnic University of Turin. He has also completed a Master's in Economics and Management at MIB Trieste. Recognized among the Top 100 Italian Innovators of 2023.
speakers.tagline: Founder and CEO of Focoos AI

sessions.title: The Importance of Physical Health in the Workplace and How to Achieve It
sessions.description: In today’s fast-paced work environment, physical and mental well-being often take a backseat. However, integrating low-intensity workouts like walking and making simple adjustments at work can have a profound impact on both our cardiovascular and mental health. This talk will provide practical tips on how employees, team leaders, and managers can incorporate movement into their daily routines, from walk-and-talk meetings to using standing desks, and even rethinking how we book meetings. Learn how small changes, like taking the stairs or commuting by bike/foot, can significantly boost your energy, creativity, and productivity, while also reducing stress and improving overall health.

speakers.bio:
Hey, I’m Manuel Wiltz and I am a Team Lead and Software Engineer at Dynatrace for almost 5 years now and back then I started as a Software Engineer and gradually took on more responsibility leading to take the Add-On role of the Scrum Master and in 2023 I switched to being a Team Lead where I have been growing, leading, coaching and developing a Software Engineering team since then. In my first 1,5 years as a people leader I learned a lot of valuable lessons what I would love to share with the audience. 

In my free time I love going to the gym, cycling, hiking and playing tennis.

sessions.title: Software is the New Fuel, AI the New Horsepower - Pioneering New Paths at Mercedes-Benz
sessions.description: Join Katrin Lehmann and Magnus Östberg and learn why software is the new fuel and AI the new horse power behind every new Mercedes-Benz. The Mercedes-Benz operating system MB.OS enhances connectivity, performance, and future-proof technology. Behind the scenes, however, there's a symphony of innovation at work. The MB.OS End-to-End Software Journey is the initiative to design these processes and build the required IT tooling. Discover how AI applications in our products improve safety, efficiency, and personalization and how our developers support AI implementation across the entire value chain.

speakers.bio:
Katrin Lehmann has been the Chief Information Officer (CIO) of Mercedes-Benz Group AG and Mercedes-Benz AG since April 2024, with a global responsibility for IT across all divisions, brands and markets. 

Previously, she was Vice President IT Sales/Marketing & Home of Tech at Mercedes-Benz AG. The focus of her work was on the digitalization of all sales processes, including IT-based marketing, sales and after-sales activities. 

She started her professional career in the SAP sphere in 2001. Since 2004, she has held various management positions in consulting as well as in solution and business development within the SAP Group. In 2015, she took on the role of Program Lead in Strategic Program Management and became the Global Chief Data Officer in 2017. Afterward, she was appointed as Senior VP of S/4 HANA Cloud Data Development. In her last position as Senior VP of Customer Innovation & Maintenance at the Product Engineering Group at SAP SE, she oversaw customer and industry-specific software development, software maintenance and innovation from 2020 to 2023.

Katrin Lehmann holds a Master of Business Administration (MBA) from Mannheim Business School.

She is married with four children and enjoys competitive swimming and triathlons.

Magnus Östberg assumes overall responsibility for the MB.OS vehicle operating system as Chief Software Officer at Mercedes-Benz AG since September 1, 2021. Magnus Östberg was born on April 27, 1973 in
Sweden. After graduating from Chalmers University of Technology, Gothenburg, with a master’s degree in electrical engineering, he obtained an Executive Master in Business and Administration from the
University of Gothenburg in 2006. He started his career in the automotive industry at Mecel, a software and technical consulting company, followed by various management positions at Delphi in Germany and the United States with a focus on vehicle software, infotainment and telematics. Most recently, Magnus Östberg was Vice President Software Platform & System at auto-motive supplier Aptiv in the US and responsible for development and launch of the ADAS Satellite Architecture at multiple automotive manufacturers.

sessions.title: Beyond the Prompt: Evaluating, Testing, and Securing LLM Applications
sessions.description:
When you change prompts or modify the Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline in your LLM applications, how do you know it’s making a difference? You don’t—until you measure. But what should you measure, and how? Similarly, how can you ensure your LLM app is resilient against prompt injections or avoids providing harmful responses? More robust guardrails on inputs and outputs are needed beyond basic safety settings.

In this talk, we’ll explore various evaluation frameworks such as Vertex AI Evaluation, DeepEval, and Promptfoo to assess LLM outputs, understand the types of metrics they offer, and how these metrics are useful. We’ll also dive into testing and security frameworks like LLM Guard to ensure your LLM apps are safe and limited to precisely what you need.

speakers.bio: I’m a Software Engineer and a Developer Advocate at Google in London. I build tools, demos, tutorials, and give talks to educate and help developers to be successful on Google Cloud. I currently live in Greenwich, not far from the prime meridian!

sessions.title: Leave it to the Dutch: How to save on your Azure bill!
sessions.description:
As your usage of Azure expands, so too does the likelihood of incurring unnecessary costs. But what if you could harness the renowned Dutch knack for thriftiness to optimize your Azure spending?

In this session, Michaël will embody his Dutch heritage to guide you through understanding your Azure expenditures. He will provide practical tips and tricks to help you identify potential savings and make the most of your Azure investment.

Key Takeaways:
* Gain insights into your Azure spending and learn how to identify areas of potential savings.
* Discover practical tips and tricks to optimize your Azure usage and reduce costs.

speakers.bio:
Michaël Hompus is an Architect and Area Lead at Info Support.

As an architect he is part of several teams, creating new and innovative solutions.
Michaël has many years of development experience with .NET, Java, and Azure.

His passion is to share knowledge with colleagues, customers, and peers.
Microsoft has recognized his efforts for the community by awarding him a Microsoft MVP award.

sessions.title: Create AI-Infused Java Apps with LangChain4j
sessions.description:
Generative AI has taken the world by storm over the last year, and it seems like every executive leader out there is telling us “regular” Java application developers to “add AI” to our applications. Does that mean we need to drop everything we’ve built and become data scientists instead now? 

We promise it’s not as complicated as you might think! With Quarkus and LangChain4j, integrating AI models into your Java apps is easier than you might think. These tools make it simple to leverage the power of AI and impress your stakeholders.

In this session, you’ll explore a variety of AI capabilities such as Quarkus DevUI to try out AI models even before writing any code, LangChain4j features for prompting, chaining, and preserving state, function-calling for enriching your AI model’s knowledge with your documents using retrieval augmented generation (RAG),  and Podman AI Lab for discovering ways to run (and train) models locally.

speakers.bio: Daniel Oh is a Java Champion and Senior Principal Developer Advocate at Red Hat to evangelize developers for building cloud-native apps and serverless ob Kubernetes ecosystems. He's also contributing to various cloud open-source projects and ecosystems as a CNCF ambassador for accelerating DevOps adoption in enterprises. He's speaking at lots of technical seminars, workshops, and meetups to elaborate on new emerging technologies for enterprise developers & DevOps teams.
speakers.tagline: Sr. Principal Developer Advocate at Red Hat

speakers.bio: Kevin is a Java Champion, software engineer, author and international speaker with a passion for Open Source, Java, and Cloud Native Development & Deployment practices. He currently works as developer advocate at Red Hat where he gets to enjoy working with Open Source projects and improving the developer experience. He previously worked as a (lead) software engineer at a variety of organizations across the world ranging from small startups to large enterprises and even government agencies.
speakers.tagline: Sr. Principal Developer Advocate at Red Hat

sessions.title: Pragmatic Blockchain Design Patterns: Integrating Blockchain into Business Processes
sessions.description: Imagine enhancing your existing web2 processes with blockchain—without a complete system overhaul. In this talk, I'll first introduce four pragmatic blockchain design patterns that show how to integrate blockchain into everyday business processes: from time stamping and transparent on-chain data aggregation to tokenizing simple assets and enforcing asset rules. Then, we'll shift gears to explore how these patterns align with modern architectural styles like event-driven systems and microservices. You'll see how blockchain can serve as an auditing module in a microservices setup or be incorporated into event streams in an event-driven design. Join me to learn practical ways to add blockchain capabilities to your existing systems.

speakers.bio: Michiel is a seasoned professional in the Web3 space, bringing a wealth of experience from roles at Hedera, Algorand, and Lisk. With over 8 years dedicated to technical documentation and development, his journey has evolved from software engineering to DevRel, fueling a passion for enhancing developer experiences through meticulous documentation strategy, engaging video content, and innovative information architecture.

sessions.title: Bringing Clarity to Event Streams: Enabling Analytics and AI Through Rich Metadata
sessions.description:
Event streams are central to delivering actionable insights for analytics and AI. However, without rich metadata to contextualize these streams, data consumers often struggle with inconsistencies, poor quality, and a lack of interpretability. By leveraging metadata as a cornerstone of event stream architecture, organizations can unlock clarity in their streaming data, bridging the gap between raw event streams and actionable insights. This clarity not only enhances the quality and usability of event streams but also ensures alignment between developers, analysts, and AI systems, enabling them to extract maximum value from data in motion.

This session explores how rich metadata transforms event streams into a reliable foundation for advanced analytics and AI workflows. We will examine the role of schema definitions, semantic annotations, and cataloging practices in improving data quality and context.

speakers.bio: Clemens Vasters is Lead Architect in Microsoft’s Azure Messaging team that builds and operates a fleet of hyper-scale messaging services, including Event Grid, Service Bus, Event Hubs, Stream Analytics and Microsoft Fabric Eventstreams. Clemens represents Microsoft in messaging standardisation in OASIS (AMQP, MQTT) and CNCF (CloudEvents, xRegistry) and writes too much code for being an "Architect". He looks back at nearly 30 years in professional software development and has seen the same fashion come and go a few times.

sessions.title: Delay the AI Overlords: How OAuth and OpenFGA Can Keep Your AI Agents from Going Rogue
sessions.description:
What happens when your AI agents bypass controls, abuse tool permissions, or hallucinate sensitive data from RAG pipelines? The path to an “AI Overlord” starts with one unguarded API call.

In this talk, you’ll learn how to weaponize OAuth2, OpenFGA, and battle-tested authorization strategies to keep AI agents in check. We’ll cover:

✅ Role-Based Shackles: Enforce least privilege for AI toolchains using RBAC and Fine-Grained Authorization (FGA).
✅ Credential-Free Tool Calls: Fortify API integrations with OAuth2 token exchange, letting agents act on behalf of users without ever touching raw credentials.
✅ RAG Jailbreaking Fixes: Embed FGA directly into retrieval workflows to prevent agents from leaking confidential data
✅ Human Guardrails: Leverage asynchronous authorization workflows to audit high-stakes actions.

Forget sci-fi doomsday scenarios—we’re tackling today’s threats. Walk away with knowledge to armor your AI agents against rogue behavior and security nightmares.

speakers.bio: Deepu K Sasidharan is a Software Engineer by passion and profession. He is a Java Champion working as a Staff Developer Advocate at Okta. He is the co-chair of JHipster and the creator of KDash and JDL Studio. He is a polyglot programmer working with Java, Rust, JavaScript, Go, and so on. He is also a cloud technology advocate and an open-source software aficionado. He has authored books on Full-stack development and frequently writes about Java, Rust, JavaScript, Go, DevOps, Kubernetes, Linux, and so on, on his blog.

sessions.title: Code meets connectivity - Developers as the powerhouse of Network API innovation
sessions.description: Join Alex Welling, Head of Business Development for Nokia's Network Monetization Platform Business Unit, for an insightful session on how network APIs are transforming key industries. In this session, Shkumbin will explore the "Blueprint for Success" by addressing common challenges faced by developers across sectors like fintech, healthcare, logistics, and transportation. Rather than starting with the technology, Shkumbin will focus on real-world challenges, such as customer identity verification, and demonstrate how network APIs provide innovative solutions. The session will also highlight Nokia's role in empowering developers through tools like the enterprise hub, live demos, and collaboration with industry-leading companies. Don’t miss this opportunity to learn how network APIs are driving industry evolution and unlocking new opportunities for developers worldwide.

speakers.bio: My experience includes successfully leading organizations through extremely transformative phases, defining long-term objectives, and optimizing operations to achieve sustainable success. With a strong background in sales, developer relations, team management, product strategy, and software development, I possess a unique blend of technical expertise and business knowledge that drives revenue growth and fosters cross-functional collaboration.
speakers.tagline: Head of Business Development, Network Monetization Platform BU at Nokia

sessions.title: Transforming Task Management: Integrating Camunda with Scalable Frontend Solutions
sessions.description:
In modern enterprise environments, managing tasks efficiently is crucial for scalability and automation. This talk explores how we transformed task management by integrating Camunda with a scalable frontend solution, streamlining manual activity while maintaining flexibility for decentralized process ownership. ​

We will deep dive into process orchestration, the challenges of process-driven applications, and how a modular frontend architecture enhances task execution efficiency.  ​

Learn how we tackled scalability, automated routing, and seamless user interaction, providing a unified experience across teams.

speakers.bio:
In 2017, I joined ING as a platform backend developer, focusing on process automation with Camunda. Over the years, I advanced to become the product owner for the process automation platform used across ING Germany. Currently, I am leading the FutureOps project as the technical project lead, aiming to build a new backoffice platform for ING Germany.
I am passionate about process orchestration, particularly with Camunda. I thrive on modeling, implementing, and optimizing processes to drive efficiency and innovation.

I am an experienced Product Owner at ING with a strong background in IT and a passion for agile leadership. Throughout my career, I’ve specialized in designing and implementing platform solutions and automation strategies that drive efficiency, reduce operational complexity, and elevate customer experience within the financial industry.

sessions.title: The AI Skills Gap: What Tech Leaders Must Get Right

speakers.bio:
With over 10 years of experience in machine learning, a focus on computer vision and a PhD in computer science (University of Heidelberg), Thomas combines technological excellence with entrepreneurial thinking.
As CTO of Merantix Momentum in Berlin, he is responsible for the delivery of production-ready AI solutions as well as researching the next generation of machine learning methodologies. He is also a Director at the e-learning solution provider PWS and a regular lecturer and speaker on topics such as machine learning, developer experience, and technical leadership.

Gerrit Einhoff is a CIO for Deutsche Bank’s Business Banking and Payments Acceptance businesses. He also leads Deutsche Bank’s Berlin Technology Centre, where ~1,800 Engineers develop strategic applications for the bank. Previously, Gerrit worked with McKinsey, advising Financial Services companies on technology and operations topics.
speakers.tagline: Head of Berlin Tech Centre at Deutsche Bank

speakers.bio: Kara Sprague is the CEO of HackerOne. She holds over 20 years of experience assisting public and private technology companies in growing their businesses at a global scale. Prior to HackerOne, Kara served as the Executive Vice President and Chief Product Officer at F5 where she led several enterprise-wide transformation initiatives to enable the company to adapt to changing market conditions and disruptive market forces. Kara received her bachelor’s and master’s degrees in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science as well as her master’s degree in Technology and Public Policy from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. In her spare time, Kara remains passionate about equity and sustainability and served as a member of the Executive Committee of the Girls Who Code Board from 2016 through 2022.

Alexandra Wudel is AI researcher and tech entrepreneur. With FemAI, she’s building one of Europe's first responsible AI brands. As the CEO of FemAI, she has won awards such as "AI Person of the Year 2024, "40 under 40" and was one of 25 global experts on ethical considerations for AI. Alexandra has contributed to the design of ethical AI guidelines for over 25+ organizations such as the EU, German Federal Foreign Ministry, the UN, and the German Parliament.

sessions.title: HR Tech and AI Trends and Where You Can Start
sessions.description: Building the future of HR starts with a foundation of tech. Did you know there’s amazing tech and AI out there that can transform how you operate, reduce admin work, and let you (finally) focus on the human side of things? This talk uncovers mind-blowing tools you never knew existed: options that simplify processes, improve efficiency, and empower you to reimagine your role. Discover how HR tech and AI can complement your work, not replace it, and see how you can reshape HR of the future to be more impactful than ever.

speakers.bio: Jessie is the Founder of Stakkd: the go to place to discover HR tech. A strategic leader with 13+ years of unique experience in both corporates and startups. She is known for her unconventional approach to People topics and is passionate about HR tech and leveraging the benefits to build the future of work.

sessions.title: Building Your Leadership Muscle: How You Show Up Impacts Culture
sessions.description: Leadership is a muscle to grow and development, and a very important one at that. It starts before you even become a leader - and, most are not very good leaders on the first try - you have to fail to learn, and keep growing. As a leader, that growing never stops. You’re faced with new challenges every day: whether from your team and work, the global or outside environment, your own self, and everything in between. And, how you show up has a direct impact to your team and organisation culture. This talk will dive in here, and highlight ‘self-improvement’ as a critical tool in your leadership toolbox.

speakers.bio: Meghan is a results-driven leader, passionate about people, culture, and team development and empowerment. She has experience with some of the world’s best known companies and largest brands, leading internationally distributed teams, and working at the intersection of talent and HR. She strongly values the creation of people-first culture, and puts vision and focus on operationalising for scale and people development, having developed high-performing, global organisations.

sessions.title: Mobile AI Just Got Faster: What’s Coming for Developers on Arm
sessions.description:
Arm is enabling AI applications through various accelerators, etc. Including an exciting announcement for Mobile application development. 

 'Developers want speed, efficiency, and portability—with as little friction as possible. In this session, Arm will share how it’s enabling the next wave of AI applications on mobile, from LLMs to vision, voice and multimodal models. You’ll learn how Arm’s work with partners like Google is delivering significant performance gains. 

We’ll preview upcoming AI acceleration capabilities coming to Armv9 CPUs that plug directly into popular frameworks like PyTorch, ONNX Runtime, and Llama.cpp via open-source libraries like KleidiAI and XNNPACK. You’ll also see what your team can do to prepare for these optimizations in real-world apps—from photos to messaging to generative models.’

speakers.bio: Gian Marco leads the GenAI team at Arm and is an expert in Edge computing, with a focus on AI workloads. He has 10+ years of experience designing and developing AI libraries. He authored the TinyML Cookbook and co-created KleidiAI and the Compute Library.

sessions.title: UX in the Dev Cycle: Moving from Handoff to Handshake
sessions.description:
UX isn’t a phase. It’s a thread woven through the entire product development cycle.
Here’s how to stop throwing designs over the wall—and start building better tools, faster.

We show that integrating UX doesn’t slow teams down—it increases speed, quality, and dev happiness when done right.

speakers.bio:
Malte is a passionate nerd who develops software. He likes pragmatic solutions but loves when pragmatism is pushed to its boundaries and 'better' engineering is required.
Malte is an avid accessibility advocate, cross-functional connoisseur and soothing social person.
He holds degrees in math, computer science and education.

As a strategic designer and enterprise UX researcher, I am bridging the messy gap between user insights, business requirements and dev realities. 
I love unearthing hidden behavioral patterns and crafting solutions that respect users and take into account codebases.
 🖖
speakers.tagline: Strategic Design at E.On Global User Excellence

sessions.title: Ask Me Anything: Advanced Discord Workshop
sessions.description: You’ve set up your Discord—now it’s time to take it to the next level. This AMA-style advanced session dives into the deeper layers of Discord management, automation, and community engagement. Bring your questions! We’ll cover everything from advanced bot integration and to designing community flows, scalable moderation systems, Discord partner programs, and analytics. This session begins with a short presentation of advanced tips and real-world case studies from successful communities, followed by a live Q&A where attendees can ask anything, technical, strategic, or creative. We’ll cover setting up tiered access and role-based content, automation workflows using bots like ReactionRolls, ProBot, Dyno, and custom scripts, leveraging Discord for live events, dev updates, and gated content, and tools to track server health and user engagement. This is your opportunity to get hands-on advice tailored to your challenges—and leave with new ideas to supercharge your server.

speakers.bio: Maezza Romero is a Community Manager at Romero Games. With 5 years of experience in the industry, she has used her acquired skills to build and manage large community spaces, such as the Romero Games Discord which has recently celebrated 7,000 members.The Romero Games Twitter, the company’s biggest social media page with nearly 9,000 followers is a fun and nostalgic space for fans of Romero’s legacy titles such as DOOM and Quake, offering discussions on what DOOM weapon one would bring to a desert island, and other lively user polls and QnA. The current social media landscape is challenging, with new platforms overtaking the next.In 2023, fast-form video content is the meta, so Maezza has had to adapt her social media management to platforms such as TikTok and Instagram Reels. By utilising traditional social media platforms such as Facebook and Twitter, as well as modern platforms, Maezza creates content for diehard Millennial and Gen-X fans.

sessions.title: NVIDIA Expert Session: How NVIDIA Inception Supports the Startup Developer Community
sessions.description: Visit us at booth A-16 to get answers to your most pressing questions from NVIDIA technology experts, and claim a free self-paced DLI course on July 10-11.

speakers.bio: Alexander Martynau is leading NVIDIA Inception program for AI startups and scaleups in the Nordic and CEE regions. He has been helping EMEA startups grow by making use of NVIDIA technology for nearly a decade

sessions.title: Why Understanding Infrastructure Makes You a Better Developer
sessions.description:
How often do developers dive into a project without really considering what the infrastructure can handle? 
Sometimes, it leads to missed limitations, unrealistic timelines, or even overcomplicated (and expensive) solutions that could’ve been avoided. 
And let’s be honest—how many times have we heard things like, “Oh, it’s just some automated process” or “Well, it works on my machine”? 
Let’s break down why it’s crucial for developers to understand infrastructure capabilities. We’ll explore how this knowledge impacts the quality of your code, improves estimates, smooths out integration and deployment, and helps you avoid common pitfalls. 
We’ll also discuss why being a full-stack developer means knowing your way around infrastructure—and which foundational skills are a must-have.

speakers.bio:
Angelika Shvets, a software developer based in Israel.
I've been in the IT industry since 2004.
Over the last 6 years, my work has primarily involved software development, encompassing research, implementation, integration, and testing of systems of varying complexity.
Prior to my current role, I spent 8 years as a full-stack web application developer. 
In the early stages of my career, I gained a solid foundation with 5 years of experience as a system administrator. 
I also served as a system administrator in the military.
I hold a Masters in Mathematics and Computer Engineering.

sessions.title: What tattoos and software projects have in common
sessions.description: In this session, we’ll explore why getting a tattoo and building software aren’t as different as they might seem. Both require vision, trust, and a steady hand—whether it’s ink hitting skin or code hitting production. We’ll look at how great artists and great developers share a respect for careful planning, a willingness to iterate, and the courage to commit. By the end, you’ll see that whether you’re holding a tattoo gun or a keyboard, the path to something remarkable is forged through patience, care, and embracing the unexpected. As a tattooed software guy i know of what i am speaking :)

speakers.bio: Since many years, Jan works in different software architecture positions all over the globe. With a background in software engineering, he successfully planned, designed and helped implement solutions in various business fields such as defence, automotive, pharma or finance. As an ISAQB accredited software architecture instructor he loves to share his knowledge and enable others to grow in their career paths. Jan at the moment is working as a senior consultant for NFQ worldwide.

sessions.title: Azure-Well Architected Framework - designing mission critical workloads in practice
sessions.description:
What is the Azure Well-Architected Framework, and how can you leverage it to make the right application and infrastructure design decisions? How to achieve sustainable scale and performance? How to avoid unnecessary infrastructure costs while preserving the maximum reliability of Your apps? What are the key architecture patterns for mission-critical workloads and how can I use them? 
During my talk, I'll help you answer those questions, briefing you on the theory and providing real-life architecture and tooling examples.

speakers.bio:
Pawel Siwek has been working in it for more than 20 years in many roles: architect, devops, .NET developer and even CTO in fin-tech startup for 2+ years. For the last 4 years Product Architect, fucing on making life easier for people who want to leverage AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud observability signals in Dynatrace. In my free time, I enjoy house-keeping: both traditional (garden & likes) and digital (home-assistant automations). 
If there is still free time after all that: I love traveling, further.. better. :)

sessions.title: Best of the Worst – the most awful anti-features in JavaScript, ranked!
sessions.description:
Browser, browser on the wall, who's got the worst features of them all? JavaScript of course!

This session takes a close look at the most awful features in JavaScript and the DOM, how they work and why they are still part of today's web standards. We explore the reasons for continued browser support of even the most broken features from the cretaceous period, how bad decisions from the 1990s still haunt JavaScript's syntax today and which absurd hacks from ancient history are still being re-purposed even today.

Apart from sheer shock and/or entertainment value, even the most awful anti-features in JavaScript are actually worth learning about. Sometimes they are important constraints for the continued evolution of the JavaScript standard, and sometimes they are simply the only way to solve (extremely specific) programming challenges. If you ever wanted to know why JavaScript works and looks like it does or just like to gawk at some rather... exotic code, this is the session for you!

speakers.bio: Peter Kröner works as a web technology expert across the country. Since the release of his book "HTML5: Innovative and Future-Proof Websites" in 2010, he has been active as a trainer and consultant for JavaScript, HTML5, React, TypeScript, and other web technologies. Previously, he worked as a freelance web designer and developer. He blogs, hosts podcasts, and develops projects focused on modern web technologies.

sessions.title: Reimagining the Developer Experience: The AI Advantage
sessions.description:
Join Atlassian President, Anu Bharadwaj, for a deep dive into what the future of developer experience looks like in an AI-powered world. 

Drawing on insights from thousands of developers and Atlassian’s own journey, Anu will explore how AI agents are evolving into true productivity partners—transforming workflows and eliminating friction across the software development lifecycle. She’ll also discuss the cultural shifts—like experimentation and growth mindset—needed to fully usher in this new era of intelligent, collaborative teamwork.

Most importantly, Anu will explore how AI removes friction at every stage to unlock creativity, collaboration, and speed, to help developers focus on what matters most: building great software, faster.

speakers.bio:
Anu Bharadwaj is the President of Atlassian and is focused on uniting the Product, Business, Design, and Engineering teams to deliver innovative products that customers love while supercharging the growth of Atlassian’s businesses.
With nearly 20 years of experience in transforming and building billion-dollar businesses, Anu brings deep expertise in Product, Operations, and Engineering for customer-focused growth. As former Atlassian COO, she scaled a distributed workforce across 13 countries, led Atlassian’s SaaS transformation, and built the Cloud enterprise business. Previously, she held leadership roles at Microsoft, launching products for the Visual Studio ALM team.
Anu is deeply passionate about growing diverse teams and making the world a better place through technology and effective philanthropy, and regularly advises young and emerging companies (Snyk, Xembly).

Tobias Schlottke is the founding CTO of saas.group, a B2B SaaS aggregator with over 400 employees across its global portfolio. He co-founded OMR, Germany’s leading platform for the digital economy, best known for its annual 70,000+ attendee festival, as well as two adtech companies, serving as CTO in both. He’s passionate about developer experience, AI adoption, and scaling engineering teams. Tobias also hosts the alphalist.CTO podcast and runs Europe’s largest CTO community.

sessions.title: Mastering AWS Cost Optimization: Real-world technical and operational cost-saving best practices
sessions.description: In this talk, we will show you how you start on your AWS Cost Optimization journey. It can be difficult to understand how to start, so we will explore how to monitor costs, get automated alerts, create dashboards, and take actions to bring your costs down. We dive deep into real world cost monitoring and cost optimization examples, which have worked well for other AWS Customers. Join us and let's take your first steps into your AWS Cost Optimization journey together! After this session, you will be able to identify specific cost-saving opportunities in your AWS spending, and other opportunities for better cloud efficiency.

speakers.bio: Joachim has been at Amazon Web Services since 2019 and supports Enterprise customers with the adoption and use of AWS services. He enjoys speaking on stage and spreading cloud knowledge. His favorite topic in the cloud area is cost optimization and high scale events. You should ask him about it! Before joining AWS, he worked at Adidas, Sivantos, and a smaller travel software company as a Solution Architect, Development Lead and Senior Developer. When he isn’t supporting customers on their inevitable journey to the cloud, he is enjoying playing and watching Sports.

Olga is a Principal Customer Solutions Manager working for Strategics accounts; with 20+ years experience in Finance, Project Management, Customer Engagements, Olga has worked in different environments and enjoys cultural diversity. Expertise areas include Operational Excellence, ID&E, Culture, Cloud Economics.

sessions.title: Shaping Up: Rethinking Product Development with Basecamp's Shape Up Methodology
sessions.description:
In this talk, I would like to share lessons learned on how we introduced Shape Up. Shape Up is an alternative product development methodology pioneered by Basecamp, designed to address the pitfalls of traditional agile and waterfall approaches. The session dives into how Shape Up structures work in six-week cycles, promotes empowered teams, and minimizes the chaos of backlogs and constant reprioritization.
We'll walk through our journey implementing Shape Up. Why we made the switch, how we adapted the principles to our organization, and what lessons we learned along the way. You'll gain insights into how shaping, betting, and building work together to create more meaningful and autonomous delivery cycles.

speakers.bio: Sebastian Gierlinger is an experienced developer, team builder, and leader. As VP of Engineering at Storyblok, he is dedicated to providing developers with a CMS that meets all their requirements. With over 10 years of experience in CMS development and security, his focus is on performance and usability. Sebastian is passionate about supporting open-source projects and organizing community events for developers.

sessions.title: Self-Hosted LLMs: From Zero to Inference
sessions.description: As large language models (LLMs) become more accessible, running them locally unlocks exciting opportunities for developers, engineers, and privacy-focused users. Why rely on costly cloud AI services that share your data when you could deploy your own models tailored to your needs? In this session, we'll dive into the advantages of local LLM deployment, from selecting the right open source model to optimizing performance on consumer hardware and integrating with your unique data. Let's explore the journey to your own local stack for AI, and cover the important technical details such as model quantization, API integrations with IDE code assistants, and advanced methods like Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to connect your LLM to private data sources. Don't miss out on the fun live demos that prove the bright future of open source AI is already here!

speakers.bio:
I’m Roberto Carratalá, an IT professional with more than ten years of experience in the industry of AI, Linux, Cloud, DevOps and Kubernetes/OpenShift.

Currently I am working as a Principal AI Platform Architect for Red Hat working in the AI Business Unit, focused in OpenShift AI, Cloud Services, DevSecOps, CICD and MLOps, helping the customers to achieve their goals and objectives with linux, cloud and containers in public and private environments.
speakers.tagline: Principal AI Architect at Red Hat

speakers.bio: Cedric Clyburn (@cedricclyburn), Senior Developer Advocate at Red Hat, is an enthusiastic software technologist with a background in Kubernetes, DevOps, and container tools. He has experience speaking and organizing conferences including DevNexus, WeAreDevelopers, The Linux Foundation, KCD NYC, and more. Cedric loves all things open-source, and works to make developer's lives easier! Based out of New York.
speakers.tagline: Senior Developer Advocate at Red Hat

sessions.title: Breaking Silos: Successful Collaboration Between Tech & Business Teams in Complex Enterprise Systems
sessions.description:
In today's world, especially in the financial sector, tech and business teams often face the challenge of aligning their different perspectives and working styles. While tech teams are often driven by agility and new technologies, business departments must operate within highly regulated and legacy-heavy environments. This tension between innovation and regulatory requirements can lead to inefficient collaboration and stifled innovation.
In this talk, we will explore the key aspects of successful collaboration within development teams – from translating business requirements into technical solutions to handling internal conflicts and adapting to constantly changing regulatory mandates.
We will also examine the importance of knowledge sharing, flexible and agile collaboration models in the complex enterprise context, and the potential of AI to enhance efficiency in daily work.
Join us as we explore the exciting question of how to successfully drive the transformation from a hierarchical to an agile, team-oriented culture.

speakers.bio: Stefan joined Finanz Informatik back in 2006 as part of his dual studies. He has worked in various areas of software development – from technical support for software development tools to developing banking applications. As Senior Manager, Stefan is now responsible for the development of the process and application landscape for consumer loans at Finanz Informatik. As the person responsible for architecture in the business unit, he is still close to the source code of the applications.
speakers.tagline: Business Unit Lead Application Development at Finanz Informatik

speakers.bio:
Alexander Weisshaupt has been working as a Business Analyst at Finanz Informatik for 10 years.
Together with a team of developers, subject matter experts, and other colleagues, he develops software in the field of personal loan processes for the German Sparkassen (Savings Banks) Finance Group and their 50 million customers. As part of project work, he closely collaborates with associations, savings banks, and the relevant committees.
In his private life, he dedicates his time to his family and, when time permits, to his home server—while also trying to stay fit.

sessions.title: Practical AI with Machine Learning for Observability in Netdata
sessions.description:
ML for observability can be challenging, given the uniqueness of each workload. However, we can leverage ML to detect individual component anomalies, even if they are sometimes noisy/imprecise. At Netdata, we use ML models to analyze the behavior of individual metrics. These models adapt to the specific characteristics of each metric, ensuring anomalies can be detected accurately.

The power of ML becomes evident when these seemingly noisy anomalies converge across various services, serving as indicators of something exceedingly unusual.
