ML is an advisor, training numerous independent models for each individually collected metric to achieve anomaly detection based on recent behavior.

When multiple independent metrics exhibit anomalies simultaneously, it is usually a signal that something unusual is occurring. This approach to ML can be instrumental in uncovering malicious attacks and, in many cases, predicting combined failures across seemingly unrelated components.

speakers.bio: Costa Tsaousis, is the Founder and CEO of Netdata. Since 1995, Costa has been actively working on internet related startups. He has been a co-founder and C-level executive of many successful projects, including Internet Service Providers, Cloud Hosting Providers and Fintech startups. With a passion for innovation and open-source, he now leads Netdata, a monitoring solution aiming to simplify and modernize infrastructure observability for all of us.

sessions.title: API = Some REST and HTTP, right? RIGHT?!
sessions.description:
What does it mean building REST-full APIs? What do you need to think about while building and maintaining those? How do we expose data (hypermedia), handle errors, version the API, provide contracts, etc.? 

Join us for this interactive session where we will be looking at real-life examples, based on Jakarta EE and Microprofile. The knowledge you gain can be applied to other tech stacks you might be using.

Finally, what are alternatives to REST-full-ish APIs, like GraphQL or standards like gRPC?

speakers.bio: Passionate computer scientist. Developer and Architect. Java Champion, Google Developers Expert for Cloud, Docker Captain and Oracle ACE. Public speaker. Ex-leader of JavaZone and Norwegian JUG – javaBin.
speakers.tagline: Senior Software Engineer at SpareBank 1 Utvikling

sessions.title: Getting to Know Your Legacy (System) with AI-Driven Software Archeology
sessions.description:
Maintaining old software systems can be challenging. The code is often hard to read, documentation may be missing, and the original authors might no longer be available. However, with the data we already have at our fingertips, we can quickly dig deeper in existing codebases and track how they have evolved over time.

By using artificial intelligence, especially large language models, alongside modern data analysis techniques and freely available open-source tools, you too can gain deeper insights into a system’s architecture. Uncover hidden patterns that help you better understand the legacy entrusted to you and its evolution.

Join me to see how data-driven analysis helps you work more efficiently, reduce uncertainty, and confidently take the first step toward moving your legacy system into the future.

speakers.bio: Markus Harrer has been working in software development for several years, primarily in conservative industries. As a Senior Consultant, he helps develop and improve software in a sustainable and economically sensible way. He is an active contributor in communities focused on software analytics, software architecture, software refactoring, and Wardley Maps. Additionally, he is an accredited trainer for the iSAQB Foundation Level and the Advanced-Level module IMPROVE.

sessions.title: Intelligence Everywhere: The Future of Consumer Tech
sessions.description:
The home and consumer tech landscape is rapidly evolving. In this panel, we will discuss how advanced AI is revolutionizing retail operations, customer experiences and hyper personalised product design, paving the way for a new era.

- AI Driven Retail & Marketing: How artificial intelligence is transforming everything from inventory - management to customer service and marketing in real-time
- Generative AI in Product Design: How brands are co-creating with consumers using AI to develop products that reflect real-time desires and lifestyle shifts.
- Customer Experience 3.0: Reimagining every touchpoint—physical, digital, and hybrid—to deliver intelligence-powered convenience, delight, and loyalty

speakers.bio: Leif Lindner has been CEO of IFA Management GmbH – organizer of IFA, the world's most important trade fair for consumer and home technologies – since October 2023. Last year, more than 1,800 exhibitors from around the world and 215,000 visitors from 138 countries came together at IFA at the exhibition halls in Berlin to exhibit and marvel at the latest tech trends. In his role as CEO, Leif Lindner is making IFA Berlin fit for the future and focusing on a complete reflection of the global electronics and tech market. Before his time at IFA, the Berlin native worked for Samsung Electronics for over 15 years, most recently as Vice President CE.

As the Global Data & AI Practice Lead at Avanade, a joint venture from Accenture and Microsoft, Annika Grosse brings over 20 years of experience in Data & AI, innovation, strategy, and transformational consulting.  Her leadership is marked by a strong focus on technical innovation and guiding organizations through their complex digital transformations. In the era of AI, she is passionate to help leveraging emerging AI technologies to generate more collective intelligence and to become “we” convinced that we can be more than the sum of our parts.

With a background that spans both strategic advisory and hands-on delivery, Annika has led large-scale AI and data transformation programs across industries at IBM Consulting and Accenture/Avanade. She is also a vocal advocate for inclusive innovation, championing initiatives that empower underrepresented groups in tech. At Avanade, she  is actively involved in shaping the company’s AI-first strategy, helping clients and teams alike navigate the evolving landscape of responsible and impactful AI adoption.

Annika is scheduled to appear on the Tech Leaders Stage at the upcoming WeAreDevelopers World Congress in Berlin, where she will join a panel hosted by IFA titled “Intelligence Everywhere: The Future of Consumer Tech.” The session will explore how AI is transforming retail operations, customer experience, and product design.
speakers.tagline: Executive, Global D&AI Practice Lead at Avanade

speakers.bio: Alejandro is the Director of Engineering, Science & Product at Zalando SE, where he is responsible for large-scale AI & Data platforms that power Supply and Demand across the group. Alejandro is appointed as AI Expert at the United Nations and the European Commission, serves as Board Member at ACM's Board of Directors, and is the Scientific Adviser at the Institute for Ethical AI, where he has led contributions to EU policy, including the AI Act, the Data Act and the Digital Services Act, among others
speakers.tagline: Director of Engineering, Science & Product at Zalando

sessions.title: Beyond the Code: Driving Change with Effective Communication
sessions.description:
How to make an impact with strong communication? Do you find it difficult to get your ideas on the table? Do you often get the feeling that your vision is unseen and this is blocking your career.  I will help you to get this fixed. With strategic communication you will be seen as a strong partner who's knows his expertise. Are you ready to make an impact?

- How to convey your message clearly and empathetically so that you are heard and understood.
- Discover powerful tools to get others on board with your vision and plans.
- Not theory, but concrete tips that you can immediately apply in your work.

speakers.bio:
By nature, I am an energetic speaker who easily translates complex topics into practical insights. With a focus on autonomy and communication - what can YOU do to make your ideas land better in the organization - I inspire you to get the best out of yourself.

My way of speaking is sharp, accessible and I also provide a lot of familiarity. Because of this, I not only inspire but also really spur people into action.

sessions.title: From Buzzwords to Action: Forget the Posters – How Culture Dive Makes Values Stick and Teams Thrive!
sessions.description: In this session, we address the challenges of making company values and strategies tangible for employees. Often, these remain abstract, as empty slogans or wall decals. Culture Dive creates a digital, interactive experience where employees share their own anecdotes and perspectives on company values, bringing them to life in an authentic way. Instead of top-down directives, a space for mutual exchange and learning is created. We will show how employee engagement can be increased and how companies can boost not only productivity but also profits. At the end, the Culture Dive tool will be introduced – an innovative solution that makes values and culture truly experienceable.

speakers.bio: Laura Dückers studied International Air Traffic Management before focusing on HR and organizational development. After gaining experience in a telecommunications company, she joined denkwerk GmbH in 2019. Since 2021, she has led the Talent Management team as "Lead Organizational Strategy & Culture" in the digital agency with around 250 employees across four locations. Her focus areas include strategic alignment, digitalizing HR processes, employee satisfaction, health, retention, and overall organizational strategy.
speakers.tagline: Lead Organizational Strategy & Culture at denkwerk

sessions.title: The Happiness Algorithm: Building a Rich Life Beyond Code
sessions.description:
Tech professionals are often hyper-focused on solving external problems, but what about our own inner “algorithms” for happiness?

In this talk, we’ll explore the Realistic Happiness framework to help developers find fulfillment, balance, and “richness” in life beyond just work.

We’ll dive into actionable steps for developing a personal algorithm for happiness that includes setting boundaries, managing stress, and cultivating connections.

Because happiness isn’t a final destination - it’s a powerful tool.

speakers.bio: Daisy Ilaria is a career educator, talent acquisition expert, and host of the 'Realistic Happiness' podcast, dedicated to exploring workplace wellbeing and personal growth. With nearly 10 years’ experience hiring top talent across EMEA and providing insights on job satisfaction, professional relationships, and career happiness, Daisy blends her background in recruitment with a passion for building thriving workplace cultures.
speakers.tagline: Founder and Podcast Host of Realistic Happiness

sessions.title: High performance Serverless Java on AWS
sessions.description:
Java is for many years one of the most popular programming languages, but it used to have hard times in the Serverless community. Java is known for its high cold start times and high memory footprint, comparing to other programming languages like Node.js and Python. In this talk I'll look at the general best practices and techniques we can use to decrease memory consumption and cold start times for Java Serverless applications on AWS Lambda including GraalVM (Native Image) and AWS own offering SnapStart based on Firecracker microVM snapshot and restore and CRaC (Coordinated Restore at Checkpoint) runtime hooks. I'll also provide Lambda functions performance (cold and warm start times) benchmarking for:
 
    -Deployment package sizes 
    -Lambda memory settings
    -Java compilation options
    -Managing Lambda dependencies with Lambda layers 
    -Choice of garbage collection algorithm
    -Choice of hardware architecture x86 vs arm64 
    -HTTP (a)synchronous clients

speakers.bio: Vadym Kazulkin is AWS Serverless Hero and Head of Development at ip.labs GmbH, a 100% subsidiary of the FUJIFILM Group, based in Bonn. ip.labs is the world's leading white label e-commerce software imaging company. Vadym has been involved with the Java ecosystem for over twenty years. His focus and interests currently include the design and implementation of highly scalable and available applications in AWS Cloud with the special passion for Serverless. Vadym is also the co-organizer of the Java User Group Bonn meetup and a frequent speaker at various Meetups and conferences.

sessions.title: The AI Agent Path to Prod: Building for Reliability
sessions.description:
AI agents work great in demos, fail spectacularly in production. Why? LLMs are probabilistic, but production demands reliability. 

Join me for a live transformation where I'll take a naive customer support agent and systematically apply production-ready layers: evaluation frameworks, human-in-the-loop safeguards, prompt injection protection, and robust fallback mechanisms. 

Drawing from patterns deployed by n8n's global userbase, you'll witness the mindset shift from "does it work?" to "is it reliable at scale?" and leave with a proven checklist to make your AI agents truly production-ready.

speakers.bio: Early team member at n8n, where I've worn many hats from founding Head of Design to Developer Advocate. I'm passionate about building "digital hammers"—tools that unlock human potential. Now I educate folks worldwide on AI workflow automation, sharing lessons from scaling n8n into the world's most powerful AI automation platform. The original "Flowgrammer" spreading the low-code revolution.

sessions.title: Bringing AI Model Testing and Prompt Management to Your Codebase with GitHub Models
sessions.description: As developers, we already juggle the roles of testers, operations, security specialists, and now as AI engineers.This session will transform your approach to AI development, integrating it directly in your current workflows. GitHub Models introduces tools for managing, comparing, and integrating AI models and prompts directly alongside your code, supporting reproducible experiments and collaborative iteration. Join us to learn about the variables that impact AI requests, how to evaluate models and parameters, and how to take a prompt from ideation to production. This session is intended for developers interested in practical approaches to integrating and iterating on AI capabilities within their existing projects, even if they have no prior AI experience.

speakers.bio: Sandra worked at some Axel Springer Companies where she learned a lot about coding and DevOps in large companies. That knowledge helped her a lot in setting up the automated infrastructure and DevOps pipeline plus the agile momentum in the StartUp she worked afterwards. In her first year at Microsoft, she helped several companies with their container, Kubernetes, DevOps, agile processes before moving 6 years ago to the cloud advocacy team where she keeps focusing on open-source technologies and heavily in Java and AI.

Kevin is a Senior Developer Advocate at GitHub, helping senior technical leaders understand and get the most out of the platform. His work in developer relations & experience has spanned tooling, education, and initiatives that support developers to learn and succeed with new technologies. He is a JavaScript developer, avid boardgamer, tired dad of two amazing kids, and shameless Disney adult. He is based in Berlin despite not drinking beer or liking techno.

sessions.title: From Uncertainty to Empowerment: Personalizing the Human Experience with AI
sessions.description:
In today's rapidly evolving landscape, technology and AI are transforming HR like never before. But the true magic lies in how these innovations can elevate the human aspects of our workforce. This session delves into the exciting ways tech can enhance employee
 well-being, engagement, and growth, all while maintaining a people-first approach.  

What You'll Discover:  AI-Powered Human Connections: Explore how AI can enrich human interactions in HR, making them more meaningful and personalized. Balancing Automation and Personal Touch: Learn strategies to harmonize automation with personal connections,
 ensuring that technology serves as a bridge, not a barrier. 

Human-Centric AI in HR: Discover how AI-driven HR can stay focused on the human element, fostering a culture of empathy, collaboration, and growth.

speakers.tagline: Global HR & Transformation Lead at Novartis

sessions.title: How Average Developers Can Become Great Digital Designers
sessions.description:
Developers excel at understanding technology and building digital solutions. But what if they could elevate their skills by mastering Digital Design? This talk shows how developers can leverage their knowledge of "digital material"—data, algorithms, and systems—while expanding their perspective to include People and Business. By adopting Digital Design principles and thinking holistically, developers can move beyond technical excellence to craft innovative, sustainable solutions that truly transform the digital world.

Key Takeaways:
- Understand digital technologies as "materials" with unique properties and constraints.
- Combine People, Business, and Technology perspectives for greater impact.
- Apply the Form-Function-Quality (FFQ) model to balance stakeholder needs and innovation.
- Transition from developer to designer with practical tools and steps.

speakers.bio:
Stan Bühne is Managing Director at IREB, with over 20 years of experience in Requirements Engineering, business analysis, and project management. During 15 years in IT consulting, he led international digitalization and transformation projects, particularly in the telco sector. 

In addition to his role at IREB, Stan is an active board member of the Bitkom Working Group for Software Engineering and Architecture and a frequent speaker at international conferences, sharing insights on digital trends and best practices.

sessions.title: High-quality software development
sessions.description: At first glance, software development seems simple: a good idea and a few programmers - and you're ready to go. But that's not how software development works, and projects that are started in this way often quickly run into difficulties and often end in disaster. In this session, we will show you how to do it right. Which roles need to be defined? What should the process look like? Who is responsible for what and how do we ensure that we do everything right? Numerous practical examples and anecdotes will be used to illustrate how to set up modern, high-quality software development - or how to get an existing project on the right track.

speakers.bio: David Tielke is a certified consultant, coach and trainer for software architectures and software quality. He has over 15 years of project experience across a wide range of industries across the world. In addition, David works as a speaker on numerous professional conferences and as an author in various print media.

sessions.title: Building Interactive Async UI with React 19 and Ariakit
sessions.description: Handling async operations in UI components can be tricky—pending states, inefficient updates, and accessibility challenges often arise. This session will explore how React Server Components and React 19 tools streamline data management and improve user experience. Combined with Ariakit, we’ll demonstrate how to build interactive, accessible UIs with less boilerplate using the Next.js App Router.

speakers.bio:
Aurora Scharff is a software developer and Microsoft MVP from Norway. Aurora began her career at a financial technology startup and now serves as a consultant at Crayon Consulting. She focuses on web development and has extensive experience in React and Next.js and active use of React Server Components.

Aurora shares her knowledge through workshops, technical blog posts, social media, demo applications, and supporting fellow developers, and she regularly presents internationally at recognized conferences to contribute to the global developer community.
speakers.tagline: Web Developer and Consultant at Crayon Consulting

sessions.title: The Limits of Prompting: ArchitectingTrustworthy Coding Agents
sessions.description: LLMs can summarize, autocomplete, and comment on code, but when applied to tasks like code review, they often fall apart. We've run agents across real PRs in production environments and observed consistent failure modes: overconfidence, repetition, and lack of judgment. This talk examines the architectural reasons behind that breakdown—why transformer-based models struggle with intent, structure, and impact when reviewing code - and how reasoning phases, memory, and reflection improve both precision and trust. Using real-world examples from Baz's code review agent, we'll show why prompt engineering isn't enough, and what it takes to move from generic pattern-matching to useful, reliable feedback in large, evolving codebases. Expect concrete takeaways for anyone building or evaluating LLM-based developer tools.

speakers.bio: Nimrod Kor is the Co-founder and CTO of Baz, helping development teams craft unbreakable code. Nimrod specializes in code analysis, cloud security, and developer tooling. As the #1 contributor to Checkov, he has helped shape best practices in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) security. His work on open-source projects like Checkov, Yor, and Airiam—focused on creating and analyzing code—has been central to his past talks.

sessions.title: The future of Stack Overflow as the most vital source for technologists
sessions.description: Over the last few years Stack Overflow has been focused on its mission by keeping humans at the core of unlocking technological progress and growth by bringing the best of trustworthy, community curated knowledge and the power of AI together to benefit our users and customers. CEO Prashanth Chandrasekar will take the stage to share how Stack Overflow is powering developer workflows and explore what the future of Stack Overflow looks like alongside Chief Product & Technology Officer Jody Bailey, who will unveil the latest innovations across our public platform and enterprise products.

speakers.bio:
Prashanth Chandrasekar is the CEO of Stack Overflow and is a proven technology executive with extensive experience leading and scaling high-growth global organizations. Before joining Stack Overflow, Prashanth held a range of senior leadership roles at Rackspace including Senior Vice President & General Manager of Rackspace’s high growth, global business focused on the world’s leading Public Clouds.

He holds an MBA from Harvard Business School, an M.Eng in Engineering Management from Cornell University and a B.S. in Computer Engineering (summa cum laude) from the University of Maine.

Jody Bailey is the Chief Product & Technology Officer at Stack Overflow, leading our Product Management, Product Innovation, User Experience, Product Engineering, Platform Engineering, InfoSec, and IT teams.
Prior to Stack Overflow, Jody spent the last eight years of his nearly 30-year career in tech leading EdTech software development teams. Most recently, Jody served as a senior product development leader at AWS, where he led the Product Management, User Experience, and Engineering teams responsible for new self-paced learning experiences for AWS customers. Prior to AWS, he was the Chief Technology Officer at Pluralsight where he grew the development team by 10X and transformed the product into an industry-leading enterprise SaaS learning offering.
Jody is married and has three children. Outside of work Jody enjoys spending time with his family, traveling, mountain bike racing, sailing and listening to live music.
speakers.tagline: Chief Product & Technology Officer at Stack Overflow

sessions.title: Docker network without Docker
sessions.description:
Ever forgotten to add a port forwarding rule in Docker? Annoying to restart the container, right? But how does port forwarding between a container and a host even work? What about container-to-container communication, and what exactly are virtual Ethernet bridges? Wait, how do cgroups and namespaces relate to all this?

Let’s continue my "Docker * without Docker" series and dive into the depths of Docker networking - without worrying too much about Docker itself. What does Linux offer? How can we build something like this from scratch? Maybe even directly in the terminal?

Join me for a hands-on exploration of the fundamentals and exciting details behind container networking!

speakers.bio: I've been a software developer at heart for twelve years and am interested in everything related to software development, like containerization and orchestration, machine learning, security, and the cloud. I work as an Associate Manager @ Accenture in Munich, Germany. I love fishing, Microsoft Flight Simulator, and TikTok.

sessions.title: From Painful to Easy: Discover .NET Aspire
sessions.description: Have you ever struggled with complex applications composed of multiple deployable components? Dealing with countless dependencies on other services and infrastructures like Redis, relational or non-relational databases, messaging systems and others can be overwhelming. I used to believe that setting up these intricate apps locally and deploying them was a painful ordeal. But that was before I discovered .NET Aspire. Now, I find the entire process surprisingly easy. I understand some of you might be skeptical, but today, I aim to convince you otherwise.

speakers.bio:
I am a Software Engineer at TBC Bank, specializing in authentication systems. For over three years, I've driven innovation and ensured top-tier platform performance to deliver seamless, secure user experiences. 

In addition to my role at TBC, I am passionate about education. Since September 2024, I have been serving as a Lecturer at Edutech Academy, sharing my knowledge and expertise with aspiring developers. Previously, from May to July 2023, I taught at TBC IT Academy.

Earlier, as a Quality Assurance Engineer at Vabaco (2019–2021), I built a foundation in software quality.

sessions.title: Test-Driven Development: It's easier than you think!
sessions.description:
Everyone loves writing tests, don’t they? How do you write good tests? What tools are available for you to write good tests?
In this session, I will give a whirlwind introduction into the many features of Quarkus that help developers write good tests. I will highlight some of the features of Quarkus, Dev Services and Continuous Testing, which help make testing easier. Additionally, I will live code some tests for common use cases developers encounter, including unit, integration, and “black box” testing. I will discuss techniques such as mocking, spying, and interaction-based testing/verification.
I'll even spend some time showing how IDE-based AI assistants can help!
Once you see how easy TDD really can be there isn't a reason to not do it!

speakers.bio: Eric Deandrea is a Java Champion & Senior Principal Developer Advocate at Red Hat, focusing on application development technologies. Eric has over 25 years of experience designing and building Java-based solutions and developer training programs. He is a contributor to various OSS projects, including Quarkus, Spring, LangChain4j, WireMock, and Microcks, as well as a speaker at many public events and user groups around the world. Eric recently put his Quarkus and Spring knowledge to use by publishing his first book, “Quarkus for Spring Developers (https://red.ht/quarkus-spring-devs).”
speakers.tagline: Senior Principal Developer Advocate at Red Hat

sessions.title: Hello JARVIS - Building Voice Interfaces for Your LLMS
sessions.description:
Movies have promised the future where we can talk to AI Assistants with natural language and have them respond with all the nuances of humans. However for years we've been stuck with really "stupid" AI experiences over voice. With the advent of LLMS this is finally a reality! 

Lots of different technologies have come together to create amazing audio experiences. However, there are some technical problems that we need to solve. In this talk we will learn how to chain these technologies, solve some of the common problems and build a new JARVIS together, powered by the LLM of your choice.

speakers.bio: Nathaniel is a Developer Evangelist at Twilio working to create magical moments for developers with their products. His life goals are to have Batman's brains, Deadpool's humour, T'Challa's fashion sense, Killmonger's Wokeness, and Thanos' determination! He serves the Javascript community in the UK and the rest of Europe

sessions.title: Node.js: More Threads Than You Think
sessions.description:
Node.js was announced in 2009 as a single-threaded JavaScript runtime. In 2018, it became multi-threaded, and no one noticed.

What can worker_threads do? What are they useful for? What's the best way of communicating between two threads? How can you leverage multi-threading to improve the performance of your application? How can we make a thread wait for another?

In this session, we will cover the key Node.js APIs and then discuss some useful techniques and ecosystem modules that you can start using today.

speakers.bio: Matteo is the Co-Founder and CTO of Platformatic.dev. He is also a prolific Open Source author in the JavaScript ecosystem and modules he maintain are downloaded more than 30 billion times a year. Matteo is a member of the Node.js Technical Steering Committee focusing on streams, diagnostics and http. He is also the author of the fast logger Pino and of the Fastify web framework. Matteo is an renowed international speaker after more than 60 conferences, including OpenJS World, Node.js Interactive, NodeConf.eu, NodeSummit, JSConf.Asia, WebRebels, and JsDay just to name a few.

sessions.title: The Dependency Cookbook - Recipes for Micro Frontend success
sessions.description:
As organizations increasingly adopt Micro Frontends, the management of shared dependencies becomes critical to their success. In this presentation, we will explore the "recipes" necessary for effectively handling these dependencies, ensuring that your Micro Frontend architecture remains robust and efficient.

We will address the common challenges faced when sharing libraries across teams, such as maintaining minimal bundle sizes, ensuring backward compatibility, and avoiding runtime errors due to incompatible library versions. By examining the foundational technologies and existing solutions, we will provide a comprehensive analysis of their strengths and weaknesses.

Join us to discover practical strategies and best practices that will help you maintain consistency across your Micro Frontends while reducing loading times, ultimately serving up a delightful user experience.

speakers.bio: Lucas studied computer science at TU Dresden. He began his journey into the world of technology by writing his first website in the 9th grade, and since then, he has never lost his fascination for the topic. Currently, Lucas serves as a Software Architect at ZEISS Digital Innovation. Recently, he has taken on the role of leading an engineering design team that is dedicated to utilizing Micro Frontend architecture to enhance the efficiency of healthcare digitization.
speakers.tagline: Software Architect at ZEISS Digital Innovation

speakers.bio: Stefan is a software architect at ZEISS Digital Innovation in Berlin and has worked on various Angular projects in different industries throughout his career. He loves experimenting with new technologies and sharing his knowledge by speaking at conferences and contributing at community events. Recently, he has been leading an engineering design team focused on leveraging micro frontend architecture for performant healthcare digitization.
speakers.tagline: Software Architect at ZEISS Digital Innovation

sessions.title: The Four Horsemen of the Information Apocalypse: Taming the Wild West of Information Overload
sessions.description:
Prepare yourself for a whirlwind tour through the chaotic landscape of today's information overload! In this talk we'll step into the realm of the Four Horsemen wreaking havoc on our digital lives: Misinformation, Disinformation, Malinformation, and Noninformation.

We'll start with uncovering how propaganda and rumour mills of yesteryears have evolved into today's sophisticated, AI-powered info-wars. From the rise of the internet and social media to the shocking realities of deepfakes and bot armies, we'll explore how these modern plagues are accelerating faster than ever.

But it’s not all doom and gloom, as we’ll also look at the heroes fighting back—fact-checkers, innovative tech solutions, and the critical thinkers (and how we can become one). Join us for an eye-opening journey through the highs and lows of our information age, and discover how we can all play a part in taming these four threats to reality.

speakers.bio:
A lifelong technologist, having started coding at the age of six, Jeff has been in the industry for over 25 years. He has a love for CyberSecurity and AI, especially the human elements of both subjects. Working for a consultancy, he's seen the world change to be product- and service-oriented, and bangs the drum for ensuring that everybody is involved in delivering secure and usable offerings.

Publications include:
* Wired
* Forbes
* Raconteur
* IT Pro
* Business Cloud
* Information Age

sessions.title: Business Strategies for Scaling European Tech

speakers.bio: Anastasia Zemskova is VP of Strategy at JetBrains, driving change and leading company-wide initiatives across product, AI transformation, and go-to-market. With a humanities background and deep experience in tech, she bridges people, systems, and innovation—especially in times of disruption. Previously, she was a founding team member and CMO at Nebius, Europe’s largest AI infrastructure platform, where she led global product strategy, GTM, and strategic communications through a $700M raise backed by NVIDIA and a Nasdaq IPO.

Vuyiswa's professional journey began as an Analyst at Andersen Business Consulting, where she worked on customer and channel solutions. She then joined The Advantage Group's Pricing Solutions Division, developing expertise in pricing research and strategy. Her career accelerated at SAP, where she rose to become Global Chief Product Strategist, directly supporting the Executive Board. Later, as Senior Vice President within SAP's Services and Support organization, she led transformative initiatives in sales, customer success, and digital transformation.
Today, Vuyiswa serves as the CEO of bloon GmbH, an AI-powered no-code software development platform. She also runs her own consultancy, has cofounded a cosmetic line Magalie & Me, and is an active investor, applying her diverse expertise across multiple entrepreneurial and business ventures.
Vuyiswa's professional foundation was built on strong academic credentials, earning an HBA from the Richard Ivey School of Business, an MBA from WHUOtto Beisheim School of Management, and a Postgraduate Certificate from Stanford University.

Entrepreneur, Investor & Social entrepreneur Starting his entrepreneurial journey out of Israel 25 years ago, Gilli has co-founded 6 startups and helped build many others. During the past 20 years he has been working with clients from various sectors in Western Europe, helping them innovate & build their digital future. Leveraging his exposure to hundreds of Israeli startups each year, Gilli started angel investments resulting in several exits so far. 7 years ago, he moved from angel investments to VC investments by founding Direct Round VC, together with several European Limited Partners. 
Direct Round focuses on early-stage investments in great Israeli entrepreneurs building technology intensive startups. Investment strategy prioritizes startups with the potential to create new market categories.

Nikola is a seasoned innovation leader with a global footprint in the tech ecosystem. From UN field offices in Africa to Tokyo boardrooms focusing on technology and development initiatives. Transitioning to the private sector, he exited his own startup and then led startup and investor relations at Nikkei, one of leading business media groups globally. Later, as Director of Startups and Developer Experience at Infobip, Croatia's first tech unicorn, Nikola has launched a global startup program engaging with thousands of startups from over 120 countries. He has been living in Japan for over a decade now, but he also lived in the US and Tanzania after studying in Italy, the UK and Switzerland.

sessions.title: Transforming Developer Experience: Lessons from Building a Platform Team
sessions.description:
Creating a superior developer experience is key to motivating and streamlining engineering teams, serving as a strategic pillar for business success. Focus areas include optimizing workflow, reducing cognitive load, and establishing efficient feedback loops. As technology grows more complex, achieving these becomes increasingly challenging.

A dedicated Developer Experience (DevEx) team can significantly impact, especially in expanding organizations. In this talk, I’ll share our journey from 2021 to 2023 in founding and running a DevEx team within a hypergrowth startup. You’ll learn about our team member selection, building a high-performing group, and prioritizing impactful tasks.

We’ll also discuss our collaboration with other departments, address our challenges and mistakes, and share key lessons learned. By the end, you'll gain actionable strategies to empower your DevEx team, drive change, and enhance employee satisfaction, productivity, and business success.

speakers.bio: Tobi is an experienced consultant, coach, and mentor for engineering leadership, developer experience and software craft. He was the driving force behind the developer experience team at BRYTER, leading the successful transition to continuous deployment. He is dedicated to helping software companies build high-performing engineering organizations and teams, leveraging his expertise in engineering leadership and developer experience. With an inherent passion for software craft, Tobi is committed to enabling companies and individuals to create software excellently and joyfully.
speakers.tagline: CTO & Co-Founder of Tech Unicorn Builders

sessions.title: Successful talent development in tech: A joint journey of executives and talents
sessions.description: Many companies are undergoing a generational change. This is the best time to build and promote talent. And for employees, it's a great opportunity to be seen and supported. What organizational conditions and structures can a company provide to identify and develop talent? How can executives recognize talent early on and plan and support their authentic, strength-oriented development? And how can employees contribute to being seen and supported by executives? In this talk Tabitha will share her insights from a company and leadership perspective, Vanessa and Alex will add the talent perspective and Stefan will share learnings from his career path from crafting software to leading tech teams. His key challenge was to find a way to build great stuff and manage great staff at the same time.

speakers.bio: Stefan joined Finanz Informatik back in 2006 as part of his dual studies. He has worked in various areas of software development – from technical support for software development tools to developing banking applications. As Senior Manager, Stefan is now responsible for the development of the process and application landscape for consumer loans at Finanz Informatik. As the person responsible for architecture in the business unit, he is still close to the source code of the applications.
speakers.tagline: Business Unit Lead Application Development at Finanz Informatik

speakers.bio:
Tabitha Kleine is responsible for developing all kinds of lending business applications at Finanz Informatik, the central IT Partner for the Sparkasse Finance Group.
Together with her team, she works on designing the simplest and most secure solutions possible for the savings banks' lending business.
She also coordinates all AI initiatives within application development with a focus on the further development of digitalization and efficiency gains.
speakers.tagline: Business Unit Manager Software Development at Finanz Informatik

speakers.bio:
Alexander Weisshaupt has been working as a Business Analyst at Finanz Informatik for 10 years.
Together with a team of developers, subject matter experts, and other colleagues, he develops software in the field of personal loan processes for the German Sparkassen (Savings Banks) Finance Group and their 50 million customers. As part of project work, he closely collaborates with associations, savings banks, and the relevant committees.
In his private life, he dedicates his time to his family and, when time permits, to his home server—while also trying to stay fit.

Vanessa Zellien is a passionate Learning & Community Expert at Finanz Informatik, specializing in user-centered collaboration, agile methods, and creative facilitation techniques. With a strong background in digital transformation and strategic development, she inspires others through a bold and connected approach to work. Vanessa brings energy, empathy, and innovation to every interaction—empowering teams to grow and thrive together.
speakers.tagline: Learning & Community Expert at Finanz Informatik

sessions.title: Hiring for the Future: AI, Human Judgment, and the War for Top Tech Talent
sessions.description:
As AI continues to reshape industries, its role in hiring and talent acquisition is becoming more prominent. Organizations are turning to AI-powered solutions to streamline recruitment, improve efficiency, and identify high-potential candidates. But can AI truly replace human intuition and decision-making? What happens to the candidate experience when algorithms take over key hiring functions? And how can companies leverage AI without sacrificing authenticity, employer brand, or fairness in hiring?

This session dives deep into the evolving landscape of AI-assisted hiring, exploring how technology is transforming talent acquisition and where human judgment remains essential. With tech talent in higher demand than ever, organizations must find the right balance between automation and the human touch to win the war for top talent. Through case studies, insights, and best practices, we’ll examine what’s working, what’s not, and what the future holds.

speakers.bio: Tatjana Obenaus (M.A.) is an award-winning brand marketing professional specializing in employer branding and recruitment marketing. With 12+ years of experience at brands like Booking.com, Nike, and Miro, she blends brand marketing and people communications to craft compelling employer brands. She is the Founder & Senior Consultant at TBO – Employer Brand Consulting. Based in Amsterdam with her husband and two sons, she enjoys traveling, yoga, and cycling.
speakers.tagline: Global Head of Employer Brand at Prosus Group

sessions.title: From Monolith to Magic: An AI-Powered DevOps Workshop
sessions.description:
Tired of the slow, manual grind of modernizing applications? What if you could containerize, deploy, refactor, and add powerful new AI features with seamless automation?

For all the DevOps gurus, we'll roll up our sleeves and tame the beast. You'll get hands-on experience containerizing a legacy app with Docker, deploying it to the serverless bliss of Google Cloud Run, and building a rock-solid, fully automated CI/CD pipeline. We'll even use Gemini to help us refactor and clean up our code, because who doesn't love AI-powered code reviews? 

And for the AI adventurers, we'll unleash the power of Generative AI by building an event-driven function that uses the Gemini Vision model to automatically analyze images the moment they're uploaded. The secret sauce? A Cloud Run file mount that makes our AI integration seamless, powerful, and cool. 

In this practical lab you'll leave with a deployed, AI-enhanced application and the skills to automate and innovate in your own work.

speakers.bio:
Riccardo loves caipirinhas and 🍷 Amarone, playing 🎹 piano and 🏊🏻🚴🏿🏃‍♀️ triathlons; he's been passionate about Mathematics since he was 4. He's still in love with Ruby and Rails.

Former network administrator, sysadmin, and Ruby on Rails developer, Riccardo has been in operations for 20+ years and still likes to spend time coding (better if Ruby). He loves engaging with customers and helping them run their operations reliably and successfully in the cloud.

sessions.title: From Chaos to Control: GitOps Workflows Using ArgoCD
sessions.description:
Running apps on Kubernetes is powerful  — but managing those deployments can quickly get messy. As your setup grows, keeping everything consistent, trackable, and easy to roll back becomes a challenge. In this hands-on workshop, we’ll show how GitOps with ArgoCD can help bring order to the chaos by managing your Kubernetes deployments through Git.
We’ll kick things off with a quick intro to GitOps principles and the key features of ArgoCD. Then we’ll jump into a live, cloud-based environment where you’ll work with a real Git repo hooked up to a Kubernetes cluster. Together, we’ll explore how Git-based workflows and ArgoCD’s automation handle app rollouts, config updates, drift detection, and self-healing. You’ll push pull requests, watch ArgoCD sync changes in real time, and see what a solid GitOps setup looks like in action.
Expect to leave with practical experience you can take straight to production.

speakers.bio: Alexander is an experienced, AWS-certified cloud architect with 8 years of professional experience in planning and implementing cloud solutions on AWS, Azure and Open Telekom Cloud. He has extensive knowledge in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Pulumi, Ansible), container orchestration (Kubernetes, Docker) and CI/CD (GitLab, Jenkins, Azure DevOps). He also has experience in cloud security, identity management, test automation and monitoring. With his analytical mindset and practice-orientated approach, he supports companies in scaling, automating and securing their cloud architectures.

Emanuel is an experienced platform engineer who, since completing his training as an IT specialist for system integration, has worked for a year as an IT administrator in the cloud environment and then spent 7 years as a DevOps engineer, supporting frontend and backend developers. During his years as a DevOps engineer and network administrator, he gained experience in network technology, cloud infrastructure and firewalls. His main focus is on Kubernetes, cloud, network technology, CI/CD and server administration

IT professional with 20 years of experience — from nerdy programmer to architect to manager. I love building impactful solutions with passionate people and pushing the boundaries of what's possible (and sometimes what's not). Always happy to connect with like-minded.

sessions.title: The Open Future of AI: Beyond Open Weights
sessions.description:
Matt White, Executive Director of the PyTorch Foundation and GM of AI at the Linux Foundation, will discuss the evolving landscape of open source AI, distinguishing between open weights models like Llama and permissive open models such as DeepSeek-r2 and Granite. He will examine how the Model Openness Framework and OpenMDW license are reshaping AI development, enabling genuine collaboration while ensuring permissive usage of open models.

The talk will cover the implications of the EU AI Act on open source development, practical challenges in model governance, and emerging opportunities for developers. It will explore how organizations can leverage different types of open models effectively, from fine-tuning to full model development.

Attendees will learn how the open source AI ecosystem is evolving beyond just open weights, and gain practical insights for incorporating these models into their projects while navigating regulatory requirements and ethical considerations.

speakers.bio: Matt White is the Executive Director of the PyTorch Foundation and GM of AI at the Linux Foundation. He is also the Director of the Generative AI Commons. Matt has nearly 30 years of experience in applied research and standards in AI and data in telecom, media and gaming industries. Matt is the Co-founder and Chair of the Open Metaverse Foundation at the Linux Foundation. He also runs the Silicon Valley Generative AI paper reading group and is a co-organizer at the GenAI Collective.
speakers.tagline: General Manager of AI at Linux Foundation

sessions.title: From Mainframe to Modular: The Developer’s Guide to Legacy Modernization
sessions.description: Modernizing legacy systems is one of the toughest – and most rewarding – challenges in enterprise IT. In this session, Jannis, Lars, Hergy and Kritika share how they are transforming mission-critical legacy systems and mainframe applications to a modern state of the art banking platform for the German Sparkasse Finance Group and their 50 million customers. From COBOL to Java, from monolithic mainframes to shared services and cloud-native architectures – we explore different modernization strategies and where the mainframe still makes sense. A special focus lies on empowering developers: by automating routine tasks and improving the developer experience, we enable teams to shape the future, not just maintain the past.

speakers.bio: Hergy Fongue is a Lead Developer at Finanz Informatik, the central IT service provider of the German Savings Banks Finance Group. He plays a key role in the transformation of the central data warehouse from mainframe-based infrastructure to a modern, decentralized architecture. His focus lies on building core components for business-rule-driven data correction and an open interface that enables Sparkassen to enrich their local data warehouses. This involves ensuring both the semantic integrity of data and the flexible processing of individual records as well as large files.

Jannis Eickenroth has been working for Finanz Informatik (FI) since 2014 and currently leads the department responsible for the Data & Analytics Platform.

In the early years, Jannis was involved both in backend development on the mainframe and in Java development for frontends and middleware on client/server systems. Over time, he took on the role of project manager and played a key part in introducing new software technologies for OSPlus—the core banking system used by the savings banks.

Now, Jannis supports a fantastic team at FI, working to ensure that Finanz Informatik’s technical ecosystem for data, analytics, and AI is secure and modern, ready for the future.

Outside of work, Jannis enjoys spending time on his mountain bike.
speakers.tagline: Head of Analytics and Customer Engagement at Finanz Informatik

speakers.bio: Lars Reichert is Head of Sales Management at Finanz Informatik, the central IT service provider of the German Savings Banks Finance Group. He and his team are responsible for applications supporting Sparkassen sales planning, cost accounting, and pre-/post-calculations in customer business. In addition, his area oversees the central data warehouse for all sales-related data. Since taking on this role at the end of 2023, he has been leading the modernization of the application architecture—transforming it from centralized mainframe systems to scalable, decentralized components.
speakers.tagline: Head of Sales Management Solutions at Finanz Informatik

sessions.title: Cross-Platform Browser Extensions: Building AI-Powered Personalized New Tab Experiences
sessions.description: Discover how to create a cross-platform browser extension that redefines the new tab experience with AI-powered personalization. This workshop will guide participants through building a dynamic, feature-rich browser extension compatible with Chrome, Firefox, and Edge. Learn to integrate OpenAI’s GPT or Gemini for personalized widgets like task organizers, curated news feeds, and habit trackers. The session will include live coding and cover challenges in cross-platform compatibility, AI integration, and publishing extensions at scale. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced developer, you'll leave with practical skills and actionable insights to enhance user engagement and deploy impactful solutions.

speakers.bio: Software Development Head specializing in browser extensions, scalable web architectures, and cloud technologies. CTO, Applications Engineering Manager, and co-founder of a software solutions company delivering 37 projects across various industries. A seasoned speaker at events like the International JavaScript Conference, Lisbon JS, React Berlin, and GitNation conferences, I deliver engaging talks on React, metaframeworks, and cross-platform solutions. Passionate about innovation, I excel in leading teams and bridging technology with business strategy.
speakers.tagline: Software Development Head at Soki AG

sessions.title: Hands-On MCP: Building AI-Connected Tools
sessions.description:
Dive into the future of AI integration with this workshop on the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Designed for developers eager to enhance AI capabilities, this session offers a practical introduction to MCP’s architecture and its seamless integration with Claude. Through a hands-on project, you’ll build a weather data retrieval tool, empowering Claude to access real-time weather information via a web API.

By the end of this workshop, you’ll have a functional MCP server integrated with Claude, capable of fetching and delivering weather data in real-time. This experience will equip you with the skills to develop AI-connected tools that enhance user interactions and data accessibility.

speakers.bio: Patrick Schnell is a distinguished computer scientist and acclaimed author specializing in the integration of AI into software development and business-processes. With a solid foundation in computer science, Patrick has dedicated his career to exploring the transformative potential of AI and Large Language Models (LLMs) within the software industry.

sessions.title: How to sabotage your software development with agile? – 10 pro tips for guaranteed success
sessions.description: 21 years after the development of the Manifesto for Agile Software Development, which originally aimed to bring software development back into the spotlight, we shifted focus once again. Nowadays, the software development industry is saturated with agile practices and methodologies. Instead of inventing exotic meeting structures and distracting developers with excessive synchronization, it’s time to revert to the basic principles that uncover the real potential of agile software development. This approach enables economies of speed, reduces uncertainty and drives innovation. If however you just aim to follow the newest trends and inventions of the agile industry we offer 10 fool-proof and entertaining strategies to follow that totally screw up your software development. We strive to reveal agile overhead and reduce agile practices to the essentials in order to bring the art of agile software development back into focus.

speakers.bio:
Marlene Roth is responsible for the Enterprise and Software Architecture and at Lufthansa Technik. She strives to make software engineering a cutting-edge capability of organizations.
In her current role, she drives the digital Transformation of Lufthansa Technik by leveraging Conway’s Law and combining state-of-the-art architectures and technologies with effective team topologies. 
Marlene is passionate about software engineering strategy, Big Tech and lifting heavy weights.

Tobias is responsible for IT and related services for Aircraft Maintenance and Digital Fleet Solutions at Lufthansa Technik.

He strives with his team to drive the company's digital transformation and to make Lufthansa Technik a software company. In this endeavor, he works on building, growing, and scaling a software engineering organization based on state-of-the-art technologies, lightweight architectures, and agile team topologies.

In doing so, he can rely on his broad experience in various tech leadership positions covering various tech functions, from operations to engineering and development to strategy.

Besides his professional activities, he is passionate about combining his fascination for sports and traveling by visiting football matches around the globe.
speakers.tagline: Senior Director IT Aircraft Maintenance and Digital Fleet Solutions at Lufthansa Technik

sessions.title: From Job Titles to Skill Signals: How AI Reinvents Talent Matching
sessions.description: In today’s dynamic job market, roles evolve faster than resumes. Laurens Waling presents how AI can detect, predict, and match skills based on fragmented data—enabling organizations to look beyond outdated job titles. Drawing from real-world use cases in both corporate and public sectors, he demonstrates how AI-powered skills matching increases internal mobility, identifies untapped talent, and supports data-driven workforce planning. This talk shows how explainable AI can make matching processes more inclusive, transparent, and efficient. Laurens shares insights from leading implementations, discusses ethical challenges, and invites the audience to reflect on how HR can evolve into a skills-first function. Expect a practical, visionary session with interactive elements—built to inspire action, not just awareness.

speakers.bio: Laurens Waling is an expert on AI-driven talent matching and skills-based workforce transformation. With a background in technology, policy, and behavioral science, he speaks across Europe about the future of work, responsible AI, and skills-based strategies in HR and beyond.

sessions.title: Composable Intelligence: How Henkel and Microsoft Are Shaping the Agent Ecosystem
sessions.description: Henkel is adopting AI and agent-based systems to enhance internal operations and customer experiences. With its RAQN platform, Henkel explores use cases like product recommendations and customer care. In this presentation the joint team will share their learnings on building composable, cloud-native architecture and for building agents powered by open source technology on Azure.

speakers.bio: Dennis Zielke is a Cloud Native AI Architect at Microsoft where he drives strategic customer engagements across roles, industries, and domains to envision, design, and implement end-to-end solution architectures leveraging the Microsoft product portfolio. He collaborates with field teams and product engineering to design agentic workforces, build real-time user experiences, and modernize data platforms and services to ensure business outcomes and customer value.
speakers.tagline: CTO Customer Success, Lead Architect at Microsoft

speakers.bio:
Meet Manuel Schettler, a technology leader with a strong focus on innovation and problem-solving. Since 2024, he has been the Head of Software Center of Excellence and AI Agent Engineering at Henkel, where he works on advancing software practices for AI agents. Previously, he served as Head of Integration at Henkel and DATEV eG, where he focused on collaboration and integration strategies, and as a Senior Technical Architect at GfK, contributing to the digital landscape.
With a background in software architecture, Manuel is interested in how technology can enhance business outcomes. At this conference, he looks forward to discussing the future how AI agents can be engineered and their business impact for Henkel.
speakers.tagline: Head of Software and AI Agent Engineering at Henkel AG & CoKg.

sessions.title: Thriving Is a Feature, Not a Bug: Wellbeing for the Future of Work
sessions.description:
What if wellbeing wasn’t a perk—but a product feature?
In today’s fast-moving world of work, thriving employees aren’t a luxury—they’re a strategic advantage. Based on insights from Indeed’s global Work Wellbeing research, this session unpacks why wellbeing is the single biggest predictor of retention and how it fuels engagement, innovation, and long-term performance.

Spoiler: When people thrive, businesses do too. Let’s stop treating burnout like a badge of honor—and start creating work that actually works.

speakers.bio: Ute Neher is Principal Talent Intelligence at Indeed, driving innovation at the intersection of data, inclusion, and HR strategy. She empowers leaders to reimagine hiring through skill-based approaches and responsible AI. With a strong voice in the HR community and as a Queb board member, Ute challenges the status quo and champions better work for all—globally and locally.

sessions.title: How AI Models Get Smarter
sessions.description: In this beginner-friendly talk, we’ll explore the scaling laws that explain how AI performance improves as we scale up compute. You’ll learn how models are pre-trained and why bigger models often deliver better results. You will understand why developers and researchers use techniques like fine-tuning and distillation to optimize model performance and why reasoning models continue to push performance even further. What does this mean for developers building real AI applications? No advanced math required — just curiosity and a desire to understand the next generation of AI models.

speakers.bio:
Ankit Patel is a Senior Director at NVIDIA, leading developer engagement for the company’s extensive collection of libraries, developer tools, and ecosystem software. Ankit joined NVIDIA in 2011 as a GPU Product Manager helping pioneer GPU-accelerated virtual machines, and pushed the boundaries of server GPUs, including NVIDIA's early 8-GPU server appliance. His career transitioned to software, notably leading product management for NVIDIA's OptiX library for ray tracing and AI denoising, a key development that leveraged RT Cores and deepened his connection to deep learning. Prior to NVIDIA, he held product management roles at Matrox Video and Blackmagic Design. Working on full systems for over two decades has given him perspective and expertise at the intersection of silicon and software. Ankit holds a Bachelor's in Computer Science from Concordia University and an MBA from Cornell University and serves on the PyTorch Governing Board.


Ankit Patel is a Senior Director at NVIDIA, leading developer engagement for the company’s ecosystem of libraries, compilers and developer tools. Ankit joined NVIDIA in 2011 as a GPU Product Manager helping pioneer GPU-accelerated virtual machines, and pushed the boundaries of server GPUs, including NVIDIA's early 8-GPU server appliance. His career transitioned to software, notably leading product management for NVIDIA's OptiX library for ray tracing and AI denoising, a key development that leveraged RT Cores and deepened his connection to deep learning. Prior to NVIDIA, he held product management roles at Matrox Video and Blackmagic Design. Working on full systems for over two decades has given him perspective and expertise at the intersection of silicon and software. Ankit holds a Bachelor's in Computer Science from Concordia University, an MBA from Cornell University and currently serves on the PyTorch Governing Board.
speakers.tagline: Senior Director Developer Marketing at NVIDIA

sessions.title: IP Authentication: A Tale of Performance Pitfalls and Challenges in Prod
sessions.description:
I explore our journey with IP-based authentication as part of a major re-engineering of our authentication methods. I will focus on the inherent performance challenges and unexpected issues we encountered... in production. I will talk about why IP authentication, despite its initial appeal, is a problematic solution in practice.

- The fundamental flaw
- Performance implications of constant IP checks
- Production rollout tale: Massive error rates (>30k/hour)
- Root cause analysis: Unexpected impact of cookieless crawlers
- Lessons learned

I will offer insights for engineers considering IP authentication (don't do it). I will discuss how the requirement for constant IP checking creates a performance bottleneck, and how seemingly minor factors like crawler behavior and old clients can significantly impact system stability. I will also talk about our production fuckups and how we tried to find out if our customers really had a problem or if this was just a storm in the waterglas.

speakers.bio: Christoph is an experienced Engineering Manager with a rich background as a Ruby on Rails full-stack engineer, specializing in backend technologies and Linux based (cloud) infrastructure. Over the past 8 years, he has led diverse product and architecture teams, guiding them through complex challenges and almost always came up with solutions.

sessions.title: AI'll Be Back: Generative AI in Image, Video, and Audio Production
sessions.description:
This talk introduces the world of generative AI, focusing on Text-to-Image, Text-to-Audio, and Text-to-Video technologies for creating images, music, and videos. We explore how neural networks use diffusion models and Transformer architectures to generate outputs from short text prompts. Highlighting tools like Sora and Midjourney, we delve into techniques like Latent Diffusion Models, which combine text understanding with denoising processes to create and edit media.

A detailed look at video generation with Sora illustrates how it compresses and reconstructs visual data into final videos. We also discuss alternatives like RunwayML and SunoAI to showcase a wide range of tools for image, audio, and video generation.

By the end of this talk, you’ll gain a foundational understanding of diffusion models, an overview of generation tools, and insights into their functionality. Practical demos will provide hands-on examples throughout the presentation.

speakers.bio: Fabian Pottbäcker is a software consultant at TNG Technology Consulting GmbH in Berlin. He currently focuses on backend development, mainly using Python. Besides customer projects, he also works on the integration of self-hosted AI models into development environments. In the past, he has also been involved in computer graphics, information visualization and image stylization. Moreover, he has also participated in competitions in competitive programming, for example the NWERC. Last but not least, he is also passionate about passing on knowledge, for instance in interactive events for students.
speakers.tagline: Software Consultant at TNG Technology Consulting

speakers.bio: Thomas Endres is a Managing Partner for TNG Technology Consulting in Munich. Besides his normal work for the company and the management of the customers he is creating various prototypes, he and the the Innovation Hacking Team develop various prototypes, including an Augmented Reality application that displays the world from an artist's perspective, real-time deepfakes, or an AI for generating presentations. He works on applications in the field of AR/VR, AI, and gesture control to e.g. autonomously fly quadcopters or control them without physical contact.
speakers.tagline: Managing Partner at TNG Technology Consulting

speakers.bio: Martin Förtsch studied computer sciences and is an IT consultant at TNG Technology Consulting GmbH, specialized in Agile Software Development, primarily in Java, Search Engine Technologies, and Databases. Recognized as an Intel Software Innovator and Intel Black Belt Developer, he contributes to innovative tech-demos in areas like 3D camera technologies, IoT, and AI. Martin frequently speaks at national and international conferences, sharing insights on cutting-edge technology. He's an Oracle JavaOne Rockstar awardee, underscoring his contributions to the tech field.
speakers.tagline: Principal Consultant at TNG Technology Consulting GmbH

sessions.title: In-depth .NET Azure Functions: Flex plan, Isolated mode and performance
sessions.description:
Azure functions are fun and still evolving fast, so this talk will bring you an in-depth review of the latest updates, including the FlexConsumption plan and the performance of functions in Isolated mode, along with considerations for choosing the right stack and service plan in 2025.

Key-topics
- Consumption plan pros and cons with performance analysis and load testing results of .NET functions
- Isolated process nuances and challenges compared to in-process
- Optimizations for .NET Functions and AoT compilation 
- Evolution of Function apps through containerization and DAPR

Join this talk to learn about the nitty-gritty details of building advanced Azure Functions apps, see a lot of code, and encounter possible issues.

speakers.bio: Stas Lebedenko is a full-stack cloud architect and platform engineer at Solidify AB. He is also a co-organizer of the Odesa Microsoft. NET User Group, a speaker and author, and an active member of the international and Ukraine .NET/Azure/Operations communities. He has been building and designing software for the last twenty years and has been the Microsoft Azure Most Valuable Professional since 2020.

sessions.title: Possibilities with Web Capabilities
sessions.description:
The web platform keeps evolving, and with it comes a new wave of capabilities that blur the lines between web and native applications. Project Fugu, a collaborative effort by Google, Microsoft, and Intel, aims to expand the web’s capabilities by introducing powerful APIs that enable developers to create more feature-rich and performant web applications.

This session will explore how these innovations transform the web development landscape. Attendees will gain insights into APIs such as File System Access, Web Share, and Web Bluetooth. Through practical examples and real-world use cases, participants will learn how to leverage these new capabilities to build next-generation web applications that offer seamless user experiences and enhanced functionality.

speakers.bio: Rowdy Rabouw is a Google Developer Expert in Web Technologies with over 25 years of experience in HTML, CSS and JavaScript. Currently, he works as a Front-End-Focused Senior DevOps Engineer on Vue, Node and NestJS projects, paying special attention to usability and accessibility. Rowdy loves his electronic drum kit and dabbles in creating music on his laptop.

sessions.title: Keycloak case study: Making users happy with service level indicators and observability
sessions.description:
Authenticating users can start simple with a username and a password for each user. But you will also need to handle forgotten passwords and user registration. You might also want to validate email addresses, add second factors and have users update their profile information as needed.
A single-sign-on system like Keycloak can handle all that for you and will redirect users after they are authenticated to your applications.
See how you can delegate authentication by leveraging features of OpenID Connect. We will start simple and enable more and more features in our demo to show the functionality and flexibility of Keycloak. We will also look at features of the latest release and the road map ahead.

speakers.bio: Alexander Schwartz is a Principal Software Engineer at Red Hat working full time as a Keycloak maintainer and technical team lead. At work and in his spare time he codes for Open Source projects. In previous jobs he worked as a software architect and IT consultant. At conferences and user groups he talks about JavaScript front ends, Java back ends, Kubernetes and single-sign-on with Keycloak.
speakers.tagline: Principal Software Engineer at Red Hat

sessions.title: AI-Augmented DevOps with Platform Engineering
sessions.description:
In this talk, we dive into how AI is reshaping the landscape of DevOps and platform engineering. We’ll showcase how AI can automate workflows, enhance efficiency, and fuel innovation in software development, offering attendees practical insights into integrating AI effectively.

Key highlights include:

- DevOps and Platform Engineering Foundations: Brief overview of how these principles work together.
- Value Stream Mapping for Bottleneck Detection: How AI helps pinpoint and address inefficiencies.
- AI-Augmented DevOps: Real-world examples of AI driving smarter automation in DevOps.
- Strategic AI Integration: Proven strategies for embedding AI into your DevOps processes.
- Live AI Demo: A live demonstration showcasing AI tools in action.
- Challenges and Solutions: Tackling hurdles when implementing AI in DevOps workflows.
- Future Trends: What’s next for AI in the DevOps ecosystem?

speakers.bio: Romano Roth is a thought leader in DevOps and platform engineering, with over 20 years of experience. As the Global Chief of DevOps at Zühlke, he shapes global strategies for DevOps, platform engineering, and cloud solutions. He organizes the DevOps Meetup Zurich, presides over DevOps Days Zurich, and runs a YouTube channel with 200+ videos on DevOps, Platorm Engineering and leadership. Romano is also a lecturer at Lucerne University and has authored 30+ blog posts on DevOps and agile methodologies.
speakers.tagline: Global Chief of DevOps at Zühlke

sessions.title: Buy or build and what is AI Middleware
sessions.description: The technology in the field of AI is developing on a weekly basis. It is no longer about the large models of hyperscalers, but rather about which models are suitable for which processes. speeds, accuracies, context uncertainties and costs are just some of the parameters. Then there is the issue of data with high-performance RAGs that can process multimodal data. Individual processes will become sequential process steps and then autonomous processes, i.e. agents within the company. How is it possible to manage all of these topics, constantly develop them further and always rely on the right technologies? What do I do myself, what do I buy in is one of the most important questions and what is middleware anyway?

speakers.bio: Gerhard Kürner, CEO & Gründer von 506.ai. Seit den 1980er Jahren von der digitalen Welt fasziniert, entwickelte er in den 1990er Jahren die ersten Websites Österreichs und gewann den Staatspreis für Werbefilm. Nach der Gründung eines der ersten Streamingdienste war er 14 Jahre in leitenden Positionen bei voestalpine tätig und trieb die Transformation zum Technologiekonzern voran. Seit 2015 hat er mehrere Unternehmen gegründet, darunter 506.ai, eine führende Plattform für sichere und einfach integrierbare KI. Seit 2023 ist er Vizepräsident von AI Upperaustria und schreibt seit 2024 für Profil.

sessions.title: Your Testing Strategy is broken - lets fix it!
sessions.description: Testing is essential for delivering reliable software, but too often, teams fall into the trap of testing everything and testing it poorly. Endless unit tests for trivial code create a false sense of security while ignoring the areas that matter most—like how your system behaves when it really counts. This session takes a hard look at what makes a good testing strategy. Instead of chasing meaningless metrics like 100% coverage, learn how to test behaviors, focus on integration points, and embrace a leaner, smarter approach to quality assurance. Your users don’t care about how many tests you’ve written—they care about software that works. This is your guide to writing fewer tests, but better ones, that actually make a difference.

speakers.bio:
Microsoft MVP, Microsoft 365 Consultant, Power Platform Developer

Luise helps customers around the globe to improve their business processes and to get rid of everything that only keeps them busy. She is a member of the Microsoft 365 platform community (PnP) team and supports developers in extending Microsoft 365. She loves all things community, open-source, stickers, and the number 42.

sessions.title: Why (most) software projects fail silently...
sessions.description:
Software has several unique features that differentiate it from other products. It is not bound by natural laws, can be easily modified, can be replicated indefinitely, and is largely intangible. These traits create a specific kind of complexity that can make it challenging for even experienced software developers and architects to successfully manage their projects.

In this talk, we will explore how these characteristics affect different software systems, whether they are small mobile apps or large enterprise cloud solutions.

The goal of this presentation is to help everyone involved in projects gain a better understanding of each other's perspectives and to provide insights that can improve awareness of potential project risks.

speakers.bio: Hendrik Lösch is a management consultant and architect at ZEISS Digital Innovation. The focus of his work is on the development and evaluation of software, based on Microsoft technologies. He also enjoys writing and talking about his work as well as his enthusiasm for clean code, software evolution and test automation in its various forms.
speakers.tagline: Management Consultant at ZEISS Digital Solution

sessions.title: How GitHub secures open source
sessions.description:
Uncover valuable insights into how GitHub secures the open-source software we all depend on, with real-world examples from the GitHub Security Lab, which uncovered 1,000+ vulnerabilities and was credited with 700+ CVEs over four years. Securing open-source software is critical because it underpins much of today’s digital infrastructure, and vulnerabilities in widely used components can create significant risks across entire software ecosystems.

This session will provide the latest updates on how GitHub enhances various elements of the Secure Software Development Life Cycle (SSDLC), leveraging Artificial Intelligence (AI), Developer Experience (DevEx), and community collaboration to secure open source. We will explore best practices in software security, including code scanning, secrets hygiene, and automation. The audience will gain a deep understanding of industry-leading initiatives and lessons learned from our experience in today's rapidly changing landscape.

speakers.bio: Joseph is a security expert who empowers developers to ship secure software through his research and education work at the GitHub Security Lab. His recent contributions include video content with combined 1.2 million views packed with practical security tips, and the free game gh.io/securecodegame for software developers who want to build a security skillset with 6K+ players worldwide in the first year. As the speaker of 55 talks in 23 countries in the past 3 years, he captivates audiences with his insights and dynamic presentation style.

sessions.title: AI in Leadership: How Technology is Reshaping Executive Roles

speakers.bio:
Jeff Hausman is the Chief Product Development Officer (CPDO) at PagerDuty, responsible for the company’s product strategy, product management, engineering, design, and user experience of the PagerDuty Operations Cloud. Hausman joins PagerDuty from Samsara, where he was the Chief Product Officer.
Previously, Hausman served as ServiceNow Senior Vice President and General Manager of the Operations Management Portfolio - ITOM, ITAM, Security, Risk and ESG. He brings a proven track record of over 25 years leading product development as a senior executive across a wide range of products at McAfee, Symantec, Hewlett-Packard and Veritas.
Hausman received his MBA at Dartmouth’s Tuck School of Business and graduated from Claremont McKenna College with degrees in mathematics and economics.
speakers.tagline: Chief Product Development Officer at PagerDuty

speakers.bio: As Chief Information and Data Officer (CIO & CDO) at Lufthansa Cargo, Jasmin leads the IT, AI and data organization. Since joining the Lufthansa Group in 2013, she has held various leadership and expert roles, gaining extensive experience across diverse business models and IT disciplines.
