Bernd Datler is managing director of the tolling company of ASFINAG since November 2009 and CIO/CDO of the ASFINAG group. Mr. Datler is responsible for technical development and operation of the tolling systems of ASFINAG covering all highways and expressways of Austria as well as for various ITS activities within ASFINAG. In addition to that, Mr. Datler is responsible for all IT- and digitalisation related activities of ASFINAG.

sessions.title: HR & Tech: Why can't we be friends?
sessions.description:
Cats & dogs, techies and HR. But why is it like that and how can we surpass it in 2025?

Building trust is vital to building rapport between Tech teams and their respective HR partners.
However, in a survey from ServiceNow (Nov, 2024), over 50% of employees state that they trust AI more than they trust their HR.
What drives the sense of distrust and how can we move on?

In this session I will talk about factors of trust and  pillars of strong cross-department collaboration: transparency, proximity & rapport. I will also clarify different types of business values and how HR can measure what they bring to the table to find common language with their tech counterparts.

speakers.bio:
I'm a psychologist & Gestalt psychotherapist that likes to spend her time between the world of business and technology.
I like to get creative about the human element in organisations and create value by boosting the value of others.

I was born by the sea in Croatia and found myself thriving in an international environment from a young age studying in English, working in DACH, Nordic and Central EU markets.
speakers.tagline: Talent Partnership & Acquisition Manager at reev

sessions.title: NVIDIA Expert Session: Sovereign AI in Practice: Building, Evaluating, and Scaling Multilingual LLMs
sessions.description: Visit us at booth A-16 to get answers to your most pressing questions from NVIDIA technology experts, and claim a free self-paced DLI course on July 10-11.

speakers.bio: Ziv Ilan is a Solution Architect at NVIDIA, focusing on Agentic AI, LLM evaluation, optimization, and deployment. He joined from deci.ai (acquired by NVIDIA), where he worked on Neural Architecture Search and model compression techniques for GenAI and Computer Vision models. Ziv holds an Electrical and Electronics Engineering degree from Tel-Aviv University and an MBA from HEC Paris. He leverages his technical and business expertise to drive AI solutions development and deployment.

Sergio Perez specializes in conversational AI. He has experience in optimizing training and inference of LLMs, building retrieval-augmented generation systems, and working with companies in different sectors to leverage AI. His area of expertise at NVIDIA is quantization and inference serving. Previously, he worked as an AI engineer at Graphcore and Amazon, and got a Ph.D. in computational fluid dynamics from Imperial College London.

sessions.title: Beyond the Logo: Data-Driven Employer Branding
sessions.description: This panel discussion will explore how companies use data to shape their brand strategy, and balance analytics with creativity. From leveraging platforms like LinkedIn to measuring the impact of content such as blogs and podcasts, the conversation will reveal how data informs decisions and sometimes challenges assumptions about what resonates with talent.

speakers.tagline: Global Employer Branding Lead at StoneX Group Inc

speakers.bio:
Martyna is the Employer Branding Lead at CD PROJEKT RED, where she co-creates and drives the global employer branding strategy, positioning the company as an employer of choice in the global game dev industry. Together with her team, she leads impactful initiatives like the AnsweRED Podcast and Beyond the Game Blog.

With over 14 years of experience across gaming, tech, retail, and construction — and as a certified Employer Branding Leader since 2021 — Martyna combines strategic thinking and creativity with data-driven insights to build authentic, standout employer brands.
speakers.tagline: Employer Branding Lead at CD PROJEKT RED

sessions.title: Vibe coding sucks! Long life to vibe coding: Hardening Applications for Production with GenAI
sessions.description: We love the speed of 'vibe coding' with GenAI, but it often introduces anti-patterns and production challenges. GenAI particularly struggles with complex software engineering tasks like robust architecture, reusability, and multi-runtime design due to its limitations in deep context understanding. This talk tackles these GenAI shortcomings head-on. We'll explore practical strategies to overcome these hurdles, enabling you to harden your AI-assisted applications and confidently ship maintainable, performant, and secure software.

speakers.bio: Hi there, it's Raúl! A senior product engineer obsessed in making sure we work productively with machines. During the day I build scallable energy software @ E.ON, and at night I try to automate myself away while keeping my picky code quality standards. I tried most agentic cli's and IDE's so you don't need to, and learnt over 10+ real-world projects how to go from vibe coding to agentic engineering. My goal is not only to help you be more productive, but also to retain the fun & fulfillment in your engineering duties, and make sure you keep the technical abilities that got you here sharp.
speakers.tagline: Senior AI Engineer & Trainer at E.ON Digital Technology

sessions.title: How Robots Learn to be Robots
sessions.description: Everything that moves will be autonomous and physical AI will embody robots of every kind. This talk explores how Cosmos World Foundation Models and Isaac GR00T accelerate the development of intelligent robots. We'll walk through the continuous loop of robot AI simulation, training, and testing—enabling developers to generate diverse synthetic data at scale using these openly available models, train robust policies, and validate them in simulation before deployment. Because in robotics, amazing things are born in simulation.

speakers.bio: Alexander Schwarz is a Robotics Solutions Architect at NVIDIA, where he helps customers accelerate AI training and robotics simulation with NVIDIA Cosmos and Isaac. He holds an M.Sc. in Robotics, Cognition, Intelligence from TU Munich and conducted research in computer vision and robot learning at ETH Zurich, Johns Hopkins University, and Delft University of Technology. Alexander is passionate about guiding developers and product teams to build next-generation Physical AI workflows.

sessions.title: Supply Chain Security and the Real World: Lessons From Incidents
sessions.description:
Supply chain security is becoming more and more important, but it is often talked about in abstract and general terms that do little to help the average organisation.

Sophisticated and not-so sophisticated breaches and attacks in recent years have taught us a lot about the soft spots that attackers target. We can these insights into actionable advice for the average devops team.

This talk will look at some real world examples of supply chain compromises and translate the lessons into concrete actions that you can take today to help secure your builds and pipelines.

The incidents we’ll look at include the codecov breach and the recent changed-files attack. I’ll show how straightforward changes to build processes and CI/CD settings can help prevent similar attacks and mitigate the effects when dependencies are breached.

Supply chain security is becoming more and more important, but it is often talked about in abstract and general terms that do little to help the average organisation.

Sophisticated and not-so sophisticated breaches and attacks in recent years have taught us a lot about the soft spots that attackers target. We can these insights into actionable advice for the average devops team.

This talk will look at some real world examples of supply chain compromises and translate the lessons into concrete actions that you can take today to help secure your builds and pipelines.

The incidents we’ll look at include the codecov breach and the recent changed-files attack. I’ll show how straightforward changes to build processes and CI/CD settings can help prevent similar attacks and mitigate the effects when dependencies are breached.

speakers.bio:
Adrian has been involved with containers from the early days of Docker and authored the O’Reilly book “Using Docker”. 

He works at Chainguard  whose mission is to make the software lifecycle secure by default. His current focus is on improving the standard of security and provenance guarantees in container images.

sessions.title: Crew Management System for Airlines: Plan duties for pilots & flight attendants worldwide
sessions.description:
In today’s fast-paced operational environment, managing crew efficiently is more critical than ever.  
Join us as we explore the journey of transforming our crew management system into a resilient, scalable, and cloud-native application. We share how we tackled legacy constraints, embraced microservices and containerization, and what it really means to modernize for the cloud. Whether you're facing similar modernization challenges or planning your first cloud-native move, this talk offers insights based on our experiences, lessons learned, and real-world outcomes.

speakers.bio:
Annette is a Senior Product Owner with 15 years of experience in product development. 
Under her leadership, a new rule application is designed that is envisioned to reduced time-to-market for business rule changes, increased rule transparency, and significantly improve customer satisfaction.
She leads cross-functional teams through Agile delivery cycle. 
Before assuming the Senior Product Owner role, Annette held several positions in product strategy and software development. She held a degree and a PHD in Mathematic, and is passionate about building intelligent, customer-first solutions.
speakers.tagline: Senior Product Owner at Lufthansa Systems

speakers.bio:
Krishnan is a Technical Strategist with over 15 years of experience in software architecture. As Chief Product Architect at NL/Crew, he is driving the strategic transformation of legacy monolithic product into a modern, cloud-native solution leveraging micro-frontends & -services

By decoupling tightly integrated modules, adopting service-oriented architecture using domain driven design, containerization, CI/CD automation, API-first design, and event-driven architectures -  he is empowering the product teams to iterate faster while maintaining robust system reliability and data integrity.
speakers.tagline: Chief Architecture Owner at Lufthansa Systems

sessions.title: Building Blocks for Agentic Solutions in your Enterprise
sessions.description: In this 30-minute session, we’ll cover the core components of enterprise agentic AI, memory management (short-term context vs. long-term knowledge), inter-agent orchestration across systems, and secure identity. You’ll learn how to embed human-in-the-loop oversight and implement safe agent impersonation that respects access controls and user preferences. Drawing on real-life project experience, we’ll showcase reusable patterns that provide a clear roadmap for integrating and scaling agentic solutions within your organization.

speakers.bio: Dennis Zielke is a Cloud Native AI Architect at Microsoft where he drives strategic customer engagements across roles, industries, and domains to envision, design, and implement end-to-end solution architectures leveraging the Microsoft product portfolio. He collaborates with field teams and product engineering to design agentic workforces, build real-time user experiences, and modernize data platforms and services to ensure business outcomes and customer value.
speakers.tagline: CTO Customer Success, Lead Architect at Microsoft

speakers.bio: Rene Pajta is an AI Solution Engineer at Microsoft, where he spearheads AI pre-sales strategy and champions the adoption of generative and agentic AI solutions at enterprise scale. He architects AI platform foundations for global software vendors and empowers developer communities through extensive enablement and training. As a trusted advisor on security and compliance, he ensures responsible and scalable deployment of AI technologies.
speakers.tagline: Solution Engineer - Agentic AI at Microsoft

sessions.title: Videogames:  The Medium of the 21st Century

speakers.bio: Warren Spector has been making games since 1983, first in the tabletop gaming world and, beginning in 1989, making video games at seminal studios Origin / Electronic Arts, Looking Glass,  Ion Storm / Eidos (where he directed Deus Ex) and Junction Point / Disney where he led development on Epic Mickey. After creating a game development program at The University of Texas, he joined OtherSide Entertainment as co-founder and Chief Creative Officer. Among other honors he has been awarded an Honorary Doctorate by Columbia College of Chicago and the Game Developers Choice Lifetime Achievement award.
speakers.tagline: Chief Creative Officer at OtherSide Entertainment

sessions.title: Kubernetes Security Best Practices
sessions.description:
The big challenge we see with Kubernetes security is that setting up a Kubernetes cluster and configuring it to run the applications within it is already so sophisticated that security is often just an afterthought added to the already complex configuration. However, we cannot deny the importance of security, especially when the systems are so complex!
 
Cloud applications are a very attractive target for many hackers, and the growing numbers of cloud applications using Kubernetes as a platform, show us that it is important to know how to secure Kubernetes clusters.
 
Here we look at what tools, setups, and configurations we can use to make our clusters reasonably more secure.

speakers.bio:
Rico is a senior security consultant at adesso SE. His main security areas are in application security, cloud security, offensive security and AI security.

For him, general security intelligence in various aspects is a top priority. Today’s security world is constantly changing and you should always familiarize yourself with the most up-and-coming technologies and methodologies. Rico is a national and international speaker at various conferences on different IT security topics.

As a husband and father of two, he enjoys spending time with his family and exploring the world with them.

sessions.title: What you can learn from an open-source project with 500 million downloads
sessions.description:
After more than 12 years of development, our pet project, Fluent Assertions has almost reached the 500 million downloads. Providing a high quality library like that doesn't come for free. We've been trying to write code that is clean enough for our contributors, write tests that are self-explanatory, ensure breaking changes are strictly controlled and try to make it easy to use. 

In this talk, I'd like to share the tools and techniques we have been using, how they've enriched our day jobs, and how they may do that for you too. 

I'll talk about the release strategy, documentation, versioning, naming conventions, code structure, the build pipeline, automated testing, code coverage, API change detection, multi-targeting and more.

speakers.bio: Dennis is a Microsoft MVP and Principal Consultant at Dutch Microsoft consultancy firm Aviva Solutions. With 29 years of experience under his belt as a software architect and/or lead developer, he specializes in designing full-stack enterprise solutions based on .NET as well as providing coaching on all aspects of designing, building, documenting, deploying and maintaining software systems in an agile world. He is the author of several open-source projects, most notably Fluent Assertions. You can find him on Twitter, Mastodon and BlueSky.

sessions.title: Blazing Fast Page Navigation with Speculation Rules
sessions.description: Performance optimization is critical to delivering fast and seamless user experiences in the ever-evolving web development landscape. This talk delves into the innovative use of speculation rules to enhance web loading times and overall performance. Attendees will gain insights into the principles and mechanisms behind speculation rules, learn how they predict and pre-fetch resources, and explore real-world applications and case studies demonstrating their impact. Join me to discover how speculation rules advance the limits of web performance optimization and how you can implement these techniques to create faster, more efficient web applications.

speakers.bio: Medhat is a Senior Software Engineer at Miro and a Google Developer Expert in Web Performance with extended experience in several web technologies, through his writings on his blog, online video courses, and talks he likes to share learnings, tips to write cleaner/reusable code, and useful DevTools, also he likes to speak about web performance and how to ship a fast and accessible web application to everyone

sessions.title: Develop on Windows, Deploy on Red Hat Enterprise Linux
sessions.description:
Microsoft and Red Hat recently simplified the ability to run Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) on Microsoft Windows systems using Windows Services for Linux version 2 (WSL2). In this demo-filled session, we’ll show you how to install RHEL on WSL2 and use it to develop a Linux-based Python application. We’ll also have a look at the capabilities of RHEL image builder and demonstrate how you can build a WSL2-ready developer image that runs in WSL2 and lets you use a suite of your favorite Linux and Windows tools in the development process..
This way of working has been getting harder as systems become more and more distributed. Now, with the advent of AI-driven development, it has become even more challenging than ever before. Many of us use remote generative AI services to help us with scaffolding, writing and testing code, and with many other tasks. 

Wouldn’t it be great if we could still run everything on our local machine? That’s what this session is all about! 

In this session we’ll take a look at various solutions to continue to do local, network-optional development: 
Run AI models locally using different tools such as Ollama, Podman AI Lab, RamaLama, Docker, etc.
Evaluate different code assistants that can work with these locally running models
Explore how to infuse AI capabilities from local models into our code
Compare models from different vendors; and with different sizes to find the right balance between performance and accuracy
Weigh pros and cons of using local vs remote models

Come to this session to learn more about local development while leveraging AI to optimize our development flow, code and our functionality itself!

speakers.bio: Ben Breard is a product manager for Red Hat Enterprise Linux and focuses on immutable operating systems and bridging infrastructure with artificial intelligence. As a true believer in open source, he also enjoys evangelizing containers, systemd, Kubernetes, and Linux. Previously he was a Solutions Architect working closely with enterprise accounts on cloud & infrastructure management, virtualization, and all things RHEL. Ben joined Red Hat in 2010 and currently works out of Frisco, Texas.
speakers.tagline: Product Manager at Red Hat Enterprise Linux

sessions.title: The 2025 State of JavaScript Testing
sessions.description:
Have we been stuck in the same testing pain loops for years? Even though it might seem like it, we haven't!
Even if AI is now writing our tests, many JavaScript developers have faced numerous challenges, from the unclarity of test classifications to the struggle of mocking, long-running integration tests, and shifting everything to E2E tests.
Let's recap everything that has happened in the past years and look into the present to explore what 2025 will bring for testing in the JavaScript world around test runners, testing libraries, mocking, production practices, and AI-based tools.

speakers.bio: Daniel Afonso is a Senior Developer Advocate at PagerDuty, SolidJS DX team member, Instructor at Egghead.io, and Author of State Management with React Query. Daniel has a full-stack background, having worked with different languages and frameworks on various projects from IoT to Fraud Detection. He is passionate about learning and teaching and has spoken at multiple conferences around the world about topics he loves. In his free time, when he's not learning new technologies or writing about them, he's probably reading comics or watching superhero movies and shows.

sessions.title: Supercharged Retrieval with Agentic GraphRAG
sessions.description: AI models are getting tasked to do increasingly complex and industry specific tasks where different retrieval approaches provide distinct advantages in accuracy, explainability, and cost to execute. GraphRAG retrieval models have become a powerful tool to solve domain specific problems where answers require logical reasoning and correlation that can be aided by graph relationships and proximity algorithms. We will demonstrate how an agent architecture combining RAG and GraphRAG retrieval patterns can bridge the gap in data analysis, strategic planning, and retrieval to solve complex domain specific problems.

speakers.bio: Stephen Chin is VP of Developer Relations at Neo4j, member of the Open AI Alliance, and author of several titles with O'Reilly, Apress, and McGraw Hill. He has keynoted numerous conferences around the world including AI DevSummit, Devoxx, DevNexus, JNation, Shift, JavaOne, Joker, swampUP, and Open Source India. Stephen is an avid motorcyclist who has done evangelism tours in Europe, Japan, and Brazil, interviewing developers in their natural habitat. When he is not traveling, he enjoys teaching kids how to do AI, embedded, and robot programming together with his daughters.
speakers.tagline: VP of Developer Relations at Neo4j

sessions.title: AI Changed the Game: How VCs Rethink Product, Talent & Technical Moats

speakers.bio:
Dr. Christian Nagel is a Partner and Co-Founder of Earlybird Venture Capital, a leading European venture capital firm established in 1997. He brings over 30 years of experience in technology investing, with a focus on Fintech, Artificial Intelligence, and Foodtech. As a key driver of Earlybird’s growth, Christian has played a pivotal role in shaping the firm’s strategy and expansion across Europe.

Prior to founding Earlybird, Christian was the Co-Founder of SMB Industrieholding GmbH, a diversified group of industrial component companies, where he led initiatives in scaling operations, mergers and acquisitions, and divestitures. He began his career as a Project Manager at McKinsey & Company, working in the Düsseldorf, Zurich, and Hamburg offices. 

Christian holds a Ph.D. in Economics from the University of St. Gallen and a degree in Industrial Engineering from the Technical University of Hamburg (TUHH).

Romain Mombert is a Managing Director within the Eurazeo Growth team, one of the most active European funds in late-stage investment in AI. He has over ten years of experience in growth-stage investing, financial advisory, and the operational scaling of technology companies.

At Eurazeo, Romain focuses primarily on investments in data and artificial intelligence infrastructure. He has notably backed industry-leading companies such as Neo4j, Cognigy, Mistral and Dataiku.

Shikha joined Balderton’s investment team in 2021. She is based in Berlin and covers the DACH region (Germany, Austria, Switzerland).Prior to Balderton, Shikha gained deep operational experience first-hand as a founder in Asia for six years. As part of her entrepreneurial journey, she built SBL, the largest, tech-enabled and vertically integrated D2C women’s fashion e-commerce player in India. For her achievements at SBL, she was on the Forbes 30 under 30 list as the youngest in retail and e-commerce.

Based on her experience in India, Shikha also set-up a tech advisory and implementation boutique, aiding world-leading retailers to implement data-driven and iterative prototyping.Prior to her entrepreneurial journey, she gained experience at JP Morgan’s Investment Banking Division in London. Shikha studied at WHU – Otto Beisheim School of Management, where she earned a summa cum laude for her thesis & defence on game theory.

Shikha’s native language is German. She also speaks English, Hindi and Punjabi fluently.

sessions.title: Cracking the Code to Tech Team Satisfaction
sessions.description:
Employee satisfaction is a key factor in engagement, productivity and commitment - especially as tech teams face unique challenges that set them apart from other specializations. In this session, we’ll explore how employee satisfaction surveys, particularly within the Great Place to Work (GPTW) framework, help us understand the specific needs of tech teams.

We’ll highlight the main issues developers encounter, the actions we took to improve our survey results, and the real impact of these changes. We’ll also share best practices for turning survey data into meaningful improvements - creating a better work culture, supporting mental health, and providing employees with a greater sense of purpose.

speakers.bio: Pauline Pagliaro has been focused on HR and employee satisfaction since the beginning of her career. She gained valuable experience in different digital agencies, studied Business Psychology with a focus on Organizational Development. Since 2021, she has been working at denkwerk GmbH, where she is part of the "HR Organizational Strategy & Culture" department. She is responsible for employee satisfaction surveys, onboarding processes, professional development, mental health, and employee commitment. denkwerk is a digital agency that employs around 250 people across four locations in Germany.

sessions.title: Achieving Design Excellence in Open-Source Software
sessions.description:
In this talk, Martin explores the challenges of achieving high design standards in open-source software—projects often led by developers, characterized by flat hierarchies, and reliant on volunteers. Design thinking is frequently fragmented, with limited focus on the broader user experience. He will demonstrate how even well-intentioned plans can unintentionally create user confusion, using real-world user testing examples.

Martin will also outline practical strategies for fostering a design-driven culture, including user testing, public charters, and contribution standards—helping open-source communities adopt modern design thinking effectively.

speakers.bio: Martin Keary, Head of Software at Muse Group, has over 20 years of product design experience and has contributed to open-source projects like Ubuntu and Microsoft's Mixed Reality Toolkit. Over the last 5 years, he has been running MuseScore Studio, and Audacity.
speakers.tagline: Head of Software at Muse Group

sessions.title: Friend or Foe? TypeScript Security Fallacies
sessions.description:
So TypeScript has become the de facto industry standard for developing web applications these days and promising type security, but do developers properly understand the role it plays in securing applications and does the type safety promise hold true in face of real-world security threats?

Developers often mistake dev-time vs runtime security as well as confuse test cases for security guard rails. Can TypeScript actually provide you with code security benefits? In this session we will explore insecure TypeScript patterns, learn how HTTP parameter pollution vulnerabilities impact TypeScript code bases and witness first-hand how attackers employ prototype pollution attacks that cripple codebases even when developers use schema validation libraries like Zod. Through hands-on coding we’ll hack a TypeScript application and learn security best practices.

speakers.bio: Liran Tal is a software developer, and a GitHub Star, world-recognized for his activism in open source communities and advancing web and Node.js security. He engages in security research through his work in the OpenJS Foundation and the Node.js ecosystem security working group, and further promotes open source supply chain security as an OWASP project lead. Liran is also a published author of Essential Node.js Security and O'Reilly's Serverless Security. At Snyk, he is leading the developer advocacy team and on a mission to empower developers with better dev-first security.
speakers.tagline: Director of Developer Advocacy at Snyk

sessions.title: On a Secret Mission: Developing AI Agents
sessions.description: Answering questions, summarizing texts, generating images—it's all well and good. But AI becomes truly useful when it learns to make its own decisions and collaborate with other AIs in a team. We will explore how agent systems are structured and how task distribution works. We will also discuss how agents exchange data and the different completion strategies available. Jörg Neumann explains the background of agentic AI, demonstrates practical use cases and showcases the future of software development.

speakers.bio: Jörg Neumann is founder and CEO at NeoGeeks and specialist for AI and frontend technologies. In addition to the technical aspects, he has an eye for design and usability. He has over 25 years of experience in conception and development of enterprise applications. He shares his knowledge in various books and magazines and as speaker on developer conferences. Jörg is also a Microsoft MVP in the areas Azure OpenAI Service and Azure Machine Learning Platform.

sessions.title: Building resilient .NET applications for the modern age
sessions.description:
In a world driven by microservices, where applications frequently communicate over HTTP, network calls can fail for various reasons like timeouts, service unavailability, or unexpected errors.

This is where resilience becomes crucial, which is the ability for an application to recover from failures and keep running smoothly! Without it, the smallest issues can lead to loads of complications, resulting in a poor user experience.

In this session, you will learn how to build resilient .NET applications that can withstand and recover from failures. By the end of this session, you'll not only understand the theory behind resilient applications but also gain practical tips and access to demos, enabling you to start building resilient .NET applications right away!

speakers.bio: Sander ten Brinke is a Microsoft MVP and Lead Software Engineer at Arcady, a Dutch IT consultancy firm based in Zwolle. He loves working with .NET, Azure, DevOps and a whole lot more. He always stays up to date with all new technology and loves sharing his knowledge with everyone by speaking, blogging, podcasting and more!

sessions.title: The irresistible UX: the psychology of brainwaves and clickbait
sessions.description:
This presentation dives into how understanding the human brain’s wiring can lead to more intuitive, engaging, and seamless user experiences. By leveraging cognitive biases, psychological principles, and neuroscience insights, we can design interfaces and workflows that feel natural to users, guide their behavior, and create habit-forming interactions. We'll explore how to reduce friction in digital products, keeping users engaged and making interactions almost instinctive.

Although I'm not a developer, I'm working with developers, and our connection has always been close - once I understood the importance of the Developer Experience, it's even closer. This topic is something that I want to educate people about: as a developer it's important for you to understand how the developed product will be perceived by the users, and how you can contribute to make it even more user-friendly.

speakers.bio: Dora is a lead product designer with over 17 years of professional experience in design, product delivery and management. In all roles, her goal is to ensure that the processes run smoothly and that her colleagues receive all possible support.
speakers.tagline: Head of Design at Element Logic

sessions.title: Planet-Scale Dashboards
sessions.description:
Google runs hundreds of thousands of services globally, often interdependent and with shared concerns.  At that scale, classical Federated Observability — a platform team providing foundations and/or building blocks for each team to assemble on their own — does not scale anymore.

In this talk, we will demonstrate how Google managed to cut toil dramatically while providing best-in-class monitoring out-of-the-box:

- What are the unique circumstances that contributed to Google’s scaling problem?
- A data model for re-usable dashboards
- Impact on both configuration overhead and incident response
- Looking beyond dashboards, how such re-use can be facilitated in the broader observability space

Robert will draw on Google’s research paper on Planet-Scale Dashboards (to be published mid 2025) and more than a decade of experience in SRE.

speakers.bio: Robert has spent the past decade with Google SRE, building the tools that a majority of Google's incident response uses for production monitoring.  In a previous life, he was a Python aficionado and otherwise enjoys teaching.

sessions.title: Data-Oriented Programming - Version 1.1
sessions.description:
In data-oriented programming (DOP), we model data as data and polymorphic behavior with pattern matching. This talk will introduce the concept of DOP and its four principles:

* model data immutably and transparently
* model the data, the whole data, and nothing but the data
* make illegal states unrepresentable
* separate operations from data

We'll also explore how to use pattern matching as a safe, powerful, and maintainable mechanism for ad-hoc polymorphism on such data that lets us define operations without overloading the types with functionality. The talk ends with a juxtaposition to OOP, so you not only learn how to employ DOP but also when (not).

speakers.bio: Nicolai (aka nipafx) is a Java enthusiast focused on language features and core APIs with a passion for learning and sharing - in articles, newsletters, and books; in tweets, videos, and streams; in demo repos and at conferences - more on all of that on https://nipafx.dev. He's a Java Developer Advocate at Oracle and organizer of Accento. That aside, he's best known for his haircut.

sessions.title: How to add test automation to your project: The good, the bad, and the ugly
sessions.description:
Introducing test automation to your project is not an easy feat, this is why failing to implement test automation projects or ending out in a loop of trying different tools, tend to be the common experience for many teams trying to implement test automation.

This talk will focus on the general pitfalls when trying to implement automation, the return on investment you can expect, and how you can sell automation to other stakeholders. It will also include real-life case scenarios of implementing automation successfully and unsuccessfully.

speakers.bio:
Hello, my name is Augustin, and I have been working in the IT sector for the last 9 years. 

Over this time, my focus has been on quality and automation, with several roles both as developer and QA.

I'm fascinated by everything automation-related, and I actively contribute to the Selenium and Appium communities besides having my own open-source projects. 

Besides that, on my free time I enjoy playing DnD and spending time with my friends and my dog

sessions.title: Event-Driven Architecture: Breaking Conversational Barriers with Distributed AI Agents
sessions.description:
If agents are the new apps, what's the operating system?

We currently stand at the convergence of speech, vision, and intelligence as the boundaries of human interactions with machines are blurring into a more seamless, interactive ecosystem. Imagine a world where hundreds of AI agents interact with humans globally, generating hundreds and thousands of conversations per hour. 

Building such a system at scale requires a robust, well-designed architecture. As microservices need Event-Driven Architecture(EDA) to scale beyond fragile point-to-point connections, AI agents need a similar architectural shift. 

This talk demonstrates a practical approach to building production-ready distributed AI agents beyond simple reactive systems. Through a real-world example, the hands-on live demo will showcase a scalable event-driven architecture for AI agents using Apache Kafka, Apache Flink, and Kubernetes.

EDAs are the future of Agentic AI. Why don't we start building them from here?

speakers.bio:
Abhimanyu "Chitra" Selvan, aka "diabhey,"  is a Developer Advoacy Leader and an engineer with expertise across multiple high-tech domains. His experience spans programming digital cockpit systems for Boeing 787 simulators, controlling automated industrial robots, and engineering FDA-approved medical IoT systems. Over the last five years, he has delved into the cloud-native ecosystem, particularly kubernetes. Currently, he is tinkering with GPUs and helping developers build and break things at DigitalOcean.

You can find out more at https://diabhey.com
speakers.tagline: Head of Developer Advocacy at DigitalOcean

sessions.title: Engineering Productivity: Cutting Through the AI Noise

speakers.bio: Himanshu Vasishth is the Director of Engineering at Grammarly, where he focuses on developing the next generation of AI-powered innovations in the apps and productivity space. Previously, he was head of core product engineering at Coda, where he scaled the engineering team from the ground up and helped deliver over 230 product features that fueled the company’s growth. With a background at Google and Microsoft, Himanshu brings deep technical expertise and a proven track record of building scalable systems, shaping strategic roadmaps, and fostering high-performing, collaborative teams. He’s passionate about empowering engineering leaders, driving data-informed execution, and creating products that delight users.

Mindaugas Mozūras is the CTO at Vinted, the world's biggest preloved fashion marketplace and Lithuania's first tech unicorn. He’s been with Vinted for over 12 years, seeing its journey from a dozen employees to a company that now employs more than 2000 people. Mindaugas joined Vinted as an engineer and then started leading engineering in 2015. Since then, he has helped grow the engineering team from 30 to 750 and scale the technology behind Vinted to serve millions of members in more than 20 markets.

Jackie is the Head of AI & Data Platform at Block. She leads a software engineering team that provides infrastructure to power streaming data and ML experiences for diverse business use cases across Square, Cash App, TIDAL and AfterPay. Jackie previously led the risk teams for Square’s banking and lending products. Before joining Block, Jackie worked in quantitative finance and scientific computing and received her PhD in high energy physics from UC Berkeley.
speakers.tagline: Head of AI & Data Automation at Block

speakers.bio: Lukas Pfeiffer is Senior Communications Director at PIABO Communications, where he leads strategic PR campaigns at the intersection of deep tech, cybersecurity, and enterprise IT. With more than a decade of experience in B2B communications, Lukas has worked across leading agencies and tech-driven clients, turning complex technologies into compelling narratives. He specializes in topics such as AI, cloud infrastructure, data security, and digital transformation.

sessions.title: From Friction to Flow: How We’re Empowering Developers
sessions.description: In today’s fast-paced tech landscape, developer effectiveness is key to delivering value at speed and scale. This session explores how the Digital Hangar tackles common challenges like fragmented toolchains, unclear ownership and cognitive overload. By diving into practical enablers such as developer portals, guardrails, platform capabilities and an AI empowered toolchain — we’ll showcase how we actively transforming the developer experience. These capabilities help reduce cognitive load, improve decision-making, and accelerate common development workflows, making it easier for teams to focus on delivering value. You’ll leave with actionable insights on reducing complexity, enabling flow and accelerating delivery through automation and integrated tooling. The session concludes with a hands-on demo on onboarding teams for rapid, secure delivery from day one.

speakers.bio:
Marek Wasilewski is Chapter Lead Frontend at Digital Hangar, where he focuses on building a strong engineering community, improving developer experience and helping shape the future of frontend development across the Lufthansa Group. His work involves supporting teams with better tools, knowledge sharing and long-term strategies for frontend technologies.

Before joining the Digital Hangar, Marek worked across a range of roles in software development and consulting, contributing to projects in cloud infrastructure, backend systems, DevOps and frontend architecture.
speakers.tagline: Chapter Lead Frontend at Lufthansa Group Digital Hangar

speakers.bio:
Ronnie is Chapter Lead Backend at Lufthansa Group Digital Hangar, where he drives the technical strategy and leadership for a international community of over 150 backend developers. 

With a strong focus on engineering excellence, Ronnie builds technical vision, and fosters collaboration through workshops, training sessions, and active community engagement.

Prior to joining the Digital Hangar, Ronnie held senior engineering leadership roles in the e-commerce and healthcare sectors, delivering large-scale software products using technologies like Java, Spring Boot, Docker and Kubernetes.
speakers.tagline: Chapter Lead Backend at Lufthansa Group Digital Hangar

sessions.title: BEST RECRUITERS Award
sessions.description:
BEST RECRUITERS is conducting an annual evaluation of the recruiting quality of more than 1,400 organizations across the D-A-CH region. The study is based on 330 criteria spanning 10 categories of the candidate journey.

This year's award ceremony for all nominees in the German market will take place at the HR Leaders Summit on Stage 12 on July 10th. Arrivals start at 17:00 but the ceremony will begin at 17:30.

speakers.bio: Bernhard Schwingsandl has been part of the BEST RECRUITERS study team since 2022, where his responsibilities include communications, copywriting, and presentations. He has a scientific background in general linguistics. His hobbies include theater photography; he also occasionally performs on stage.
speakers.tagline: Project & Communication Manager at BEST RECRUITERS

speakers.bio: Christian Pasteka has been leading the BEST RECRUITERS study since 2025. He has been part of the scientific team since 2022 and has a diverse academic background in psychology, philosophy, and economics, among other fields. His passions include strength training. As a psychological consultant, he also supports the mood barometer robin mood.
speakers.tagline: Head of Scientific Research at BEST RECRUITERS

sessions.title: From Vision To Victory - What It Takes to Succeed in Tech Today
sessions.description:
A new wave of entrepreneurial spirit is sweeping across Western countries, with start-up formation reaching an all-time high - particularly in the IT sector. Young founders are launching their ventures with great enthusiasm and passion. Yet, despite this momentum, failure rates have surged to over 95%.

What does it take to succeed in today’s rapidly evolving tech landscape - especially as AI continues to disrupt the very foundations of Western society? This presentation offers key insights into that question, drawing from both current trends and the personal experiences of Wolfgang Platz, founder of Austria's first unicorn.

speakers.bio:
After studying Technical Physics and Business Administration, Wolfgang Platz began his professional journey as a software developer. While working on Austria’s largest IT insurance project, he quickly recognized the vital role of software testing. This insight led him to pioneer a new, no-code approach to test automation, empowering business users to take part in the testing process. 
In 2007, he founded Tricentis, which went on to become Austria’s first unicorn, boasting over 1,000 employees, $450 million in revenue, and a valuation of $4.5 billion.

Today, Wolfgang mentors emerging companies, helping them navigate the complexities of the business world. One of his greatest rewards is seeing those he has guided grow into leadership positions.

He remains at the forefront of modern technology, having delivered keynotes on cutting-edge topics such as blockchain, virtual reality, and artificial intelligence.
speakers.tagline: Founder and CEO of Katharo Ventures

sessions.title: Agentic DevOps: How AI-Powered Automation Transforms Software Delivery on GitHub and Azure
sessions.description:
The DevOps world is shifting from pipelines to agentic systems—autonomous AI-driven agents that understand intent, orchestrate workflows, and adapt in real-time. In this session, we’ll explore how GitHub Copilot, Actions, and Azure Monitor can be combined with modern agent architectures to redefine CI/CD, infrastructure as code, and platform engineering.  You’ll see live demos of AI agents that:

 	•	Diagnose failing pipelines and propose fixes
 	•	Spin up cloud environments based on natural language prompts
 	•	Coordinate infrastructure updates across microservices autonomously  

We’ll also discuss the organizational and cultural implications of introducing AI teammates into your DevOps lifecycle.  Whether you’re a platform engineer, SRE, or tech lead, this talk will challenge how you think about automation - and show you what’s next.

speakers.bio: Michael Kaufmann is a Microsoft MVP and Regional Director and the CEO of Xpirit Germany. Mike has been working as a .net developer and architect for more than 20 years. In addition to implementing agile techniques (like scrum), ALM and DevOps practices, he is an Azure architect and a Clean Code addict. He shares his knowledge in books, trainings, his blog, articles and as a speaker and keynote speaker at international conferences.

sessions.title: Designing the Future of Human<>Agent Collaboration
sessions.description:
Figma has always believed that the best products are built by the most collaborative teams, who work together to explore the possibilities, iterate on ideas, and craft innovative solutions. Now, a new collaborator has entered the mix with a promise to supercharge this workflow: AI agents.

Emil Sjölander, Director of Engineering for Figma’s developer tools, discusses how to integrate agents that will help your teams—not replace them. Learn how designers and engineers can leverage agents and MCP servers for closer collaboration, faster iteration, and to build higher quality products.

speakers.bio: Emil is a director of software engineering at Figma, overseeing Dev Mode and other developer product initiatives. Emil joined Figma through the acquisition of his startup, Visly, where he focused on bridging the gap between design and development. He has spent the last decade building frameworks and developer tools.

sessions.title: Booth Crawl @Expo Halls
sessions.description: Join us for the Booth Crawl for relaxed networking, good music, and great company in the Expo Halls! Grab a drink, connect with fellow attendees, explore exhibitor booths in a casual atmosphere, and enjoy some fun surprises along the way. It’s a great way to experience the vibrant energy of the WeAreDevelopers community.

sessions.title: Drag Karaoke
sessions.description: Work can be a drag, this won't be!

sessions.title: Speaker Happy Hour
sessions.description: A relaxed get-together for all speakers to unwind after a full day at the congress. Join us for drinks and light snacks, reconnect with fellow speakers, and enjoy the evening atmosphere in good company - before heading to the official congress party :)

sessions.title: Executive Wine & Dine
sessions.description: Hosted in partnership with AWS, Atlassian, and Accenture, this exclusive gathering offers the opportunity to engage in candid discussions, share perspectives, and explore strategic topics shaping the future of technology in the AI era — all in a focused and intimate setting.

sessions.title: Figma Meetup
sessions.description:
Figma Meetup
Join us at Stage 10 in the Expo Area (Hall A) from 6:00 PM for a relaxed evening meetup.
We’ll have cold beers, light snacks, and Figma merch to share. It’s a great chance to hang out, chat, and unwind with fellow attendees.
We’d love to see you there!

sessions.title: CODE100 Finals - Europe's Ultimate Coding Competition
sessions.description:
CODE100 is Europe’s ultimate coding competition. Join the live show and experience the 32 Challengers competing against each other through 4 dramatic elimination rounds.

Only one developer can emerge as the ultimate CODE100 Champion at this epic fusion of coding and party.

sessions.title: Official Congress Party powered by WeAreDevelopers
sessions.description:
Join us for an unforgettable night where the global developer community comes together to celebrate. Prepare to dance, connect, and let loose—because this year, Moonbootica will set the stage on fire with an electrifying set! You don’t want to miss the beats and energy that will light up the night.

Please note: there is a maximum capacity of 2.000 at Entrance South. Bookmarking this session does not guarantee access.

sessions.title: Finding Your Way in Tech
sessions.description: Getting started in tech can be overwhelming. There’s so much to learn, and it’s easy to feel like you’re always behind. In this talk, I’ll share how you can build a clear strategy for your future, learn effectively, and take real steps toward your goals. Everything comes from my own journey and the stories of people I’ve interviewed or met throughout my career. By the end, you’ll walk away with at least one powerful action you can take to grow your career in tech with confidence and purpose. Let’s crush it!

speakers.bio:
Hi, I am Francesco, I am 39 from Rome, Italy.

I am a Computer Scientist who worked from 2017 to 2020 on the Copernicus project for the European Space Agency.

I am very active on Social Media since January 2020, especially Twitter, YouTube, and Discord. I became a Docker Captain in June 2021, I have been a host for the Official Docker All-Hands in September 2021, and a guest on the official Docker Youtube channel.

I've interviewed 150+ Developers on my YouTube Channel.

Currently Developer Advocate at daily.dev

I am currently creating content about Web3.

I stream on Twitch, and I started posting videos on TikTok.

sessions.title: Breaking the Ice: Debunking Myths Between Recruiters and Developers
sessions.description:
In the fast-paced world of tech recruitment, misconceptions often create barriers between recruiters and developers. Our podcast, "HR-HR and Deploy," has been tackling these issues head-on, and now we're bringing our insights to the WeAreDevelopers' HR Leaders Summit. This session will dive deep into the unspoken tensions, mutual myths, and communication gaps that exist between these two crucial groups in the tech industry.

By attending this session, both recruiters and developers will gain valuable insights into each other's perspectives, helping to create a more welcoming and collaborative tech ecosystem. Join us as we break down common myths, bridge the gap between these two worlds, and show that recruiters and developers aren’t rivals—but allies who can thrive together.

speakers.bio:
Dilara Bukellal is a Senior Talent Sourcer at Veeam Software, specializing in recruiting top tech talent across different programming languages and countries.

As the co-host of the podcast "HR-HR and Deploy" Dilara bridges the gap between HR and Tech, sharing unique insights into the IT industry. Her recruitment blog on LinkedIn covers talent sourcing, recruiting and tech topics both for HR professionals and programmers.
speakers.tagline: Senior Talent Sourcer at Veeam Software

speakers.bio:
Arsenii is a Talent Acquisition Sourcer at Veeam Software, focused on connecting top engineering talent with impactful roles across all over the world.

With a background in international recruitment, he specializes in sourcing for technical roles across multiple regions, adapting his approach to local markets and talent pools.

Passionate about football and tech hiring, Arsenii brings a human touch to tech hiring and loves sparking meaningful conversations, both on and off the pitch.
speakers.tagline: Talent Acquisition Sourcer at Veeam Software

sessions.title: Let's Get Aggregated: Custom UDAFs in Spark
sessions.description:
Tired of the same old avg() and sum() in Spark? Wish your data could tell more interesting stories? Then this talk is for you! We'll dive into the world of User-Defined Aggregation Functions (UDAFs) in Apache Spark — your secret weapon for solving those "just-one-more-metric" moments that built-ins can't handle. 
You'll learn how to build your own aggregations using Spark's type-safe Aggregator API, giving you full control, better performance, and compiler-approved confidence. We'll show you how to craft custom metrics that actually reflect your business logic. 
Whether you're wrangling massive datasets or just want to impress your coworkers with some next-level Spark wizardry, join us and level up your data game — one custom aggregation at a time!

speakers.bio: Nikolai Nikolaev is a data expert with over 18 years of experience across IT consulting, fintech, e-commerce, and the aviation/travel industry. Having held roles from developer to architect and team lead, he has successfully implemented data platforms in seven different organizations. His professional focus is everything data-related - from engineering and architecture to platform rollout and data governance. A true data enthusiast and advocate of practical, business-driven digital transformation.
speakers.tagline: Senior Data Engineer at Eurowings Holidays

sessions.title: Recruiting with Soul & Smarts
sessions.description: Join Jens Echterling, CPO at HeyJobs, for "Recruiting with Soul & Smarts," a strategic keynote on leveraging cutting-edge AI and indispensable human expertise in modern talent acquisition. Discover how AI optimizes performance marketing—from intelligent job ad creation to data-driven budget allocation—ensuring unparalleled reach to active and passive candidates. Explore how innovative AI assessment streamlines candidate qualification and enriches profiles, significantly reducing screening effort and enhancing hiring precision. The keynote reveals the critical junctures where AI drives efficiency and where the indispensable human touch in "sellcruiting" secures top talent and delivers a superior candidate experience. Gain actionable insights to build a truly future-proof recruiting strategy.

speakers.bio: Jens Echterling is an experienced Product Strategist and Innovation Leader. His passion for strategy and product management has propelled him into leading product roles at various companies. With a consulting background from McKinsey he founded, grew and sold two startups and significantly shaped the product vision and strategy at FOCUS Online Group and Greator. Since 2022, Jens has been a leading product at HeyJobs, with the goal of establishing it as Europe's leading career platform. Additionally, he shares his knowledge as a Lecturer for Product Management at the DIGITALE LEUTE School. His deep expertise in product management positions him as a thought leader in digital transformation.

sessions.title: Rethinking Workflows in the Agentic Era
sessions.description: The agentic era demands a fundamentally new approach to designing solutions. In this session, Eric and Rene will walk you through their proven process for transforming traditional workflows into AI-augmented, agent-driven systems. You’ll learn how to identify high-impact use cases in existing processes, architect multi-agent collaborations, and seamlessly integrate AI components to amplify productivity and innovation. By examining real-world examples and hands-on patterns, you’ll leave equipped to rethink problem-solving for an age where autonomous agents and human expertise work side by side.

speakers.bio: Experienced AI Solutions Engineer with a demonstrated history of working in culturally diverse environments around the world, including several years leading AI and cloud initiatives in Japan. Focused on designing cloud-native, scalable, resilient, and secure back-end systems using Microsoft Azure, underpinned by a strong software development background in languages such as Python, C#, and Java. A logical, analytical thinker and clear, concise communicator, adept at bridging technical and business requirements to deliver enterprise-grade AI solutions.

Rene Pajta is an AI Solution Engineer at Microsoft, where he spearheads AI pre-sales strategy and champions the adoption of generative and agentic AI solutions at enterprise scale. He architects AI platform foundations for global software vendors and empowers developer communities through extensive enablement and training. As a trusted advisor on security and compliance, he ensures responsible and scalable deployment of AI technologies.
speakers.tagline: Solution Engineer - Agentic AI at Microsoft

sessions.title: Behind the Code: How Women Are Powering the Future of AI
sessions.description: Artificial intelligence is rapidly reshaping the global business landscape, demanding a new era of strategic leadership. This panel brings together top decision-makers from the tech sector to illuminate the critical dimensions of AI adoption and advancement within organizations. We will explore what it truly means to lead in an AI-driven world, delving into essential topics such as crafting effective AI implementation strategies, fostering an AI-first mindset, identifying and cultivating the skills necessary for a future-ready workforce, and establishing sustainable frameworks for building internal AI capabilities. Join us for a deep dive into the strategic imperatives and transformative approaches that are powering the future of AI from the boardroom to the operational core.

speakers.bio: Alexandra Wudel is AI researcher and tech entrepreneur. With FemAI, she’s building one of Europe's first responsible AI brands. As the CEO of FemAI, she has won awards such as "AI Person of the Year 2024, "40 under 40" and was one of 25 global experts on ethical considerations for AI. Alexandra has contributed to the design of ethical AI guidelines for over 25+ organizations such as the EU, German Federal Foreign Ministry, the UN, and the German Parliament.

Madalina Florean is the Director of Artificial Intelligence at Cadmatic, where she leads an Artificial Intelligence unit dedicated to developing and implementing AI solutions for maritime and EPC (Engineering, Procurement, and Construction) for industrial Plant applications. Her focus is on using AI as a supportive technology to empower engineers and streamline their workflows, allowing them to concentrate on building state of the art real-world products. With a strong technical background, Madalina holds an MSc in Computer Science and has extensive experience in large-scale engineering software. She has served as a software engineer, product owner of CADMATIC Hull Structural Design software, Research and Development manager, and Director of Technology Development.

Laura Moritz is a seasoned Tech Manager specializing in Data and AI with over seven years of commercial experience, particularly in healthcare and life sciences, e-commerce, and finance. Currently at Globant, she leverages AI to enhance business value and operational efficiency. Laura is passionate about mentoring startups, transforming research into innovative healthcare solutions, and writing about AI's latest advancements. Enthusiastic about women in tech, she is the Country Director Germany for Global Women TechLeaders and a mentor for refugees at the Tent Partnership for Refugees.
speakers.tagline: Country Leader Germany at Global Women TechLeaders

sessions.title: Beyond the buzz: Aligning AI Innovation with Customer Needs
sessions.description:
"Everything is better with Bluetooth." Dr. Sheldon Cooper.

If The Big Bang Theory was a few years older, that quote would have said "blockchain" and, if it was now, it would be about AI.
Tech fads have always and will always exist. They excite us, and they also excite the people who give us money.

But just like Penny's hair ornaments did not get any better with Bluetooth, a lot of products do not and will not get any better with AI. As a product leader and strategist, we must find ways to stay user-centric in our solutions, while still satisfying the investors and stakeholders' demand for "some AI".

In this session I will share how I navigated that, the mistakes I have made, and the failed initiatives we had along the way. 
I trust the audience will rethink some of their projects and be better equipped to create remarkable, AI-powered products.

speakers.bio: From the world's most famous Hotel Management school to becoming the Product Manager of AI at a tech unicorn, Ettore's career is nothing but diverse. A proud problem-solver and generalist, he is known to hunt down solutions from seemingly unrelated industries and finding subject matter experts to partner with to make human lives easier.

sessions.title: The retention flywheel: designing products people don’t want to leave
sessions.description:
Retention is the foundation of scalable growth, yet many companies prioritize acquisition over keeping users engaged. This session introduces the retention flywheel, a framework for designing products that drive long-term engagement, reduce churn and fuel sustainable growth.

Using real-world examples from companies like Slack and Notion, this session will provide actionable strategies to optimize the user journey and transform retention into a self-sustaining growth engine.

Key takeaways:
- Why retention is essential for sustainable growth.
- Practical frameworks for improving activation, engagement and expansion.
- How to create retention systems that evolve with user feedback.

Perfect for product leaders and tech professionals looking to design products users never want to leave.

speakers.bio: Madalena is a Lead Product Designer at Glanceable, designing intuitive scalable digital products. She is the Leader of Ladies that UX Lisbon and an Ambassador for Google Women Techmakers, passionately advocating for diversity and inclusion in tech. As a global speaker and facilitator, she shares her expertise on systems thinking, AI in product design, human-centered design and empowering communities. Madalena combines strategic vision and creativity to build meaningful products, inspire future tech leaders and foster thriving, inclusive communities.

sessions.title: A decade of tracking changes: How Spotify manages transformations at scale
sessions.description: This session will explore how to manage innovation at scale and improve developer experience in a large engineering org where change is the only constant. Over the last decade, Spotify has evolved from monoliths to microservices, on-premise to cloud native and K8s, a handful of software migrations a year to thousands, and manual coding to increasing automation and LLMs. Spotify developers work through these evolutions in their integrated development environment (IDE) and Backstage, our internal developer portal (IDP). For Spotify, source control is a source of truth — not just for code, but for ownership and more — which gives us insights into our orgs and our ways of working. In this session, we will explore how our integrations (with our repos) have helped shape these migrations through massive technological and organizational shifts, made one PR at a time.

speakers.bio: David Rubin is a technologist currently working at Spotify as an Engineering Manager owning the VCS space. He lives in Berlin with his partner and two cats. He is an avid reader and can often be found sitting by in the sun reading a book.

sessions.title: Blazor Unleashed: The Future of .NET Web Development
sessions.description: Blazor is revolutionizing .NET web development by allowing developers to build full-stack applications with C#—no JavaScript required. But how does it really perform in production? In this session, we’ll explore Blazor’s strengths, weaknesses, and best practices for high-performance applications. From WebAssembly to Server-side Blazor and even Hybrid scenarios, we’ll cover the latest advancements, optimization techniques, and real-world use cases. Whether you're a .NET pro or new to Blazor, this talk will challenge the way you think about web development and show why Blazor is more than just a framework—it’s the future.

speakers.bio: Christian Giesswein has studied Business Informatics in Vienna and is developing with .NET since he has been a child. He is speaking for years in the German area about .NET, the CLR and in special about WPF. In Austria he has founded his company "Giesswein Software-Solutions" (www.software.tirol) and is developing software in the Austrian Alps.

sessions.title: Accessibility Test Driven Development
sessions.description:
Accessibility should not be an afterthought—it should be an integral part of our development and testing workflow. In this talk, we’ll explore Accessibility Test Driven Development (A-TDD) and how developers can leverage existing tools to ensure accessibility from the start.
Many accessibility issues can be caught early using tools already built into our browsers, such as color contrast checkers and source order visualization. But we can take this further with automated testing. We'll look at the accessibility-first mindset of Testing Library, unit testing for accessibility using jest-axe, and how we can integrate CI/CD tools like Lighthouse CI and pa11y to catch issues before they reach production.
By the end of this session, you’ll walk away with practical strategies and tooling recommendations to embed accessibility checks seamlessly into your development pipeline—making your applications not only more inclusive but also more robust.

speakers.bio: Maria is a developer, trainer, book author and consultant specializing in Angular and accessibility. As a certified software architect, she writes blog posts for ng-conf and speaks at meetups and conferences. She co-organised the German-speaking Angular conference ng-de (2022) and heise Accessibility Day (2024). For her community contributions, she has been recognized as a Google Developer Expert by Google.
speakers.tagline: Frontend Technology Lead at Korneeva - IT Solutions

sessions.title: One AI API to Power Them All
sessions.description:
Llama Stack unifies the core components of AI development into a single, cohesive API, eliminating the complexity of managing multiple disconnected tools. In this session, we’ll show how Llama Stack provides a standardized approach to inference, RAG, agent workflows, tool integration, safety measures, evaluations, and telemetry—all within a flexible plugin-based architecture.
Through live demos, we’ll demonstrate how developers can build and deploy AI applications seamlessly across different environments, from local machines to cloud and on-prem infrastructure. We’ll also explore how Llama Stack integrates with Kubernetes and OpenShift, providing a scalable, enterprise-grade foundation for running AI workloads efficiently. Whether using the CLI, SDKs for Python and TypeScript, or mobile interfaces for iOS and Android, Llama Stack enables developers to build production-ready AI applications with minimal overhead.

speakers.bio:
I’m Roberto Carratalá, an IT professional with more than ten years of experience in the industry of AI, Linux, Cloud, DevOps and Kubernetes/OpenShift.

Currently I am working as a Principal AI Platform Architect for Red Hat working in the AI Business Unit, focused in OpenShift AI, Cloud Services, DevSecOps, CICD and MLOps, helping the customers to achieve their goals and objectives with linux, cloud and containers in public and private environments.
speakers.tagline: Principal AI Architect at Red Hat

sessions.title: AI-Powered Code Documentation: Simplify the Complex
sessions.description: Code documentation is essential yet often neglected due to time constraints and repetitive effort. In this session, we explore how Large Language Models (LLMs) can revolutionize this process by automatically generating accurate and context-aware documentation. Learn how to implement AI-driven documentation tools to maintain consistency, enhance team collaboration, and reduce the burden of manual documentation. This session includes practical workflows, real-world examples, and best practices to make documentation a seamless part of your development cycle.

speakers.bio: Patrick Schnell is a distinguished computer scientist and acclaimed author specializing in the integration of AI into software development and business-processes. With a solid foundation in computer science, Patrick has dedicated his career to exploring the transformative potential of AI and Large Language Models (LLMs) within the software industry.

sessions.title: Level Up with Python: Building a Shooter Game Live with PyGame
sessions.description:
Ready to see how easy and fun it is to build a game in Python? Join me for a live coding session where we’ll walk through creating a simple shooter game using PyGame, a popular Python library for 2D game development. Whether you’re new to Python or an experienced developer looking to explore game development, this session is perfect for anyone curious about building 2D games from scratch with Python.

In the live demon, we’ll cover the basics of setting up a game loop, adding player movement, implementing shooting mechanics, and introducing enemies. All while explaining the core principles of PyGame. Watch as we transform Python code into a fully functional game.

By the end of the session, you’ll have a solid understanding of how to start your own PyGame projects, whether you're looking to build games as a hobby or get a taste for game development. This is a perfect session for coders from other languages, new Python learners, or anyone interested in the world of PyGame.

speakers.bio:
Louëlla Creemers is a software developer from The Netherlands, with a passion for .NET development. At the early stage of her career she’s also a successful content creator, teacher, blogger, and public speaker. 

She has built a strong following of over 30,000 people on social media, thanks to her technical expertise and her commitment to helping others learn and grow in their careers. You can find her on Twitter and Linkedin, sharing different kinds of educational posts or dad jokes.

sessions.title: A Practical Guide to Reducing Bundle Size
sessions.description:
When it comes to bundle size, less really is more! But how do we ensure that our code can be effectively tree-shaken and minimised? 

There are common code patterns that break tree-shaking and prevent minification from doing much at all. Let me share practical insights from my experience optimising a component library that will help you do the same and shed the excess from your bundles.

The talk is split into 2 halves: tree-shaking / minification. 

Will explain tree-shaking then show coding patterns that prevent the bundler from being able to drop code. 
Will then cover sideEffects / pure code annotations.
Then how to test tree shaking is working and demo source-map-explorer.

Then will cover minification and how to optimise what the bundler can minify. #private variables unlock great savings but there are issues with downleveling for older build targets. 

The talk finishes with a quick overview of different build tools and the speed / size trade off.

speakers.bio: Stephen is a Senior Developer at AG Grid. An active blogger writing about Web Tech. Stephen has spoken at conferences and meet-ups worldwide, sharing practical and experience-based tips, tricks, and case studies.

sessions.title: Evaluating AI models for code comprehension
sessions.description:
With so many AI models out there, which one is actually the best at understanding code?

As we've built Graphite Reviewer, our high-signal AI-powered code review companion, we've run thousands of tests, gotten tons of feedback from users, and have extensively examined how these various models perform in real world scenarios.

In this talk we'll explore the nuances between these models, how they perform specifically in relation to code comprehension, and finally answer the question: which AI model should developers be using?

This talk will include a deep dive into the various experiments we've run on AI code comprehension, comparing all of the top AI models today, and an exploration of the results and data we’ve collected.

speakers.bio: Merrill is the co-founder & CEO of Graphite, the code review platform for the age of AI. Thousands of engineers at high-growth companies like Shopify, Datadog, Snowflake, and Ramp use Graphite on top of their GitHub repos every day to ship pull requests faster. Prior to Graphite, Merrill worked on product & engineering teams at Square, Oscar, and Clay, and founded Posmetrics (YC W13, acquired). He studied Applied Math at Harvard and enjoys running, climbing, DJing, and contemporary art.

sessions.title: Putting Developer Experience at the Heart of Tech Recruiting
sessions.description:
In this talk Linda & Markus (Experience One) and Jannis (Finanz Informatik) will unpack how an authentic depiction of your company's developer experience can reinvent your tech recruiting strategy.
They will underscore the importance of moving away from overly-polished portrayals of your company and towards genuine representation of the developer's work and journey. It's about how your current tech team feels about working at your company, what are they passionate about and how closely that matches what you communicate to potential recruits.
In essence, this talk advocates for a shift in perspective - start with the actual developer experience and work backwards to shape your recruiting strategy.

speakers.bio: Linda is a Strategic Advisor specializing in the field of enterprise innovation. She is co-founder and MD at Experience One, a digital agency focusing on innovative technologies for designing and scaling new and better CX for companies like Mercedes-Benz, BOSCH, AOK and FI. She focuses on strategic consulting and positioning of changemakers as well as in the implementation of customer centric change programs to create a sustainable culture of innovation. She benefits from her many years of experience in rollout and architecture consulting for the major digital platforms of large enterprises.
speakers.tagline: Managing Director at Experience One AG

speakers.bio: Markus Stauffenberg is leadership coach, change management advisor, and entrepreneur with over 20 years of experience helping leaders to create impact in their organizations. As co-founder of Experience One, founder of Aseus, and the creator of the 'How to Pitch CX'-Community, he has assisted numerous companies in navigating successful digital and customer-centric transformations. As expert in effective change management and leadership communication, he is also a passionate mentor, having trained teams in startups, universities, and corporate settings.
speakers.tagline: Changemaker Coach and Co-Founder of Experience One

speakers.bio:
Jannis Eickenroth has been working for Finanz Informatik (FI) since 2014 and currently leads the department responsible for the Data & Analytics Platform.

In the early years, Jannis was involved both in backend development on the mainframe and in Java development for frontends and middleware on client/server systems. Over time, he took on the role of project manager and played a key part in introducing new software technologies for OSPlus—the core banking system used by the savings banks.

Now, Jannis supports a fantastic team at FI, working to ensure that Finanz Informatik’s technical ecosystem for data, analytics, and AI is secure and modern, ready for the future.

Outside of work, Jannis enjoys spending time on his mountain bike.
speakers.tagline: Head of Analytics and Customer Engagement at Finanz Informatik

sessions.title: Introduction to Temporal with Go
sessions.description:
Failures are inevitable, but they don't have to be disruptive. Temporal is an open source Durable Execution platform that enables you to build scalable distributed applications that can overcome service outages, software defects, and even hardware failures.

During this hands-on workshop, which requires no prior knowledge of Temporal, you'll learn the basics of Temporal application development using the Go programming language. You'll begin by learning key concepts, continue by writing code that uses Temporal's core APIs, and finish by observing how your application handles common failure scenarios at runtime.

speakers.bio: Alternating between software engineering and technical education roles, Tom Wheeler's career spans more than 25 years in the financial, healthcare, defense, and tech industries. Prior to joining Temporal in 2022, he wrote training courses at Cloudera, developed aerospace engineering software at Object Computing, helped create a distributed system for high-volume data processing at WebMD, and built some of the earliest web applications at brokerage firm A.G. Edwards.
speakers.tagline: Principal Curriculum Developer and Developer Advocate at Temporal Technologies

sessions.title: Multithreaded Node.js
sessions.description:
The statement 'Node.js is single-threaded' is a simplification that hides its true power for high-performance applications. While excelling at I/O, Node's event loop can be blocked by a single CPU-intensive task, leading to catastrophic performance degradation and systems that fail to scale. How can developers overcome this fundamental challenge to build truly responsive applications?
This hands-on workshop provides the answer. Forget passive lectures; prepare to roll up your sleeves and code through a series of progressive challenges. We will begin by experiencing the problem firsthand, building a server that buckles under a demanding workload. From that starting point, you will systematically refactor, benchmark, and progress toward sophisticated, production-ready, multithreaded solutions. You will leave with not just theory, but the hard-earned confidence to implement these powerful concurrency patterns in your projects.

Workshop requirements:
1. A working laptop with administrator credentials.
2. Having Node.js installed (preferibly with https://github.com/nvm-sh/nvm o similar). Versions 20.18.0+ or 22.5.0+ are the minimum we need.
3. A working code editor (VSCode, NeoVim, Intellij… etc).

speakers.bio: Matteo is the Co-Founder and CTO of Platformatic.dev. He is also a prolific Open Source author in the JavaScript ecosystem and modules he maintain are downloaded more than 30 billion times a year. Matteo is a member of the Node.js Technical Steering Committee focusing on streams, diagnostics and http. He is also the author of the fast logger Pino and of the Fastify web framework.
