Matteo is an renowed international speaker after more than 60 conferences, including OpenJS World, Node.js Interactive, NodeConf.eu, NodeSummit, JSConf.Asia, WebRebels, and JsDay just to name a few.

sessions.title: Learn to Build Agentic AI Workflows for Enterprise Applications
sessions.description: You'll move beyond basic agent concepts to build and experiment with configurable tools and sophisticated agentic AI workflows, drawing inspiration and techniques from common agentic frameworks. This session will guide you not only to develop an end-to-end agentic AI workflow and create specialized tools for an AI agent, but also to delve into the critical next steps. You will learn practical approaches to evaluate the performance and reliability of your agentic applications against defined objectives and profile their operational behavior to identify bottlenecks and areas for optimization. Discover how to quickly augment these intelligent workflows with new tools, significantly increasing your productivity and the value you extract when dealing with multiple enterprise data sources.

speakers.bio: Lavinia Ghita is a senior solutions architect for the financial services industry (FSI) at NVIDIA. Her work at NVIDIA focuses on applied AI research and driving the adoption of AI-driven technologies in the financial sector. Prior to joining NVIDIA, Lavinia worked on natural language processing research and applications in a quant hedge fund and in big tech.

Ziv Ilan is a Solution Architect at NVIDIA, focusing on Agentic AI, LLM evaluation, optimization, and deployment. He joined from deci.ai (acquired by NVIDIA), where he worked on Neural Architecture Search and model compression techniques for GenAI and Computer Vision models. Ziv holds an Electrical and Electronics Engineering degree from Tel-Aviv University and an MBA from HEC Paris. He leverages his technical and business expertise to drive AI solutions development and deployment.

sessions.title: Build Your First AI Assistant in 30 Minutes: No Code Workshop
sessions.description:
Ever wonder how companies are cutting hiring time in half while making candidates feel more valued than ever? In this rapid, intensive 30-minute session, you'll go from zero to building your own Custom GPT using nothing but natural language prompts—no coding required.

You'll discover the prompting frameworks behind Loop's breakthrough AI assistants: "Martha" (doubled outreach responses), "Scorecraft" (eliminates bias with data), and "Tony" (revolutionizes performance coaching).

Watch me build a working GPT live on stage, then follow along as you create your own. You'll leave with a functioning AI assistant and the proven methodology to build your very own agents.

speakers.bio:
Leandro Gomes da Silva is a pioneer in AI innovation, currently leading strategic hiring at Loop Earplugs and co-founding YOU.BUT.AI, where he’s transforming professional photography through cutting-edge technology.

His expertise spans from building Custom GPT solutions that have doubled recruitment success rates to developing “Editorial Synthography,” a groundbreaking blend of AI and human curation.

Leandro specializes in no-code approaches that make advanced AI accessible to everyone.

sessions.title: Azure AI Foundry for Developers: Open Tools, Scalable Agents, Real Impact
sessions.description:
AI is transforming how applications interact, reason, and respond—and developers are at the forefront of this shift. In this session, we’ll explore how to fuse your applications with intelligent agents using Azure AI Foundry, Microsoft’s platform for building, orchestrating, and scaling AI-native solutions.
 
You’ll learn how Azure AI empowers developers with open integration across agent SDKs and large language models (LLMs)—including both proprietary and open-source options—giving you the flexibility to choose the right tools for your stack.
 
We’ll walk through real-world architectures, integration patterns, and best practices to help you bring intelligent, adaptive behavior into your apps. Whether you're building copilots, automating workflows, or enhancing user experiences, this session is designed to inspire you to start—or continue—your journey toward building AI-enhanced applications.

speakers.bio: Oliver wrote his first lines of code in BASIC on a Commodore 16 back in primary school — and he’s been hooked on technology ever since. Over the years, he’s explored all kinds of tech, but what excites him most today are the possibilities AI and cloud computing bring to developers. Since 2018, he’s been growing the AI & Machine Learning business at Obungi, always with the goal of turning innovative technology into real-world value for customers.

sessions.title: Adding knowledge to open-source LLMs
sessions.description:
While Large Language Models are remarkably powerful, their knowledge is typically limited to the data available during training. This makes their applications challenging when business contexts, or cultural nuances change or are not well represented in their original training data. In many cases, in-context learning techniques such as retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) can help to bridge this gap by providing models with relevant information at runtime. However, when a model lacks foundational understanding of domain-specific knowledge, use case, or local cultural context, even advanced retrieval methods may fail.
In this session, NVIDIA experts will explain how to enrich language models with new knowledge, expanding their capabilities in specialized business, engineering, or scientific domains, and adjusting adaptation to new languages, cultures, and values.

speakers.bio: Sergio Perez specializes in conversational AI. He has experience in optimizing training and inference of LLMs, building retrieval-augmented generation systems, and working with companies in different sectors to leverage AI. His area of expertise at NVIDIA is quantization and inference serving. Previously, he worked as an AI engineer at Graphcore and Amazon, and got a Ph.D. in computational fluid dynamics from Imperial College London.

Harshita is a Senior Solution Architect at Nvidia, focusing on driving AI adoption among Global System Integrators. She has experience in building and deploying large language models, with a particular focus for on-device/edge applications.

sessions.title: My AI Hallucinates. The AI Mirage VS. Your Real Talent Acquisition Challenges
sessions.description:
“AI is gonna save the day” - The latest tech promises TA miracles. But are you building on solid ground? Or is your AI dream a hallucination?
Discover proven ways to achieve operational excellence and efficiency in TA - without getting lost in the AI buzz, but utilising its strategic help.

This session tackles core recruitment inefficiencies, reveals AI's real-world limitations and super-powers (beyond the hype), and provides actionable strategies for blending technology with essential human expertise. 

Leave this session confident that you can build a talent engine that consistently delivers top talent and impactful results, AI or not.

speakers.bio:
The founder of The Principal Recruiter, Andreea brings 15+ years shaping specialist talent strategies. 
Twice awarded for Global TA Innovation, she led transformative programs at Zalando & Wayfair, including building and scaling Wayfair's Tech Hub in India. 

She also leads Talent Crunch - Berlin, a thriving DACH community, from zero to 3400+ through organic growth & 23+ events so far. 

Sharing insights on hiring excellence and career growth through her website, social media, conferences and on podcasts. Beyond work, she enjoys art, architecture, design, music, dance, and painting.
speakers.tagline: Founder of The Principal Recruiter & Talent Crunch

sessions.title: Reference Architecture of AI in the Cloud
sessions.description: Discover the essential principles and best practices for deploying AI solutions in the cloud. This session will explore reference architectures that highlight key components such as data pipelines, model training, deployment strategies, and scalability. Learn how to fully leverage cloud services to create efficient, scalable, and resilient AI implementations. Ideal for architects and developers looking to build robust AI solutions, this session offers practical insights into managing AI workflows in the cloud.

speakers.bio: Radu Vunvulea is a technology enthusiast working as VP of Cloud for Endava. He has a vast experience in different technologies and industries. Most of his time is spent working with the cloud, helping companies to innovate and finding solutions to their business problems. He enjoys building bridges between people and helping others to grow. He shares his knowledge on his personal blog and at different events where he is invited as a speaker. In his spare time, he drives an IT community and he is also a Microsoft Regional Director and Microsoft Azure MVP.

sessions.title: Outsmarting the System: What Game Cheaters Can Teach Us About Cyber Security
sessions.description:
In the high-stakes world of online games, developers face a relentless cat-and-mouse game against cheaters who constantly probe for weaknesses. Behind the scenes, the most successful studios use advanced AI, real-time data streaming, behavioral baselining, and even kernel-level monitoring to detect, deter, and defeat bad actors at scale. 

In this talk, game designer John Romero explores the frontline of anti-cheat systems, not just as defensive tools for fair play, but as living models for modern cybersecurity design. Drawing on decades of experience building iconic games and securing live environments, John shares how gaming’s arms race against cheaters has produced innovations with wide application across tech. From anomaly detection and player telemetry to predictive modeling and scalable AI deployment, this session breaks down how game developers are solving problems that look a lot like cybersecurity, and what both communities can learn from each other.

speakers.bio: John is an award-winning game designer, level designer, and programmer whose work portfolio includes 130 games, of which 107 have been published commercially. John Romero has co-founded eight widely successful game companies, including id Software, Gazillion Entertainment, and Loot Drop. He co-owns Loot Drop and Romero Games. He is regarded as one of the world’s best game designers and his products have won over a hundred awards to prove it. Furthermore, John Romero is fully a self-taught designer and programmer, drawing inspiration from early Apple II programmers.

sessions.title: What Makes Open Source Work: Licensing and Beyond
sessions.description: The term "Open Source" typically refers to the license a project uses, but is having an Open Source license sufficient for a project to embody all the values commonly associated with Open Source Software? Perhaps not. In this presentation, we will discuss what other aspects of a Project need to be assessed for long-term adoption. This includes factors like the availability of binaries and quality documentation, governance structure, community size and activity, along with several other important criteria.

speakers.bio: Peter Zaitsev is an entrepreneur and co-founder of Percona, Coroot, FerretDB and other tech companies. As one of the leading experts in Open Source strategy and database optimization, Peter has applied his technical knowledge and entrepreneurial drive to contribute as a board member and advisor to several open source startups. Additionally, Peter is the co-author of the book "High Performance MySQL: Optimization, Backup and Replication," one of the most popular books on MySQL performance.

sessions.title: C# Lowering - What is it and why should I care?
sessions.description:
In the session, we will talk about "Lowering". The mystical and magical thing your C# compiler does with your code when you hit the compile button, also known as "compiler sugar".

The session aims to give you an understanding of what happens with your code and how you can predict certain behaviors (outcome-wise as well as performance-wise). Also, we will discover why certain constructs don't "really" exist (like var, using, lock, Pikachu, ...). So where are they?

We will also misuse some of the patterns to do some trickery every production code needs! After the session, you will have a better understanding of what is going on in the compiler process.

speakers.bio:
As an experienced .NET Engineer and a Microsoft MVP in Developer Technologies in the heart of Zurich, Steven Giesel bring a substantial breadth of knowledge and expertise to each project.

His enthusiasm for technology goes beyond his professional endeavors - he actively maintains various open-source libraries (for example as co-maintainer for bUnit - a unit testing library for Blazor) and frequently speaks at user groups and conferences.

 Furthermore, he has authored concise e-Books in .NET related topics, and peer-reviewed a book focused on building applications with Blazor WebAssembly.

sessions.title: 82 Bugs I Collected in a Year You Won’t Believe Made It to Production
sessions.description:
This past year, I made it my mission to collect every bug I found while using everyday apps and websites. From minor glitches to significant problems, 82 bugs somehow made it to production. These real-world examples are more than just interesting—they're also embarrassing mistakes that teach important lessons for making software more reliable and improving how we test it.

I'll explain the different types of bugs I found and what they reveal about common mistakes in software development. I'll also point out areas that are often missed but are crucial for your product's quality.

We'll look at the bugs, and I'll show you how to avoid them and improve your testing so these issues don't reach your users. Whether you want to make your code more reliable or improve your testing, this talk will give you practical tips for your next project. Join me to learn from the embarrassing mistakes even popular apps couldn't avoid—and take-home strategies to prevent them in your software!

speakers.bio: François Martin is a senior full stack software engineer at Karakun AG, living in Switzerland. He is an active open source contributor and co-author of the two open source JavaFX frameworks WorkbenchFX and PreferencesFX, an active member of the Swiss Testing Board, and participates in the working group of Advanced and Expert level at ISTQB. He is also a co-author of the ISTQB Test Analyst v4.0 and the upcoming Security Test Analyst syllabus.
speakers.tagline: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer at Karakun

sessions.title: RAG like a hero with Docling
sessions.description:
Using RAG is relatively simple, especially with libraries like LangChain4j, which provides modules for chunking, ingesting documents, and retrieving them from the vector store. However, getting satisfactory results may be more complicated. Hallucinations, inaccurate information, contradictory answers, invalid parsed data, or incomplete responses.

In this session, you’ll move your RAG knowledge to the next level using LangChain4j and Docling.

speakers.bio:
Alex Soto is a Director of Developer Experience at Red Hat. He is passionate about the Java world and software automation and believes in the open-source software model. Alex is the co-author of Testing Java Microservice, Quarkus cookbook, Kubernetes Secrets Management, GitOps cookbook, RHCE Ansible Automation Study Guide, and Applied AI for Enterprise Java Development
books and contributor to several open-source projects. A Java Champion since 2017, he is also an international speaker.
speakers.tagline: Director of Developer Experience at Red Hat

speakers.bio: Markus is a Java Champion, former Java EE Expert Group member, founder of German JavaLand, reputed speaker at Java conferences around the world, and a very well known figure in the Enterprise Java world.
speakers.tagline: Senior Principal Technical Marketing Manager at Red Hat

sessions.title: 10 commandments for vibe coding
sessions.description:
Since the launch of GPT-4, I've spent an intense and insane amount of time coding with AI. In this talk, I’ll distill everything I’ve learned from this into 10 practical rules. I’ll end with a look ahead—what the future holds as we move into the agentic future of coding and software engineering.

1. Thou shalt not rely on it too much if you are a junior.
2. Thou shalt write lots of tests.
3. Thou shalt not exceed 400 lines of code for each file.
4. Thou shalt organize your codebase well.
5. Thou shalt move slow so that you can go fast.
6. Thou shalt make architectural decisions carefully.
7. Thou shalt provide or let AI collect necessary context.
8. Thou shalt keep the provided context to a minimum.
9. Thou shalt break down a large problem into smaller ones.
10. Thou shalt go agentic.

speakers.bio: Founder of CS Dojo, a leading programming education platform with over 1.9 million subscribers on YouTube, dedicated to empowering individuals with the skills needed for a successful career in tech. Beyond YouTube, he actively shares insights and tips on coding, AI, and tech career development across various social media channels with 2+ million total followers.
speakers.tagline: Senior AI Developer Advocate at Sourcegraph

sessions.title: Reimagining app development with Low-code and AI
sessions.description: The future of app building combines speed, flexibility, and intelligence. Join this session to explore how AI-driven low-code platforms enable rapid creation of a wide range of applications—from internal dashboards and workflow tools to customer-facing portals and mobile apps—helping organizations innovate faster and more efficiently with fewer resources. Gain a solid understanding of low-code technology as an alternative to traditional software development, learn its key benefits, and discover when low-code is the ideal choice to accelerate your digital transformation.

speakers.bio: A low-code geek with 7 years at Zoho, leading the Partner Solutions team for Zoho Creator—the ultimate low-code playground. I love diving into tech, solving real-world problems, and turning ideas into impact. Always learning, always building, and always up for a good tech conversation!

sessions.title: Multithreading in Javascript: A guide to Web Workers
sessions.description:
Javascript as a single threaded language is unable to maximise the full potential of our CPUs, but there might be a solution: Web Workers.

Not without understanding all the concepts around the Javascript engine first (call stack, event loop, micro tasks, macro tasks, asynchronous functions...)  let's find a project in which multithreading could be suitable and dive into a demonstration on how to convert the single threaded code into multithreaded.

Are Web Workers the performance solution you need for you application? Do they have any downside or everything is clear and shiny? Let's find it out

speakers.bio:
I’m a Senior Software Engineer based in Barcelona working on platform apps at Dynatrace. 
I started my tech journey on a startup 9 years ago as a mobile developer, going through a couple more consultant companies touching a different stack every couple of months I finally specialised myself in frontend development. As a Tech Evangelist I’m eager to share the lessons I learned with all of you.

sessions.title: How to kill JavaScript from your Stack with HTMX and Kotlin
sessions.description:
Interactive full-stack web application often require TypeScript, a JavaScript framework, third-party libraries to handle routing and data fetching, serialization, and a database.

To reduce complexity, one alternative is using server-side HTML templating engines like Thymeleaf or Handlebars.
However, this sacrifices interactivity and composability, and it introduces the risk of breakage whenever the data model changes, due to the lack of static compilation.

In this talk, discover how to build a full-stack web application without relying on a templating or frontend frameworks.
We’ll bypass the REST APIs altogether.
Instead, experience the power of Kotlin DSLs, which allow you to write expressive, composable and type-safe code,
and achieve a user experience rivaling Single Page Applications by using HTMX for dynamic interactions.
Using a simple web application as an example, we'll explore how to do routing, page transitions, real time validation, and write components that can be reused.

speakers.bio:
Frederik started programming in 8th grade, starting out programming Lego Mindstorms/

15 years later Frederik is a Fullstack-Developer with 7 years of professional experience - 3 of those in Kotlin, developing cloud native applications for multiple big customers in the automotive, logistics and energy sector.
During this time he experimented with a lot of different languages and frameworks, developing a broad understanding of the Software development landscape. 
3 years ago he fell in love with Kotlin and has been using it as his primary language since.

sessions.title: Quantum Tech: Preparing for the Next Leap

speakers.bio:
Dr. Alexander Glätzle is CEO and co-founder of planqc, the company that is developing the first German quantum computer based on neutral atoms. As a quantum physicist with an entrepreneurial spirit, he brings quantum technology from research into practice. After working as a Senior Research Fellow at the University of Oxford and at the Centre for Quantum Technologies in Singapore, where he researched ultracold atoms and quantum annealing, he moved to industry in 2018. At a leading consultancy, he developed strategies for the use of quantum computing and blockchain before taking the next step.

Today, Glätzle is driving Europe's quantum revolution with planqc. The company secured 50 million euro investment, is developing a 1,000-qubit quantum computer for the Leibniz Supercomputing Centre and is building quantum computing power for research and industry. His vision: quantum computers ‘Made in Europe’ that solve real billion-dollar problems.

speakers.tagline: Member of the Board of Management at Terra Quantum

speakers.bio: Nina Anika Klotz is a Berlin-based journalist with a focus on business, technology, startups, and innovation. She works as lead editor with Gründerszene. Before that she has contributed to several publications such as Business Punk, and Zeit Online. With years of experience covering the startup ecosystem, Nina still enjoys telling stories on digital transformation and entrepreneurship over an over again.

sessions.title: AI & Transparency in Hiring – Bridging HR and Engineering Perspectives
sessions.description:
As AI reshapes hiring, tensions flare between HR’s drive for efficiency and engineers’ demand for transparency. This presentation reviews AI recruitment tools usage while confronting ethical dilemmas faced by both sides. Through case studies, we explore how the Hiring Side (HRMs, Recruiters, Hiring Managers included) and engineers can collaborate to build fairer systems. Learn how companies can implement explainable rubrics and hybrid assessments, while engineers ethically hack AI tools and audit for bias. Bridging code and ethics, we’ll map a future where AI enhances and not replaces human judgment, ensuring hiring is both scalable and equitable. 
 
Agenda:
The AI Hiring Landscape: Tools, Trends, and Tensions
Transparency Matters: Why Engineers and HR Clash/Collaborate
How Companies Use AI to Evaluates Code vs. How Engineers Game It
Case Studies: Wins and Fails of the Industry
Possible Solutions and Key Takeaways

speakers.bio: Tech Recruiter with 7 years in Talent Acquisition and a background in Clinical Psychology. Working closely with Software, Hardware, and Networking business units, I support strategic hiring initiatives across the EMEA region. Being a fan of data-driven and evidence-based approaches, I contribute to Talent Mapping,  Demand Analysis, and other projects to bridge the gap between business needs and top-tier talent.

sessions.title: AI Prompting for TA and HR: From Beginner to Advanced
sessions.description:
At this talk you will learn how different GenAI work with your requests. What is prompt – engineering and how to write effective prompts. 
It is a practical session, with live demo and useful use cases that can be immediately implemented. 
You’ll leave this talk equipped with a toolkit full of valuable prompting techniques—from beginner to advanced.  Suitable for all levels of experience.

speakers.bio:
Alla Pavlova, is a sourcing trainer and Interim Tech Recruiter, based in Amsterdam. Winner of "The most influential sourcer in NL" in 2022. Building tech teams from 2008 for tech startups and gaming companies like Miro, GameHouse, Viber, Dott, Blendle, Relive, and others. Currently scaling Riot Games Singapore and Sydney studios.

Also, she launched and led Slack Community Amsterdam Chapter and she is one of the volunteers who mentor and review CVs in the biggest gaming community.

sessions.title: Building your AI agent with Agent Development Kit (ADK)
sessions.description:
Join this workshop to get hands-on experience with the Agent Development Kit (ADK), the Google’s open-source framework for building flexible and powerful AI agents. 
You’ll have the opportunity to learn how ADK’s building blocks accelerate the development, testing, and evaluation of your agents. Through guided exercises, you will build a functional multi-agent application, test it locally, and deploy it to Google Cloud with the tools provided by ADK. 
Bring your laptop and some familiarity with Python.

speakers.bio: I’m a Software Engineer and a Developer Advocate at Google in London. I build tools, demos, tutorials, and give talks to educate and help developers to be successful on Google Cloud. I currently live in Greenwich, not far from the prime meridian!

sessions.title: Unlock Your Next Step as a Tech Leader - workshop for Women in Tech
sessions.description:
This interactive workshop is designed exclusively for Female Senior Engineers, Lead Engineers, and Engineering Managers. This is a unique opportunity to connect with and learn alongside other experienced women in technical leadership roles.

We will explore your growth path in tech—whether stepping into management or deepening your impact as an individual contributor. Reflect, practice, and gain clarity on what comes next.

In this hands-on, peer-driven workshop, you'll reflect on where you are in your tech career and where you want to go next. Whether you're considering a move into management or growing as a senior individual contributor, this session offers practical tools, collaborative exercises, and space for self-discovery to help you take that next step with clarity and confidence.

speakers.bio: Larisa Amariei is a Berlin-based leadership coach and engineering leader with a background in software engineering and leadership at companies like N26. Trained in somatic coaching and mindfulness, she supports leaders in sustaining high performance with grounded clarity and helps them identify their next strategic career steps.

sessions.title: Adopting GitOps for microservices delivery via Argo CD
sessions.description:
This workshop is dedicated to GitOps principles adoption with Argo CD for deploying your microservices to Kubernetes. You will learn how to set up, configure, and control the desired state of your application and streamline delivery to Kubernetes.

Key topics
- Adopting GitOps principles for your delivery
- Setup of Argo CD and observability
- Ordered deployment of microservices
- Synchronization issues resolution and reconciliation options
- Selective sync and advanced deployment scenarios

Join this short workshop to learn about GitOps and how it can help you with Kubernetes delivery on any cloud. 

https://github.com/staslebedenko/argocd-workshop

speakers.bio: Stas Lebedenko is a full-stack cloud architect and platform engineer at Solidify AB. He is also a co-organizer of the Odesa Microsoft. NET User Group, a speaker and author, and an active member of the international and Ukraine .NET/Azure/Operations communities. He has been building and designing software for the last twenty years and has been the Microsoft Azure Most Valuable Professional since 2020.

sessions.title: Bridging the Gap: Extending Flutter Beyond its Limits
sessions.description:
Flutter is powerful, but sometimes you still hit a wall.  

This session explores practical solutions for when Flutter's core capabilities aren't enough. We'll delve into various integration methods—processes, isolates, platform channels, platform views, FFI, custom native ui, custom rendering, and more—demonstrating when and why to choose each one in real-world projects.  

Gain practical experience and tips for seamlessly integrating system-level functionalities and other languages into your Flutter applications. 

Learn how to seamlessly bridge the gap between Flutter and the underlying operating system, enabling you to tackle even the most challenging development scenarios.

speakers.bio:
With more than 15 years in development and the experience of building and working on over 200 projects for startups and multinational companies Simon has worked professionally with almost every major modern framework. From React, Angular, Vue, Ember and Svelte to Flutter, and has discovered their pros and cons.
Lately he has been deeply in love with app development using in Flutter and also Co-hosts the monthly FlutterVienna meetups.

Esra Kadah is a Senior App Developer at Antigua Mobile GmbH, co-author of Flutter Design Patterns & Best Practices (Packt, 2024), and one of the organizers behind Flutter Community AI Circle(FCAIC), Flutteristas and Flutter Berlin Meetup.

With a strong foundation in software development and a deep interest in UI/UX and design psychology 🧠, she focuses on building user-friendly, human-centered mobile experiences. Her work sits at the intersection of engineering, creativity, and empathy.

Esra is an active contributor in the global 🌍 Flutter and AI ecosystem. She explores how tools like Gemini, ChatGPT, Cursor, Firebase Studio, MCP, agentic workflows, and multimodal prompt engineering 🤖 are transforming the way developers build, scale, and reflect.

She has worked on international projects, contributed to open source, and presented at events from Istanbul to Berlin, Paris, Stockholm, Kenya, and the U.S. Blending code, content, and community with intention and care.

sessions.title: NVIDIA Expert Session: Accelerating Data Analytics Workflows on GPU Systems
sessions.description: Visit us at booth A-16 to get answers to your most pressing questions from NVIDIA technology experts, and claim a free self-paced DLI course on July 10-11.

speakers.bio: Miguel Martínez is a senior deep learning data scientist at NVIDIA, specializing in Generative AI, Recommender Systems, and Data Analytics. He is currently advancing his expertise in large language models with NVIDIA’s Advanced Deep Learning Research team, working on LLM training. Previously, he mentored students in Udacity’s Artificial Intelligence Nanodegree and brings strong experience in financial services, especially payments and channels. A dedicated, lifelong learner, Miguel is always eager to embrace new challenges.
speakers.tagline: Sr. Deep Learning Data Scientist at NVIDIA

speakers.bio: Roman is a Solutions Architect at NVIDIA specializing on accelerated data science. He specializes in helping customers deploy AI/ML based solutions. His focus is on accelerating end-to-end data science pipelines leveraging RAPIDS and RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark based solutions. Roman has a background in explainable AI and automizing credit risk solutions.

sessions.title: How Mixed Reality, Azure AI and Drones turned me into a Magician?
sessions.description: What happens when you combine a drone, an XR headset, and a multimodal AI copilot? You get magic. In this short and mind-bending session, I’ll show how I built an immersive system using Unity, Meta Quest 3, Azure OpenAI, and a real drone—where gestures summon flight, speech controls AI, and a digital twin mirrors reality. From a dancing drone  to an AI assistant (“Anna”) that sees, hears, and acts in XR

speakers.bio: I am an AI, XR expert and Microsoft MVP - As a celebrated tech-preneur, I have spoken at TED Conferences, Microsoft Build / Ignite, WeAreDevelopers World Congress, and currently working at ignore gravity, focusing on innovation and solving organizational challenges with advanced technology. My projects, which make complex tech accessible and engaging, span sectors like Cultural Heritage, Healthcare, and Creative Coding. As a multiplier for immersive technologies and AI, I am committed to fostering collaborative growth and learning worldwide.

sessions.title: Building Systems that Last
sessions.description: Dr. Werner Vogels, VP and CTO of Amazon.com, shares essential principles for building systems that endure and evolve. Drawing from Amazon’s experience with large-scale distributed systems, he demonstrates how frugality, simplicity, and asynchronous patterns create architectures capable of sustained growth and adaptation. Attendees will learn practical strategies for future-proofing their systems.

sessions.title: Collaboration Quantified: Lessons from Open Source Developer Networks
sessions.description: Is it possible to quantify collaboration? How does a single issue, pull request, or code commit contribute to establishing an effective developer network? In this talk, we will analyze millions of artifacts from multi-year open source projects, explore collaborative patterns, and connect them with recent research in organizational behavior and professional networks. The session applies results from organizational behaviors to software engineering teams, provides a framework, proposes an evidence-based perspective on measuring collaboration and practical steps to improve it.

speakers.bio: Dmitry Yanter is a technology manager with 10+ years at Deutsche Bank, known for his expertise in multiple roles such as SRE, QA, and Java development. He's also a sought-after lecturer on financial mathematics, delivering engaging and thought-provoking lectures. Dmitry is a true believer in the power of technology to drive positive change and brings a unique combination of technical expertise and passion for education to any team he joins.
speakers.tagline: Director, Technology Data and Innovation at Deutsche Bank

sessions.title: Empowering Thousands of Developers: Our Journey to an Internal Developer Platform
sessions.description:
ZEISS, a globally leading company in various industries such as semiconductor manufacturing, medical technology, measurement technology and ophthalmology, is at the forefront of digital transformation. Within ZEISS, over 6,000 developers worldwide drive innovations across a wide range of areas, including cloud applications, IoT, embedded systems, AI, and data solutions.

This diversity presents various challenges, both in the development of specific products and in the more general developer experience. These challenges involve managing large volumes of complex data, providing the necessary service infrastructure, monitoring and optimizing that infrastructure, and implementing AI technologies. All of this is done with the consideration that ZEISS developers are working on "not just" software, but also on cyber-physical systems.

In our talk, we will explain how our AI-driven platform engineering strategy creates a more agile and efficient development ecosystem that fosters innovation across various industries and addresses the stated challenges.

This platform, which is based on Kubernetes and Azure, provides a powerful foundation for self-service capabilities that allow developers to deploy applications seamlessly. By integrating Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) and a robust governance framework, we ensure that our systems are resilient and compliant.

The experiences gathered in the process of creating our platform is what we want to share. We focus in the talk on demonstrating, through a real-world example, how relieving developers in such a complex environment can look by creating "paved paths" - standardized workflows that enhance productivity and reduce friction.

speakers.bio: Studied mathematics and computer science. Software developer roles across multiple industries. Moved on to the Software Architect role and leading role. Since 09/2022 Lead Cloud Native Solution Architect at Zeiss.
speakers.tagline: Lead Cloud Native Solution Architect at Carl Zeiss AG

speakers.bio: Bruno Margula is an experienced Cloud Platform Architect with 20 years in software engineering and 10 years in cloud technologies. In his role at ZEISS he designs and helps implement scalable cloud solutions in an enterprise context  and is heavily involved in the transformation to a Platform Engineering approach within his organization.
speakers.tagline: Lead Cloud Platform Architect at Carl Zeiss AG

sessions.title: Building Multi-Tenant ASP.NET Core Applications: Best Practices and Real-World Solutions
sessions.description:
I am the owner of the open-source ABP Framework (https://github.com/abpframework/abp), a project with over 13K stars on GitHub. In this session, you will learn the basics and best practices to build multi-tenant SaaS applications based on my experiences while developing the most popular .NET app framework.  We will explore the essential architectural decisions, deployment strategies, and database isolation techniques needed to create scalable, secure, and efficient multi-tenant applications. Using ASP.NET Core code examples, I will demonstrate how to implement tenant-specific configurations and manage seamless migrations.

Whether you're new to multi-tenancy or looking to enhance your skills, this talk will provide actionable insights and proven strategies to take your development process upper.

speakers.bio: I've been a passionate .NET software architect since the early 2000s. My first application was built on QBasic. I am the co-founder of Volosoft Company, which produces tools and open-source frameworks for .NET developers. Now I'm working on the open-source ABP Framework.

sessions.title: End-to-End TypeScript: Completing the Modern Development Stack
sessions.description:
Modern applications increasingly span multiple computational layers beyond traditional client-server architectures, creating gaps in type safety and development experience that conventional full-stack approaches don't address. This session demonstrates how to extend TypeScript patterns across decentralized system boundaries to maintain code quality and developer productivity in multi-layer applications.

Attendees will learn how to extend TypeScript's type safety into decentralized technologies, maintaining the same developer experience and code quality across your entire stack.

speakers.bio: With over two decades in IT and a passion for Blockchain, GenAI and DevRel, Marco is building bridges from Web 2.0 to Web3. He specializes in community-building and enhancing developer experience through innovative tooling and education. His mission: to foster collaboration, empower developers to explore new technologies, to seek out new life and new civilizations, to boldly go where no nerd has gone before. 🦄
speakers.tagline: Senior Developer Relations Advocate at Algorand Foundation

sessions.title: Next-gen CI/CD with Gitops and Progressive Delivery
sessions.description:
You might already be using a CI/CD solution, but are you 100% sure things will roll out without a glitch once you go to production? Unfortunately differences between testing/staging and production environments are virtually unavoidable, and by extension there’s always a risk for unforeseen issues related to your production environment and/or actual load which can lead to potential disruption to your users.

Progressive delivery is the next step after Continuous Delivery to roll out your application in a controlled and automated way so you can verify and test your application in production before it becomes fully available to all your user bases.

Embrace GitOps and Progressive Delivery with techniques like blue-green, canary release, shadowing traffic, dark launches and automatic metrics-based rollouts to validate the application in production using Kubernetes and tools like Istio, Prometheus, ArgoCD, and Argo Rollouts.

Come to this session to learn about Progressive Delivery in action using Kubernetes. And to have some fun as well as we release a car racing game you can participate in :)

speakers.bio: Kevin is a Java Champion, software engineer, author and international speaker with a passion for Open Source, Java, and Cloud Native Development & Deployment practices. He currently works as developer advocate at Red Hat where he gets to enjoy working with Open Source projects and improving the developer experience. He previously worked as a (lead) software engineer at a variety of organizations across the world ranging from small startups to large enterprises and even government agencies.
speakers.tagline: Sr. Principal Developer Advocate at Red Hat

sessions.title: Startup Spotlight
HTTP headers that make your website go faster
sessions.description:
Achieving your web performance and scalability goals often requires the use of caching.  Did you know that HTTP comes with a set of built-in conventional caching mechanisms?

In this presentation, we'll take a closer look at these caching mechanisms, and the HTTP headers that are used to enforce the caching behavior.

We'll look at a typical "Cache-Control" header and dissect the various directives that this header offers.  Covering topics like TTL, tolerated staleness, caching scope, error handling and revalidation.

There are more headers that HTTP offers to control the behavior of the cache. Headers like "Vary" to set cache variations. Or "Etag" and "If-None-Match" to perform conditional revalidation. And also "Surrogate-Capability" and "Surrogate-Control" to perform edge compute logic and handle edge-side includes.

And while this is not a Varnish-specific presentation, I will be using Varnish as the implementation to showcase the power of HTTP's built-in caching capabilities.

speakers.bio:
As the Technical Evangelist at Varnish Software, Thijs Feryn focuses on web performance, software scalability, and content delivery. He demonstrates content-driven and technical messaging through presentations, videos, books, blog posts, social media posts, podcasts, and other media.

Thijs is a published author and wrote Getting Started with Varnish Cache and Varnish 6 by Example. As a public speaker, he has a track record of over 360 presentations in 25 different countries, where he is often praised for his energetic and engaging presentation style.

sessions.title: Level-Up Your Global Reach: Mastering HREFLANG for Developers
sessions.description:
Internationalization isn’t just about translation of your content — it’s about ensuring your websites are optimized for search engines across different languages and regions. HREFLANG annotations play a crucial role in making this happen, but implementing them correctly can be a challenge for developers.

Join ex-Google engineer Fili in this developer-focused session to gain a deep understanding of internationalization strategies for search engines. Learn best practices, dive into real-world case studies, and discover practical strategies to avoid common pitfalls. With Fili’s unique perspective as both a developer and technical SEO expert, you’ll walk away equipped to implement HREFLANG with confidence, enhance your international search performance, and deliver seamless user experiences across the globe.

This session is packed with actionable insights and hands-on tips tailored for developers who want to make their international websites stand out in search engine results.

speakers.bio: Fili is a technical SEO consultant, ex-Google engineer, frequent conference speaker and was a senior technical lead in the Google Search Quality team. At Search Brothers he offers SEO consulting services with SEO audits, SEO training and successfully recovers websites from Google penalties.
speakers.tagline: Technical SEO Consultant at Search Brothers

sessions.title: Confuse, Obfuscate, Disrupt: Using Adversarial Techniques for Better AI and True Anonymity
sessions.description:
In a world where algorithms dictate what we see, buy, and believe, understanding how to disrupt and manipulate them is as powerful as knowing how to build them. This session dives into adversarial techniques that challenge the assumptions of AI/ML models. By introducing noise, obfuscating data, and exploiting algorithmic learning cycles, we can uncover hidden biases and vulnerabilities in AI systems. These techniques push the boundaries of ML training, offering developers a toolkit for crafting more resilient models.

Beyond improving AI, these techniques offer a unique avenue for achieving digital anonymity. Whether you want to obfuscate your online footprint or prevent data collectors from profiling you, adversarial inputs provide a practical path forward. In this session, attendees will learn how adversarial methods can transform vision and NLP models, empower individuals to take control of their privacy, and showcase live demonstrations of these disruptive strategies in action.

speakers.bio: David is a Senior AI/ML Engineer within the Office of the CTO at NetApp, where he’s dedicated to empowering developers to build, scale, and deploy AI/ML solutions in production environments. He brings deep expertise in building and training models for applications like NLP, vision, real-time analytics, and even models to classify diseases in a medical setting. His mission is to help users build, train, and deploy AI models efficiently, making advanced machine learning accessible to users of all levels.

sessions.title: Unlocking Value from Data: The Key to Smarter Business Decisions

speakers.tagline: Chief Data Technologist at E.ON Digital Technology

speakers.bio: Taqi Jaffri is a product leader at UiPath, focusing on agentic automation solutions that integrate AI agents with robotic process automation (RPA) to enhance enterprise productivity. With a background in physics and computer science from Stanford University, Jaffri brings a deep technical foundation to his role. Prior to joining UiPath, he co-founded Docugami, where he worked on AI-driven document engineering. He previously held product leadership positions at Microsoft, contributing to the Windows platform and AI technologies for retail experiences.
speakers.tagline: Senior Director Product Management at UiPath

speakers.bio:
Farooq Sheikh is the Global Head of Industries at Cloudflare. Farooq is an operating executive with 20 years of experience building and scaling industries across fast growth companies. Farooq regularly advises the C-suite and boards of Fortune 500 companies on cybersecurity, AI and technology transformation.
At Cloudflare, Farooq leads the company's efforts to build and serve industries, to drive thought leadership, and to expand Cloudflare’s presence across C-suite and boardrooms. Prior to Cloudflare, Farooq led GTM at Unqork, a Codeless Application Cloud company, focused on transforming Fortune 500 companies' technology capabilities. Previously, Farooq was a partner at Oliver Wyman, where led the digital advisory business across industries.
speakers.tagline: Global Head of Industries at Cloudflare

speakers.bio: Tomislav is the CTO and partner at Nephos, a company that supports digital transformation for clients globally. Before Nephos, Tomislav spent 13 years at Microsoft, most recently as a technology strategist for partners integrating Microsoft's technology and cloud services. He has collaborated with various companies, from startups to large enterprises, aiding developers and system engineers in adopting the latest technologies. His focus areas include AI, cloud technologies, microservices, DevOps, Data and IoT. He frequently shares knowledge through workshops and conferences.

sessions.title: Raising Young Coders
sessions.description: Teaching kids programming at a young age is really important to improve diversity in the field of computer science. Studies show that after middle school most students have already made up their mind about a career in computers, so having a positive introduction to computers at a young age is really important. I teach workshops for underprivileged kids around the world at events like CNCF Kids Day and want programming to be fun and engaging just like how I learned to program. I will share some of the techniques I use to get kids excited about technology, which you can use to teach your own kids or others.

speakers.bio: Cassandra Chin is a keynote speaker, book author, podcast host, children's workshop instructor, and a computer science student. She has been teaching technology kids workshops at international conferences since she was 13 years old and is passionate about helping allow women, minorities, and underprivileged students to learn about technology. Her books have been featured at international events like Kubecon + CloudNativeCon and in popular technology shows like theCUBE and Techstrong TV.

sessions.title: Personal Branding for Top HR Professionals
sessions.description:
In this talk, I’ll share how to stand out on LinkedIn (without being cringe). It sounds simple, but it takes work and a clear strategy. A strong social media presence can bring you better candidates, stronger brand recognition, more visibility, and even career opportunities. It all depends on what you’re looking to achieve.

I’ll break down the exact approach that helped me reach 45,000 followers and become a LinkedIn Top Voice. From content strategy to consistency and engagement, I’ll explain how I use LinkedIn to attract talent and connect with decision-makers and how you can do the same. Almost anyone can build a strong personal brand, and in this session, I’ll show you how to start.

Ready to improve your LinkedIn game? Join us.

speakers.bio:
In 2022, I decided to open Hiire to help companies to hire better tech talent with a focus on providing an amazing candidate experience. 
I worked for companies like Feedzai, Mercedes-Benz.io and Adyen. Hired +500 IT professionals, created Employer Branding projects from zero and coached recruitment teams to help them go to their next level in PT, GER and NL.
I'm helping great professionals find better jobs with personalised coaching.  Currently w/ 40k followers on LK, I share content regarding careers & recruitment.

sessions.title: The Psychology of Success – What People That Seem to Always Get Ahead Do Right
sessions.description:
Some people just always seem to be more successful than others - why is that? We look at facts from psychology research that explain what makes extraordinary success possible. Small spoiler: Diligence and competence are important, but not decisive. 
Why is it worth taking a look at this session? Three reasons: first, to understand why you are exactly where you are in your career, second, to reflect on what success means to you personally - and third, to take away concrete ideas to advance your career (if you want to) that you can implement immediately.

speakers.bio: Dr. Fanny Jimenez studied psychology and neuroscience in Berlin and the USA before completing her doctorate at the International Max Planck Research School/Humboldt University in Berlin. She specialized in the psychology of personality and social relationships. She has been Chief of Staff at Business Insider Germany since 2023 and heads the audio team, having previously been responsible for the Career, Life and Science department. She has also worked for Stern, Deutschlandfunk and Spektrum among others and was an editor in the Science department at Welt/Welt am Sonntag for several years.

sessions.title: How to bulletproof your remote leadership
sessions.description: Leading remotely comes with unique challenges—miscommunication, disengagement, and a lack of trust can quietly weaken team performance. But great remote leadership isn’t about micromanaging or endless Zoom calls; it’s about clarity, connection, and culture. In this talk, we’ll explore the key mistakes leaders make, practical strategies to build a thriving remote team, and how to create a high-performance environment—no matter where your team is. Walk away with actionable insights to lead with confidence and impact in the remote world.

speakers.bio: With 20+ years in Global Talent Acquisition and Employer Branding, I have built high-performing teams across industries and led global remote teams for 6+ years. Passionate about community building, I’ve founded several HR and recruitment groups to foster collaboration and growth. I’ve also served as a jury member for employer branding competitions. As an international speaker and panelist, I share insights on recruitment, sourcing, employer branding, and the future of work, helping organizations attract and retain top talent while strengthening their ability to lead remote teams effectively.
speakers.tagline: Global Talent Acquisition Leader at Recruitment Thursday & Cohorts

sessions.title: Beyond Chatbots: How to build Agentic AI systems
sessions.description: As AI continues to evolve, we will a shift from static chatbots to dynamic agentic AI systems capable of autonomous reasoning, tool integration, and multi-step problem-solving. This talk explores how to design AI agents that leverage structured outputs, function calling, and workflow orchestration to solve enterprise-scale challenges. It bridges theoretical concepts with hands-on implementation strategies, covering multi-agent collaboration, evaluation frameworks, and scaling considerations for real-world deployments.

speakers.bio: Philipp Schmid is a Senior AI Developer Relations Engineer at Google DeepMind working on Gemini, Gemma with the mission to help every developer and builder to create and benefit from AI in a responsible way.
speakers.tagline: AI Developer Experience at Google DeepMind

sessions.title: Introducing Digital Samba Embedded Video Conferencing API MCP Server
sessions.description:
We're excited to announce the release of the Digital Samba Embedded API MCP Server, a tool that brings the full capabilities of Digital Samba's powerful video conferencing API to AI assistants like Claude Desktop or AI Coding assistants in IDEs like Cursor, Windsurf or VS Code.

With over 95 API endpoints now accessible through simple conversational commands, we are making it possible to control every aspect of your video conferencing environment using natural language.

In this session, I’ll introduce you to our secure, European-built white-label video conferencing API and give you a glimpse into the future of enabled through the power of and API MCP.

We’ll do some light customisation via branding and feature toggles and adapt the experience to some typical scenarios, like 1:1 tutoring, tele-health consultations, group meetings or large scale events and webinars.

Digital Samba is proudly European, fully GDPR-compliant, privacy-first, and using only European sub-processors.

speakers.bio: Born and raised in Austria, studied in UK, I moved to Barcelona, Spain in 2002 where I started working on Digital Samba with two of my friends that same year. Depending on when you read this, I therefore have 23-ish years experience in building and managing video conferencing software.

sessions.title: DataForce Studio
sessions.description:
In today's fast-paced business environment, the ability to swiftly develop and deploy AI solutions is crucial. In this talk we will explain how DataForce Studio enables organizations to transition from raw data to production-ready AI models in just hours.
We'll also discuss how DataForce Studio takes a fundamentally different approach from many traditional platforms by prioritizing openness and privacy: it operates on users' infrastructure, eliminating risks associated with cloud-based data transfers, and makes all artifacts exportable in standard open formats.

speakers.bio: Iryna is a data scientist and co-founder of DataForce Solutions, a company specialized in delivering end-to-end data science and AI services. She contributes to several open-source libraries, and strongly believes that open-source products foster a more inclusive tech industry, equipping individuals and organizations with the necessary tools to innovate and compete.

Oleh is a Data Scientist and co-founder of DataForce Solutions, a company specializing on Data Science, Machine Learning and AI. Additionally, he is a maintainer of several open-source projects including Scikit-LLM and Juvio.

sessions.title: distil labs – small model training, made simple
sessions.description:
SLMs (small language models) are all the rage, but working with them in practice can be very cumbersome...
In this session Selim will explain how anyone can create their own custom small model in just a day, no previous ML experience required!

speakers.bio:
distil labs is a developer platform that allows anyone to create custom small language models (SLMs) with very minimal training data and no ML skills required.

In cases where compute is limited, privacy is a priority, latency budgets are low or costs are a serious consideration – using specialized SLMs is the way to go. 

Using the distil labs platform you can create your own SLM in a matter of hours. 
Such models can achieve comparable accuracy to LLMs when specialized to your task, even though they are just a fraction of the size.

sessions.title: Debugging in the Dark
sessions.description: Bug trackers were supposed to help us. Instead, they often leave developers in the dark, chasing vague reports, reproducing edge cases, and reading logs like detectives at a crime scene. In this talk, we’ll break down the hidden cost of poor-quality bug reports, the myth of efficient debugging, and why fixing symptoms is not the same as solving root causes. We’ll explore how modern tools and AI are transforming debugging with context-rich reports, execution tracing, and code-level fix suggestions. If you’re tired of “it works on my machine” and late-night debugging marathons, this talk is for you. It’s time to rethink how we ship quality.

sessions.title: Building Better Apps with React Native
sessions.description:
React Native is the most popular cross-platform app development framework to date, and - if used correctly - allows you to build fast apps, faster.
By combining the development speed of JavaScript, the ease of use of React, and the performant hybrid layer of React Native, you can ship high quality apps in no time.

In this talk I will go over the state-of-the-art technologies in the ecosystem, demo advanced libraries like VisionCamera and Skia to build a realtime 60 FPS face blurring app, and showcase Nitro Modules - the fastest way to build native modules for React Native.

speakers.bio: Marc Rousavy is an entrepreneur, CEO at Margelo - a high-end React Native app development agency - and React Native core contributor and maintainer of a lot of popular open-source libraries in the React Native ecosystem such as react-native-vision-camera, Nitro Modules, and react-native-mmkv.

sessions.title: The Deichmann RPA journey: Step by step with low-code automation to success
sessions.description: The digital transformation at Deichmann is a living reality. The presentation provides a practical insight into the development and use of robotic process automation (RPA) in the Deichmann Group. It will shed light on the technological foundations, economic effects and use cases that are already leading to efficiency gains today. For us, RPA is more than just a tool for automating repetitive tasks - it is a strategic lever for relieving employees and increasing process quality. We use use cases to demonstrate its use in data processing, reporting and system integration. The next evolutionary stage is agentic AI: autonomous, AI-controlled agents that perform tasks, make decisions and adapt. In combination with generative AI, new possibilities arise, e.g. in forecasting, text creation, customer communication and campaign automation. The presentation shows how Deichmann is already using these technologies today and which organizational, ethical and technological issues play a role in this

speakers.bio: Tobias is 36 years old and from Duisburg. He has been working intensively with Robotic Process Automation (RPA) since 2018 and has been a Senior RPA Consultant at Deichmann since 2023. With his commercial background, he is a successful career changer who successfully contributes his diverse experience to the digitalization and automation of business processes.

Niklas was born in Essen and has been part of Deichmann IT since 2019. As team leader, he is responsible for the diverse and exciting areas of automation with RPA, enterprise content management and SAP Basis. In this role, he is actively shaping the digital future of Deichmann.

sessions.title: Boost your coding productivity with Github Copilot Agent
sessions.description: This year, Github introduced the agent mode for GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio Code, announcing the general availability of Copilot Edits, and providing a first look at our SWE agent. In this talk, we will demonstrate the difference between the three modes and show the advantages to use the agent mode. In agent mode, Copilot will iterate on not just its own output, but the result of that output. And it will iterate until it has completed all the subtasks required to complete your prompt. Instead of performing just the task you requested, Copilot now has the ability to infer additional tasks that were not specified but are also necessary for the primary request to work.

speakers.bio: Alexander Wachtel has been recognized as a Microsoft AI MVP since 2020 for his community work in AI area. During his Ph.D. research at the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT), he has published several AI papers in the area of Human-Computer-Interaction, Natural Language Processing & Cognitive Services. Furthermore, he is still teaching agile software engineering at the KIT using Azure DevOps. Due to his teaching activities at the KIT, he was also awarded as a Microsoft Innovative Educator (MIE) expert from 2016 to 2019. Due to his many years of experience, he has been also honored as a Microsoft Certified Trainer (MCT) since 2013. He provides Microsoft consulting for the industry and public sector, and teaches classes for Microsoft Certified Azure Solutions Architect Expert and Microsoft 365 Certified Administrator Expert.

Julia is a full-stack dev, sr software engineer, software architect, cloud solution architect, technology specialist & feminist - web & frontend development have a special place in her ❤️. Currently she is working as Global Black Belt for Developer Productivity at Microsoft. No one knows what that means, not even Julia from time to time. Just see her as an SME to talk about all questions about developer velocity, productivity and happiness. :)

sessions.title: The AI-Ready Stack: Rethinking the Engineering Org of the Future

speakers.bio:
Mirko Novakovic is a serial entrepreneur and observability expert, currently serving as the founder and CEO of Dash0 – an OpenTelemetry-native observability platform built to cut through noise, reduce cost, and bring clarity to modern software systems. Prior to Dash0, he co-founded Instana, a leading application performance management solution acquired by IBM in 2020.
With over 15 years of experience at the intersection of software engineering, DevOps, and AI, Mirko is passionate about building tools that empower developers to move fast without losing control. He is also an active angel investor with New Forge, backing more than 80 B2B SaaS startups across Europe.

Alex Laubscher is the Field CTO at Windsurf, where he leads customer strategy and enables enterprises to adopt AI-driven development practices at scale. With deep expertise in deploying AI solutions and a strong background as an engineering leader and entrepreneur, Alex focuses on aligning engineering excellence with strategic business outcomes.

Keno is a Principal Consultant and Head of AI at SQUER, where he drives AI initiatives and contributes to the company’s strategic direction. 

He holds a Master’s in IT and Cognition from the University of Copenhagen, specializing in machine learning, NLP, and software architecture. His experience spans AI-driven solutions, full-stack development,  and blockchain, with leadership roles across fintech and AI product development.

He thrives on solving complex challenges, leading high-performance teams, and pushing the boundaries of AI and software innovation.
speakers.tagline: Principal Consultant & Head of AI at SQUER

sessions.title: Streaming AI Responses in Real-Time with SSE in Next.js & NestJS
sessions.description:
Instant AI responses are crucial for modern applications, but traditional real-time data streaming methods like WebSockets and polling can introduce unnecessary complexity and overhead. What if there was a more efficient way?

This session dives into Server-Sent Events (SSE) with Next.js & NestJS as a lightweight, scalable alternative for real-time AI interactions. We’ll compare SSE vs WebSockets vs Polling, explore performance trade-offs, and implement a real-time AI-powered app that streams responses dynamically.
What You’ll Learn:

- Why SSE? How it compares to WebSockets & Polling.
- Hands-on Demo: Building an AI-powered app that streams responses in real-time.
- Performance Optimization: Reducing API overhead and improving response times.

speakers.bio: Software Development Head specializing in browser extensions, scalable web architectures, and cloud technologies. CTO, Applications Engineering Manager, and co-founder of a software solutions company delivering 37 projects across various industries. A seasoned speaker at events like the International JavaScript Conference, Lisbon JS, React Berlin, and GitNation conferences, I deliver engaging talks on React, metaframeworks, and cross-platform solutions. Passionate about innovation, I excel in leading teams and bridging technology with business strategy.
speakers.tagline: Software Development Head at Soki AG

sessions.title: AI in Action: Real Use Cases with Real Impact

speakers.bio: Michael is the Chief Product Officer of SAP Business Technology Platform. His team prioritizes security, reliability, and next-generation user experience for SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP). As SAP’s leading platform, SAP BTP offers the technical foundation essential for driving customer success and enabling Generative AI- powered applications. Additionally, Michael’s team is responsible for the success of core products such as SAP Build, SAP Integration Suite, SAP HANA Cloud and SAP BTP ABAP environment. He joined SAP in 2006 as a Research Associate and has since advanced through various technical leadership roles, including Development Manager and Senior Vice President and Managing Director of SAP Labs Dresden. He has a strong passion for software architecture and fosters close collaboration across all boundaries. Michael holds a Ph.D. in computer science and a diploma in media computer science from Technische Universität Dresden. A father of four, Michael lives with his family in Dresden. Follow Michael Ameling on social media.
speakers.tagline: CPO of SAP Business Technology Platform

speakers.bio:
Hanna Hennig has been Chief Information Officer at Siemens AG since January 2020 and is driving the digitalization of the international technology company. She is a passionate technologist with more than 30 years of experience in IT. Throughout her career, she has supported and led various companies on their way through business and digital transformation, including Osram, Telefonica O2, E.ON, Robert Bosch and Cap Gemini. 

As counselor of the BDI/ Bitkom initiative #SheTransformsIT, Hanna Hennig advocates for more gender equality in STEM and promotes IT talents in business as Deputy Chairwoman of the CIO Foundation - WHU. She is also committed to establishing sustainability standards in IT as a member of the advisory board of the non-profit organization SustainableIT.org and acts as an advisor for several technology companies and associations such as IDC, AWS, VOICE, Mendix, Next47 and the “Hamburg IT-Strategietage“.

Mike Butcher MBE is formerly the Editor-at-large for TechCrunch. He’s also co-founder of Pathfounder editorial events and reports series on ‘impact innovation’, The Europas Awards, TechForUK, TechVets, Techfugees and TechHub. You can follow his writing for TechCrunch here, subscribe to his newsletter here, follow him on Twitter at @mikebutcher, Instagram, LinkedIn, Presubscribe and email him on mike@mikebutcher.me

sessions.title: Functional Programming in C++
sessions.description:
Functional programming is a declarative way of writing programs by composing functions. In many situations, this can lead to code that is easier to write and understand and less error-prone. However, it requires a shift to a more functional mindset.
This talk gives an introduction to functional programming in C++ using the modern standard library. We will cover algorithms using `std::ranges`, composable error handling with `std::optional` and `std::expected`, algebraic data types, and separating IO from computation. In the end, we'll even cover the M-word.

speakers.bio: Jonathan is a Software Engineer at think-cell. There, he is responsible for maintaining think-cell's core libraries, which include a custom range library, a fast and convenient JSON parser, and many other utilities and data structures to write elegant C++ code. Before working at think-cell, he wrote many useful open-source C++ libraries. He is also a member of the C++ standardization committee, where he serves as the assistant chair for std::ranges, and a frequent conference speaker.

sessions.title: Securing the Future: Trust, Policy, and Governance in Agentic Workflows
sessions.description: Agentic applications are redefining software delivery, from dev to serverless production, but they are also breaking traditional security and governance models. How do we secure workflows run by autonomous agents? How do we manage identity, policy, and compliance when models make runtime decisions? Meanwhile, developers are drowning in CVEs, patching nonstop, and overwhelmed by noisy scanners offering little insight. This panel dives into the critical challenges of trust, policy, and vulnerability management in the age of AI-powered systems, and what it will take to build agentic apps that are secure, compliant, and production-ready by design.

speakers.bio: Michael is an engineer-turned-product leader with a focus on building enterprise applications for some of the world’s largest companies, currently Docker. With over 15 years of experience, his mission is to deliver real business value by ensuring product teams release working code that solves critical needs. Michael has held senior product management roles at leading tech companies, including Sauce Labs and Aquicore, and holds a Master of Science in Computer Science from Johns Hopkins University.
speakers.tagline: Vice President of Product Management at Docker

sessions.title: Justice for All! Diving into JsTz, a Native JavaScript Environment for Web3 Development
sessions.description: In this session, we’ll explore how Jstz allows JavaScript developers to build on Tezos Smart Rollups using the language, tools, and libraries they already know. By offering a native JavaScript runtime that supports standard APIs and leverages the npm ecosystem, Jstz removes the usual barriers that come with blockchain development. We’ll walk through the developer journey — from writing your first lines of code to integrating existing JavaScript libraries — and show how familiar workflows can now extend into the decentralised space with minimal friction.

speakers.bio: Arthur Breitman, the co-founder of Tezos, is a computer scientist and entrepreneur. Arthur has a background in mathematics and computer science, and prior to the Tezos project, he worked in quantitative finance at Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley, and as a research engineer at Google and Waymo. Arthur graduated from the École Polytechnique and the Courant Institute of NYU where he studied applied mathematics. Arthur is a member of the Tezos Foundation Council and is also a director at Trilitech, a London-based adoption team for the Tezos blockchain.

sessions.title: Navigating Application Modernization - Leveraging Gen-AI
sessions.description: This talk presents an approach that utilizes static code analysis using Konveyor.io (CNCF Sandbox project) coupled with Large Language Models (LLMs) to facilitate automated code transformation. Our method comes from the tool "Kai", which analyzes static code to pinpoint areas within source code requiring modification. Kai uses the power of LLMs to generate code changes to resolve identified incidents. It eliminates the need for fine-tuning LLMs. Instead, it augments the knowledge of LLMs with Konveyor data through prompt engineering (few shots) and the use of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG). This session includes a demo showcasing how a legacy application is migrated and then deployed to Kubernetes using the power of Kai.

speakers.bio:
Shaaf is a Principal Architect at Red Hat. A contributor to Konveyor community a CNCF Sandbox project.
Mostly developing code with Java, Node and recently AI/ML. For the last 15 years, he has helped customers create and adopt open source solutions for applications, cloud and managed service, continuous integration environments, and frameworks. Shaaf is a technical editor at InfoQ and spends his time writing about Kubernetes, Security and Java

sessions.title: Oh S***! There's a New Accessibility Law and I'm Not Ready!
sessions.description:
As web developers, it’s all too common to feel overwhelmed by constant changes in legal requirements. This talk dives into how we can respond effectively to the new European Accessibility Act without falling into a panic. 

We’ll start by understanding why accessibility is so important - not only to avoid legal trouble but also to create a more inclusive digital world. Next, we’ll break down the latest changes in regulations, and discuss ways to quickly assess whether your current website meets these new standards. We’ll talk about how you can identify and tackle critical issues right away, and  we’ll explore strategies for embedding accessibility into every stage of development.

Ultimately, this talk is about taking what feels like a daunting challenge and making it manageable. With a little upfront effort and an incremental approach, you can become compliant and ensure that your apps work for everyone.

speakers.bio: Emma is a web developer and accessibility specialist with a passion for creating inclusive digital experiences. She has worked with a range of banks and e-commerce businesses across the Nordics and Europe and is committed to ensuring that everyone, regardless of ability or use of assistive technology, can navigate and interact seamlessly with digital content. With her expertise in accessibility principles and web development, Emma strives to promote inclusivity and drive positive change in the digital space.

sessions.title: The Cake Is a Lie... And So Is Your Login’s Accessibility
sessions.description:
Much like the promise of cake in Portal, login forms are everywhere in web development. While they may seem functional at first glance, many users with disabilities encounter a maze of invisible walls, from keyboard traps to inaccessible CAPTCHAs. It's as if GLaDOS designed these forms herself to test us!

In this practical walkthrough, we will debug the accessibility issues of a real React login component live, similar to traversing those test chambers: Using an actual screen reader, we'll show how small improvements, such as proper ARIA implementation and effective focus management, can transform a complex test chamber into a smooth user experience. Additionally, we will address the common pitfalls that GLaDOS might throw at us in both the Portal universe and the real world of accessibility. So grab your portal gun—let's work together to break down these barriers and ensure that authentication truly works for everyone. The cake might be a lie, but accessibility doesn't have to be!

speakers.bio: Ramona is a developer advocate and software engineer with roots in quality assurance. She owns both views of the product - that of a tester and a developer. Ramona primarily uses this to strengthen trust in test automation and support the testers and developers alike, becoming a Google Developer Expert in Web Technologies, Women Techmaker Ambassador, and Cypress ambassador.

sessions.title: Management in times of Agentic AI - The Human Premium
sessions.description:
In the coming months and year, we will have Agentic and Humans working side by side. 
In this context, how will managers change their style, what will Human leadership / management mean, what skills will managers need to evolve to remain effective. 
Session will covers topics of Coaching, caring and leading with purpose. Being mindful of how to set up teams that have humans and Agents. 
Peak into what the workforce of the future will be motivated by and how to build high performing teams with such a new age workforce.

speakers.bio:
Recognised as Global Top 200 Biggest Voices in Leadership alongside names such as Simon Sinek and Marshal Goldsmith by Leaders Hum, Match.io etc. 
- AI Advisory Board Member for Goodtime.io
- Keynote Speaker, Author and StartUp advisor.
-Mastermind of Global Talent Dynamics with a proven prowess of pivoting orgs to success by building a culture of high performance and engagement.
- Rich International experience in Talent, TA, TD, TM, HR Business Partnering and HR Transformation!!
-Leadership Experience, built & nutured high performing HR / Talent teams of 40+ to 140+ globally.

sessions.title: 5 Interview Myths Busted: Is Your Thinking About Interviews Outdated?
sessions.description:
Session Description 
In a rapidly changing world of work - where the market, technology, and candidates are all evolving - our perceptions about what makes a "good interview" often remain frozen in time. This thought-provoking session challenges five deeply-held beliefs about interviewing that may be limiting your ability to identify and attract top talent today.

What Participants Will Discover:

- Why some of our most basic assumptions about interviews need rethinking
- How outdated perceptions of "good interviewing" might be hindering your hiring success
- Which traditional interview beliefs no longer serve today's hiring needs
- How to shift your mindset about interviews to match current market realities

Interactive Format:
Through myth-busting discussions and real-time reflection exercises, participants will examine their own beliefs about interviewing. They'll leave with new perspectives and practical ideas to modernize their approach to interviewing.
