speakers.bio: Shiran Danoch, Ph.D., is a serial entrepreneur and a leading expert in talent assessment and people analytics. As the founder of Informed Decisions, she leverages AI to track and mitigate interview bias, promoting equitable hiring. With a Ph.D. in People Analytics and a background in I-O Psychology, Shiran has pioneered skills-based hiring tools and AI-driven pre-hire assessments. She’s a Forbes Human Resources Council member and has consulted for global brands like Nike and Kuehne + Nagel, inspiring data-driven talent strategies through her speaking and writing.
speakers.tagline: CEO and Founder of Informed Decisions Interview Intelligence

sessions.title: How to Ride the AI Wave With Minimal Cost and Commitment
sessions.description:
AI is rapidly transforming how HR operates — but let’s face it, most of us are short on time, budget, and technical know-how. If you’re worried about missing the AI boat, this session is for you.

Luc de Ridder will show you smart, practical ways to get your HR teams ready for the wave of AI-driven change — without the need for big budgets, complex tools, or long implementation timelines. Whether you're waiting for your favorite vendors to catch up or just looking for low-effort, high-impact ideas to try now, you'll leave with actionable steps you can take immediately.

speakers.bio: Luc has over a decade of experience working in Recruitment, and has led hiring efforts for two hyper-growth tech scale ups. This experience drove him to focus on focusing strongly on scalability and efficiency, by deploying modern technologies and innovative solutions, drastically reducing administrative processes and empowering recruitment teams to focus on what they do best: finding and hiring talent.
speakers.tagline: HR Project Manager at Specialized People

sessions.title: Valven Atlas: Engineering Intelligence That Delivers
sessions.description: Discover how Valven Atlas turns engineering data into measurable business impact by providing AI-driven insights that help software teams work smarter, not harder. Learn how our platform boosts developer productivity, uncovers inefficiencies, predicts delivery bottlenecks before they happen, and aligns engineering efforts with strategic goals. By aggregating signals from different tools, Valven Atlas enables technology leaders to gain full visibility into team performance, reduce delivery risks, and align engineering with business goals.

speakers.bio: Serdar Bicer is an experienced software engineering leader with a passion for driving innovation and fostering high-performing teams. With over 17 years of experience in the industry, he has a proven track record of delivering impactful solutions and guiding teams through complex technical challenges. He's one of the co-founders and CTO of Valven. Currently, he is dedicated to driving excellence in software engineering teams to achieve their full potential.

sessions.title: Mobile vs. Backend DevOps
sessions.description: This analysis highlights the key differences in DevOps practices for mobile app development, focusing on specialized tools and their use cases. It explores critical performance indicators for Mobile DevOps, such as build times and crash rates. The CI/CD process for mobile apps is examined, detailing automated build, test, and deployment workflows. The significance of deep platform-specific knowledge for iOS and Android ecosystems is emphasized. Strategies to minimize dependencies and mitigate technical and financial risks are discussed. Challenges in code signing are addressed, alongside key security considerations from an enterprise perspective to ensure robust, secure mobile applications.

speakers.bio: Mete , a product marketing professional with a 20-year career, held key roles in product strategy at Samsung Electronics and as Country Manager for PlayStation. Currently, he serves as the VP of Strategic Partnerships at Appcircle, focusing on Mobile Ci/Cd for enterprises. Mete's expertise lies in understanding the pivotal role of mobile applications in our evolving tech landscape.

sessions.title: Secure and Private AI - DeepMask
sessions.description:
DeepMask enables companies to build and leverage AI securely. It provides a secure environment for data upload, builds RAG and fine-tuned LLMs with company private data, utilizes industry-specific LLMs, and offers knowledge and support on AI & LLM use cases. DeepMask offers secure and locally hosted LLMs via One-Secure-API in Germany and EU, with LLMs running locally within DeepMask infrastructure – similar to ChatGPT but secure. 

DeepMask offers several key benefits for companies looking to leverage AI:

- Data Security & Privacy: Your data remains within a secure, locally hosted environment, mitigating risks associated with public LLMs.
- Customization: DeepMask allows for RAG and fine-tuning of LLMs with your company’s private data, creating AI solutions tailored to your specific needs.
- Ease of Access: The One-Secure-API provides a streamlined way to access LLMs without compromising security.

speakers.bio: As Co-founder and CEO at DeepMask, my team and I help organizations to securely upload and utilize their internal data to leverage "industry-specific LLMs and Gen AI" which ensures data security and data protection. Previously, worked as a Senior Consultant in M&A at Helbling Business Advisors (HBA), a Swiss leading strategic consulting firm that helps companies via mergers & and acquisitions (M&A), value chain management, and digital process transformation. Prior to HBA, I invested in and supported early-stage startups in the InsurTech/FinTech/HealthTech vertical at Plug and Play Ventures.

sessions.title: NVIDIA Expert Session: GPUs demystified - How to accelerate your code
sessions.description: Visit us at booth A-16 to get answers to your most pressing questions from NVIDIA technology experts, and claim a free self-paced DLI course on July 10-11.

speakers.bio: Lavinia Ghita is a senior solutions architect for the financial services industry (FSI) at NVIDIA. Her work at NVIDIA focuses on applied AI research and driving the adoption of AI-driven technologies in the financial sector. Prior to joining NVIDIA, Lavinia worked on natural language processing research and applications in a quant hedge fund and in big tech.

At NVIDIA, Paul has responsibility for supporting customers and partners in delivering accelerated solutions for the Higher Education, High Performance Computing and AI communities in the UK. As well as providing advice on making the best use of NVIDIA hardware, Paul teaches on how to program for GPUs, mentors at hackathons and regularly engages with research software engineering groups. Paul is an advocate for using accelerated computing in HPC, and the use of AI as a powerful tool for researchers.

Maximilian Stadler is an AI Developer Technology Engineer at NVIDIA, where he optimizes both internal and external AI workloads for NVIDIA GPUs and bridges the gap between field teams and internal product and architecture teams. He holds a M.Sc. in Robotics, Cognition, Intelligence from the Technical University of Munich and is passionate about making AI workloads more efficient as a small contribution to a greener future in a world that is increasingly hungry for data and compute.
speakers.tagline: AI Developer Technology Engineer at NVIDIA

sessions.title: Keymate – Modern Authorization for Developers
sessions.description:
Keymate is the missing piece for Keycloak-based access control.
Built natively on Keycloak and OpenFGA, it adds fine-grained, risk-adaptive, and data-sensitive authorization — all without replacing your IAM.
✔ Plug into any Keycloak (or other IAM) with zero migration
✔ SDKs for Java, .NET, JS — with @permission annotations
✔ Built-in “Why Denied?” simulations and visual DSL
✔ Support for ReBAC, PBAC, RADAC, DSAC
✔ Organization-aware tokens and multi-tenant delegation
✔ Fully event-driven and OpenTelemetry-native
For developers, for teams, for IAM at scale — powered by Keycloak, extended by Keymate.

speakers.bio: Halil Özkan is the CEO and co-founder of Keymate, a platform focused on smart automation and enterprise productivity. With a strong background in APIs, integration, and digital transformation, he helps companies streamline operations and scale efficiently. Halil has led multiple tech ventures and is known for bridging technical innovation with business impact.

sessions.title: Open Source AI, To Foundation Models and Beyond
sessions.description: What is open source AI and how is it transforming AI development? Listen to experts discuss the technical and business aspects of building with open source AI. Our panelists examine how foundation models like DeepSeek, Llama Nemotron, and Gemma are accelerating AI innovation. You will gain valuable insights to help you leverage open source tools to build your AI application.

speakers.bio: Matt White is the Executive Director of the PyTorch Foundation and GM of AI at the Linux Foundation. He is also the Director of the Generative AI Commons. Matt has nearly 30 years of experience in applied research and standards in AI and data in telecom, media and gaming industries. Matt is the Co-founder and Chair of the Open Metaverse Foundation at the Linux Foundation. He also runs the Silicon Valley Generative AI paper reading group and is a co-organizer at the GenAI Collective.
speakers.tagline: General Manager of AI at Linux Foundation

speakers.bio:
Ankit Patel is a Senior Director at NVIDIA, leading developer engagement for the company’s extensive collection of libraries, developer tools, and ecosystem software. Ankit joined NVIDIA in 2011 as a GPU Product Manager helping pioneer GPU-accelerated virtual machines, and pushed the boundaries of server GPUs, including NVIDIA's early 8-GPU server appliance. His career transitioned to software, notably leading product management for NVIDIA's OptiX library for ray tracing and AI denoising, a key development that leveraged RT Cores and deepened his connection to deep learning. Prior to NVIDIA, he held product management roles at Matrox Video and Blackmagic Design. Working on full systems for over two decades has given him perspective and expertise at the intersection of silicon and software. Ankit holds a Bachelor's in Computer Science from Concordia University and an MBA from Cornell University and serves on the PyTorch Governing Board.


Ankit Patel is a Senior Director at NVIDIA, leading developer engagement for the company’s ecosystem of libraries, compilers and developer tools. Ankit joined NVIDIA in 2011 as a GPU Product Manager helping pioneer GPU-accelerated virtual machines, and pushed the boundaries of server GPUs, including NVIDIA's early 8-GPU server appliance. His career transitioned to software, notably leading product management for NVIDIA's OptiX library for ray tracing and AI denoising, a key development that leveraged RT Cores and deepened his connection to deep learning. Prior to NVIDIA, he held product management roles at Matrox Video and Blackmagic Design. Working on full systems for over two decades has given him perspective and expertise at the intersection of silicon and software. Ankit holds a Bachelor's in Computer Science from Concordia University, an MBA from Cornell University and currently serves on the PyTorch Governing Board.
speakers.tagline: Senior Director Developer Marketing at NVIDIA

speakers.bio: Philipp Schmid is a Senior AI Developer Relations Engineer at Google DeepMind working on Gemini, Gemma with the mission to help every developer and builder to create and benefit from AI in a responsible way.
speakers.tagline: AI Developer Experience at Google DeepMind

speakers.bio:
Andreas Blattmann is a Co-Founder of the German generative AI startup Black Forest Labs, best known for its state of the art text-to-image foundation model FLUX and backed by renowned venture capital firms like Andreessen Horowitz.

Prior to founding Black Forest Labs, Andreas was a generative AI researcher at LMU Munich, NVIDIA and StabilityAI, where he made significant contributions in the field of image- and video-generation. He is the co-inventor of Latent Diffusion, a generative modeling technique that led to the famous open-source text-to-image AI system Stable Diffusion, which he co- developed. Today the Latent DIffusion technique powers cutting edge AI models for visual media such as FLUX, Midjourney and OpenAI’s DALL-E3 and has been adopted in a variety of related fields such as audio generation, medical imaging and more. Andreas was named one of Germany’s Top-40-under-40 in 2024 by the Capital Magazin.

Dr. Lucie-Aimée Kaffee is the EU Policy Lead & Applied Researcher at Hugging Face. She works on the intersection of policy and AI technology. Her research focuses on harnessing AI to support online communities, such as on Wikipedia. Driven by a commitment to community-driven decision-making, she integrates her expertise in machine learning, AI ethics, and policy to address critical societal challenges.

She earned her PhD from the School of Electronics and Computer Science, University of Southampton, as part of the Web and Internet Research Group. She was a postdoc at CopeNLU, a NLP research group located at the University of Copenhagen (Københavns Universitet), postdoc at HPI Potsdam, Germany, Bloomberg Intern in London UK, research associate at the TIB Scientific Data Management Research Group in Hanover and was part of the part of the Marie Skłodowska-Curie ITN WDAqua.
speakers.tagline: EU Policy Lead & Applied Researcher at Hugging Face

sessions.title: From A2A to MCP: How AI’s “Brains” are Connecting to “Arms and Legs”
sessions.description:
As AI evolves, we can think of LLMs as the "brains" of AI systems, while agents and tools serve as their "arms and legs" – the components that interact with the world and execute actions. Between these lies a critical but often overlooked element: the protocols that act as a nervous system, transmitting signals, coordinating actions, and integrating feedback between AI models and their capabilities.

This talk explores how protocols like Model Context Protocol (MCP) and Google's Agent-to-Agent (A2A) are enabling AI systems to extend beyond chat to practical action. We'll explore how these protocols allow LLMs to access external tools, manage persistent memory, and collaborate with other agents.

We'll examine where protocols excel in solving today's challenges, and where they need to evolve to support increasingly complex AI applications. We'll examine how the community can contribute to shaping this infrastructure layer, ensuring it supports the next wave of AI innovation.

speakers.bio: Brad is Tech Lead for AI & Data Platform at Block. He built and maintains codename goose, Block’s open source AI agent framework that automates repetitive tasks for thousands of  engineers in the company. He also leads company-wide initiatives to optimize data and ML workflows and evolve platform architecture. Brad has a long history in python, distributed compute systems, and applied machine learning. Brad previously earned his physics PhD from UC Berkeley and worked on processing and analyzing data at the Large Hadron Collider at CERN in Geneva.
speakers.tagline: Tech Lead, AI & Data at Block

sessions.title: From Tables to Graphs in Minutes: Supercharging Kusto Graph Analytics with AI-Powered Development
sessions.description: Transform your approach to graph analytics! Discover how GitHub Copilot and the Kusto MCP server can revolutionize your workflow from tedious table analysis to sophisticated persistent graph models in minutes, not hours.  **Live Demo:** Watch AI automatically analyze schemas, generate persistent graph models, and create optimized queries for enterprise security analytics - transforming 6+ hours of manual work into under 6 minutes of AI-assisted development.  **Requirements:** - Intermediate KQL skills (joins, aggregations, basic graph concepts) - GitHub Copilot experience and data modeling background - Azure Data Explorer/Eventhouse knowledge - *Kusto Detective rank appreciated but not mandatory*  **You'll Experience:** - Real-time AI schema analysis and relationship detection - Automated persistent graph model generation with GitHub Copilot - AI-powered query creation (`graph-match`, `graph-shortest-paths`, pattern analysis) - Performance optimization for large-scale graph analytics

speakers.bio: Henning Rauch is a Principal Product Manager at Microsoft and works on improving security, geospatial, and graph features for Eventhouse in the Fabric Real-Time Intelligence team. He came to Microsoft in 2016 and mainly worked with the automotive industry before moving to Microsoft’s R&D team. He studied computer science and has over two decades of experience in the industry.

sessions.title: Tech-Enabled, People-First: The Future of Global Hiring
sessions.description: This panel explores how to keep hiring people-first in a world of global teams and advanced tech. From avoiding bias in AI to building trust across cultures, the discussion will share practical ways to balance efficiency with a human touch and ensure candidates feel valued, not just processed.

speakers.bio: Dennis Böcker is Vice President EMEA Central at SmartRecruiters, where he is responsible for regional expansion and customer success. With over 15 years of experience in the HR tech industry, he has held leadership and consulting roles at companies such as Lumesse and Haufe-umantis. He brings deep expertise in AI-driven recruiting as well as a strong understanding of current trends and challenges in the HR technology landscape.
speakers.tagline: Vice President EMEA Central at SmartRecruiters

speakers.bio: Shannon Janke is a seasoned People & Culture leader with over a decade of experience across HR, executive education, and talent recruitment & development. With a global background spanning topics like recruitment & onboarding, learning design, and organizational growth she considers herself a “people geek” with a deep passion for creating exceptional candidate and employee experiences that truly make a difference.
speakers.tagline: Head of People &  Culture and HR Lead at Lufthansa Group Digital Hangar

sessions.title: Rapid Microservice Development with Project Templates
sessions.description:
Microservice architectures are popular in modern software development.
Their flexibility enhances scalability, maintainability, and thus the overall efficiency of the development process.
However, many microservices share non-functional elements such as programming language, CI/CD and other configurations, that are independent of the functional implentation.
Implementating and maintaining these elements is time consuming and requires a different skill set than the functional implementation.
Here, we provide a live demo of our project template for microservices, which largely improves the developer experience by taking care of the shared elements.
Thereby, we keep a consistent code base and workflow, while maintaining the flexibility of the functional implementation in each microservice.
In addition, the template serves as a central documentation and provides best-practice implementations for common use cases, such as communication via a message queue and interactions with databases.

speakers.bio:
Jan Gieseler received a Dipl. Phys from the University of Karlsruhe, Germany and a MPhys. in Optoelectronics and Lasers from Heriot Watt University, Scotland, followed by a PhD in Photonics from ICFO in Barcelona, Spain.
After that, he continued to work as a postdoctoral scientist in fundamental research at ETH Zurich, Harvard University and ICFO.
In 2020, he joined IAV GmbH in Berlin, Germany.
There, he works as a Data Scientist, Software Engineer and Product owner with primary focus on data engineering, probabilisitic lifetime prediction and building microservices for AI services.

Tobias Hengelbrock received his diploma in Mechatronics from the Technical University of Dresden. 
In 2021, he joined IAV GmbH in Dresden, initially as an intern and diploma student, before transitioning to a role as a Data Engineer and DevOps. Currently, he focuses on building microservices for AI services.

sessions.title: Kettle and Pot or Peas in a Pod? A Debate on Open-Source and Proprietary Software
sessions.description:
The debate between open-source and proprietary software remains a central discussion. Are they fundamentally at odds, or can they complement each other to drive innovation? 
This talk explores the strengths and weaknesses of both models, addressing key questions: 

·         How do open-source and commercial ecosystems impact software quality, security, and sustainability? 

·         What role do licensing, community contributions, and business incentives play in shaping the future of development? 

·         How can companies successfully blend open-source and proprietary strategies to maximize value?

speakers.bio: Kevin Willems is a software developer who began his career at iText, a company known for its dual-licensed PDF library (AGPL/commercial). With hands-on experience in both open source and proprietary environments, he brings a developer’s perspective to the ongoing debate between the two models.

Roxana Crisan specializes in software licensing compliance, offering guidance to organizations navigating the complex landscape of open source and commercial models. With a focus on aligning legal frameworks with evolving business realities, she supports decision-makers in balancing risk, flexibility, and strategic growth.

sessions.title: Supercharge Agentic AI Apps: A DevEx-Driven Approach to Cloud-Native Scaffolding
sessions.description:
Agentic AI transforms how intelligent systems interact with the real world, but building and deploying these agents remains a complex challenge. This demo-driven talk introduces a cloud-native scaffolding approach using software templates to simplify development, making it more accessible and efficient for application developers.

Through live demonstrations, I’ll show how this framework speeds up the development of agentic AI applications. Key features include automated code generation, pre-configured infrastructure, and seamless integration with popular AI libraries. These tools help developers reduce setup time and focus on building intelligent functionality.

By the end of this session, attendees will understand how cloud-native scaffolding streamlines agentic AI development and gain practical knowledge on leveraging these tools to build intelligent agents faster and more effectively.

speakers.bio: Daniel Oh is a Java Champion and Senior Principal Developer Advocate at Red Hat to evangelize developers for building cloud-native apps and serverless ob Kubernetes ecosystems. He's also contributing to various cloud open-source projects and ecosystems as a CNCF ambassador for accelerating DevOps adoption in enterprises. He's speaking at lots of technical seminars, workshops, and meetups to elaborate on new emerging technologies for enterprise developers & DevOps teams.
speakers.tagline: Sr. Principal Developer Advocate at Red Hat

sessions.title: Client-Side State Management Reimagined – Think Outside the Box
sessions.description:
Web frontend applications are optimized to render application state in the browser while updating changes as frequently as necessary but as rarely as possible to maintain high performance. SolidJS introduced Signals specifically for this purpose. Angular has also adopted this concept to track state changes reactively and update the DOM with pinpoint accuracy.

In Angular, Signals serve as the synchronization mechanism between JavaScript and the browser DOM, replacing the currently used Zone.js library in the future.

As a reactive API, Signals are also well-suited for client-side state management. The most popular libraries in the Angular ecosystem come from the NgRx namespace.

This talk presents a brand new client-side state management approach that builds on this foundation while leveraging modern browser APIs.

speakers.bio:
Michael Egger-Zikes is an experienced software architect, trainer, and consultant with a focus on Angular in the field of business applications. As a member of the ANGULARarchitects expert network, he has supervised and implemented large enterprise-scale Angular projects in the public and private sectors.

As an external (part-time) lecturer, he also teaches this topic at a university of applied sciences in Graz, Austria. The business informatics graduate has a lot of experience with software engineering and automating business processes.

sessions.title: Beyond Prompting: Building Scalable AI with Multi-Agent Systems and MCP
sessions.description:
The landscape of AI development has evolved rapidly from simple LLM interactions to sophisticated systems capable of complex reasoning and action. This session maps this evolution and explores two key architectural advancements: multi-agent systems and the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

You'll learn how to design specialized agents that plan, reason, and collaborate—moving from monolithic systems to multi-agent frameworks that maintain performance at scale. Then we'll explore the Model Context Protocol (MCP), showing how it standardizes resource sharing and provides a unified communication layer.

Through demonstrations and architectural diagrams, you'll leave with implementable knowledge on how to leverage these advanced architectural patterns and build AI systems that are more modular, maintainable, and capable of executing complex workflows.

speakers.bio:
Viktoria Semaan is a Senior Developer Advocate at AWS, where she helps developers embrace the next generation of developer and AI services. She is a frequent speaker at global tech conferences, including re:Invent, Hannover Messe,  Gitex Global, where she shares the latest insights on AI technologies.

With over 15 years of experience in technology, management consulting, and engineering, Viktoria has a rich background. She holds an MBA from UCLA Anderson School of Management and completed an Entrepreneurship studies program at HEC Paris.

sessions.title: Leading efficiency, empathy, and the human experience with AI
sessions.description:
As AI transforms how we work, leaders face a critical challenge: how to drive efficiency without losing the human touch. In this panel, engineering leaders from Atlassian and Accenture will explore what it is like to lead in this new era, where Agentic AI and automation can accelerate outcomes, but empathy and human-centered design remain essential.
We’ll dive into how organizations are using AI-powered agents like Atlassian Rovo to reduce toil and unlock creative capacity, while intentionally designing systems that empower teams, preserve trust, and elevate developer experience.
Key areas of discussion include

How can organisations balance efficiency gains from AI with the need to maintain empathy and human-centric values?
What are the best practices for integrating agentic AI into daily workflows without losing the “human touch”?
How does Atlassian’s approach to AI ensure that teams remain empowered, creative, and adaptable in an increasingly automated world?

speakers.bio: Ming Wu is Head of Engineering for the DevAI organization at Atlassian, where she leads the development of AI-powered developer productivity tools leveraging Large Language Models. She has over 15 years of experience integrating artificial intelligence into flagship products, including GitHub Copilot, Microsoft 365 and Bing Search. Ming holds a Ph.D. in Computer Science from Michigan State University and is passionate about applying AI to real-world applications.
speakers.tagline: Head of Engineering for the DevAI organization at Atlassian

speakers.bio: Benjamin has been building, scaling and leading global alliances in the technology sector for ebay, Accenture, Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Atlassian, with AWS, Cognizant, Accenture and many other partners. Forming successful, long lasting partnerships in an increasingly combative world gives him a lot of purpose. Benjamin's subject matter expertise revolves around AI, GenAI, Data, Big Data, Analytics, as well as the corporate and human benefit and experience of these technologies.

sessions.title: Fighting the musts and must-haves on the road to technical sanity
sessions.description:
Are you tired of following the same, well-trodden path of choosing and using particular technologies and practices in your IT profession without questioning their validity or value?

​Do you feel like you have lost your voice, your creativity, or your sense of purpose in the IT world?

​Do you wonder how new technologies, such as AI and GPT, will affect your IT mindset and behavior?

​If you answered yes to any of these questions, then this session is for you. Join us for a fireside chat with renowned experts who will challenge some of the IT industry's sacred cows and provoke you to think critically and ethically about your IT choices and actions.

​This session will not give you easy answers or solutions, but it will stimulate your curiosity, your imagination, and your courage to fight the musts and must-haves on the road to technical sanity.

speakers.bio: Adnan Pavlovic is an expert and team leader with experience in advertising agencies and the IT industry. Joining WeareDevelopers at the early startup stage helped the company scale up, focusing on business development, content strategies, and new market opportunities. He is responsible for conducting an annual developer survey inside the WeAreDevelopers community. He regularly collaborates with corporations such as Microsoft, Bugatti Rimac, Dynatrace, Tezos, Rapyd, IBM, and Infobip. Awarded with BalCannes and WebAward.me acknowledgments for creativity in marketing communication.

Tomislav is the CTO and partner at Nephos, a company that supports digital transformation for clients globally. Before Nephos, Tomislav spent 13 years at Microsoft, most recently as a technology strategist for partners integrating Microsoft's technology and cloud services. He has collaborated with various companies, from startups to large enterprises, aiding developers and system engineers in adopting the latest technologies. His focus areas include AI, cloud technologies, microservices, DevOps, Data and IoT. He frequently shares knowledge through workshops and conferences.

sessions.title: HR ROBO SAPIENS: Decoding AI Agents and Workflow Automation for Modern Recruitment
sessions.description:
This session explores how AI-driven technologies can empower recruiters to make smarter, faster, and more impactful decisions while enhancing candidate experience. With actionable insights, real-world examples, and practical strategies, this talk will provide you with the tools to harness AI effectively in your recruitment processes.

- Why haven't recruiters been replaced yet?: Exploring the critical human touchpoints in recruitment that AI cannot replicate, and why recruiters continue to play a vital role.

- Integrating AI Across Your Talent Acquisition Process: Practical ways to leverage AI at nearly every stage of recruitment, from sourcing to onboarding, for enhanced efficiency and effectiveness.

- Building Your Own AI Agents: Step-by-step guidance on creating personalized AI assistants to streamline your recruitment operations.

- AI-Powered Candidate Matching: How to leverage AI tools to make more accurate, data-driven matches between candidates and roles.

speakers.bio:
José is a former software engineer, has been at the forefront of revolutionizing stagnant industries like recruitment through analytical strategies and technological advancements since 2006. 

José co-founded the 140-employee recruitment titan, GoodCall, along with ATS provider Datacruit and the certification authority Recruitment Academy. With a decade-long presence, these enterprises have received accolades, including recognition in Deloitte‘s TOP50 and Financial Times FT1000.

He is the author of two pillar books in the recruitment space - People as Merchandise and HR Robo Sapiens.
speakers.tagline: Co-Founder & Chief Talent Sourcing Architect at GoodCall

sessions.title: Code meets Culture: Engineering the Future of Hiring
sessions.description:
As AI and automation continue to transform how we source and assess talent, a parallel shift is unfolding; engineering leaders are emerging as the true drivers of tech hiring. This new reality goes beyond recruiter-led models, placing developers and tech leads at the center of the hiring process and the talent decisions.

This session explores what it really takes to scale world-class tech teams in a future defined by collaboration, ownership, and accountability. Whether you're a recruiter or a software engineer, you'll walk away with a new perspective on hiring, one that champions shared ownership, drives culture from the inside out, and builds a talent engine that is led by engineers and powered by Talent Acquisition.

speakers.bio:
With over a decade of experience in hyper-growth startups and Big Tech, Sophie excels at scaling high-performing, distributed teams with speed and precision.

From shaping talent strategies as an HR consultant to hiring and building engineering teams at Microsoft, her career has been a journey of transformation. Now, as head of talent acquisition at Rescue, she leads the team powering lifesaving technology.y

Beyond recruitment, Sophie mentors, speaks, and champions the next generation of talent leaders, redefining how companies attract and retain top talent.
speakers.tagline: Global TA Leader, Community Founder at Technical Recruiters Africa

sessions.title: Tolgee: Open-Source, In-Context AI Localization That Cuts Dev Effort
sessions.description:
Tolgee turns every running build into its own translation studio. Drop a three-line SDK into React, Angular, Vue, Svelte, Next.js or plain JS, hold Alt and tap any label, and an in-context editor opens so product or community linguists can tweak copy live and watch the UI refresh instantly—no JSON spelunking, no rebuilds, no developer bottlenecks. 

Our new AI Translator, powered by ChatGPT and real UI screenshots, proposes context-aware sentences that read like a local wrote them; switch on auto-translation and every new key is filled the moment it lands, leaving reviewers to fine-tune tone instead of starting from scratch. 

Tolgee’s lightweight CLI snaps into any CI pipeline, and you can self-host with a single Docker image or use our EU-hosted cloud—free for open-source. The project has grown to 3100 + GitHub stars, over 130 000 weekly npm downloads across its JS packages.

speakers.bio: Jan Cizmar is the founder of Tolgee, an open-source localization platform. He has a background in software development and a passion for making internationalization simpler for developers. Jan enjoys exploring new technologies that improve the translation process and help teams deliver apps that are truly global-ready. He regularly speaks about i18n best practices, focusing on practical, developer-friendly solutions.

sessions.title: Namespacelabs
OpenTelemetry Hands-On - Manual and Automatic instrumentation for Java and Python apps
sessions.description:
In today's modern software landscape - in the cloud-native one in particular - observability has become a critical aspect of ensuring the performance, reliability, and security of applications. OpenTelemetry, a standard and open-source observability framework, provides a unified way to collect and export telemetry data from applications and services. This hands-on lab will guide participants through the process of using OpenTelemetry to instrument a simple application, collect metrics, traces, and logs, and send them to various backends for analysis.

The lab covers the implementation and usage of OpenTelemetry into Python and Java-based applications. 

The exercises include: the instrumentation of a polyglot microservice application,
auto-instrumentation vs. manual instrumentation,
evaluating the collected traces, logs and metrics,
configuring a collector,
analysing the results in Jaeger and Prometheus.

speakers.bio: Jens Plüddemann is a Junior Observability Consultant at Novatec Consulting GmbH. He is passionate about exploring new technologies to deliver tailored solutions for customers. This curiosity led him to OpenTelemetry, and he now focuses on helping companies improve their observability strategies.
speakers.tagline: Junior Observability Consultant at Novatec Consulting

speakers.bio: Matthias Haeussler is Chief Technologist at Novatec Consulting, university lecturer for distributed systems, awarded ambassador of Cloud Foundry and the organizer of the Stuttgart Cloud Foundry Meetup. He advises clients on Cloud strategies and supports implementations and migrations. He has teaching experience from lectures at multiple universities in Stuttgart (DHBW, HSE, HfT). Besides that he is frequent speaker at various national and international conferences and meetups. (e.g. Spring One Platform, Open Source Summit, Cloud Foundry Summit, Spring IO, IBM InterConnect, WJAX).

sessions.title: Breaking Language Barriers: GPU-Accelerated Corpus Curation for LLM Training/Customization
sessions.description:
Creating large language models (LLMs) for non-English languages is frequently hindered by the scarcity or imbalance of available datasets. In this session, we introduce an advanced methodology for assembling high-quality, multilingual text corpora—spanning languages such as Spanish and French—by harnessing the computational power of GPU acceleration. We guide you through the corpus construction process, from foundational steps like text selection and cleaning to advanced approaches including semantic deduplication. The discussion will also highlight creative techniques for generating synthetic data, an essential measure for enriching datasets when authentic examples are limited.

Attendees will gain actionable knowledge on corpus curation workflows that can be adapted to a wide range of non-English languages, ultimately fostering the development of more inclusive and representative language technologies.

speakers.bio: Miguel Martínez is a senior deep learning data scientist at NVIDIA, specializing in Generative AI, Recommender Systems, and Data Analytics. He is currently advancing his expertise in large language models with NVIDIA’s Advanced Deep Learning Research team, working on LLM training. Previously, he mentored students in Udacity’s Artificial Intelligence Nanodegree and brings strong experience in financial services, especially payments and channels. A dedicated, lifelong learner, Miguel is always eager to embrace new challenges.
speakers.tagline: Sr. Deep Learning Data Scientist at NVIDIA

speakers.bio: Roman is a Solutions Architect at NVIDIA specializing on accelerated data science. He specializes in helping customers deploy AI/ML based solutions. His focus is on accelerating end-to-end data science pipelines leveraging RAPIDS and RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark based solutions. Roman has a background in explainable AI and automizing credit risk solutions.

sessions.title: Model Compression Techniques for Efficient LLM Deployment
sessions.description:
The rapid advancements in large language models (LLMs) have unlocked transformative potential across industries, with state-of-the-art models excelling in popular AI reasoning benchmarks. However, their practical application often presents challenges due to their significant size, high computational costs, deployment complexities, and latency issues. To address these limitations, model compression techniques have emerged as effective solutions to reduce model size and computational requirements while preserving core capabilities.

This tutorial will provide a comprehensive overview of key techniques, including quantization, pruning, and knowledge distillation. Participants will gain an understanding of the theoretical foundations behind each method, explore their use cases, and engage in practical, hands-on examples to solidify their learning.

speakers.bio: Harshita is a Senior Solution Architect at Nvidia, focusing on driving AI adoption among Global System Integrators. She has experience in building and deploying large language models, with a particular focus for on-device/edge applications.

Lavinia Ghita is a senior solutions architect for the financial services industry (FSI) at NVIDIA. Her work at NVIDIA focuses on applied AI research and driving the adoption of AI-driven technologies in the financial sector. Prior to joining NVIDIA, Lavinia worked on natural language processing research and applications in a quant hedge fund and in big tech.

Ziv Ilan is a Solution Architect at NVIDIA, focusing on Agentic AI, LLM evaluation, optimization, and deployment. He joined from deci.ai (acquired by NVIDIA), where he worked on Neural Architecture Search and model compression techniques for GenAI and Computer Vision models. Ziv holds an Electrical and Electronics Engineering degree from Tel-Aviv University and an MBA from HEC Paris. He leverages his technical and business expertise to drive AI solutions development and deployment.

Sergio Perez specializes in conversational AI. He has experience in optimizing training and inference of LLMs, building retrieval-augmented generation systems, and working with companies in different sectors to leverage AI. His area of expertise at NVIDIA is quantization and inference serving. Previously, he worked as an AI engineer at Graphcore and Amazon, and got a Ph.D. in computational fluid dynamics from Imperial College London.

sessions.title: Building Data-Driven Agentic Applications with AlloyDB
sessions.description:
In this hands-on workshop, you'll build a conversational AI agent from scratch and transform how you interact with your users. You'll implement advanced querying capabilities in AlloyDB for PostgreSQL, combining vector search for intelligent recommendations, full-text search for products, and location-aware insights for store data. Next, you'll connect these building blocks, using the Google Agent Development Kit (ADK) to orchestrate the agent's logic and the MCP ToolBox for seamless database integration. 
You'll leave this session with a clear understanding of how these pieces interact to build your own agentic applications with AlloyDB.

speakers.bio: Ferhat has been working as a DBA for the last 26 years in the Banking and Telecom industries. He likes to solve problems with new approaches and extreme technologies. He is working in Google Cloud for the last 5 years helping the users to modernise their database environments and migrate to cloud.
speakers.tagline: Database Solution Engineer at Google Cloud

speakers.bio: As a Database Specialist at Google, I focus on our PostgreSQL offerings, empowering developers to build high-performance, data-driven GenAI applications. Coming from a background in mission-critical enterprise systems, I bring a deep appreciation for the reliability and scale required to run modern applications. I am passionate about building a vibrant developer community by sharing practical strategies on how modern databases can fuel the future of AI.
speakers.tagline: Customer Engineer, Data Management at Google Cloud

sessions.title: Responsible AI – Build Better Products: Your Personal Yellow Teaming AI Assistant
sessions.description:
Imagine your product sells exactly as you'd hoped – could that create unforeseen issues for your company, users, or society? In this hands-on workshop, you explore that question using Yellow Teaming, a product development framework inspired by Red Teaming. But instead of testing what might go wrong, Yellow Teaming uncovers the unintended consequences when things go right and how to address them. 
 
Rooted in responsible AI principles and built for real-world use, Yellow Teaming is easy to adopt. Bring a laptop and a product idea. You'll create your own AI Yellow Teaming assistant using a Llama model on a private server or a public LLM like ChatGPT and use it to identify risks and spark innovative product features.  
 
After this workshop, you'll leave with a stronger, more competitive, and more trusted product concept than the one you came with. 

*All workshop attendees are required to bring their own laptop*

speakers.bio: Annie is passionate about empowering developers by making cutting-edge Arm technology accessible and practical. With a strong focus on AI, she specializes in turning complex technical solutions into streamlined, real-world developer experiences.

sessions.title: MLOps & LLMOps in Banking IT: Automation, Infrastructure & Real-World Challenges
sessions.description:
To bring the power of AI into everyday banking operations, robust infrastructure for MLOps and LLMOps is essential—especially in highly regulated environments.
At Finanz Informatik, the digitalization partner of the Sparkassen-Finanzgruppe, teams have a long-standing track record of building secure, scalable, and automated platforms for mission-critical banking solutions. This foundation is now being extended into the AI era.
In this session, Sebastian, Daniel, Lars and Matthias share their best practices and lessons learned from operating AI solutions inside air-gapped banking infrastructures. They walk you through key components like model registries, experiment tracking, model monitoring, and the automated provisioning of LLMs—including real-world challenges from inference server operations. The team will also present the S-AI-Pilot, a generative AI assistant already in use at Sparkassen workplaces.
What does it take to build enterprise-grade MLOps and LLMOps under the toughest constraints? Join us for technical insights and practical guidance from the core team behind one of the largest AI initiatives in the German banking sector.

speakers.bio: Daniel Evenschor is ML Ops Engineer at Finanz Informatik, specializing in deploying, scaling, and monitoring LLMs and ML models in the banking sector. With a background as a Data Scientist at Evicon, he bridges data science and production systems to drive real-world impact. His expertise spans MLOps, CI/CD, Kubernetes, OpenShift, and advanced model observability using tools like Prometheus, Dynatrace, and OpenTelemetry.

Lars Langerbein joined the AI Infrastructure Team at Finanz Informatik as ML Ops Engineer in 2025. Previously, he completed a trainee program at Finanz Informatik. He holds a master megree in theoretical solid-state physics.

Matthias Kordt is involved in the planning and provision of the AI and data analytics container platform, including new Cloud Pak for Data releases, and has been working for Finanz Informatik since 2019. The focus here is on automation. Matthias coordinates between the various players on the platform, is always keen to accelerate regulation through automation and enjoys advancing new technologies. A clear focus is the automation and monitoring of the container platform.

Sebastian Klenke heads the AI & Data Analytics Platform team at Finanz Informatik and has been working for the company since 2011. His enthusiasm for using technology to create added value for people's everyday lives motivated him to teach at the FOM University of Applied Sciences as a lecturer for Big Data and Data Science and to work there as a research assistant on publications with a research focus on text generation. He sees the provision of the necessary technologies to make artificial intelligence accessible to the masses in various facets as an exciting challenge with great potential.
speakers.tagline: Team Lead Data Analytics & AI Platform at Finanz Informatik

sessions.title: Vibe Coding with Goose: Building Apps with AI Agents and MCP
sessions.description:
So you want to be a vibe coder, huh? Well, let's put your skills to the test.
Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to build a series of apps in just 90 minutes!
Sounds impossible? Not when you've got AI Agent Goose by your side.
In this high energy, hands-on workshop, you'll be dropped into a series of fast paced coding challenges. Each task calls for creativity, speed, and a little help from AI. Armed with Goose and a curated lineup of MCP servers, you'll generate apps at the speed of vibes.
No fluff. No filler. Just real dev work assisted by a powerful open source AI agent that knows how to get things done.
Up for the challenge? See you there!
This message will self-destruct in 3… 2… 1… 🧨

speakers.bio:
Angie Jones is the Global Vice President of Developer Relations at Block, Inc. An award-winning educator and international keynote speaker, Angie shares her expertise with audiences at software companies and conferences around the globe.

As a Master Inventor, Angie is celebrated for her innovative and creative thinking, which has led to over 25 patented inventions in fields such as metaverses, collaboration software, social networking, smarter planet technologies, and software development processes.
speakers.tagline: Global VP, Developer Relations at Block

sessions.title: Beyond GPT: Building Unified GenAI Platforms for the Enterprise of Tomorrow
sessions.description: Enterprises today are quickly advancing beyond initial experimentation with generative AI (GenAI) technologies, moving towards robust, integrated platforms capable of handling diverse workloads from standard generative tasks to advanced agentic capabilities. This talk will explore the evolution from standalone GPT implementations to unified GenAI platforms, offering practical insights into architecture design, team structuring, and the governance required to responsibly scale AI within large organizations.

speakers.tagline: Chief Data Technologist at E.ON Digital Technology

sessions.title: AX is the only Experience that Matters
sessions.description:
If you’re building devtools for humans, you’re building for the past.

Already a quarter of Y Combinator’s latest batch used AI to write 95% or more of their code. AI agents are scaling at an exponential rate and soon, they’ll outnumber human developers by orders of magnitude.

The real bottleneck isn’t intelligence. It’s tooling. Terminals, local machines, and dashboards weren’t built for agents. They make do… until they can’t.

In this talk, I’ll share how we killed the CLI at Daytona, rebuilt our infrastructure from first principles, and what it takes to build devtools that agents can actually use. Because in an agent-native future, if agents can’t use your tool, no one will.

speakers.bio:
Ivan Burazin co-founded Codeanywhere, the first cloud IDE, in 2009, and later created Shift, Europe’s leading dev conference (acquired by Infobip in 2021). He then joined Infobip’s executive board as Chief Developer Experience Officer. In 2023, he co-founded Daytona, an open-source platform enabling AI agents to securely interact with runtime environments. Backed by $7M,
Daytona serves startups to Fortune 500s, helping agents reach their full potential.

sessions.title: Simple Steps to Kill DevSec without Giving Up on Security
sessions.description: The “shift left” movement in code security, intended to shift security responsibilities to developers, has largely failed. Instead of easing burdens, it has inundated developers with noisy alerts, straining the relationship between development and security teams, and ultimately putting the burden back on security.  This session will provide examples of how successful teams have addressed this issue and highlight the concept of using secure guardrails that notify (but don’t block) developers in their native workflow and promote the use of secure defaults. Find out how to effectively mature your application security program and steps you could take immediately to improve your security posture.

speakers.bio: Isaac Evans founded and served as the CEO of Semgrep starting in May 2017. Prior to that, he worked as an Entrepreneur in Residence at Redpoint Ventures from August 2016 to June 2017. Isaac also has experience in the United States Department of Defense, where he worked as a Computer Scientist from July 2013 to July 2016. Additionally, he worked as a Computer Scientist and Consultant to the Laboratory at MIT Lincoln Laboratory.

sessions.title: Enterprise Integration Is Dead! Long Live AI-Driven Integration with Apache Camel
sessions.description:
We keep hearing that “integration” is old news, with modern architectures and platforms promising frictionless connectivity. So, is enterprise integration really dead? Not exactly! In this session, we’ll talk about how AI-infused applications and tool-calling agents are redefining the concept of integration, especially when combined with the power of Apache Camel.
We will discuss the the role of enterprise integration in an era where Large Language Models (LLMs) and agent-driven automation can interpret business needs, handle routing, and invoke Camel endpoints with minimal developer intervention. You will see how these AI-enabled systems help weave business data, applications, and services together giving us flexibility and freeing us from hardcoding boilerplate of integration flows.
You’ll walk away with:
An updated perspective on the future of “integration” in a world driven by AI, LLMs, and intelligent agents.
Real-world examples of how tool-calling functionality can transform Camel routes into dynamic, adaptive workflows.
Code examples how to merge AI capabilities with Apache Camel to deliver flexible, event-driven architectures at scale.
Roadmap strategies for integrating LLM-powered agents into your enterprise, orchestrating services that previously demanded complex, rigid solutions.
Join us to see why rumours of integration’s relevancy have been greatly exaggerated—and see first hand how Camel, powered by AI, is quietly reinventing how we connect the enterprise.

speakers.bio: Bruno Meseguer is a Technical Marketing Manager for Red Hat in the integration space. Before joining Red Hat in 2015, he worked as a developer and architect for over 15 years in various industries, designing and building large throughput integration platforms. He advocates for cloud-native and distributed integration best practices & technologies.
speakers.tagline: Technical Marketing Manager at Red Hat

speakers.bio: Markus is a Java Champion, former Java EE Expert Group member, founder of German JavaLand, reputed speaker at Java conferences around the world, and a very well known figure in the Enterprise Java world.
speakers.tagline: Senior Principal Technical Marketing Manager at Red Hat

sessions.title: The Art of Firm Kindness: Managing Underperformers
sessions.description:
Have you ever underperformed at work? Okay, okay, this question is probably too personal, I'll ask differently. Have you ever seen someone at work that you wish performed better at what they do? What do you think their boss should have done about it?

Different leaders approach such situations differently. But one remains always: it is never easy because it's always nuanced and delicate.

Let's talk about why it's so challenging and why it can be so ambiguous. I will share some advice on how to make it less hard and describe a practical framework of dealing with such situations in ways that are responsible, equitable, empathetic, and kind. The way we want our leaders to be.

speakers.bio: Anton is an Engineering Director at Canonical (the publisher of Ubuntu). As an engineering leader, he's built and scaled teams, shaped tech organisations in the SaaS and consumer-facing worlds. He has a passion for systemic approaches and helping people thrive and grow. He's mentoring other engineering leaders both at work and outside of work, making sure they onboard on their leadership journey quickly and smoothly. Outside of work, he enjoys hiking, mountain skiing, and spending time with his family.

sessions.title: Your Manager Doesn’t Come with a User Manual (But You Can Totally Write One)
sessions.description: Let’s face it: managers don’t arrive with step-by-step instructions, but with the right tools, you can figure them out anyway! Success in your role isn’t just about crushing your own goals—it’s about syncing up with your boss like the perfect tech stack. In this session, we’ll dive into the art of “managing up” using empathy, emotional intelligence, and strategic communication. You’ll learn how to decode your manager’s quirks, priorities, and working style (yes, even their 7 a.m. email habit) and craft a working relationship that’s less glitchy and more collaborative. Whether you’re looking to build a better connection or troubleshoot tricky dynamics, this session will leave you with practical strategies to lead with understanding—and make your working partnership a win-win.

speakers.bio: Meet Natalie, an impostor extraordinaire who came to the world of technology with a degree in linguistics and background in journalism… and turned her temporary gig into a 15-year long career. Her experience spans two continents, and four countries. She is a mother of three, and a proud owner of an imaginary cat. She loves adventures, skiing and board games. The things that make her happy are people and insatiable passion for learning. She translates her experiences into a broad picture of WHY we do things the way we do and HOW we can use the knowledge to make our lives, and the world, better.

sessions.title: Smart Hiring or Smart Bias? AI's Diversity Challenge
sessions.description: AI has burst onto the recruiting scene, dazzling us with promises of faster hires, better matches, and streamlined processes. While our inboxes overflow with both miracle solutions and cautionary tales, one crucial question remains: are we sacrificing inclusion at the altar of efficiency? Join Miz as she cuts through the hype to examine the real-world implications of AI recruiting tools on diversity in European hiring practices, offering practical insights  for maintaining human-centered recruitment in an increasingly automated world.

speakers.bio: With over 15 years of talent acquisition experience, Miz Cree leads Global Talent Acquisition at Kiwi.com. Her journey spans continents and industries, from Berlin tech startups to music technology innovators like Native Instruments. Having built TA functions across Europe and Australia, Miz brings unique insights on inclusive hiring and recruitment evolution. Passionate about leveraging technology while maintaining human-centered hiring approaches, Miz combines strategic hiring expertise with a commitment to inclusive recruitment practices in our AI-driven world

sessions.title: Executive Synergy Luncheon
sessions.description: Hosted in partnership with AWS, Atlassian, and Accenture, this exclusive gathering offers the opportunity to engage in candid discussions, share perspectives, and explore strategic topics shaping the future of technology in the AI era — all in a focused and intimate setting.

sessions.title: From Model to Metal: An Open Source Stack for Accelerating Intelligence
sessions.description: Artificial intelligence is becoming truly ubiquitous: from agentic AI systems in enterprise settings to everyday smart devices. Arm's vision is to enable this intelligence to run efficiently everywhere. This talk outlines the technical architecture needed to support advanced AI on Arm CPUs and accelerators. It will highlight the strategic role of open source tools in unifying the currently fragmented AI software landscape. At the core is a PyTorch model for which training and inference is accelerated with tools such as vLLM, Ray and oneAPI that optimize everything from matrix operations to data pipelines and distributed workloads. Ultimately, this open ecosystem approach unlocks faster innovation, greater developer velocity, and reliable deployment at scale and ensures that AI stack evolves in sync with the hardware. Open source collaboration allows the industry to pool its efforts on common tooling, avoiding duplicated work and ensuring that breakthroughs benefit everyone.

speakers.bio: Andrew is part of Arm’s Strategy & Ecosystem and Developer Platforms leadership team, leading the Open Source Office and managing Arm’s engagements with software communities. With 25+ years in open source, he has held roles across numerous projects and foundations. He currently chairs the Yocto Project and sits on the boards of the PyTorch Foundation, FreeBSD Foundation, and Xen Project, among others. A regular presence at global open source events, Andrew actively supports community collaboration and open ecosystem growth.
speakers.tagline: Engineering Lead for Generative AI at Arm

sessions.title: Data Driven HR in Europe
sessions.description:
This session will cover: 

How HR can change using data analytics?
How HR can make impactful, strategic decisions?
How to implement data-driven HR reformation?
How to apply ESRS S1 for evidence-based transformation?

speakers.bio:
David Simmonds, Chairman of HCM Metrics, and of the HR Analytics Group, is the first individual to receive a professional certification for ISO
30414 Human Capital Management reporting. It was announced by Dr. Ron B. McKinley and Lee S. Webster, co-founders of the International Center for Enterprise Engagement at TheICEE.org, the only organisation offering this certification.

sessions.title: NVIDIA Expert Session: Your AI, Everywhere: Unifying Infrastructure for Unbounded Innovation
sessions.description: Visit us at booth A-16 to get answers to your most pressing questions from NVIDIA technology experts, and claim a free self-paced DLI course on July 10-11.

speakers.bio: Anshul is a Sr. Solution Architect at NVIDIA's DGX Cloud team, he specializes in assisting customers with deploying their workloads at scale. Anshul has a strong background in SRE and has extensive experience in managing production-grade Kubernetes clusters across various Cloud Service Providers (CSPs). He has received Ph.D. in computer science from TU Munich, graduating summa cum laude.

Martin Piercy is a solutions architect at NVIDIA, where he is responsible for helping customers effectively adopt and use NVIDIA hardware and software at scale. During his time at NVIDIA, Martin has helped customers scale out training to thousands of GPUs and built solutions to help customers train, monitor, and manage jobs and infrastructure effectively.

sessions.title: Modular Secrets to Lightning-Fast Android Builds
sessions.description:
As Android projects scale, the need for better modularization becomes critical—not just for maintainability, but also for build speed and developer efficiency. In this talk, we'll dive deep into techniques for creating a truly optimized modular setup that balances independence, scalability, and build-time performance.

You'll learn:
- How to design module relationships to minimize dependencies and reduce build times.
- Strategies for leveraging custom Gradle plugins to enforce consistency and simplify configuration.
- The power of version catalogs to manage dependencies across modules effortlessly.
- A cutting-edge navigation system enabling seamless transitions between modules without direct dependencies.

This session combines practical coding techniques with real-world architectural insights, equipping you with actionable ideas to improve your project’s modularization. Attendees will walk away with tools, tips, and strategies they can apply to their codebase immediately.

speakers.bio:
I'm Mohamed Gamal (you can call me Jemy), a Mobile Staff Engineer at SumUp. With a focus on architecture and scaling projects, I thrive on turning innovative ideas into robust and efficient solutions. 

When I'm not diving into code, you might find me on the squash court, refining both my programming and racket skills. 
I'm also a passionate traveler, exploring new places and cultures whenever I get the chance. 

Let's connect and geek out about tech, or perhaps challenge me to a squash match! 🚀📱🌍

https://www.linkedin.com/in/mohamed-gamal-a231ab94/

sessions.title: Beyond the IDE: A new era of agent collaboration
sessions.description: The way developers interact with their primary tool is on the cusp of a dramatic transformation. Over the next few years, AI agents will become integral partners, working alongside you throughout the software development lifecycle directly within and beyond your IDE.  We’ll explore what this new collaborative landscape will look like, highlighting how a richer understanding of project context will enable these agents to provide unprecedented support and automation -- and what it means for your workflow.

speakers.bio: Ryan is an experienced developer, product manager, and founder with 25 years of experience building developer tools at startups, Microsoft. GitHub, and now Google. Today, he's responsible for efforts to engage, onboard, and enable developers with best-in-class experiences and assistive technology. Ryan leads product teams responsible for developer onboarding, code authoring, build and deployment systems, logging, observability, and end-to-end developer experiences.
speakers.tagline: Senior Director Product Management, Code Assist and Developer Tools at Google Cloud

sessions.title: The Innovation Formula: Fast Prototyping, Data Analysis, and Real User Insights
sessions.description:
At INTERSPORT, we are tackling the common challenges of digital transformation—moving from fragmented, loosely connected systems to a seamlessly integrated digital ecosystem for our retailers.
Building such an ecosystem requires a comprehensive, end-to-end understanding of business processes.
Using a real-world example, we’ll walk through our approach—how we iterated quickly, identified inefficiencies, and used data-driven insights to create and validate hypotheses. We’ll also showcase the technologies we leveraged for prototyping and learning.
Additionally, we’ll highlight the crucial role of user research in ensuring that our solutions align with real-world needs.

speakers.bio: Nico is a passionate Product Manager with 6 years of experience in user-centric product development, value-driven business strategies, and leveraging technology. He specializes in customer research, data-driven analysis, and rapid prototyping to accelerate product development. In his current role, Nico serves as the strategic link between users, stakeholders, and development teams, taking charge of the product roadmap for retailers' product procurement processes.

As Principal Engineer and Architect, Silvia Schreier enjoys bridging the gap between technology and business at INTERSPORT.
She has more than 10 years of experience in web development & architecture as well as wholesale & retail product management. She combines this experience with her passion for bringing people together and fostering collaboration. This enables her to help teams finding solutions that are technically appropriate and sustainable while also creating business value.

sessions.title: Modern Software Development – DORA all the way, or what?
sessions.description:
There's an ever-increasing need for high-performing teams and organisations – to meet current and future market demands and customer expectations. But what does this mean for software development? Just work harder? Or do you need to make your teams, work and processes smarter?

Many books have been written on the subject, such as "Accelerate" and "Modern Software Engineering" in recent years. In this session, we'll look at the findings from the latest DevOps Research and Assessment (DORA) report from their perspective.

We'll demystify Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, coupling of architecture and teams, and so on – and we'll see what modern software development should be based on in the 2020s.

And if you've already heard of the DORA metrics: This might not be the best choice for targeting modern software development in 2025. There's way more to it than just metrics!

speakers.bio: Thomas works as a Technical Agile Coach at Techniker Krankenkasse in Hamburg. Together with his coaching colleagues, he supports teams in always getting a little bit better at collaboration and agile programming practices – by encouraging (and doing!) pair and team programming, TDD, test automation and the like. Over the years, Thomas has contributed to various software systems large and small, many of which had to and have to be maintained for many years, even decades.
speakers.tagline: Technical Agile Coach at Die Techniker

sessions.title: Developing ASP.NET Core Microservices with Dapr: A practical guide
sessions.description: In this session we will look at the benefits of developing ASP.NET Core Microservices with Dapr. Learn how to use Dapr's versatile building blocks such as state stores, pub-sub events and virtual agents to efficiently implement your microservices architecture. The session will walk you through the details of building these building blocks and demonstrate the use of Docker Compose for local environments as well as Kubernetes for production scenarios. This presentation is tailored for developers who want to effectively integrate Dapr into their ASP.NET Core projects and provides a comprehensive and hands-on knowledge transfer.

speakers.bio: Marc Müller is a principal consultant for DevOps and .NET / Azure solutions at 4tecture GmbH and has been recognized by Microsoft as a Most Valuable Professional (MVP) for Developer Technologies (Azure DevOps). He has been able to bring his DevOps expertise and know-how for enterprise architectures and component-based distributed systems to many projects over the past few years. As a trainer and speaker, he focuses on the training and coaching of DevOps and .NET project teams.

sessions.title: Prompt Injection, Poisoning & More: The Dark Side of LLMs
sessions.description:
This talk provides an in-depth look at the key security risks in LLM-based systems and applications. I will explore threats such as prompt injection, data poisoning, model leakage, and other vulnerabilities, explaining their impact, demonstrating real-world examples, and discussing effective mitigation strategies. 

Attendees will gain practical insights into securing LLM implementations across different use cases, from customer-facing applications like chatbots and AI assistants to internal tools and deeply integrated AI-driven processes. This session is designed for technical and leadership roles alike, equipping them with the knowledge to proactively address security risks before they become critical threats.

speakers.bio:
Keno is a Principal Consultant and Head of AI at SQUER, where he drives AI initiatives and contributes to the company’s strategic direction. 

He holds a Master’s in IT and Cognition from the University of Copenhagen, specializing in machine learning, NLP, and software architecture. His experience spans AI-driven solutions, full-stack development,  and blockchain, with leadership roles across fintech and AI product development.

He thrives on solving complex challenges, leading high-performance teams, and pushing the boundaries of AI and software innovation.
speakers.tagline: Principal Consultant & Head of AI at SQUER

sessions.title: gRPC Load Balancing Deep Dive
sessions.description: Many organisations use gRPC for their service-to-service communications. At first glance, this is “just another protocol” running over TCP/HTTP. But working with gRPC load balancing can be a bit tricky as you have to use a different set of tools for testing (e.g. grpcurl instead of curl), the return codes are different and things like unary calls vs. streams require a good understanding of the protocol and its implications. We will give an overview of the protocol, explain what load balancing options we have using examples of AWS Load Balancers. We will explain how to perform functional and performance testing and finally go through some common pitfalls when Load Balancing gRPC.

speakers.bio: Max has been a Solutions Architect at AWS for more than five years, and focuses on all things networking. He has worked with multiple small and large enterprise customers within AWS, in order to help them plan out their networking environments, and meet their requirements.

Yves is a Specialist Solution Architect for Containers and Networking at AWS. He is passionate about application networking and network automation, right where Dev meets Ops. Prior to joining AWS, Yves worked as an enterprise networking consultant, product manager, and solution architect, starting with physical networking and moving on to network virtualization and cloud networking.

sessions.title: Dev & Test in the Cloud? Deploy your cloud environments with Ansible & Terraform
sessions.description:
Learn how combining Ansible and Terraform streamlines cloud infrastructure and configuration management. 
This session shows how developers can use Terraform for provisioning and Ansible for post-deploy 
automation—creating consistent, reliable environments ideal for development and testing workflows. In addition we'll 
explore how Red Hat Ansible Automation Platform enables developer self-service through controlled, 
repeatable workflows. This allows teams to deploy consistent environments faster, with less overhead and 
more governance.

speakers.bio: Götz works as a Principal Solution Architect at Red Hat. He has 20 years experience using Open Source software in the enterprise and has worked in this area as systems administrator, consultant and architect. Götz is enthusiastic about all areas of Linux-based infrastructures, his favorite topic is IT automation. Since the first contact with Ansible he has been hooked and enjoys helping Red Hat customers and partners to realize Ansible's full potential.
speakers.tagline: Principal Solution Architect at Red Hat

sessions.title: Inside the Mind of an LLM
sessions.description:
Recent studies in 2024 have revolutionised our understanding of large language models (LLMs). 

This talk explores three key discoveries. 

First, research shows Llama 2 models use English as their internal representation regardless of input/output language, explaining certain biases. 

Second, breakthroughs by Anthropic and OpenAI have revealed monosemantic features in Claude 3 and GPT-4, enabling better understanding and adjustment of topic-specific behaviours. 

Third, studies demonstrate why LLMs memorise outlier data, particularly unique strings and personal information, explaining instances of privacy breaches. We'll discuss implications for LLM privacy and security.

Attendees will walk away with a deeper understanding of the inner workings of LLMs, and with hints to mitigate their intrinsic limitations.

speakers.bio: Engineer, researcher, entrepreneur. Emanuele earned his PhD in AI by researching time series forecasting in the energy field. He was a guest researcher at EPFL Lausanne, and he's now the Head of AI at xtream, where he solves business problems with AI. He published 8 papers in international journals, presented and organized tracks and workshops at 20+ international conferences, including AMLD Lausanne, ODSC London, WeAreDevelopers Berlin, PyData Berlin, PyData Paris, PyCon Florence, and lectured in Italy, Switzerland, and Poland.

sessions.title: Semantic HTML means it's semantic, right? Right?
sessions.description:
I wish I could tell all the developers out there who dutifully use semantic HTML because they are told that good developers who pay attention to code quality, a good developer experience and accessibility will automatically build accessible websites. I mean, in most cases this is the case (lucky us).

That's why I hate to break it to you: not all elements are automatically accessible just because they are semantic. Some HTML elements do not have browser or screen reader support by default. The same applies to some HTML attributes, which should be used with caution.

Let's take a closer look at some of these elements, what they are, why they are not accessible, and what you can do to make them accessible.

speakers.bio: Emma is a web developer and accessibility specialist with a passion for creating inclusive digital experiences. She has worked with a range of banks and e-commerce businesses across the Nordics and Europe and is committed to ensuring that everyone, regardless of ability or use of assistive technology, can navigate and interact seamlessly with digital content. With her expertise in accessibility principles and web development, Emma strives to promote inclusivity and drive positive change in the digital space.

sessions.title: Building Developer Experience - Brick by Brick
sessions.description:
Digital Native Companies have been investing in Developer Experience(DX) for years but only in the last couple of years have we begun to see other industries invest in Developer Experience (or Developer Productivity) as Digital Business becomes mainstream. 

This session features Notes-from-the-Field from establishing DX from scratch, finding our way and where we are today. Learn from our challenges and hear how we taggled them, and hopefully find inspiration for your own journey. 

Join me for a peak into how the 91 Year old LEGO Group is tuning its digital ambitions to and investing in Developer Productivity and Happiness.

speakers.bio: I'm heading up the Developer Experience and Cloud journey at one of the coolest companies on the planet as an Engineering Director at the LEGO Group. We inspire the builders of tomorrow by developing awesome digital products people of all ages, all around the world.
speakers.tagline: Head of Cloud & Developer Experience at The LEGO Group

sessions.title: Empowering Developer Innovation - Balancing Speed, Security, and Scale
sessions.description: This panel discussion will explore how organizations can drive developer innovation through self-service, while maintaining robust governance, security, and compliance. Our panelists bring diverse experiences in building integrated toolchains, fostering executive sponsorship, and creating customer-focused cultures. A key focus of our discussion will be the role of metrics—how data-driven insights help us track adoption, measure productivity, and ensure compliance as we create scalable and secure DevOps platforms. Let’s dive into how metrics can illuminate the path to both innovation and control.

sessions.title: Wellbeing at Work: The Foundation of Sustainable Performance
sessions.description: Join our expert panel as they unmask the real state of workplace wellbeing and why it’s a business essential for 2025. From spotting hidden issues and measuring what matters, to practical actions and sustainable performance, discover how leaders can foster thriving teams—and bust some stubborn wellbeing myths along the way.

speakers.tagline: Sustainable Performance Expert and Co-Founder of Well Made Training

speakers.bio: Bianca Errigo is a wellness expert, global speaker, and founder of HumanOS, a pioneering company integrating health and performance into the workplace. With a background in psychology and over 12,000 coaching hours, she blends science with real-world insight. Once hospitalised from corporate burnout, Bianca now partners with companies such as American Express, Cisco, Snapchat and The University of Cambridge to support individuals and organisations on their journeys of sustainable high performance.
