In this session, we'll explore the most important ways Spring Boot integrates with containers, covering tools and features that simplify building, testing, and running your applications in Docker and Kubernetes. 

This talk will guide you through the entire developer journey covering established integration points as well as updates and new ones: building efficient images with Buildpacks including options like jlink, support for native images, testing in realistic environments with Testcontainers, running locally with recently added Docker Compose feature, and deploying securely in Kubernetes. 

The majority of integration points will be shown in live demo steps.

speakers.bio:
Eva Panadero is a Senior Software Engineer at Novatec, specializing in backend development with technologies such as Spring Boot, Java, Kotlin, and Nest.js, as well as microservices, databases, containers, and automation with GitHub Actions. She holds a master’s degree in Cybersecurity and Privacy, along with certifications as a cybersecurity professional and in Management 3.0.

With over 10 years of experience, she combines a solid technical background with a creative and innovative approach. She is actively involved in initiatives like "Seré Ingeniera", encouraging girls to pursue technical careers through workshops and hands-on projects. Currently, she is also developing two new initiatives focused on digital education and cybersecurity.

"This is my story." (FFX)

Matthias Haeussler is Chief Technologist at Novatec Consulting, university lecturer for distributed systems, awarded ambassador of Cloud Foundry and the organizer of the Stuttgart Cloud Foundry Meetup. He advises clients on Cloud strategies and supports implementations and migrations. He has teaching experience from lectures at multiple universities in Stuttgart (DHBW, HSE, HfT). Besides that he is frequent speaker at various national and international conferences and meetups. (e.g. Spring One Platform, Open Source Summit, Cloud Foundry Summit, Spring IO, IBM InterConnect, WJAX).

sessions.title: API First - Successfully decoupling teams
sessions.description:
Having worked in both frontend- and backend-focused teams, I learned that the best way to design the implementation of new features is at the fault lines of the architecture, the APIs.

Working API first means defining the contract at the API level as the starting point. These contracts are written in the Openapi specification, a well-established format that benefits both sides of the API. Using code generators for the client and server side code parts makes sure the data is always transferred in the correct shape.

Since APIs are often the lines along wich we split up teams, working API first is a great strategy to decouple them.

speakers.bio:
I aspire to build maintainable and sustainable software by writing clean code and awesome documentation.
Currently, I am doing this at Dynatrace.
You could call me a full stack developer, but I try to grow beyond frontend or backend and understand all aspects of software engineering.

sessions.title: Beyond Files: Reimagining writing code in a distributed AI-powered era
sessions.description:
In 1960s code made the jump from holes in cardboard to digital text on a file system. Can we make another jump? Modern IDEs already hint at the need: all the useful bits work hard to turn text in files into graphs or abstractions. We search, link, build graphs, reformat, and re-model. It's not just IDEs, even humans spend most of their time reading code just to re-model it in their heads.

Let's imagine one possible jump. All functions, classes and statements are distributed abstractions in a graph. Dependencies become fungible instead of hard-wired. Better yet, we can use AI fulfill ad-hoc statement of intentions by summoning new packages into existence. Imagine a possible future where every particle of code is shared and written by countless unknown authors, human or otherwise. Be amazed as we escape dependency hell and make AI a productive yet invisible collaborator.

speakers.bio:
Brian started programming at the age of seven and have spent over a decade in a zig-zag career ranging from programmer to software architect, manager, and manager-of-managers. Often mistaken for a product manager. He especially enjoys bringing business concepts to the table such as Theory of Constraints.

In 2022, driven by a desire to make a broader impact, he began independent consulting through Building Better Teams in Berlin. Now focused on enhancing profitability of Engineering and Product organizations.

sessions.title: New AI-Centric SDLC: Rethinking Software Development with Knowledge Graphs
sessions.description:
In the 2010s, test automation with tools like Selenium sped up QA cycles—but why stop there? By blending an automation-first mindset with AI capabilities, we discovered ways to streamline every phase of the SDLC.

In this keynote, we’ll present 3 real-world initiatives:

Figma to Email: How we converted a human-intensive process into software, reducing labor costs while improving governance and quality.

Codewrap: Our initial foray with AI—attempting to migrate a massive Drupal PHP repository to React using AI-generated requirements.

Knowledge Graphs: How we realized that code can be represented as a graph, and our journey building a “dream combo” of Knowledge Graph + LLM for AI-driven software engineering.

We’ll also unveil our new SDLC framework, designed to free teams to tackle higher-level challenges. Expect honest insights on what worked, what didn’t, and how we navigated AI constraints. Walk away ready to supercharge your development processes and embrace an AI-led SDLC.

speakers.bio: Gregor, tech innovation lead at Riverty and co-founder/CEO of cloud ahead, Germany's leading digital sovereignty think tank, brings 25+ years of experience in bridging perspectives between tech and business stakeholders. His insights span from strategic innovation to practical implementation, making him a valuable voice in the industry.

Sujay Joshy here, convinced programming is humanity's best language—no syntax errors! With over ten years in software development and digital transformation, I’m an AI Engineer in Fintech Innovation, automating workflows and integrating smart solutions. A AWS Solutions Architect, co-founded startups, launched SaaS products, and mastered ASP.NET, C#, Java, Python, and Javascript. Passionate about modernizing legacy systems, I love turning bugs into features and empowering teams to excel in today’s dynamic tech landscape.

Marcel Gocke holds a Computer Science degree and an Executive MBA, bridging tech and business. With 20+ years in IT—including a decade in New York as senior engineer,  solution architect & team lead —he’s led e-commerce platform launches, product development and explored VR/XR, blockchain, AI, cloud and DevOps. Today, he supports a fintech CTO’s consulting & innovation team on AI-driven software engineering, development practices and further topics.

sessions.title: AI or KO: Is HR ever going to use intelligent technology?
sessions.description:
ChatGPT was publicly launched almost 3 years ago. OpenAI turns 10 years old this year. GPT-1 and GPT-2 went largely unnoticed in the HR field. Fast forward to now: HR is scrambling for defining great use cases, finding high-value items to build, and cashing in on the promises we believed to be true, when we first saw generative AI tools. There is one major reason for this problem. We, as HR professionals, never actually left "consumption mode". We are still hoping for someone to show us the light. But generative AI is a general purpose technology. We, in HR, need to be the one's finding the light by understanding the technology, really understanding the employees' pain points with our processes and offerings, and then crafting solutions that are tailored to these pain points. 

And here's the clou: HR can leverage ChatGPT as a key to more general AI competence. But only, if we start experimenting and applying the technology proactively. 

I will share how I have done that.

speakers.bio: Dr. Daniel Mühlbauer is an expert in HR-IT solutions and focuses on the meaningful use of modern technologies in personnel management within a global corporation. He shares his knowledge on his blog and YouTube channel called “HR Datenliebe" and as co-host of the HRDataDudes-Podcast. His passion lies in the combination of data analytics, artificial intelligence, and HR tech to pave the way for the future of personnel management. After completing his PhD at the Institute for Human Resource Management at LMU Munich, he co-founded a startup specializing in People Analytics.

sessions.title: Harnessing Apple Intelligence: Live Coding with Swift for iOS
sessions.description:
Join us for an engaging session tailored for software developers and entrepreneurs interested in Apple Intelligence technology!
Through live coding in Swift, we’ll create and start a small app to demonstrate practical examples of integrating Apple Intelligence and Siri's capabilities through App Intents into your projects. You'll learn essential best practices for creating seamless voice interactions and task automation.
Whether you’re an experienced developer, a budding entrepreneur, or just starting out, this presentation will provide valuable insights and techniques to enhance your development skills. Don't miss the chance to harness the power of Apple Intelligence, Siri, and App Intents to bring your applications to life!

speakers.bio:
An Apple Certified Trainer, Consultant, and Software Engineer, with extensive experience in software development and training developers at all levels of knowledge. Deeply focused on Swift since 2014. A lecturer at the Apple Authorized Training Centre in Serbia, helping both beginners and experienced developers to enhance their skills in development, machine learning, augmented reality, and other technologies.
A regular lecturer at the WeAreDevelopers events and serve as a consultant for several major companies in Serbia and Europe. Additionally, I am the founder of Edulibris in Estonia.

sessions.title: AI Agents Graph: Your following tool in your Java AI journey
sessions.description:
Large Language Models (LLMs) have recently become increasingly popular. These models can be incorporated into your enterprise code to enhance the customer experience or automate business operations.

In any use case involving AI, you’ll rapidly encounter the concept of an AI agent, the code responsible for determining the following steps. LangChain4J is an example of implementing AI agents, a sequence of Java calls and logic interacting with a model. For simple use cases, it might work, but step by step, as the code becomes more complex, you’ll end up with unmaintainable spaghetti code with business logic and AI logic mixed together.

Tools like LangGraph4j offers a structured and efficient framework for defining, coordinating, and running multiple LLM agents using cyclical graphs.

Come to this session to learn how graph networks can help you implement advanced use cases and explore their integration with LangChain4j to create robust, efficient, and versatile AI applications.

speakers.bio:
Alex Soto is a Director of Developer Experience at Red Hat. He is passionate about the Java world and software automation and believes in the open-source software model. Alex is the co-author of Testing Java Microservice, Quarkus cookbook, Kubernetes Secrets Management, GitOps cookbook, RHCE Ansible Automation Study Guide, and Applied AI for Enterprise Java Development
books and contributor to several open-source projects. A Java Champion since 2017, he is also an international speaker.
speakers.tagline: Director of Developer Experience at Red Hat

sessions.title: Comfortably Quantum with Qrisp
sessions.description:
In this talk, we'll strip quantum programming down to its essence - QuantumVariables and QuantumTypes, stepping away from qubits and gates.

By leveraging these abstractions, Qrisp allows developers to write quantum algorithms as naturally as classical ones - without getting entangled in the mess of manual circuit construction.

This move beyond circuit constructions to a more intuitive, high-level approach will be showcased on stage through the introduction of the QuantumVariable, QuantumFloat, QuantumBool,  before creating a custom QuantumType and applying it to implement known algorithms and algorithmic primitives.

Whether you joined us last year or are perfectly new to Qrisp, this session will reshape the way you think about quantum programming. No gate gymnastics, no low-level headaches - just an elegant, high-level approach to become Comfortably Quantum.

P.S.: can you count how many Pink Floyd references will be included in the talk? 🎸

speakers.bio:
Matic Petrič studied theoretical physics at University of Ljubljana, Faculty of Mathematics in physics. 

Since 2023 he is working as a Quantum Computing Researcher at Fraunhofer FOKUS, focusing on implementing quantum algorithms, and contributing to Eclipse Qrisp - a high level programming language.

With a strong background in quantum development and communication, he focusses on sharing knowledge through educational content, including tutorials, webinars, and hands-on workshops with the goal of bridging the gap between classical and quantum programming.
speakers.tagline: Quantum Computing Researcher at Fraunhofer FOKUS

sessions.title: Blueprints for Success: Steering a Global Data & AI Architecture
sessions.description: Join us for an insightful session that delves into the steering and governance of the data & AI architecture at Merck Group, a leading science and technology company that operates across Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. In this presentation, we will explore our strategic approach to create a unified data architecture that seamlessly integrates diverse data sources and AI capabilities. Attendees will learn about the frameworks and methodologies we employ to steer this architecture across the data & AI community at Merck, ensuring alignment with our business objectives and fostering innovation. This session is ideal for professionals looking to understand the intricacies of building a robust and scalable data and AI ecosystem in a complex, global organization.

speakers.bio: Dominik is the Global Head of Data & Al Architecture and Excellence at Merck Group, leading the central team of experts in solution architecture, IT-Security, GxP regulation and Service Excellence in the Merck Data & AI Organization (MDAO).
speakers.tagline: Global Head of Data & AI Architecture and Excellence at Merck Group

sessions.title: Enterprise Linux as Container Images
sessions.description:
With image mode available in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 10, CentOS Stream and Fedora, container technology 
isn’t just for apps—it now defines the OS itself. This session introduces image mode and bootc, showing developers 
how to build and manage complete, bootable & immutable Linux systems as container images to run everywhere from 
bare metal to cloud instances. Learn how this approach simplifies deployments, enhances security, and aligns with 
modern DevOps workflows like GitOps and CI/CD.

speakers.bio: Götz works as a Principal Solution Architect at Red Hat. He has 20 years experience using Open Source software in the enterprise and has worked in this area as systems administrator, consultant and architect. Götz is enthusiastic about all areas of Linux-based infrastructures, his favorite topic is IT automation. Since the first contact with Ansible he has been hooked and enjoys helping Red Hat customers and partners to realize Ansible's full potential.
speakers.tagline: Principal Solution Architect at Red Hat

sessions.title: Unveiling the Magic: Scaling Large Language Models to Serve Millions
sessions.description:
Ever wondered what's behind the curtain when you chat with AI like OpenAI's ChatGPT?

At STACKIT, we've developed a model-serving service designed to host chat models, embedding models, and more, with a particular focus on supporting large language models.

In this talk, we'll unveil the challenges and solutions of scaling large language models (LLMs) to serve millions. We'll explore model acquisition, caching, building an OpenAI-compatible server, secure authentication, usage tracking for billing, autoscaling, and hosting multiple models under the domain.

Whether you're a developer, engineer, or just curious, this talk will show you how every token counts in making AI accessible to millions.

speakers.bio:
I'm a dedicated and highly skilled Tech Lead with a strong passion for Distributed Systems and Cloud-Native Development.

My key areas of expertise include:
- Backend Development (Go, Python, Rust)
- Distributed Systems (Microservices, Service Mesh, Message Queues)
- Cloud-Native Technologies (Kubernetes, Docker, Serverless)
- Scalable & High-Performance Systems
- Continuous Integration & Deployment (CI/CD)

sessions.title: Breaking the Hardware Mindset: Overcoming Barriers to System-Level Innovation
sessions.description:
In today’s world, products are no longer standalone artifacts; they are systems... complex ones. A loud speaker, for example, is no longer just a piece of hardware but an ecosystem of hardware, software, machine learning and services designed to work together seamlessly. If this system thinking isn’t embedded at the very beginning of the idea and discovery stage, the result is fragmentation, frustration, and failure of good customer experience and customer satisfaction. On the one hand, we talk about AI, on the other hand we fail to deliver a device with an app that simply just works perfectly. 

This speech will explore how companies born in the pre-digital era can adopt a systems mindset to stay competitive with their software and integrated solutions on the top of their hardware offering. Through case studies and actionable insights, I’ll uncover why leaders with connected and intelligent products excel and how others can achieve the same results.

speakers.bio: I’m a Senior Consulting Manager at Zühlke, specializing in systems and technology consulting. With a BSc in Industrial Engineering and an MSc in Product Management, I bridge the gap between business strategy and product development to deliver integrated, end-to-end solutions together with hardware, software, connectivity, ML, etc. My work spans industries like robotics, automotive, and energy, focusing on turning complex challenges into innovative outcomes. I’m passionate about making systems thinking practical and available on the business side as well.

sessions.title: MVI: Minimum Viable Interface for React Components
sessions.description:
We are used to make code as abstract and reusable as possible. And that is great for libraries, that have to be agnostic to the use case. But we usually don't create libraries. We create code to satisfy our business logic. So I challenge the idea of "good abstract and reusable code" by focusing on having the minimum viable interface in the context of React Components.

We will look at some examples how reducing the interface of our components, and being more aggressive with principles like YAGNI can help your codebase.

If you want to know how to create more readable, testable, and maintainable code, join me on this talk!

speakers.bio: Fullstack Software Design Engineer at Mattermost. He has helped with the re-architecturing of the new version of the mobile app, written in React Native. Confident with React, React Native and Go, and always happy to learn new things. Fun fact: studying psychology for fun.
speakers.tagline: Senior Software Design Engineer at Mattermost

sessions.title: Can You Touch the Internet? A Journey in Remote Touch With Edge Computing and Haptic Coding
sessions.description: Virtual reality applications in the cloud have reached a high level of sophistication, offering immersive experiences that blur the line between the digital and physical worlds. This talk explores how edge computing and haptic coding are pushing these boundaries further and enabling remote touch experiences in addition to visual and auditory sensations. Discover how edge computing reduces latency by processing data closer to users, essential for real-time tactile applications with "the human in the loop". We'll delve into innovative haptic coding techniques that ensure seamless and intuitive interactions. Explore practical applications like remote surgery, online shopping, or gaming and discuss challenges in security, scalability, and reliability. As developers, you'll gain insights into the future of digital interactions and learn how to make the intangible tangible, redefining our connection with the digital world and paving the way for new possibilities in remote experiences.

speakers.bio: Andreas Noll holds a PhD in electrical engineering, specializing in haptic codecs, quality assessment, and machine learning. After being awarded the VDE Bayern Award 2023 for his groundbreaking work, Andreas is now a Software Consultant at TNG Technology Consulting GmbH. With expertise in haptic technology, hardware and software, Andreas is passionate about integrating haptics into cloud environments to drive innovation and enhance real-time applications.
speakers.tagline: Software Consultant at TNG Technology Consulting

sessions.title: Trust by Design: Creating Responsible AI-Powered Services

speakers.bio: Dr. Marc Fuchs has served as CEO of Gofore’s DACH region since the beginning of 2024. He brings over 20 years of experience in the IT industry, having held leadership and consulting roles at major IT service providers. Marc’s expertise lies in shaping strategic business direction, developing long-term customer relationships, and driving growth, especially in the context of digital transformation. He also has a strong track record in building international delivery organizations. Outside of work, Marc is an avid triathlete, balancing his passion for sports with his professional pursuits.

speakers.tagline: HEAD of AI at BSI Software

speakers.bio:
Niklas is a founding member of OpenAI’s Go-To-Market team in Germany, partnering with leading technology companies and the tech ecosystem across the DACH region.
Prior to OpenAI, Niklas led Looker’s market entry and growth in Germany and worked at Google Cloud on developing the German market.

sessions.title: The Future Past of Technology - A Game Developers POV
sessions.description: The future has already been shaped by the past, and that past is built on game development. Game dev isn’t just about creating fun or entertainment—it’s a methodology, a mindset, and a powerful design philosophy that’s been quietly influencing everything from AI to education to digital interaction. In this talk, Johanna Pirker will explore how the tools and thinking behind game development aren’t just part of the entertainment industry—they’re the future of tech itself. By looking at how games have already started to shape areas like user experience, smart cities, healthcare, and even AI, we’ll uncover why play is the next superpower every developer should embrace. The future past has arrived, and it’s time to think like a game developer to build tomorrow’s world, today.

speakers.bio: Dr. Johanna Pirker is Prof. in Munich and at TU Graz in Austria, leading the research group Game Lab Graz, and researching games with a focus on AI, HCI, data analysis, and VR technologies. She has lengthy experience in designing, developing, and evaluating games and VR experiences and believes in them as tools to support learning, collaboration, and solving real problems.

sessions.title: Shape Your Career Transition Competence
sessions.description:
In today’s dynamic tech environment, change is not only constant — it's critical for long-term success. This session is designed for developers and tech professionals.

Career transitions can be exciting, but they can also be overwhelming. This session will break down career transitions into manageable, strategic components. We’ll begin by helping you assess your current career landscape. Beyond technical abilities, we’ll also address the often-overlooked but equally vital elements of a successful transition.

Whether you're actively job searching, eyeing a promotion, or simply future-proofing your career, this session offers the tools and confidence to make bold, intentional moves. Shape your career transition competence — because in tech, standing still is never the safest move. Let’s build the skills, mindset, and momentum you need to thrive through change.

speakers.bio:
Alice Ngan Pham is a Global Talent Acquisition expert at Smartly.io with extensive experience hiring across Europe and Asia. Formerly with ManpowerGroup and co-founder of IpowerPartner, she brings deep expertise in recruitment, people analytics, and talent strategy. 

Alice Ngan Pham is passionate about DEIB, especially its impact on immigrants and inclusive international workplaces. She also enjoys hospitality, travel, charity work, and supporting pet welfare.

sessions.title: Data Analytics with Microsoft Fabric: End-to-End Use Case with Data Agents
sessions.description: This session presents a practical end-to-end use case built in Microsoft Fabric, covering topics from data ingestion to analytics. As a data hub, Microsoft Fabric combines data flows, analytical models, and operational logic on a single platform. A key component of this session is the use of Fabric Data Agents, which enable organizations to build conversational AI experiences that let users ask questions across different data sources. These agents work seamlessly across lakehouses, warehouses, Power BI semantic models, and KQL databases.

speakers.bio: Alexander Wachtel has been recognized as a Microsoft AI MVP since 2020 for his community work in AI area. During his Ph.D. research at the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (KIT), he has published several AI papers in the area of Human-Computer-Interaction, Natural Language Processing & Cognitive Services. Furthermore, he is still teaching agile software engineering at the KIT using Azure DevOps. Due to his teaching activities at the KIT, he was also awarded as a Microsoft Innovative Educator (MIE) expert from 2016 to 2019. Due to his many years of experience, he has been also honored as a Microsoft Certified Trainer (MCT) since 2013. He provides Microsoft consulting for the industry and public sector, and teaches classes for Microsoft Certified Azure Solutions Architect Expert and Microsoft 365 Certified Administrator Expert.

Hanna is an Azure Cloud Consultant specialized in Data and AI. She designs and implements data platforms using Microsoft Fabric, Azure AI, and OpenAI services. With certifications in Data, AI, and Fabric Engineering, she supports projects from architecture to deployment across industries. Passionate about empowering others, she supports the tech community through ITgirls and ReDi School - mentoring, teaching, and encouraging more women to find their voice and confidence in tech.
speakers.tagline: Team Lead Data & AI at teccle group

sessions.title: How we built an AI-powered code reviewer in 80 hours
sessions.description:
How hard can it be to build an AI-powered code reviewer using modern LLMs? Easier than you think—until it isn’t.

In late 2024, I helped a client launch an AI-powered code reviewer. We built the initial prototype in the first few hours. But we soon encountered many unexpected challenges as we tried to productionize the idea into a coherent user experience.

In this session, let me tell you the surprises, challenges, and lessons learned from building an AI-powered code reviewer and what it tells us about the current state of LLM technologies.

speakers.bio:
Yan has run production workloads at scale in AWS since 2010 and has a track record of improving businesses with technology.

He is an AWS Serverless Hero and the author of several books, including "Serverless Architectures on AWS, 2nd Edition" by Manning.

Nowadays, he helps clients launch their product ideas, improve their development processes and upskill their teams as an independent consultant.

sessions.title: Java Meets AI: Empowering Spring Developers to Build Intelligent Apps
sessions.description:
For over a year, we haven't stopped talking about AI.

As Spring developers, we have an ever-expanding range of tools and frameworks that make integrating AI into business applications more seamless than ever - without needing Python!

But where should you start as a Spring developer? What real-world use cases can you tackle with AI? Should you directly integrate models like OpenAI, Gemini, or Llama, or choose a framework that simplifies the implementation?

Join this session to explore the latest advancements in building intelligent Spring applications and learn about powerful frameworks such as LangChain4j, Spring AI, and Semantic Kernel, and how they compare.

speakers.bio:
Timo Salm is the first Solution Engineer for Developer Experience at Tanzu by Broadcom in EMEA, focusing on internal developer platforms and commercial Spring products. In this role, he's responsible for educating customers on the value of these products and ensuring that they succeed by working closely on different levels of abstractions of modern applications and modern infrastructure.

Before Timo joined Pivotal, which VMware and now Broadcom acquired, he worked for consulting firms in the automotive industry as a software architect and full-stack developer.
speakers.tagline: Sr. Lead Tanzu DevX Solution Engineer at Broadcom

sessions.title: Lessons from Our API Past: Evolving to a Resilient API Future
sessions.description: APIs are the connective tissue of our digital world — powering everything from e-commerce and finance to travel and AI-driven automation (oh, and yes—critical for our AI transformation). Over the past 20 years, we’ve seen massive innovation, but also critical failures — single points of failure, brittle integrations, and cascading outages that have disrupted millions. As we move forward, how can we ensure that our APIs are evolvable, maintainable, and resilient in an increasingly complex landscape?

speakers.bio: Yousaf Nabi works in the Developer Relations teams at SmartBear as an API Evangelist . Yousaf started his career in 2007,  has worked across several industries and can be found helping users navigate their way around open source communities, and spreading API technical knowledge wherever he goes.

sessions.title: Quantum DevOps - Quantum Application Development
sessions.description:
Quantum Computing is emerging as the next big thing promising hyper-scaling of computational resources in all research and productivity domains.
However, the Quantum Computing technology has not
matured to a level where it can provide a clear advantage over
high performance computing yet. Towards achieving this
"quantum advantage", a larger number of Qubits is required,
leading inevitably to a more complex topology of the
computing Qubits. This raises additional difficulties with decoherence times and implies higher Qubit error rates.
Nevertheless, the current Noisy Intermediate-Scale Quantum
(NISQ) computers can prove useful despite the intrinsic
uncertainties on the quantum hardware layer. In order to
utilize such error-prone computing resources, various concepts
are required to address Qubit errors and to deliver successful
computations. In this presentation we introduce Quantum DevOps which entails regular checking of the reliability of NISQ Quantum Computing (QC) instances.

speakers.bio: M.Sc in Computer Engineering, specialized in advanced computer architectures. Now researcher at Fraunhofer FOKUS in Quality Engineering for Quantum Computing. Works in several industry and research projects in the fields of quantum computing, artificial intelligence, IoT, IT security and telco. Main interest is researching efficient application development and implementation of algorithms especially in the quantum domain (Quantum DevOps). Other areas of interest are quantum computing, quantum networks, IoT, Industry 4.0, 5G/6G, AI, robots and the high-level quantum  programming language Qrisp.

sessions.title: Software Engineering Social Connection: Yubo’s lean approach to scaling an 80M-user infrastructure
sessions.description: A five-person team at Yubo, the Gen Z social app, runs one of the most scalable software infrastructures for over 80 million users across more than 100 countries, giving new meaning to ‘running lean.’ By harnessing ArgoCD, Kubernetes, Infrastructure-as-Code, and automation templating, Yubo has maximized engineering efficiency under CTO Arthur Patora. His session will dive into Yubo’s DevOps philosophy: why automation is essential but not universal; how GitOps streamlines deployments; and how database self-service unlocks speed without sacrificing control. Get a behind-the-scenes look at pragmatic engineering choices that enable rapid scaling while keeping infrastructure lean and efficient.

speakers.bio:
Mikael Robert is the Head of Infrastructure at Yubo, a leading Gen Z social app with over 80 million users. With a background in cloud architecture, distributed systems, and SRE practices, he brings experience from both large enterprises and startups, specializing in DevOps and automation at scale. 

At Yubo, Mikael leads DevOps, Security, and Data Engineering, and has designed a CRD-based automation system powering a fully templated, self-service infrastructure. His focus is on developer autonomy, platform reliability, and accelerating delivery through modern infrastructure.

sessions.title: Eclipse Che for Infrastructure Automation
sessions.description:
This session aims to navigate through the concept of an Ansible Development Environments, exploring what it entails and how to effectively manage and distribute these environments using a Web IDE like Eclipse Thea on Kubernetes.

We will cover:
Introduction to Development Environments
Differences between Local and Remote (Cloud) Development Environments
Why should you care about Development Environments for Infrastructure Automation?
Motivation and Use Cases
Introduction into Eclipse Thea
Best Practices for Managing and Distributing Development Environments
Live Demo

speakers.bio: Niklas Werker works as a Technical Lead and Consultant at SVA System Vertrieb Alexander GmbH. Following a professional prologue in the automotive industry, where he primarily developed embedded systems, he now focuses on the automation of multi-cloud environments. His main focus lies in the intersection of software and infrastructure, with the goal of managing infrastructure efficiently across cloud platforms. To achieve this, Niklas prefers to rely on open-source technologies.
speakers.tagline: Technical Lead and Consultant at SVA System Vertrieb Alexander GmbH

speakers.bio: Norris is a Principal Solution Architect at SVA System Vertrieb Alexander GmbH. Current work and focus includes adopting cloud-native Application Platforms, Distributed Systems and event-driven Architectures in regulated environments like Government, Energy, Banking or Insurance.
speakers.tagline: Principal Solution Architect at SVA System Vertrieb

sessions.title: Coding for Good: Achieving social change with an app
sessions.description:
As coders, we have an enviable ability to create platforms and apps that bring people together. The world is not short of challenges right now, especially climate change, but we will only have a real impact on the world if we can help people unite and organise to pressure those with power and influence.

Chris and his husband quickly developed an app ten years ago to allow ordinary people to lobby the normally inaccessible and unelected House of Lords to pass the Same Sex Marriage Bill. It unexpectedly took off, with 15,000 emails sent in the space of two weeks, helping the Bill overwhelmingly succeed in the normally-socially-conservative upper House of Parliament in the UK.

He'll talk here about how he did it, and how you - an individual with a computer and knowledge of how to knock an app together - can use this skill to give a voice to the voiceless, and to potentially change or even save the world.

speakers.bio: Chris is a mobile specialist who moved into engineering management a few years ago, yet still insists he's still a coder really. Additionally, he's been an elected official in the UK, had a key role in legalising same-sex marriage in the UK through his LobbyALord app, and addressed the UN Human Rights Council in Geneva on atrocities against LGBTQ+ people. He also writes and speaks about his late ADHD diagnosis and the challenges neurodivergence brings to an individual working in tech. Chris lives in Berlin with his cat and his husband and has a mid-life-crisis friendship with crows.
speakers.tagline: Head of Mobile Development Empowerment at 1&1 Mail and Media

sessions.title: Lessons learned from building a thriving Vue.js SaaS application
sessions.description:
Have you ever wondered which techniques actually work at scale for Vue.js apps? What to optimize for early on and what decisions that could pay its dividends early on?

In this talk, I will talk about composable, data management, code structure, performance specifically for SPA apps, DX for your team, and efficient testing strategies for small teams for large code bases.

You will gain invaluable insights into both the pitfalls and triumphs we encountered along the way of building a thriving web application.

speakers.bio:
An open-source maintainer and a GDE in Web Technologies.  I created vee-validate and villus for Vue.js. I host the Untyped podcast and co-host “Web workers” podcast. I’m also one of the organizers of the EgyptJS monthly meetup.

I write about Vue.js and the composition API and also TypeScript on my Blog. I am passionate about learning and teaching Vue.js and TypeScript.

sessions.title: The Strategic Power of DevRel: From Community to Business Impact

speakers.bio: Emilio Salvador is vice president of strategy and developer relations at GitLab. A technology executive with more than 20 years of experience, Emilio has held roles at Amazon and Microsoft, and most recently led strategy and operations for the Developer Advocacy and Experience team at Google. He holds an MBA from MIT Sloan School of Management.
speakers.tagline: VP of Strategy and Developer Relations at GitLab
Sr. Director, Developer Marketing & Strategy at Red Hat

speakers.bio:
Angie Jones is the Global Vice President of Developer Relations at Block, Inc. An award-winning educator and international keynote speaker, Angie shares her expertise with audiences at software companies and conferences around the globe.

As a Master Inventor, Angie is celebrated for her innovative and creative thinking, which has led to over 25 patented inventions in fields such as metaverses, collaboration software, social networking, smarter planet technologies, and software development processes.
speakers.tagline: Global VP, Developer Relations at Block

speakers.bio: Nikola is a seasoned innovation leader with a global footprint in the tech ecosystem. From UN field offices in Africa to Tokyo boardrooms focusing on technology and development initiatives. Transitioning to the private sector, he exited his own startup and then led startup and investor relations at Nikkei, one of leading business media groups globally. Later, as Director of Startups and Developer Experience at Infobip, Croatia's first tech unicorn, Nikola has launched a global startup program engaging with thousands of startups from over 120 countries. He has been living in Japan for over a decade now, but he also lived in the US and Tanzania after studying in Italy, the UK and Switzerland.

sessions.title: The Day After the Robots Come. Tech Edition.
sessions.description:
Bill Boorman has spent a working lifetime in and around recruiting. He has seen hype, noise, reality and change loudly proclaimed over the years. In this session, Boorman looks ahead and asks the question What happens when AI technology arrives. How will this impact the way that we hire. What is happening now that gives us an indication of what is coming next. 2025 is the year that Boorman calls proof of concept. The year where real hiring tests are pitching people against agentic agents in AB tests, to determine how hiring , and the work of talent acquisition teams will emerge in 2026. The probable winners and losers.

Expect a few surprises, with more than a hint of controversy.

speakers.bio:
Bill Boorman has spent his working life in around recruiting, starting out at the age of 16 in what he saw at the time as a short term gig as a trainee recruiter. He has worked as a third party recruiter, run and owned recruiting firms, been HRD and Trainer for international business, helped some of the worlds largest brands evolve the way people get hired through the age of digital and social media. Boorman advises tech companies and investors on the technology needed for the modern day. He is on the board of tech brands Vonq, PlacedApp and StaffCircle.

Boorman has won numerous awards including Recruiter Life Time Achievement, and was recently listed in HR Techs Top 100 influencers. Away from work he is a Dad, Husband, Street Artist and Stand Up Comedian. He is an in demand speaker known for sharing realities to challenge the people people.

sessions.title: GenAI Unpacked: Beyond Basic
sessions.description:
This demo-driven session delves into advanced aspects of Generative AI beyond basic prompt engineering. You’ll learn how GenAI works and how to implement use cases like classification, recommendation, and semantic search.

The session begins with core concepts such as tokens, exploring how transformers learn associations, followed by text generation via completions for a deeper understanding of model functionality. Key topics include embedding vectors, cosine similarity, and vector databases to explain semantic modeling.

You’ll also discover techniques like Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) to expand and manipulate model knowledge.

Finally, we’ll explore various model types and tools, including OpenAI Playground, Azure AI Studio, and Microsoft’s Semantic Kernel.

This technical session is ideal for those looking to understand and build intelligent applications powered by large language models.

speakers.bio: Dr. Damir Dobric is Lead Software Architect at DAENET. He specializes in Cloud Computing, IoT, and AI. In addition, Damir is also a Microsoft Most Valuable Professional (MVP). The Microsoft MVP Award is a prestigious recognition given to exceptional technical experts who are passionate about sharing their knowledge and experiences with others. As an MVP, Damir is part of an elite group of professionals known as Microsoft Regional Directors who actively contribute to the Microsoft community by offering guidance, support, and expertise in various Microsoft technologies.

sessions.title: Fireside Chat with Warren Spector &  John Romero
sessions.description:
Join two of the most iconic minds in game development—Warren Spector (Deus Ex, System Shock) and John Romero (DOOM, Quake) - for an unmissable fireside chat exploring the past, present, and future of gaming. 

From the birth of immersive sims and first-person shooters to the evolving landscape of interactive storytelling and AI in games, this session dives deep into how game design has transformed over the decades. 

Expect behind-the-scenes stories, bold predictions, and timeless insights from two visionaries who helped shape the medium - and continue to push its boundaries.

speakers.bio: John is an award-winning game designer, level designer, and programmer whose work portfolio includes 130 games, of which 107 have been published commercially. John Romero has co-founded eight widely successful game companies, including id Software, Gazillion Entertainment, and Loot Drop. He co-owns Loot Drop and Romero Games. He is regarded as one of the world’s best game designers and his products have won over a hundred awards to prove it. Furthermore, John Romero is fully a self-taught designer and programmer, drawing inspiration from early Apple II programmers.

Former Yahoo, Mozilla, Microsoft. JavaScript and Accessibility expert. Worked on Chromium Developer Tools. Author of the Developer Advocacy Handbook, LinkedIn Learning and Skillshare Trainer. Curator of the WeAreDevelopers World Congress and editor for the WeAreDevelopers DevDigest Newsletter.

Warren Spector has been making games since 1983, first in the tabletop gaming world and, beginning in 1989, making video games at seminal studios Origin / Electronic Arts, Looking Glass,  Ion Storm / Eidos (where he directed Deus Ex) and Junction Point / Disney where he led development on Epic Mickey. After creating a game development program at The University of Texas, he joined OtherSide Entertainment as co-founder and Chief Creative Officer. Among other honors he has been awarded an Honorary Doctorate by Columbia College of Chicago and the Game Developers Choice Lifetime Achievement award.
speakers.tagline: Chief Creative Officer & Game Creative Director of OtherSide Entertainment

sessions.title: Closing HR Leaders Summit
sessions.description: This is the official closing of the HR Leaders Summit.

sessions.title: Five things in tech that matter and we have to make work
sessions.description: The last year was a roller-coaster of innovation and worry. Whilst hot new technologies promised to automate daily tasks and allow anyone to be a coder or creator, we also faced changes in the market that led to people losing jobs who thought they were safe for life. We've seen tech giants fail and small companies rise and grow quickly. We've seen amazing technology empower people, but also bring up new barriers and battle legal requirements in different markets. The good news is that we've kept the finger on the pulse all year for you, so time to look back and see what was, check out what is coming soon and how you can use these technologies and ideas to make your mark and ensure your success and career.

speakers.bio: Former Yahoo, Mozilla, Microsoft. JavaScript and Accessibility expert. Worked on Chromium Developer Tools. Author of the Developer Advocacy Handbook, LinkedIn Learning and Skillshare Trainer. Curator of the WeAreDevelopers World Congress and editor for the WeAreDevelopers DevDigest Newsletter.
